eng:
Today is Nin's first day of school.

But Nin can't put on her uniform by herself!
She runs to her mother for help.
“Mama, will you help me put on my uniform?” asks Nin.“I will help you when I finish cooking,” says Ma.
Nin runs outside to find someone else who can help.
“Papa, will you help me put on my uniform?” asks Nin. “I will help you when I finish feeding the ducks,” says Papa.
“Grandpa, will you help me put on my uniform?” asks Nin. “I am taking the cattle to the field. I’ll help you when I come back,” says Grandpa.
“Grandma, will you help me put on my uniform?” asks Nin. “I will help you once I finish sweeping leaves from the yard,” says Grandma.
“Brother Lah! Will you help me put on my uniform?” asks Nin. “I'll help you when I finish drawing water from the well,” says Brother Lah.
No one can help me, thinks Nin sadly.
Everyone is so busy!
Nin decides to put on her uniform herself. First, it's inside-out.Then, the back is in the front!
And then, Nin tries to put on her shoes.
Nin looks in the mirror. Oh no! Her uniform is all wrong!
Her family looks at her and giggles.“I will help you,” says Ma.“We will also help you!” say Brother Lah and Papa.
Now, Nin is finally ready for school.Have a great first day, Nin!
zho: 今天是小玲第一天上學， 但她不懂得自己穿校服。
她跑去找媽媽幫忙。
小玲說：「媽媽，幫我穿校服！」媽媽說：「我在忙著做飯，等一下！」
小玲跑到外面，想找別人幫忙。

小玲說：「爸爸，幫我穿校服！」

爸爸說：「我在忙著餵雞，等一下！」

小玲說：「爺爺，可以幫我穿校服嗎？」


爺爺說：「我在忙著種田，等一下！」

小玲說：「奶奶，可以幫我穿校服嗎？」

奶奶說：「我在忙著掃地，等一下！」

小玲說：「

哥哥

，可以幫我穿校服嗎？」

哥哥說：「我在忙著打水，等一下！」
沒有人有空幫她，小玲有點難過。
大家都很忙啊！
小玲決定自己穿衣！第一次，裏外穿反了。第二次，前後穿反了。
然後，小玲嘗試穿鞋子。
小玲照一下鏡子 — 不好了，校服穿錯了！

大家看著她，忍不住大笑。媽媽說：「我來幫你！」




哥哥和爸爸也說
：「我們也來幫忙！」
終於，小玲準備好上學了。小玲，祝你第一天上學開開心心！

eng:
A rat has entered the house. Grandma was the first to see it.

"Rat!" He jumped on the sofa as he shouted.

The little pillows in it all fell down.

"Where?" Dad climbed out the window as he heard that.

The curtains all fell down as he pulled.

"There!" Mom jumped on the table shouting. The plates in it fell down and broke.

﻿
"Catch the mouse," Mithun looked at the cat and shouted.

The cat saw the mouse, then ran away and crawled under the bed.

"Rat!" Mithun ran after the cat shouting.

"I will chase away that rat," said the mother boldly.

He took a broom and stabbed here and there.

"You're a rat," Dad shouted. Mom saw the rat and he too hid under the cot.
"I know how to get rid of this rat!" Grandma jumped down from the sofa. He rolled up a newspaper and stabbed it here and there.

"Rat!" Said Dad. He climbed a little further up the window.

"Left with you!"

Grandma looked at the mouse. He too ran and hid under the bed.

"Damn!" Said Dad. He could not climb above it.

Slowly descended from the window. He hid under the bed without catching the mouse's eye!

“Rat! Rat! ” That everyone shouted together.

Papa woke up to that noise.

She sat up in bed and rubbed her eyes gently.

Um, of course, yes, I know this, why it's something known in advance.

It had two eyes, four legs, and a long tail.

"Rat!" Papa clapped his hands happily.

Papa looked at the rat and the rat started to run. Papa also ran backwards!
Climb on the sofa, jump out the window, jump on the table, roll on the pillows ...
... slipped between the curtains, stumbled on the plates, and ran out the door!
zho: 房子裡有一隻老鼠，奶奶先看到它。「﻿老鼠！」她大叫並跳上沙發，抱枕掉到了地上。
「在哪裡？」爸爸爬上窗戶，把窗簾拉了下來。「在那裡！」媽媽跳上桌子，盤子掉落一地。
﻿米頓﻿對著貓咪說「﻿抓住它！」。貓咪看到老鼠後躲到床底下。「﻿是老鼠！」﻿米頓﻿邊跑邊喊。
「我會把它趕出去的！」媽媽勇敢地說。她拿著掃把戳來戳去。爸爸大喊：「老鼠在你後面！」媽媽看到老鼠後就躲到床底下。
「我知道怎麼做！」奶奶邊喊邊跳下沙發。她捲起報紙東戳西戳。
「老鼠！」爸爸大喊，在窗戶上爬得更高了。「在你的左邊！」奶奶看到老鼠，躲進了床底。
「歐，不！」爸爸輕輕地說。他不能爬更高了。他小心翼翼的爬下窗戶，在被老鼠看到之前躲進床底。
「家裡有老鼠！」大家一起喊著。小寶寶被吵醒了。她坐在墊子上，睡眼惺忪的揉著眼睛。在她的枕頭上的是什麼啊？
它有一雙眼睛，四隻腳，和一條很長的尾巴。「老鼠！」小寶寶一邊拍手一邊說。小寶寶看了老鼠一眼，老鼠逃走了，小寶寶在後面追。
老鼠跳到沙發上，爬到窗戶上，跳到桌上，將抱枕弄散一地...
...在窗簾間到處跑，穿過盤子，最後逃出家門！

eng: Not here, not there.Where have you gone?
Not on the sofa.Not under the cot.
Not in the box.Not under my sister's frock.
Not under the pillow.Not in my bag.Sob, sob, where have you gone?
I have looked in every room, l have looked under every book.
I have looked under the chair,I have looked under the stool.Where have you gone?
Soon granny came back from her walk."Look what I found in the park."
"It can sway, it can bounce.It can spin, it can dangle.Ha-ha, hee-hee," said Granny with a giggle.
Oh Granny! Thank you so much!You have found my dear yo-yo!
"Yo-yo? What a funny name!What a funny toy!I want to play with it,It gives me so much joy!"
Giggle, giggle, giggling away,Granny played, with my little toy.For the rest of the day!
zho: 不在这里，不在那里。你到底在哪里？
不在沙发上，也不在床底。
不在盒子里，也不再妹妹的裙底。
不在枕头下，也不在包里，呜呜，呜呜，你到底在哪里？
我找遍了每个房间，也翻过了书柜和抽屉。
我找过了椅子的地下，也找过了凳子和茶几。你到底在哪里？
直到祖母散步归来——“瞧我在公园里找到了什么！”
“它可以摆动，它可以弹跳。它可以旋转，它可以摇荡。”祖母一边说，一边笑。
谢谢你祖母！你找到了我最喜欢的溜溜球！
“溜溜球？真是个可爱的名字！真是个可爱的玩具！我很喜欢你的溜溜球，它给我带来这么多欢乐！”
笑着，笑着，祖母渐渐走远。祖母就这样带走了我的溜溜球，还玩了整整一天！

嘿！Chunnu和Munnu洗澡的时间到了。今天，妈妈为
Chunnu和Munnu唱了一首新歌，啦啦啦啦...

Chunnu和Munnu洗澡的时间到了，妈妈把
Chunnu和Munnu的脏衣服都洗了，洗刷刷，洗刷刷...

Chunnu和Munnu洗澡的时间到了，
Chunnu和Munnu玩起了肥皂泡，哗哗哗...
Chunnu和Munnu洗澡的时间到了，妈妈追着淘气的Chunnu和Munnu，哈哈哈哈...
Chunnu和Munnu洗完澡了，妈妈抱抱干干净净的Chunnu和Munn，亲亲...

Chunnu和Munnu洗完澡了，但是对
Chunnu和Munnu来说穿睡衣很吃力，哦哈哈....

Chunnu和Munnu洗完澡了，嘿！
Chunnu和Munnu吃饭的时间到了，Yum yum yum...

Chunnu和Munnu吃完晚饭了，爷爷和奶奶正准备亲亲
Chunnu和Munnu，亲亲...
Chunnu和Munnu玩累了，要进入梦乡了，Zzzzz....
eng:
Yay! It is bath
time for Chunnu and Munnu,Today, Mama sings
a new rhyme for Chunnu and MunnuLa la la la...

It is bath
time for Chunnu and Munnu,Mama washes all the
dirt off Chunnu and MunnuScrub-a-dub-a-dub…

It is bath
time for Chunnu and Munnu,Soap bubbles and
fun for Chunnu and MunnuThup! Thup! Thup!

It is bath
time for Chunnu and Munnu,Mama runs to catch
naughty Chunnu and MunnuHa ha ha ha…

Bath time is
over for Chunnu and Munnu,Mama hugs
clean-clean Chunnu and MunnuMmmmm…

Bath time is
over for Chunnu and Munnu,But tying up pyjamas is hard for Chunnu and MunnuOh oh aah….

Bath time is
over for Chunnu and Munnu, Yay! It is
dinner time for Chunnu and MunnuYum yum yum…

Dinner time is
over for Chunnu and Munnu,Nana and Nani are
waiting to kiss Chunnu and MunnuMwaah, Mwaah,
Mwaah…

Today's play time is
over for Chunnu and Munnu,Sweet dreams now
for Chunnu and MunnuZzzzz…

zho: Kicchu 早早地起了床。“我要去捉魚了”，他打著哈欠說道。
他在去池塘的路上碰到了他最要好的朋友Choru。他們整天都在一起玩。
Munia看到他們拿著魚竿在趕路。於是他們問Munia“我們要去池塘捉魚，你一起來吧！”
Munia想了想說道“不要捉魚啦！”“沒有水，魚兒會死的。”
他們才不要聽Munia的話，徑直去了池塘。
Kicchu和Choru坐在池塘邊等著，有兩條魚游了過來，一條瘦瘦的一條圓圓的。
這時候游過來第三條魚，是他們見過最大的！Munia笑著說："這條魚比我爸爸的腳還大！"
Kicchu 和 Choru為了這條大魚爭了起來。Kicchu 叫道“這是我的魚！”Choru也教導“不！這是我的魚！”
Kicchu 使勁拉魚竿，Choru 也使勁拉魚竿。
啪! 魚竿斷了！咚！Kicchu摔倒了。嘩啦！Choru掉進了水裡。
想想看這是怎麼回事呢？原來魚兒們在水裡把魚線栓在一起啦！
eng: a warm morning , Raja woke up with a yawn and said to himself "lets go for fishing now".
While going to the pond,he met Ram,his best friend and invited him to go to the pond together.
Sita saw them going for fishing. The boys asked her if she wanted to come with them.
Sita thought for a moment and said "don't do this,fishes will die when separated by water"
They didn't paid attention to her and continued on their way to the pond.
Raja and Ram sat near the pond and saw to fishes jumping in water,one was a thin and second a fat one.
There came a third fish. They didn't saw any fish bigger than this! Sita said" This fish is even bigger than my father's foot!"
Raja and Ram took their fishing rods with and struggled for the fish.Ram said"its mine!"Raja said"no,its mine!"
Raja pulled the rod, Ram pulled stronger.
BOOM! They fell down as their rods broke.
Do you know why ?Any guesses ?fished tied their strings together!

zho: 一天， 农夫斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯先生带着他最好的牛去了牛群博览会。 他带着自己的牛从自己的小村边走上了洲际公路。
那条洲际公路有很多的汽车和大卡车。 每一个司机都大声地鸣叫着喇叭。轰！隆！啪！牛儿们不喜欢这些噪音。 它们决定回家去。
他对司机挥舞着他的手，想让它们不要再鸣汽车喇叭。但是并没有什么用。司机们看着斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯先生，鸣笛声反而更大了。 那些噪音不停地进入并停留在他的耳朵里。这真是糟糕的一天， 他决定带着自己的牛回家了。 牟！牛儿们很开心地回到了自己的牛圈。
但是那些噪音还是停留在斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯的耳朵里。轰！隆！啪！就像一群疯狂的音乐家在不停地演奏。其他的噪音也不停地加入进来。 就算是正常的声音对斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯先生来说也显得格外吵闹了。
青蛙的呱呱叫太吵闹了， 蝉的咔咔叫也太吵闹了。斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯先生想让咕咕叫的猫头鹰都离他远一点。凌晨四点钟还在鸣叫的杜鹃鸟也让他发狂。
还有牛儿们五点就开始的牟牟声。还有为什么公鸡每天早上都打鸣？愚蠢的老虎！不要再叫了！
可怜的斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯先生，他的耳朵现在脆弱的像受了伤。他想尽一些办法保持安静。他对着大声说话的孩子们大叫。在高压锅鸣笛的时候怒视着自己的妻子帕瓦塔玛太太。
斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯先生现在只想要安静。每个人都在试图保持安静。 帕瓦塔玛太太不再斥责孩子们。孩子们在玩板球的时候也小心翼翼的。
牛儿们也停止了牟牟叫。蝉和猫头鹰都去了别的村子。就连老虎都不再咆哮了。
但是斯林格 斯利尼瓦斯先生是不开心。在大家都安静的时候他还是能听到噪音！
﻿“我要离开这里”他在一天清晨说到。“求你不要”帕瓦塔玛太太说“你要去哪里找安静的地方？”斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯只是对她皱着眉， 然后离开了村子。
很快，他到了一个新的城镇。他看着这个吵闹的城镇里的吵闹的人们。一个路过的年轻人带着他的耳机。斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯先生都可以听到耳机的的“叮！当！叮！当！”的声音。这个年轻人看起来很开心。他甚至没有注意到一个正在轰鸣的火车从旁边驶过。
“这是什么？”他问这个年轻人。“这是我的耳机。 来，您试试看。”年轻人说着给斯利格.斯特尼瓦斯先生戴上了耳机并放起了音乐！叮！当！叮！当！汽车喇叭的声音消失了。“啊！这正是我需要的”他说。
斯利格.斯利尼瓦斯先生到了城镇里。 然后买了一对最好的耳机戴上。然后...噪音消失了！他戴着自己的大耳机回到了自己的村子。
斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯的妻子很高兴看到他回来，给了他一个大大的笑容。他的孩子们也帮他吧耳机连接到手机上开始播放让人开心的音乐。
现在，当斯林格.斯利尼瓦斯先生再为汽车，青蛙的噪音生气的时候，他就戴上自己的耳机。有时还放一些音乐。村里的牛又开始牟牟叫了。杜鹃鸟也飞回了村庄。青蛙又开始呱呱叫了。蝉又开始咔咔叫了。
但是公路上的汽车只是会发出太多噪音。轰！隆！啪！一点都不好听。斯利格.斯利尼瓦斯先生必须要带自己的牛儿们去牛博览会了。他会给牛儿们也戴上耳机吗？
eng: One day, Sringeri Srinivas, the farmer, set out with his best cows to the cattle fair. He had to walk along the new national highway that had come up near his village.
That big road had many cars and trucks. Every driver seemed to be honking loudly. Paoon! Ponn! Paaa! The cows did not like the noise. They decided to go back home.

He waved his hands at the drivers to stop the noise. This did not help. Seeing him, they just honked louder. The noise of the horns went straight into his head. And it stayed there. It was a bad day for him. He went back home with his cows. MOOO! The cows were happy to be in the cowshed again.

But the noise simply would not go away from his head.Paoon! Ponn! Paaa! It kept on playing like a band of untrained musicians. Other noises around him soon joined in the chorus. Even the sounds that he heard daily suddenly became too loud for Sringeri Srinivas.

The ribbit ribbit of the frogs was noisy.The cicadas and their kirkk kirkk were too
loud. Sringeri Srinivas wanted the hooting owls to be sent away. He was
angry at the koyals for screeching loudly at 4 am.

And at the cows that mooed at 5 am. And
whoever asked the roosters to act as alarm clocks? And that stupid
tiger! Enough of his roaring!

Poor Sringeri Srinivas. His ears had become raw, like a fresh wound. He tried hard to keep things quiet.He shouted at the children if they talked
loudly. He glared at his wife Parvatamma when the pressure cooker
whistled and whistled.
Sringeri Srinivas only wanted silence. Everyone tried to help. Parvatamma stopped scolding the children. The children played cricket quietly with a very soft ball.
The cows did not moo any more. The cicadas and owls moved to another village. Even the tiger stopped growling.
Yet Sringeri Srinivas was not happy. He could hear the noise of everyone trying to be silent!

“I will go away from this place,” he declared one morning. “Please don’t,” said Parvatamma. “Where will you find silence?” Sringeri Srinivas simply frowned at her and started to walk away from his village.

Soon, he came close to a new town. He watched the noisy people in the noisy town. A young man passed by. He had some wires dangling from his ears. Sringeri Srinivas could also hear a ‘ting dang ting dang’ sound. The man looked very happy. He did not even notice that trucks were blaring horns nearby.

“What is this?” he asked the man.“These
are my headphones. Here, try them on,” the young man said. He put them
on for Sringeri Srinivas. Music! Ting dang ting dang. No horns. “Aha! This is just what I need,” he said.
Sringeri Srinivas went into the town. He bought a pair of the best headphones and put them on. At last... no more noise! He returned to his village, with his big new headphones.
His wife was happy to see him. Sringeri Srinivas gave her a big smile. His children helped him to connect the new headphones to some good, happy music.

Now, when Sringeri Srinivas gets very angry at the cars or even at the frogs, he puts on his headphones and listens to the silence. Or he listens to good music. In the village, the cows are mooing again. The koyals have come back. Ribbit ribbit, go the frogs. Kirkk kirkk, sing the cicadas.
But the cars on the highway are still making too much noise.Paoon! Ponn! Paaa! It is not a good sound. Sringeri Srinivas has to take his cows to the fair soon. Will they want headphones too?

"Line
up class! Let’s go to the park," Laila Miss says.
All
the students hold hands, chattering away. Kavya stands by herself.
As
they start walking, Laila Miss asks, "Does anyone know what a
caterpillar becomes when it grows up?"  

Kavya’s
stomach flips. She knows the answer! Should she say something?

Kavya
and her family have just moved to Bengaluru from her village.
They
live at the construction site where her parents work.
It’s
hard living in a half-finished house. The air smells of smoke, and
the honking traffic makes it hard to sleep. The towering buildings,
zooming cars, and busy people make her feel very, very small.

Kavya
has been coming to school for a week. She still hasn’t spoken to
anyone.
What
if they make fun of her accent? Or tease her because she’s never
been to school before?  

Kavya
takes a deep breath and raises her hand. In a noisy city like
Bengaluru, she can’t be quiet forever.

"When
caterpillars grow up, they become butterflies," Kavya says.
"That’s
right!" Laila Miss says.
"Caterpillars
are only caterpillars for a few weeks," Kavya says. "They spend
that whole time eating leaves." 

"They
must get very big," says Mary, her classmate.
"They
do!""After they eat and eat and eat, caterpillars weave cocoons on the sides of plants. They go inside, where they grow and change," says Kavya.

"That’s
correct," Laila Miss says. "They stay in the cocoons for about
two weeks. When they come out, they are butterflies."
"Look,
we’re at the park!" Mary says. Kavya gasps. The park is covered in butterflies!

Blue
butterflies the colour of rivers. Yellow butterflies the colour of
sunlight.
Orange
butterflies the colour of ripe chikoos. Black-and-white butterflies
the colours of starry skies.These are all the colours Kavya misses from her village.She feels her heart flutter.

"Every year, butterflies travel thousands of kilometres to come to this park. They are here formore food, better weather, and a safe place
to lay eggs," Laila Miss says.  "This journey is called
migration."

"Don’t
they get tired, flapping their wings for so long?" a classmate
asks.
"If
there is a strong wind, they don’t have to flap their wings,"
Kavya says. "They spread their wings and glide."
"That
must be bumpy," Mary whispers to Kavya.

Kavya
thinks about the bus ride to Bengaluru – squeezed in between all
the luggage. Bumping and tumbling for hours and hours and hours. 

Is
that how a butterfly feels on the wind?

"When
butterflies migrate, they follow rivers. To stay healthy, they stop
along the riverbank to soak up minerals with their feet. It’s
called mud-puddling," Laila Miss says.
"Mud-puddling?"
Mary says. "That sounds like fun."
Mary
and Kavya smile at each other. 

"It
is," Kavya says. "But now puddles are hard to find."In
Kavya’s village, men in trucks take sand away from the river. The
weather gets hotter and hotter. There is less and less rain.

Last year, the river went dry. The butterflies
didn’t have enough water to mud-puddle. Kavya’s family didn’t
have enough water to farm.  
That’s
why they moved to Bengaluru.

"You
know a lot about butterflies, Kavya," says Laila Miss.
"That’s
because they are my favourite insects," says Kavya.
"Why
do you love butterflies so much, Kavya?" asks Mary.
How
can Kavya choose just one thing? 

She
loves how their bodies are sometimes spotted and sometimes striped.
How they drink nectar with their long noses. How they spread pollen,
which makes more flowers grow.

"They
fly far, but wherever they land, they make new friends," Kavya
says, squeezing Mary’s hand. "They’re very small, but they’re
also very brave."
"Just
like you," Laila Miss says.
Kavya
smiles a smile as wide as a butterfly’s wings.

Make
a Butterfly Rest Station
Butterflies
in India migrate twice a year. Their journey is getting harder and
harder because our forests and rivers are disappearing. Butterflies
don’t have enough places to rest. Many get tired along the way. 



One
way to help butterflies is to make safe spaces for them to stop and
have a good meal.

Here’s
how to make a butterfly rest station:Find
	a flat vessel with high edges, like a thali or
	a
	plate.Butterflies
	love bright colours. Paint the vessel red, yellow, or orange.Fill
	the vessel with butterfly food. It’s easy to make! Mix four cups
	of water with one cup of sugar.

Add pieces of over-ripe fruit. Butterflies love bananas, guavas, mangoes, papayas, and oranges.Keep the vessel out on your veranda, windowsill, or anywhere outside.Clean and refill the vessel every two to three days.To attract even more butterflies, plant flowers that butterflies love. You can plant verbena, geraniums, dahlias, or sunflowers. You don’t need a lot of space – you can plant them in pots on the ground, or keep them on windowsills.
zho: “集合啦同学们！我们现在出发去公园！”莱拉老师说。所有的同学们都手拉着手，聊着天。 卡维娅一个人站在一边。他们开始出发之后，莱拉老师问“有没有人知道毛毛虫长大了之后会变成什么呀？”卡维娅的心跳了一下。 她知道答案！她应该说些什么吗？
卡维娅和她的家人刚刚从她的村庄搬到了班加罗尔。他们住在她父母工作的工地上。住在半完成的房子里不是件容易的事情。空气里总是有烟的味道。路上轰鸣的汽笛声让她晚上很难入睡。这些高高的楼房， 飞驰而过的汽车让她觉得自己很小，很小。
卡维娅已经去学校一个星期了。 她还没有跟任何人说过话。万一他们嘲笑她说话的口音怎么办？又或者他们因为她从来没有上过学而取笑她怎么办？卡维娅深呼吸了一口，然后举起了手。在班加罗尔这样热闹的城市里，她不能总是一言不发。
“当毛毛虫长大的时候它们就会变成蝴蝶。”卡维娅说。“回答正确！”莱拉老师说。“毛毛虫只有几个星期的时间会看起来像毛毛虫，”卡维娅说，“它们在这段时间里会一直在吃叶子。”“它们必须长得很大很大，”她的同学玛丽说。“是呀！”“它们吃呀吃，然后就会在植物旁边织一个茧。然后它们就会在茧里面成长蜕变。”卡维娅说。
“说的很对，”莱拉老师说。“毛毛虫们要在茧里面呆两周左右。 当它们再出来的时候，就变成了蝴蝶。”“看呀，我们到公园了！”玛丽说。卡维娅惊呆了。公园里全部都是蝴蝶！
蓝色的蝴蝶有小河一样的颜色。黄色的蝴蝶有阳光一样的颜色。橙色的蝴蝶有熟透了的人心果一样的颜色。黑白相间的蝴蝶有繁星满天的夜空一样的颜色。这些颜色都是卡维娅一直在想念的她的村庄的颜色。她能感受到自己心脏的颤动。
“每一年，蝴蝶们会飞上千米来到这个公园。 这里有更多的食物，更好的天气， 和适合产卵的安全的地方，”莱拉老师说。 “这样的旅行叫做迁移。”
“它们扇动翅膀那么长时间不会累吗？”一个同学问。“如果有强风的话，它们就不用扇动翅膀，”卡维娅说。“它们可以展开翅膀，乘风滑翔。”“那样肯定很颠簸，”玛丽悄悄对卡维娅说。
卡维娅想起了她们来到班加罗尔的车程 - 她就被挤在所有的行李之间。 颠簸了一个小时又一个小时。那就是蝴蝶在飞翔时候的感觉吗？
“当蝴蝶们迁移的时候， 它们会沿着河飞。 为了能健康的活着，它们会停在河岸边在脚上沾满矿物质。 这些矿物质又叫做泥浆，”莱拉老师说。“泥浆？”玛丽说。“听起来好有趣。”玛丽和卡维娅互相微笑。“是呀，”卡维娅说。 “但是现在这些泥浆很难找了。”在卡维娅的村子里， 男人们会用卡车把沙子从河边运走。 天气越来越热。 也越来越少下雨。
去年的时候， 那条河干了。蝴蝶们没有水源去做泥浆。 卡维娅的家人也没有水耕种。这也就是为什么她们搬到了班加罗尔。
“卡维娅，你知道很多蝴蝶的事情。”莱拉老师说。“因为蝴蝶是我最喜欢的昆虫。”卡维娅说。“你为什么这么喜欢蝴蝶呀，卡维娅？”玛丽问。卡维娅是怎么可以选择一样东西来喜欢的呢？她喜欢蝴蝶的身体有时候是带斑点的，有时候是带条纹的。 她喜欢它们用它们的长鼻子吸花蜜。 喜欢它们可以传播花粉，让更多的花儿生长。
“它们可以飞很远，可是每次它们着陆的时候，都会交很多新朋友。”卡维娅说， 捏了捏玛丽的手。“它们很小，可是却很勇敢。”“就像你一样的。”莱拉老师说。卡维娅咧开了一个像蝴蝶翅膀一样的微笑。
做一个蝴蝶休息站蝴蝶在印度每年迁移两次。它们的旅途正在变得越来越艰难，因为我们的森里和河流正在消失。蝴蝶在旅行的路中没有可以休息的地方。 很多蝴蝶在路上会变得很累。我们可以做一些安全的地方帮助它们休息，并提供给它们食物。
﻿以下是如何做一个蝴蝶休息站：﻿找一个平底带高边的容器，比如塔利，或是盘子。蝴蝶们喜欢鲜艳的颜色。把容器涂成红色，黄色， 或是橘黄色。在容器里放上蝴蝶的食物。蝴蝶的食物很容易做！把四杯水和一杯糖混合在一起就好了。
再放一些熟过了的水果。蝴蝶们很喜欢香蕉，番石榴，芒果，木瓜，还有橘子。把容器放在你的阳台上，窗户边，或者是任何在外面的地方。每两到三天，把容器清洗干净， 并放上新的蝴蝶食物。想要吸引更多的蝴蝶的话， 可以种一些蝴蝶喜欢的花。比如马鞭草，天竺葵，大丽花，和向日葵。这些花不需要很大的空间。 你可以把它们种在花盆里放在地上，或者窗边。

eng: ﻿There are four of us in the family. Miguel is my favorite,                              and I follow him everywhere.
I have to keep an eye on Miguel.                                 I'm older than him.
Sometimes Miguel is not careful,                         so I had to guard the house.
﻿I am with him in everything. We sympathize with everyone.
We play with each other.
And Mother scolded us too.
I help Mom when Miguel is busy.   I pimp the birds away from our wares.
Today, Miguel will teach me. Finally, I will learn something new.
I am a kind dog. I'm not chasing cats.
If you're Miguel's friend, I'm your friend too!
Read the following sentences. Which of these do you like? I love to dance. I love to swim. I love jumping rope. I love to draw.

I love cycling. I love to climb. There is a saying “Nothing is more loyal than a dog”. This is because the dog does not leave his master. Whether he goes away or gets lost, he can definitely return to his master.
zho: 我們是一家四口。我到哪裡都跟著晴古。
我必須照顧晴古，因為我比他年長。
有時候晴古很粗心，守護房子便成了我的工作。
我們做什麼都在一起。我們一起工作。
我們一起玩。
甚至一起被媽媽罵。
每當晴古去上學，我會幫忙媽媽。我會趕走烏鴉，不讓它們接近印度薄餅。
今天晴古是我的老師。我終於可以學到新東西了。
我是一隻乖狗狗。我不會把貓咪嚇跑。
你是晴古的朋友嗎？那麼你也是我的朋友。
閱讀下列句子。以下的活動，哪一個是你喜歡的活動？我喜歡跳舞。我喜歡游泳。我喜歡跳繩。我喜歡畫畫。
我喜歡騎腳踏車。我喜歡攀爬。有時候我們說：「跟狗一樣的忠心。」這是因為狗狗總是跟主人很親近。如果狗狗去了很遙遠的地方或是走失了，它總是能找到回家的路。
天空为什么是蓝色的？
不一定是蓝色的对吗？
叶子为什么是绿色的？
不一定是绿色的对吗？
香蕉为什么是黄色的？
香蕉熟了会变黄色。生的香蕉是绿色的。
雨伞为什么是黑色的？
不是全部雨伞都是黑色的。
血为什么是红色的？
因为血里面包含铁，所以就变红色了。
那盐为什么是白色的？ 不知道！
eng: Why is the sky blue?

It's not always blue.

Is not it?
Why are the leaves green?

They are not always green.

Is not it?
Why are bananas yellow?

Ripe bananas are yellow.

Unripe bananas are green.
Why are umbrellas black?
Not all umbrellas are black.
Why is the blood red?

There is iron in the blood.

It makes it red.

Why is salt white?

I do not know!

zho: 这是我的家。妈妈，爸爸，和小轩都住在这里。
房子里最好的椅子是我的。但坐在小轩的脚更好，对吗？
小轩是我最好的朋友。我每天都等她从学校回家。
我不必用水来保持干净。我不需要像汤米一样洗澡。
Shhh...不要告诉别人我在这里躲藏！一，二，散。。。抓到你了！
当我从花园里带回一些美味的食物时，妈妈回对我大喊大叫。
我能爬树。我能跳。我知道这里的所有捷径！
三州住在附近。他常常挑逗我。这让我很生气！
请告诉三州老虎是猫科动物。我们有尖锐的爪子。
我的朋友们晚上有时会很吵。到了那个时候，我已经安静地躺在床上了！
尾巴可以说话 ！ 你知道动物和鸟类能用它们的尾巴来类沟通吗？一只狗快乐的时候就会摇尾巴。一只猫生气的时候就会吹起尾巴。
eng: Hello, my name is Rake. This is my house. Dad and Çinu also live here.Merhaba, benim adım Tırmık. Bu benim evim. Babam ve Çina da burada yaşıyor.
I have the best chair in the house, but isn't it better to sit on the lap?Evin en güzel koltuğu benimkidir. Ama yine de kucakta yatmak daha güzel değil mi?
Çinu is my best friend. I always wait for her to come back from school.Çinu benim en iyi arkadaşım. Ben hep onun okuldan dönüşünü beklerim.
I keep myself clean without water. I don't need a bath like Tombik.Ben su olmadan da kendimi temizleyebiliyorum. Tombik gibi yıkanmak zorunda değilim.
Shhhhh ... Don't tell anyone that I'm hiding here. 1,2,3, ... Gotcha!Şşşşşşt... Kimse burada saklandığımı söylemesin. 1,2,3,... Yakaladım!
Mom shouts at me when I bring home some funny food from the garden.Annem, eve yenmemesi gereken bir yiyecek getirdiğimde bana kızar.
I can climb trees and jump. I know all the shortcuts.Ben ağaçlara da tırmanabiliyorum. O yüzden bütün kestirme yolları biliyorum.
Sangu lives nearby. He teases me and that makes me angry!Sangu yakınlarımızda oturuyor. Benimle uğraşır durur. Kızıyorum artık!
Sanju doesn't know that tigers belong to the cat family... we both have sharp claws.Sangu'dan bahsetmişken, kaplanlar da kedi ailesindendir. Ama onların patileri daha keskin.
My friends sometimes make lots of noises outside, but I sleep quietly in bed.Benim arkadaşım bazen geceleri horluyor. Ama ben yatağımda sessiz sessiz uyurum hep.

Paw speaks.When the dogs are happy, they wag their tails.When cats shake their tails, they are getting angry.Pençe de konuşuyor. Köpekler mutlu olduklarında kuyruklarını sallıyorlar.Kediler de kızdıkları zaman kuyruklarını sallarlar.
Why have you not done your homework?Miss, it is all because of the cat.
The cat sat on the tree.So I took a ladder to climb the tree.
But the ladder was broken. So I took a hammer.The hammer made a noise.So the baby woke up.
Mother ran out to see the baby.So the monkey came in.
The monkey ate all the food.So there was no food for us.
Father bought chicken biryani for us.So the dog followed him.
The dog ate my notebook.So I couldn't bring my homework.
So, the dog ate your homework?
Yes, Miss. But it is all because of the cat.
zho: 小朋友, 為什麼還沒做作業呢 ?老師, 這其實是貓咪害我的．
因為貓咪被困在樹上了我必須找一個梯子爬到樹上去救他下來
因為我要使用梯子爬到樹上去就貓咪我要先把梯子修理好我要把梯子修理好的時候我把小baby吵醒了
因為我把小Baby吵醒了我的媽咪趕緊從廚房跑了出來我的媽咪從廚房跑出的時候有一隻小猴子跑進了廚房
小猴子跑進了廚房把所有的食物都吃光光了我的爸爸只好去餐廳買好吃的咖哩雞和好吃的麵包回家
爸爸帶好吃的咖哩雞還有麵包回家的時候一隻調皮的小狗狗也跟著爸爸一起回家
那一隻調皮的小狗狗跟著爸爸回到了家裡小狗狗看到了我的作業本然後它把作業本吃掉了
老師： 嗯....所以是小狗狗把你的作業本吃掉了 ?
是的!!!都是因為貓咪被困在樹上我的作業本才會被小狗狗吃掉的
一隻大象要去喝水
兩隻長頸鹿要去喝水
三隻水牛與四隻鳥也要去喝水
五隻羚羊與六隻疣豬正走向水源
七隻斑馬正跑向水源
八隻青蛙與九條魚正在水裡游泳
一隻獅子吼叫，他也想要喝水。誰害怕獅子呢？
一隻大象在與獅子一起喝水
eng:
One elephant is
going to drink water.
Two giraffes are going to drink water.

Three buffaloes
and four birds are also going to drink water.
Five antelopes and warthogs are walking to the water.
Seven zebras are running to the water.
Eight frogs and nine fish are swimming in the water.
One lion roars. He also wants to drink. Who is afraid of the lion?
One elephant is drinking water with the lion.

Sukhiya Kaka lived in a village called Bitauna. Bitauna was famous all over Rajasthan for its singers. No celebration was complete without Sukhiya Kaka's sweet songs. Today he had been invited to village Jhalaura.
Sukhiya Kaka twirled his big moustache and set off.He was singing raag Malhar....Come to me o rolling clouds...
Suddenly, he heard, dhupp dhupp dhupp dhupp!Was someone giving a beat to his song?Dinoo, the dinosuar came running towards him. Sukhiya Kaka was so happy to see him!
You don't get such a BIG listener every day!... Come to me o rolling clouds, shower me with lovely rain!Sukhiya Kaka and Dinoo sang a duet and did a little jig to keep time.
The clouds just had to listen to them!Lightning flashed and the wind danced. Dark clouds came rolling in. Sukhiya Kaka and Dinoo laughed with joy.

As the rain came pouring down, Sukhiya Kaka and Dinoo shared a small umbrella. Then off they went to Jhalaura following the smell of yummy pakoras, singing...O thank you for the lovely rain...O..la la la.
Dear Reader,Have you ever seen a dinosaur?Do you think they would have sung songs?What do you like to do in the rain?What do you like to eat when it rains?

#6FrameStoryChallenge: A Carnival of ArtThe illustrations in this book were created as part of the #6FrameStoryChallenge, an online campaign run by Pratham Books to build a rich bank of illustrations for StoryWeaver. The essence of the #6FrameStoryChallenge was to tell a good story using just 6 illustrations.  The campaign inspired nearly 70 illustrators to donate their time and skills to India’s first open-source story-publishing platform for children. What started out as an experimental campaign soon blossomed into a carnival of art, birthing nearly 500 new illustrations.These wordless narratives cut across language barriers, opening up a world of possibilities, encouraging StoryWeaver’s growing community to dream up multiple stories around these images. The #6FrameStoryChallenge is a powerful reminder of the need for collaboration, to get closer to our mission: “A Book in Every Child’s Hand.”
zho:
苏西亚卡卡住在一个叫 比陶纳的村子里。 比陶纳因其歌手而闻名于拉贾斯坦邦。 没有
苏西亚卡卡

 的甜美歌曲，庆祝活动是不完整的。

今天他被邀请到贾劳拉村。

苏希亚卡卡捋了捋大胡子，出发了。

他在唱 拉格马尔哈尔。


……来吧，滚滚的云……
突然，他听到，嘟嘟嘟嘟。是有人在给他的歌声打拍子吗？迪诺，那个恐龙朝他跑来。苏希亚卡卡见到它非常高兴。
你不可能每天都有这么大的听众！...滚滚的云彩啊，向我走来，用可爱的雨给我沐浴吧！...苏希亚卡卡和迪诺唱了二重唱，还跳了一阵儿吉格舞来。
云只得听他们的！电一闪过，风就跳起舞来, 乌云滚滚而来。苏希亚卡卡和迪诺开心地笑起了。

雨倾盆而下，苏希亚卡卡和迪诺共用一把小雨伞。然后他们跟着美味的
帕科拉斯

的味道去了贾劳拉 

，唱着...哦，谢谢你的可爱的雨...哦..啦啦啦。
亲爱的读者， 你见过恐龙吗？ 你认为他们会唱歌吗？ 你喜欢在雨中做什么？ 下雨天你喜欢吃什么？
首先，我要造一座桥。然后，我要搭建非常高的塔。我还要修一条全世界最长的路。这条路会以我的房间为起点，直通月球！我要成为一名创造这些东西的土木工程师。
我也造发动机。有些发动机会用在火箭上，有些会用在太空飞机上。太空飞机将带着我们周游列国，火箭将带着我们一路飞向火星。我的奶奶也会跟着我一起去旅行！我要成为一名创造飞行发动机的航天航空工程师。
我不只是要造东西。我要用微小的粒子来发电。只要用一个小小的粒子的能量就能照亮我们的村庄。奶奶会高兴得想要举办一场盛大的庆典！我要成为一名从粒子里提取能源的核能工程师。
我要制造两部机器：一部能清洁海洋，另一部能清洁大气。动物们能健康地生活在这里，人们能呼吸新鲜的空气。我要用我的机器来拯救地球！我要成为一名制造地球清洁器的环境工程师。
我要给我家的宠物狗造一只耳朵（她在一次战斗中失去了耳朵）。我还要给奶奶制造一副新的牙齿。最后，我要给自己制造一双翅膀！我要成为一名制造人造身体器官的生物医学工程师。我将展翅高飞，到世界各地去，寻找更多创造的机会。
eng:
First, I will build a bridge. After that, I will build a very tall tower. And then, I will build the longest road
in the world. It will start at my room
and go right up to the moon!

When I build these structures,I will be a civil engineer.

I will build engines too.
Some engines will be in rockets
and some will bein planes.

The plane will take us from country to country and the rocket will fly us all the way to Mars.
My Anaideo* will come with me on all my trips!

When I build flying engines,
I will be an aerospace engineer.

*Anaideo means grandmotherin Assamese.

But I won’t stop at that.
I will produce electricity from small particles.
One tiny particle will light up our whole village.
Anaideo will be so happy that she will throw a big feast!

When I make power like that, I will be a nuclear engineer.

I will build a machine to clean the sea.
And another to clean the air.
The animals will be healthy
and people will breathe easy.
I will save the earth
with my machines!

When I make machinesto clean the planet,
I will be an environmental engineer.

I will build a new ear for Pempem
(she lost it in a fight... grrrr).
Then I will build a new set of teeth for Anaideo.
Finally, I will build wings for me!

When I build artificial body parts,
I will be a biomedical engineer.

And I will soar over theworld
looking for more things to build.
वाघमारे काकाचा तो वार्षिक केशकर्तन दिवस होता.   It was the Annual Haircut Day for Waghmare Kaka.

वाघमारे काका न्हाव्याकडे जाण्यासाठी घरात निघाले.

 Waghmare Kaka left home to go to the barber.

पण न्हावी म्हणाला, ''एवढे लांब केस कापण्यासाठी आज मला वेळ नाही.''

But the barber said, “Today, I have no time to cut such long hair!”

वाघमारे काका

 दुःखी झाले. ते मदत मागण्यासाठी आपल्या बायको कडे गेले.Waghmare Kaka felt sad. He went to his wife to ask for help.

पण त्यांची बायको म्हणाली, ''एवढे लांब केस कापण्यासाठी आज मला वेळ नाही.''  

 But his wife said, “Today, I have no time to cut such long hair!”

थोडा रागवून, 

वाघमारे काका

 आपल्या शिंपी मित्राकडे गेले. Feeling a little angry, Waghmare Kaka went to his friend, the tailor.

पण शिंपी म्हणाला, ''एवढे लांब केस कापण्यासाठी आज मला वेळ नाही.''

 But the tailor said, “Today, I have no time to cut such long hair!”

वाघमारे काका आणखी एका मित्राकडे गेले, सुताराकडे.
 Waghmare Kaka went to one more friend, the carpenter.

पण सुतार म्हणाला, ''एवढे लांब केस कापण्यासाठी आज मला वेळ नाही.''
 But the carpenter said, “Today, I have no time to cut such long hair!”

बिचारे वाघमारे काका. वार्षिक केशकर्तन दिवशी त्यांचे केस कोणीच कापू शकणार नव्हते.

 Poor Waghmare Kaka. No one could cut his hair on this Annual             Haircut Day.
रडत रडत,  ते गावाजवळच्या जंगलात पोहोचले. Crying, he went to the forest near the village.
ते एका गुहेजवळ बसून जोरात रडायला लागले. He sat near a cave and cried loudly.

''देवा, मदत कर! कोण माझे केस कापतील?''
 “Oh God, help me! Who will cut my hair?”
गुहेत शांतपणे झोपलेला वाघ त्याच्या आवाजाने जागा झाला. The tiger sleeping peacefully inside the cave was awake now.
ते वाघ जोराने गरजला आणि वाघमारे काकांवर उडी मारली!  The tiger roared loudly and jumped on Waghmare Kaka!

बिचारे वाघमारे काका इतके घाबरले, इतके घाबरले

, इतके घाबरले  की ...
 Poor Waghmare Kaka was so scared, so scared, so scared that ...

... त्यांच्या डोक्यावरचे सगळेच केस गळून पडले!

 ... all the hair fell off his head!
वाघमारे काका धावत गावात आले. वाघ पुन्हा झोपायला गेला.Waghmare Kaka ran all the way back to the village.                                   The tiger went back to sleep.

आता वाघमारे काकाला खूप दिवस केस कापण्याची गरज

 येणारच नाही.
 Now, Waghmare Kaka will not need a haircut for a very long time.
zho: 这一天是斯林格里的年度理发日。
斯林格里和往常一样离开家，前往当地的理发店。
可是理发师说，“今天，我可没有时间剪这么长的头发！”
伤心的斯林格里回家找他的妻子帮忙。
可是他的妻子说，“今天，我可没有时间剪这么长的头发！”
有点气愤，斯林格里去找他的朋友，裁缝。
但是裁缝说，“今天，我可没有时间剪这么长的头发！”
现在有点发愁了，斯林格里又找了他的朋友，木匠。
可是木匠说，“今天，我可以没有时间剪这么长的头发！”

可怜的斯林格里。貌似没有人愿意在这个
年度理发日里为他剪头。
流着泪，他一个人走开了，经过小镇的树林。
他坐在一个山洞旁边大声哭泣。
“这一天就快要过去了。我怎样才能兑现理发的诺言呢？神啊，帮帮我！”
在洞里安眠的老虎被他的吵闹声打扰了。
它出来，嘶吼着，朝斯林格里挥舞着它巨大的爪子。
可怜的斯林格里太害怕，太害怕，太害怕了，怕到。。。
所有的头发都从他头上掉下来了！

斯林格里一路跑回了镇上。
老虎回去继续睡觉了。
现在，斯林格里很长一段时间都不需要理发了。

eng: Ummm..  hello mister and can you see me?I am in the fourth of the longest line
We walk left and right always and that to silently and we also make a different styles of lines!
Ahaa! I got an Idea let's go on this WHEEL MOVING THING to go even faster and that to no need of wasting time !
And we are not noisy than other animals even not noisy as you mister. Our language is just smelling food.
One of our smelling language says '' Go that way for a tasty treat feast.''
Some of our other smelling language says '' UH-OH STOP! There is DANGER DON'T GO!''
I love cakes and all sort of sweets, and so do you to!!
Well, I might be small and tiny but don't think i am a weak I am strong and i can hold big sweets eh! like this big sweet what I am holding now see you see??
NAAN! don't worry even if the shop door is closed so we can't go in but NO! we can just slip under the door and have our treats!
Don't even think about it we all live in a big family not just a big family we are living with more hundreds and live happily in a colony

LET US LEARN SOME NEW WORDS.Small - BigSlow - FastShort - TallThin - FatHard - SoftNoisy - QuietHere are some words with their opposites.Can you make a sentence for each pair of opposite words?For example, ‘An ant is small; an elephant is big’.“As busy as an ant” is a nice way to describe someone who is very hard working.
zho: 你好，我是隊伍中的第四個。你有看到我嗎?
左，右，左，右。我們成一線安靜地走著。
我有了個點子。我要來弄對輪子讓我們可以移動快一點。
我們不像其他動物一樣吵雜。我們的語言是氣味。
其中一種氣味是代表，『跟我來這邊吃大餐。』
另一種氣味代表，『危險！別走那邊。』
我喜歡蛋糕跟各種甜點，跟你一樣。
想看看我工作時的肌肉嗎？對你來說我也許非常的小，但是我非常強壯。
不用擔心門已經關上了。我可以從最小的縫隙中穿過去。
信不信由你，數以百計的我們快樂地住在殖民地中。
讓我們來學一些新的單字。小 - 大慢 - 快矮 - 高瘦 - 胖硬 - 軟吵雜 - 安靜這些是一些單字跟他們的反義詞。你可以用這些字來造句子嗎?例如：『一隻螞蟻很小；一隻大象很大。』『跟螞蟻一樣忙』是一個適合用來形容一個人很熱真工作的形容。
冬天来啦！小鸟决定要给自己筑个巢。
她收集了一些小树枝，小心翼翼地建起了她的巢。
经过仔细和努力的工作，小巢终于筑好啦！小家非常温暖和舒适。
小鸟非常高兴。她躺在巢里，开始幻想着能度过一个舒适温暖的冬天。
当她慢慢地快要睡着的时候，她感觉到了摇晃
她想“也许是风吹的关系”，但是小巢继续摇晃，晃得更加厉害！
小鸟飞出了鸟巢，过了一会，鸟巢就掉到了地下。
小鸟看见一只大象正蹭着树挠痒痒呢。她非常生气。“你太粗鲁了，大象。”小鸟对着她生气地说，然后就飞走了。
她开始寻找新的家，一个没有大象的地方。
她开始重新筑巢。
在她的悉心努力下，她建了一个新家。小鸟累了，睡着了。
正当她要闭眼睡着的时候，她看到两个大大圆圆的眼睛，正瞪着她看。
这是一个刷墙工。他拿起小鸟的巢就扔了。然后他拿起笔和刷子开始涂墙。
小鸟被惹恼了：“你太粗鲁了，人类！”她生气的对他说然后飞走了。她的心充满着担忧。
在天空中飞翔的时候，她看到了一只漂浮在空中的气球。
另一只！
她向下一看，好多好多的气球啊！
小鸟看了一眼气球有了一个好主意。
又一次精心努力的工作，她又建了一个新巢。这一次，再也没有人打扰她了！
eng: Winter is approaching. A bird decides to build a nest.
She gathers little twigs and builds her nest carefully.
After a lot of care and hard work, the nest is ready. It is warm and cosy.
The bird is happy. She lies down and begins day-dreaming of a comfortable winter.
As she is about to fall asleep, she feels something shaking.
The bird thinks, “Maybe the wind is shaking the nest a little.” But the nest shakes and trembles and shakes some more.
The bird flies out of the nest. The next moment, the nest falls to the ground.
The bird sees an elephant using the tree to scratch her back. She is quite annoyed. “This is so rude of you, elephant!” she says to her angrily, and flies away.
She begins to search for a new place. A place where elephants can't reach her.
She starts building a new nest.
With care and hard work, she builds a home. Tired, she falls asleep.
Just as she is about to close her eyes, she sees two big, round eyes. They are staring at her.
It's a painter.He takes her nest and throws it away.Then he picks up a brush and starts painting the wall.
The bird is very annoyed. “This is so rude of you, human!” she says to him angrily and flies away. Her heart is heavy with worry.
As she flies, she sees a balloon floating in the air.
And another!
She looks below and sees lots and lots of balloons!
The bird looks at the balloons and has an idea.
With care and hard work, she builds a new nest. This time, nobody can disturb her.
Roja is sad. Amma is going to work.“I will be back before bedtime, kannamma,” says Amma.
“But at what time?” asks Roja.“At exactly 9 o’clock tonight,” replies Amma. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 6 o’clock in the morning.
“I want Amma to give me milk. Not you!” says Roja to Appa. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 8 o’clock in the morning.
“Let’s buy potatoes, Thaatha!” says Roja.“But we had potatoes just yesterday. How about brinjal today?” Thaatha asks. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 10 o’clock in the morning.
“Paati, let’s eat. Thaatha is making pappadam!” Roja yells. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 1 o’clock in the afternoon.

Honk! Honk! Roja’s Akka is back from school.“Paati says I will go to school with you after this summer. Won’t that be fun, Akka?” says Roja, excitedly. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 3 o’clock in the afternoon.
“It’s time to go home, Roja,” Appa calls out.“Just one last time!” shouts Roja. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 5 o’clock in the evening.
“Selvi, eat your dosai quickly! Only then will you become big and strong,” says Roja. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is 7 o’clock at night.
“And so, when the cap-seller threw down his cap, the monkeys threw their caps down too… ”
“AMMMAAAA!” Roja shouts. “What did you do all day, Roja?” Amma asks. Tick tock! Tick tock! It is almost 9 o’clock at night.
“I had a lot of fun today, Amma!  Appa fed me breakfast.  I bought brinjal with Thaatha.  He made pappadam for lunch.
I picked up Akka from the school van.I played in the park.I fed Selvi dinner.Appa told me a story and now you are back!” Roja says, with a wide smile.
Tick tock! Tick tock!It is 9 o’clock at night!

My Day Here are some things that Roja does at different times of the day.What did you do at the same time yesterday? Draw pictures of yourself doing these different things on a piece of paper.1. Roja eats breakfast at 8 o’clock. What did you do at 8 o’clock yesterday?2. Roja goes shopping at 10 o’clock. What did you do at 10 o’clock yesterday?

3. Roja eats lunch at 1 o’clock. What did you do at 1 o’clock yesterday?

4. Roja picks up Akka from the school van at 3 o’clock. What did you do at 3 o’clock yesterday?5. Roja plays in the park at 5 o’clock. What did you do at 5 o’clock yesterday?6. Roja feeds Selvi at 7 o’clock. What did you do at 7 o’clock yesterday?
zho:
罗哈有点伤心，因为阿马要上班了。“ 我睡觉时间之前会回来哦，坎纳玛

”

阿马说到。
罗哈问道“具体是几点回来啊”阿马回答”今晚9点肯定回来“滴答！滴答！现在是早上6点

“我想让阿马给我牛奶，不是你”

罗哈和爱派说到。滴答！滴答！现在是早上8点。
“咱们买土豆吧”罗哈说到。“可是我们昨天刚刚买了土豆，今天买茄子怎么样”爷爷问道。滴答！滴答！现在是早上10点。

“帕蒂，吃饭了。爷爷在做

帕帕达姆

” 罗哈喊道滴答！滴答！现在是下午1点。

滴！滴！

罗哈的亚卡从学校回来了。“帕蒂说我夏天过后就能和你去学校了。是不是很好呀，罗卡兴奋的说到。滴答！滴答！现在是下午3点。

“我们该回家啦”

爱派喊道。“再玩最后一回”罗哈喊道。滴答！滴答！现在是下午5点。

“

塞尔维 ，多吃一点，只有这样你才长的更大更强壮”罗哈说到。滴答！滴答！现在是晚上7点。
“所以，当卖帽子的扔掉帽子时，猴子们也扔掉了帽子”
“阿马！”罗哈喊道。”罗哈，今天过得怎么样呀“阿马问道。滴答！滴答！现在将近晚上9点了。

”我今天过得很开心，阿马！爱派给我做了早饭，我和爷爷买了茄子，爷爷中午做了帕帕达姆

“
我从校车上接回了亚卡。我在公园玩耍了。我还喂了塞尔维。爱派给我讲了故事，现在你也回来了！罗哈高兴的说着。
滴答！滴答！现在是晚上9点。
我的一天这是罗哈在每个时间做的事情。你昨天的这个时间都做了什么呀。请把它们画到纸上吧。1.罗哈早上8点在吃早餐。你昨天8点在做什么呀？2.罗哈10点去买东西。你昨天10点在做什么呀？3.罗哈下午一点在吃午饭。你昨天的下午1点在做什么呀？
4.罗哈下午3点从校车上接回了亚卡。你下午3点在做什么呀？5.罗哈下午5点在公园玩。你下午5点在做什么呀？6.罗哈晚上7点喂了塞尔维，你晚上7点在做什么呀？
球.
我的球.

到哪裡了呢?

"Dara, it's almost time to go to bed! Where have you been?" Mom asked angrily.﻿
Dara replied, "You know, there is a tall tree outside our school. I climbed this tree. It's too high and it's reaching into the sky."
"I looked down and saw white clouds. I looked up, but I heard the leaves laughing
"I don't think the leaves can laugh! Then I found out that the squirrel hiding under the leaves was giggling."
"The big squirrel asks me to eat a lot of nuts. The little squirrel is playing hide and seek in my hair!"
"We played for a long, long time, until I remembered that it was time to go home. But I don't know how to climb down the tree!"
"The squirrel started calling for help. You should hear these sounds! Haw--chiw--chiw--"
"Fortunately, a purple plane flew across the sky. Can you believe that the pilot heard the squirrels cry?"
"The plane descended from the sky. The pilot picked me up and drove me home."
"Mom, that's why I came back so late.""Dara! Don't make up stories and make excuses," Mom said
"Haw--"Haw--"Haw—"
zho: “达拉，都快到睡觉的时间了！你上哪里去了？”妈妈生气地问道。
达拉回答：“你知道的，在我们学校外面有一棵很高的树。我爬上了这棵树。它太高了，直插云霄。”
“我往下看，只见白云绵绵。我抬头望，却听见树叶在欢笑。”
“我想，树叶是不会笑的！然后，我发现，原来是藏在树叶底下的松鼠在咯咯笑呀。”
“大松鼠请我吃许多的坚果。小松鼠则在我的头发里玩起捉迷藏来！”
“我们玩了很久、很久，直到我想起来该回家了。但是，我不知道怎么从树上爬下去呀！”
“松鼠开始呼救。你应该听到这些声音！唧唧——唧唧——唧唧——”
“幸运的是，一架紫色的飞机飞过天际。你能相信吗，飞行员竟然听到了松鼠们的呼喊？”
“飞机从天上骤降下来，飞行员把我接上了机，并送我回家。”
“妈妈，这就是为什么我这么晚才回来的原因啊。”“达拉！别编故事找借口了，”妈妈说。
莎蜜拉開了便當盒皺著眉頭想 ：「誰要吃印度煎餅和茄子咖喱？我才不要呢。」媽媽上個禮拜給她燈籠椒紅蘿蔔麵吃。她回家時跟媽媽說：「麵扭來扭去，看起來像蚯蚓。」
「我不喜歡吃麵。」隔天，媽媽煮了花生豌豆粥，可是莎蜜拉只吃了花生，把剩下的食物帶回家。當媽媽問她為什麼沒吃完，她回答：「吃起來像濕濕的沙子。」
「那饅頭怎麼樣？」媽媽問。「好啊！我可以把他們像球一樣丟來丟去。可是吃起來像泥土，我絕對不會吃。」
莎蜜拉生氣地關了便當盒，然後走到學校中庭。牆壁上的螞蟻問：「莎蜜拉你為什麼不像其他孩子一樣吃午飯？」莎蜜拉說：「我不喜歡印度煎餅。 我不喜歡蔬菜。 我不想吃午飯。」
「蔬菜當然不能吃。」蝴蝶同意。「你想吃這隻蟑螂的翅膀嗎？這真的很好吃。」「不要！我不要惡心的蟑螂。」莎蜜拉逃到花園。
花園充滿五彩繽紛的花。美麗的蝴蝶從一朵飛到另外一朵。 一條橙色的蝴蝶與黑色的條紋說，「莎蜜拉你為什麼不像其他孩子一樣吃午飯？」
莎蜜拉說：「我不喜歡印度煎餅。 我不喜歡蔬菜。 我不想吃午飯。」「蔬菜當然不能吃。」蝴蝶同意。「那就像我們一樣從花里喝一些花蜜。 真的很好吃。」
莎蜜拉把她的舌頭伸進一朵花的中心，但什麼也找不到！ 「我不想要任何花蜜。 我想你是在欺騙我。」她哭著說。 她跑到草坪上的大菩提樹。
樹上的烏鴉說：「你好，莎蜜拉！ 你為什麼不像其他孩子一樣吃午飯？」莎蜜拉說：「我不喜歡印度煎餅。 我不喜歡蔬菜。 我不想吃午飯。」
「蔬菜當然不能吃。」烏鴉同意。「那就像我們一樣從花里喝一些花蜜。 真的很好吃。」「我給你一些很好的東西。」它在莎蜜拉的面前掉了半隻老鼠。「我不要！好可怕喔！ 老鼠留給你。」莎蜜拉尖叫著逃跑到牆壁邊。
牆壁上的麻雀說：「莎蜜拉你為什麼不像其他孩子一樣吃午飯？」莎蜜拉說：「我不喜歡印度煎餅。 我不喜歡蔬菜。 我不想吃午飯。」
「蔬菜當然不能吃。」麻雀們同意。「這裡有一些脆脆的薏米 - 真的很有營養。」莎蜜拉嚼了一個臉， 「這吃起來像石頭·。 連粥都比較好吃。」
一隻善良的麻雀馬上問她：「你想吃一些柔軟多汁的蚯蚓嗎？ 等一下，我拿給你。」就在它要飛走之前，莎蜜拉說：「 不要·，謝謝！ 我寧願吃麵。」她跑到學校門口。
在學校門口吃草的一頭牛說：「莎蜜拉你為什麼不像其他孩子一樣吃午飯？」莎蜜拉說：「我不喜歡印度煎餅。 我不喜歡蔬菜。 我不想吃午飯。」
「當然，煮熟的茄子根本不好吃。」牛同意。「讓我為你咬一些草，下雨後特別甜蜜。 你應該配旁邊的木槿灌木吃。 你太幸運了。 我只希望我能進入這個門。」
莎蜜拉覺得很噁心。 她說：「我不想吃任何草或灌木。即使粥也比草好吃。 我很高興門關上了，因為木槿花很漂亮，我不想讓你把它吃光。」
薩米拉跑回教室，開了便當盒。「我的印度煎餅和茄子咖哩好吃多了。」她立刻把它們吃完。
eng: Samira made a face when she opened her tiffin box and thought, ‘Who wants to eat parathas and brinjal curry? Not I.’Last week Amma had given her noodles with capsicum and carrots. “The noodles are squiggly and they look like worms,” she said when she went back home.

“I don’t like noodles.”  The next day, Amma made upma with peanuts and peas, but Samira ate only the peanuts in it and took the rest back home.“It was like wet sand,” she said when Amma asked her why she hadn’t eaten it.

“Shall I give you idlis?” asked Amma.“Oh, yes ! They would be lovely to play with. I can toss and catch them. But I will not eat them—idlis taste like mud.”So now there were parathas and brinjal curry. Ugh, ugh, ugh!

Shutting her tiffin box with a bang, Samira went to the school courtyard. A row of ants crawling along the wall said, “Samira, why aren’t you eating your lunch like all the other children?”Samira said, “I don’t like parathas. I don’t like vegetables. I don’t want any lunch.”

“Of course, one cannot eat vegetables,” the ants agreed. They offered her the wing of a cockroach that they were carefully carrying and said, “Now try this, it is really delicious.”“Oh no! I don’t want any horrible cockroaches,” said Samira and ran away to the garden.

Colourful flowers were blooming in the garden and butterflies were flitting from one to the other. An orange butterfly with black checks and stripes said, “Hello Samira! Why aren’t you eating your lunch like all the other children?”

Samira said, “I don’t like parathas. I don’t like vegetables. I don’t want any lunch.”“Of course, one cannot eat vegetables,” the butterfly agreed.“Why don’t you drink some nectar from the flowers like us? It is really delicious.”
Samira put her tongue into the centre of a flower but could find nothing! “I don’t want any nectar. And I think you are fooling me,” she cried. She ran to the big pipal tree in the lawn.
A crow cawing above called, “Hello Samira! Why aren’t you eating your lunch like all the other children?” Samira said, “I don’t like parathas. I don’t like vegetables. I don’t want any lunch.”

“Of course, one cannot eat vegetables,” the crow agreed, “Here, I’ll give you something nice,” and it dropped a half-eaten mouse for Samira.“Oh no! What a terrible thing! Keep your mouse for yourself,” screamed Samira and ran away to stand near the wall.

Some sparrows were chirruping on the ledge of the wall and called out, “Hello Samira! Why aren’t you eating your lunch like all the other children?”Samira said, “I don’t like parathas. I don’t like vegetables. I don’t want any lunch.”

“Of course, one cannot eat vegetables,” the sparrows agreed. “Here are some crunchy grains of barley — they are really nutritious.”Samira chewed one and made a face. “This is like eating pebbles. Even upma is better.”

A kind sparrow at once asked her, “Would you like some soft, juicy worms instead? Just a minute…”Just before it flew off to get her a worm, Samira said, “Worms indeed. No, thank you! I would much rather eat noodles,” and ran to the gate of the school.

A cow was lazily chewing cud just outside and mooed when it saw Samira. “Hello!” it called, “Why aren’t you eating your lunch like all the other children?”Samira said, “I don’t like parathas. I don’t like vegetables, especially brinjals. I don’t want any lunch.”

“Of course, cooked brinjals aren’t nice at all,” the cow agreed. “Let me bite off some of this grass for you — it is particularly sweet after the rains. You should eat it with the hibiscus bush next to you. You are so lucky. I wish I could get inside this gate.”

Samira was disgusted. She said, “I don’t want to eat any grass. Nor any bushes. Even idlis would taste better than grass. And I am glad the gate is closed because the hibiscus has pretty flowers and I don’t want you to eat them.”
Samira ran back to her classroom and opened her lunch box.‘How nice my parathas and brinjal curry are,’ she thought and quickly ate them up.

zho: 從前從前，鳥兒們開了一次會。他們想要一個國王，就像是人和動物們一樣。該讓哪一隻鳥成為國王呢？
「我選老鷹，他又強壯又有王者風範！」，有人說。「不，他沒有王冠，而且叫聲太糟糕了」，另一人回。「那麼駝鳥吧，因為他體型最大，而且怒吼就像獅子」，有人大喊。「不，他不會飛，鳥中之王一定要會飛。」
「我想我應該是國王」，孔雀邊說邊拍打尾羽。「我這麼的漂亮」。「你太驕傲了」，貓頭鷹說。「我有最大的眼睛，我才應該是國王」「不，才不是你，貓頭鷹」，他們大叫。「你都在太陽昇起時就去睡覺。」
他們遲遲沒有進展，然後一隻鳥有個主意。「不如讓可以飛最高的鳥當國王。」，他說。「好！好！」大家大聲叫道，然後所有鳥朝向天空飛去。
天鵝飛了一天，直直的朝向世界上最高的山。老鷹飛了兩天，飛向山頂的晴空。而禿鷹不停的飛翔了三天，筆直地朝向太陽飛去。
禿鷹遠遠的超越其他鳥，他們聽見禿鷹大喊「我是飛最高的，我是國王！」
但是從禿鷹上方傳來一陣小小的聲音，「啾啾啾，我才是飛最高的，我是國王。」那是恩愛迪，一隻小笛聲扇尾鶯，世界上最小的鳥！他緊抓著禿鷹龐大的翅膀羽毛，隨著他一起飛向天空！
「你不會再次打敗我的」禿鷹說著，然後繼續向上飛去。他飛啊飛直到無法繼續飛下去。「我比所有的鳥還要高，我是你們的國王！」他大喊。
但是，在他的翅膀底下不知不覺的躲了一隻小鳥。「啾啾啾，我在這裡哦，世界上最小的鳥！我是你們的國王。」禿鷹實在是累得無法再繼續飛了。
當禿鷹往下飛行，那隻小鳥依然在他的翅膀底下。其他的鳥們對恩愛迪相當生氣，準備要把他的羽毛全部拔掉。
不過那敏捷的小鳥看見大家是多麼生氣，就飛進了一個空的蛇洞。
「用你的大眼睛，你一定要好好的看守這個洞，當他出來的時候抓住他。」大家對貓頭鷹說。因此貓頭鷹坐在洞口前。
但是在太陽溫暖的照射下貓頭鷹馬上就睡著了。那小鳥向外偷看，發現貓頭鷹睡著，就咻咻的飛走了。
貓頭鷹讓那隻小鳥逃走感到非常羞愧。現在他只有晚上出來狩獵。白天他就待在其他鳥看不到的地方睡覺。
eng: Once long ago, the birds had a meeting. They wanted a king, just like people and animals. Which bird should be king?

"The Eagle, he is strong and kingly!" said one. "No, he has no crown, and when he calls, he sounds too sad," said another. "Then Ostrich, because he is the largest and roars like a lion," one called out. "No, he can't fly. The king of the birds must be able to fly."

"I think I should be king," said Peacock, fanning his tail. "I am so beautiful." "You are too proud," said Owl. "I have the largest eyes of any bird. I should be king." "No, not you, Owl," they shouted. "You go to sleep when the sun rises."
And so they didn’t get very far. Then one bird had an idea. “He who can fly the highest will be king,” he said. “Yes, yes,” they shouted, and they all flew up, up, into the sky.

The Goose flew for one day, straight over the highest mountains in the world. The Eagle flew for two days into the blue above the mountains. But the Vulture soared for three whole days without stopping, straight toward the sun.
Way above them, the birds heard Vulture cry, "I am the highest, I am king!"

But then just above him Vulture  heard a tiny voice, "Tink, tink, tink! I am the highest, I am king." It was Ncede, the Neddicky, the smallest bird of all! He had held onto the great wing feathers of Vulture as he soared into the sky!
"You won’t beat me again," said Vulture, and soared straight up into the air. He flew up and up until he could fly no more. "I am higher than any other bird. I am your king!" he cried.
But out from under his wing crept the tiny bird. "Tink, tink! Tink, tink! It is I, the smallestone! I am your king." Vulture was too exhausted to fly any further.
So down he sailed - with the little bird still under his wing. The other birds were furiouswith Ncede. They waited for him, ready to pluck out all his feathers.
But the quick little bird saw how angry they were, and flew into an empty snake hole.
"With your big eyes, you must keep guard at the hole and catch him when he comes out," they said to Owl. So Owl sat in front of the hole.
But the sun was warm and soon Owl was fast asleep. The little bird peeped out, saw that Owl was asleep, and z-zip, away he went.
Owl was very ashamed that he had let the little bird escape. Now he only hunts at night. In the day, he sleeps, away from the sight of the other birds.

One day, Avani was sitting at the kitchen table, watching her mother cook. Amma got the cooker

ready.
"Avani, please give me the peas," Amma said.

Avani took a bowl of dried peas from the kitchen table and gave it to Amma.
One pea fell out of the bowl. Avani and Amma did not see it!

The pea bounced on the table, onto the floor...... and rolled under the table. 

Chikki the cat found it.
   She pushed it. She pawed at it. She tried to lick it.

The pea rolled to the kitchen door.Chikki pushed it again. 

It rolled out... 
... into the garden.

A mynah saw the pea. She pecked at it with her beak. But it was too hard.

 

She pecked at it again. With a jump, the pea landed

on the soil, near a tomato plant.

An earthworm popped out of the ground. It looked at the pea, but did not find it interesting. It popped back into the ground.Now there was a hole in the ground! The pea slipped into the hole, and got covered by loose mud. It rested in the cool, dark mud.

The days passed. The rains came. The pea got wet. It swelled,  
and it swelled a little more.
It grew a tail... ... and a crown.

The crown shot out of the ground, and tried to reach for the sun.
It grew taller... and taller... and taller!

Avani saw it when she was playing in the garden.  
"Amma! Look here!" she said."A pea plant!" said Amma. 

Both of them looked at the pea plant. They were surprised.

"Did you plant it?" Amma asked Avani.
"No Amma, did you not sow it?" asked Avani.  "Then, who did it?" they wondered. "Who planted it?"You and I know, don’t we?

Try it yourself!1.   Plant a seed in a small pot and water it every day. 2.   Does it grow if you keep the pot in a dark and cool place?  3.   Many sprouted seeds and grains are very good for our health. Which sprouts do you like to eat?
zho: 有一天，阿瓦尼坐在厨房的桌子旁，看着她母亲做饭。妈妈准备好了，她说 阿瓦尼，请把豌豆给我。
阿瓦尼从桌子上拿了一碗豌豆，递给了妈妈。但是阿瓦尼和妈妈都没有注意有一颗豌豆掉了出来!
豌豆在桌子上弹了起来，落到地上...... 然后滚到了桌子下面。猫咪Chikki发现了它。 她推了推它。她用爪子抓着它，尝试去舔它。
豌豆滚到了厨房门口。Chikki又推了推它。就这样，豌豆滚了出去.........到了花园里。
一只小鸟看到了这颗豌豆，于是用嘴啄了一下它，但是它实在太硬了。 于是她又啄了一下它，豌豆一跃而起，落在了土壤上，掉在一株西红柿的附近。
一只蚯蚓从地下钻了出来。它看了看豌豆，但并不觉得它有什么意思。它又蹦回了地里。现在，地面上有一个洞！豌豆滑进了洞里。豌豆滑进了洞里，被松散的泥土覆盖。它在凉爽的黑泥中休息。
日子一天天过去。雨水来了。豌豆被打湿，变得饱满啦。又饱满了一点。它长出了尾巴......长出了像皇冠一样的树叶。。。
它从地下伸展出来，并尝试接近太阳。它越来越高......越来越高......越来越高!
阿瓦尼在花园里玩耍时看到了它。妈妈， 看这里！她说。一株豌豆！妈妈说。他们两个人都看了看那株豌豆，他们都觉得很惊讶。
是你种的吗？妈妈问阿瓦尼。不，妈妈，不是你播种的吗？"阿瓦尼反着问妈妈。那么，是谁干的？他们想知道是到底是谁种的？"我们都知道 “不是我们” ？
让我们尝试一下吧!1. 在一个小盆里种下一粒种子，每天给它浇水。2. 如果你把花盆放在黑暗和阴凉的地方，它能生长吗？3. 许多发芽的食物 对我们的健康很有好处。4. 你喜欢吃哪些发芽的食物？

eng: Sringeri Srinivas was having a very bad day.Nobody wanted the sweet, ripe bananas he was growing on his farm.
Not his family.Not his neighbour.Not his friends.
Not the traders who could sell the bananas in far away markets. And not even his cows!
“No, thank you,” they all said. “The bananas are very sweet but we have had too many. We cannot eat any more!”
Poor Sringeri Srinivas!What was he to do now with his rich harvest of bananas?
He decided to seek help from the Farmer's Centre in Doddooru, a big town near his village
Off he went carrying the best crop of bananas.Surely someone there would have a good idea for him.
A few days later, Sringeri Srinivas returned home looking very happy. He went back to growing bananas on his farm.
But he did not offer the fruits to anyone anymore.
Not to his family.Not to his neighbour.Not to his friends.
Not to the traders who could sell the bananas in far away markets. And not even to his cows!
Everyone became very curious.Where were all the bananas going?
One day, neighbour Shivanna arranged a very big pooja.
The priest asked him to get 108 ripe bananas as an offering to the gods.
Shivanna ran to Sringeri Srinivas. “I’m sorry for saying no to you before, but now I need 108 ripe bananas.Can you help me, please?”
Sringeri Srinivas tapped his chin. “Well, my crop has just been cut but let me see what I can do. You may start your pooja. I will surely come.”
The pooja started.The whole village came to watch.The priest began chanting.
Soon it became time to offer bananas to the gods.
Just then, in came Sringeri Srinivas carrying a big bag.
From the bag, he carefully took out 27 packets and laid them out before the holy fire. Each packet was carefully wrapped in banana leaf.
On each one was written - “High Quality Banana Halwa, S.S. Farms.” Sringeri Srinivas offered one to the priest.
“Each one has the pulp of 4 bananas. There are 27 packets. So here are your 108 ripe bananas!”
The priest was so surprised that he forgot to chant. In the silence, one child began to laugh.
Soon the whole village was laughing and clapping.
Now we know what Sringeri Srinivas does with all the bananas that he grows!

DID YOU KNOW?Facts About Bananas The word banana is derived from the Arabic word for ‘finger’. India is the largest producer of bananas in the world. There are over 120 edible varieties of bananas grown here. The National Research Centre on Bananas in Trichy has a collection of 1120 banana varieties! Bananas are high in minerals that help increase brain power. Bananas make students more active and alert. Many Indian sweets are made out of bananas - Banana Payasam in Kerala, Banana Rasayana in Karnataka, Banana Halwa, Rawa Kela-Gur Mithai. Do you know some more?
zho: 史林傑今天過的很糟糕。他在農場裡種的那些香香甜甜的熟香蕉，都沒有人想要買。
他的家人不想買香蕉。他的鄰居不想買香蕉。他的朋友也不想買香蕉。
那些可以把香蕉賣到遠方市場的小販們不想買香蕉。就連他的牛也不想買香蕉！
「不用了，謝謝。」大家都這樣說。「你的香蕉真的很甜，但我們手上都有太多香蕉了，真的再也吃不下了」
可憐的史林傑！現在他該拿這些大豐收的香蕉們怎麼辦呢？
他決定找多多魯鎮的農夫中心幫忙，多多魯鎮是他村子附近的一個大城鎮。
載著他最好吃的香蕉，史林傑出發了！那裡一定有人可以給他一些好點子！
幾天後，史林傑回到了家裡，看起來非常開心。他又繼續回他的農場裡頭種香蕉。
但是他再也不把香蕉給任何人了。
不給他的家人香蕉。不給他的鄰居香蕉。也不給他的朋友香蕉。
不給那些可以把香蕉賣到遠方市場的小販們香蕉。就連他的牛也不給！
大家都很好奇，那些香蕉都拿去哪了呢？
某一天，鄰居史瓦納，正要準備一個非常盛大的祭典。
祭司請史瓦納準備 108 根成熟的香蕉，來當作給神明的供品。
史瓦納跑到史林傑那裏，問他：「很抱歉我之前拒絕了你，　但現在我需要 108 根熟香蕉，你可以幫幫我嗎，拜託？」
史林傑摸了摸下巴，說：「恩……我的作物才剛採收完，我想想看我可以怎麼幫你……　你先回去開始你的祭典吧，我等一下一定會過去的！」
祭典開始了。全村的人都跑來看。祭司開始誦經。
馬上就要把香蕉獻給神明們了。
就在此時，史林傑帶著一個大麻袋走了進來。
從袋子裡，他小心地拿出了 27 個小包裹，把它們放在聖火前。每個小包裹都細心地用香蕉葉裹著。
每個小包裹上都寫著：高品質香蕉哈瓦甜糕－－史家農場製史林傑拿了一個甜糕給祭司。
「每塊甜糕裡都有四根香蕉的果肉。　　這裡有 27 塊，那就等於有 108 根香蕉了！」
祭司實在是太驚訝了，都忘了要繼續誦經。在一片沉默中，有個小孩笑了出來。
很快地，整個村子的人，都跟著大笑和鼓掌。
現在，我們終於知道史林傑到底都把他種的香蕉拿去做什麼了！

你知道嗎？關於香蕉的小知識英文的香蕉(Banana)這個字，其實是從阿拉伯文中「手指」這個字演變而來。印度是世界上產最多香蕉的地方，總共有超過 120 種的可食用香蕉在這裡種植著。
位於印度特里奇(Trichy)的國家香蕉研究中心，則收集了超過1120種香蕉品種！香蕉富含礦物質，可以增強腦力，幫助學生更加有活力和專注。
很多印度甜點都是由香蕉製成的，包括：Kerala的香蕉米布丁(payasam)、Karnataka的香蕉甜湯(Banana Rasayana)、香蕉哈瓦甜糕(Halwa)、香蕉麩糕(Rawa Kela-Gur Mithai)……你還知道哪些香蕉點心呢？
我是一个大女孩。 我可以自己一个人出门。
真是太黑了！ 有人在吗？ 是谁呀？
哦，只是一只猫而已。 我不害怕。
我看到外面一个很大很黑的东西！ 是什么东西？
哦，只是一口井而已。 我不害怕。
那声音！ 吱吱作响！ 是什么东西？
只有我妹妹从井里打水！ 我不害怕。
我听到脚步声！ 是谁呀？ 是谁呀？
是我的母亲。她从田里回家了。
我现在是个大女孩了。
我什么东西都不怕！
eng: I am a big girl. I go out of the house alone.
It is so dark!.. Is someone there?.. What is it?..
Oh! It is just the cat... I am not afraid...
I can see a big dark thing outside!.. What is it?..
Oh! it is just the well*... I am not afraid... ﻿*well - колодец
And that sound! "Creak... creak... creak!"... What is it?..

Just my sister
drawing* water from the well!.. I am not afraid...*drawing - черпающий, набирающий
I can hear footsteps!... Who is that? Who is that?!
It is my mom! She is back home from the fields.
I am a big girl now!
I am not afraid of anything!
On a bright sunny day, a fawn was racing in a forest.
On his way he met a rabbit, he ran past the fast runner.
Next, he met an elephant and he ran past the huge animal too.
Then came a stream, he leapt and cleared the stream feeling refreshed with the fresh and cool water.
He was still full of energy, so he ran past the crumbling wall too.
He was sure that he is going to win the race and in his excitement he missed a large boulder on the grassy plain. He stumbled and fell down.
He got hurt in his leg and was bleeding. He burst into tears.
Hearing his cry a monkey came and massaged his aching leg and the tears flowed from the fawn's eyes.
Brother bear also came and picked him up but the fawn didn't stop crying
Mama dear came running to her baby and said, "Look we'll beat up this bad boulder!"
The fawn forgot his pain and stood up and said, "Oh, don't do that or he will also start crying." His mother laughed and hugged him. So did the fawn.
zho: 有一隻小鹿在森林裡賽跑。
他超越了兔子。
他超越了大象。
他一跳，躍過了一條溪。
他跑過了一道坍方的牆。
他被一顆在草原裡的大石頭絆倒、並跌個大跤。
他哭了出來。
一隻猴子按摩他的腿。小鹿的眼淚卻一直掉下來。
一隻大熊把他抱起來。小鹿還是一直哭。
他的媽媽來了。媽媽說：『看！我來教訓這顆大石頭！』
小鹿說：『喔，媽媽別這樣！不然他也會哭的！』他的媽媽笑了出來，小鹿也跟著破涕為笑。
小鹿說：『喔，媽媽別這樣！不然他也會哭的！』他的媽媽笑了出來，小鹿也跟著破涕為笑。

eng: Can you guess who our best friend is? He’s not like us at all.
Our best friend is Bird!
I am Rhino. I get covered in fleas.
Bird eats them all up.
I am Crocodile. I can’t brush my teeth.
Bird pecks them all clean.
I am Giraffe.I can’t scratch my head.
Bird can reach just the right spot.
I am Zebra. I can’t see things far away.
Bird has great eyes, so when he’s watching I’m safe.
Bird might be different, but that’s no problem…
We don’t even mind when he sings!
Will you be my friend?
zho: 你能猜出谁是我们共同的好朋友吗？他和我们长得可不一样了。
小鸟是我们共同的好朋友！
我是犀牛阿诺。我浑身上下都是跳蚤。
小鸟来了可真好，把跳蚤统统吃掉。
我是鳄鱼库台儿。我没办法给自己刷牙。
小鸟来了可真好，把牙齿上的结石都啄掉。
我是长颈鹿阿福。我挠不到自己的头。
小鸟来了可真好，舒服、舒服，这里再挠挠。
我是斑马札巴。我眼睛近视，看不清远方。
小鸟来了可真好，有他帮我盯着梢，我能安安心心去吃草。
虽然小鸟和我们不一样，但是……
我们依然可以做好朋友！
你会和我做朋友吗？

eng: It is Rani's first day at school.Her mother is holding her hand and walking her to school."I am grown up now", Rani says to her mother. "Let go my hand, let go!"Her mother holds her hand even more tightly.
There were many children reaching the school already.Some children came by bus, by car, some by rickshaw, cycle.And some came by walking, just like Rani.
Rani and her mother reached the school gate, and her mother let go off her hand.Her mother stays at the gate. Now Rani has to go inside alone.There are many new faces all around her.

She takes one step, then another. She looks back, her mother was getting smaller and smaller as she walks away. She thinks. will my mother disappear and feels scared so runs back to her.She doesn't feel so grown up and holds her mother's hand and says "Don't go away".

All the students were inside by now, Rani was the only one outside.The teacher comes out and smiles at Rani. Rani smiles back at her teacher and let go off her mother's hand. Her mother says, "Rani, I will be here when you come out."Her mother waves to her and goes away.
Rani went inside. She was now happy, her mother will be there after school!
zho: 今天是我第一天上学。妈妈握着我的手走着。“我现在长大了”我说。“快走吧！”妈妈把我的手握得紧紧地。
学校附近有很多小孩。有的坐巴士来。有的父母开车来。有的坐三轮车。有的骑自行车来。有的像我一样走过来。
我们到达校门时，妈妈松开我的手。她待在校门外面。我必须一个人进去。我周围有很多新面孔。
我往前走一步。我又往前走一步。我回头看着妈妈。她变的越来越小了。她会消失吗？我往回跑。我现在感觉不那么成熟了。我握住她的手。“别走”我说。
所有的人都进去了。外面只剩下我一个人了。老师从里面走出来。她对我笑一笑。我对她笑一笑。妈妈说，“罗尼，你出来的时候我会在这儿等你的。”我松开她的手。她对我摆摆手。
我往里面跑去。我放学的时候，妈妈一定会在外面等我呢！
我有五种感官。
我用眼睛看。我的眼睛是黑色的。
我看到蓝色的大海。
我用耳朵听。我和我的小狗都有两只耳朵。
我听到美妙的音乐。
我用鼻子闻。
我闻到，橙色的花的香气。
我用舌头尝。黄色的柠檬好酸！
我用手摸。
爸爸的手又大又宽，很温暖。
eng: I have five senses.
I use my eyes to see.My eyes are black.
I can see the blue ocean.
I use my ears to listen. The dog and I both have two ears.
I can hear the lovely music.
I use my nose to smell.
I can smell, the nice scent from the orange flower.
I use my tongue to taste. The yellow lemon is sour!
I use my hands to touch.
Daddy's hand is big, wide, and very warm.

zho: 米拉和我是好朋友。她是这个世界上我最喜欢的人。你知道为什么吗？因为只有她能看见我。

她喜欢的我都喜欢，我喜欢的，她也都喜欢。我们的名字也很像。

米拉和

美拉。
在她身上发生的事情，同样也会在我身上发生。“我掉了一颗牙“，米拉说。当我掉了一根刺的时候。
有的时候，我们还有点不一样。米拉制造麻烦，我解决它们。

比如说有一天外面正在下雨——“噢我们今天不能出去玩了”

米拉说。
我知道了！我们可以做个纸船。
或者是当她开学的时候。“如果我交不到朋友怎么办？”米拉着急的说。“你和我成为了朋友啊，现在更交更多的朋友”我告诉她。
现在到我讲故事啦。美拉是这个世界上我最喜欢的人。你知道为什么吗？它总是能变换视角，所以我也能有不同的视角。
美拉从来不让我自己单独打架。虽然说她也帮不上什么忙。

她让每天都变成冒险。就像上次我们一起去了

姆鲁古迷宫。“让我们冲出去“美拉说。
就像美拉说的，我们是好朋友。
eng: Meera and I are a team. She’s my most favourite person in the world. Do you know why? She’s the only one who can see me!
Everything she likes, I like. Everything I like, she likes. Our names also sound the same. Meera and Ameera!
Things that happen to her happen to me too. “I lost another tooth,” Meera says. While I lost another quill.
Sometimes, we can be a little different. Meera makes up problems. I make them go away.
Like the other day when it was raining—“Oh no, now we can’t go out to play,” Meera cried.
But I had an idea! Off we sailed on a paper boat.
Or the time when she started school.“What if I don’t make any friends?” Meera was worried.“You made friends with me. Now go make one more friend,” I told her.
It’s my turn to tell the story now. Ameera is my most favourite person in the world. Do you know why? She turns stuff upside down, just so I have a different view.
Ameera never lets me walk into a fight alone. Even though she doesn’t help much.
She makes every day a BIG adventure. Like the time we had to get out of a murukku maze. “I know! Let’s eat our way out,” Ameera said.
Like Ameera said, we’re a team.

zho: 看過來. 你願意跟我們交朋友嗎？
我有一雙強壯的腿所以我能夠跑得非常快
我用我強壯的雙臂盪鞦韆
我很喜歡畫畫, 用我的雙手
我能畫一張你嗎？我可以透過我的眼睛看到你
我的耳朵能聽到鳥兒唱歌, 好好聽
我的鼻子聞到好香的味道, 應該是媽媽在煮飯
我的牙齒也很堅固, 可以咬甘蔗
我的舌頭告訴我這個超甜的
我很會唱歌, 你想聽我唱嗎？
媽媽說我有一副好嗓子, 是從喉嚨出來的嗎？
eng: Look at us. Do you want to be our friend?
My legs are very strong. I can run really fast with them.
And my arms... such a nice swing!
I like to draw. I use my hands for drawing.
Should I draw your picture? I can see you with my eyes.
The bird sings a sweet song. I can hear it with my ears.
I think Ma is making halwa. I can smell it with my nose.
Oh! This sugarcane is so tough! But my teeth are strong too!
It is very sweet. My tongue just told me.
I can sing. Should I sing you a song?
Ma says I have a good voice. Does it come from my throat?

他穿了一件紅色的上衣。
２. 橘色

eng: What are the seven colors of the rainbow?

He wears a red shirt.
2. Orange

3. Yellow
What is yellow in this picture?
3. Green

5. Blue

﻿6. Indigo

7. Violet
