zho: 這是一項巨大的任務，它是首要的任務，第二也是非常重要的，因為你永遠不能忽視大自然的召喚。 所以當你得去的時候你就得去！有些人可以在家裡做這些事情，有些人需要外出。 有些人在倒完成後需要倒入些水來清洗，其他人不需要。 在世界不同的地方有所不同，就像在歷史中的不同時期一樣。
廁所的歷史很久以前，大約3000多年前，印度河谷的人們都有美麗的房子，裡面裝有廁所。 人們可以在隱密地完成他們的事情，然後倒入一桶水，將廢物沖洗至溝渠裏去。 這樣他們可以保持房屋和街道的清潔。
印度河谷位於當今的巴基斯坦和印度，是除了古埃及和美索不達米亞之外我們所知道的三個最古老的文明之一。 從今時今日我們所看到的廢墟中，印度河谷人民的建築技術水平很高，他們擅長製作金屬和陶瓷製品，並且非常精心的策劃了城市排水系統。

大約在同一時間，世界其他地方都有類似的廁所安排。 在埃及和巴比倫，廁所是安裝在家園內的，而蘇格蘭的斯卡拉·布萊（Scara Brae）和地中海的米諾克里特島（Minoan Crete）的遺跡顯示了許多管道，這些管道顯示出那裏的廁所應該是安裝於家裏。大約在二千年前的羅馬，人們都是使用公共廁所的。 一塊長長的石塊裏每隔一小段就有鎖眼形的切口。 人們會坐在這些開口處，一邊上廁所一邊和他們旁邊的人進行友好的交談。我已告訴你那是“公共”廁所！
他們事後是怎麼清理自己的，你知道嗎 ？在我告訴你後你可能希望你從來沒有好奇過。他們會以一條長長的棍子把一塊海綿貼在一端，然後將海綿浸入水中，用它擦拭屁股。 在他們感到乾淨後，他們只是把棍子交給坐在一旁的鄰居，然後他們會把它浸在水中，再次使用它。 讓我給你一個友好的提示 - 如果你到這個地方，請確保你選擇第一個座位！
在羅馬，不是每個人都不得不在公共場合如廁。 如果你是超級富豪，你會在家裡有一個便壺讓你如廁。 一旦完成，您只需清理到外面的街道上。 如果當時有人偶然經過那只能說他們倒霉了！大約500年前，英國的伊麗莎白女王在她家裡建了一座廁所。 那座廁所有一條管道通向外面的污水坑。 但是她沒並什麼機會使用到，因為下水道的臭氣充塞了廁所，臭味難聞直至令人無法呼吸。 所以她又回覆使用原先的便壺。
現在的廁所現今的廁所不臭，這是如何辦到的？1775年，英國發明家亞歷山大·康明（Alexander Cumming）發現了一種方式。 他不用直管將馬桶連接到污水管，而是將其做成S形。 這樣做可以確保在糞便和尿液排放下來時，氣味不會上升。 你有沒有註意到在沖洗後，馬桶總會保留有一點點的水？ 這就是以密封方式防止臭味通過排水口進入廁所。
就像古時代一樣，現今社會中，世界各地的廁所都各有所不同。有些地方根本沒有廁所。 一些廁所是坐式的，有些是蹲式的。 有些是以水桶用於沖洗，有些則是裝有一個充滿水的大水槽和一個可以釋放水的手柄。 有些廁所還備有衛生紙，有些廁則有一個水龍頭或一桶水讓人沖洗乾淨。

有一些廁所根本不用水。 就如飛機上的廁所，隨著飛機動盪，馬桶裡當然不適合存有任何水！ 那些廢物通過強大的真空被吸入並儲存在下面的槽中。那些廢物將在飛機降落後被清理。除此之外，陸地上有些廁所也是沒有水的。 他們是為了有些不容易獲得水的地方所設計和建造的，比如泰米爾納德邦（Tamil Nadu）和馬哈拉施特拉邦（Maharashtra）的偏遠村莊。 既然那些廁所一直運作良好，那把我們都建類似的廁所是不是一個好主意呢？ 如果我們使用的水越少，我們制造的廢物及污水就越少，那也對地球越好不是嗎？
未來的廁所怎麼建造無水廁所？第一步是確保不要讓尿液和糞便混合。 不，它不像聽起來那樣噁心 - 它只需要一個巧妙的設計。 就像有一個篩子，讓廢水通過，但可以擋住糞便並傳送到不同的坑。
既然尿液本身是無害的（只有聚集在尿液上的細菌會引起臭味和危害），這樣我們便能將它們安全地流入地面或廢物利用。 方法如下：氫氣我們可以從尿液中分離出氫氣來，並用於燃燒發電機。 尿液中還含有氮，磷，鉀，浙西是肥料的重要成分。 現在我們處理了尿液，那我們將如何處理那些糞便呢？ 嗯，如果將其與灰和草混合併放置在坑中，數以百萬計的細菌會將其分解成可用於農業的有用的堆肥。
這些廁所將幫助我們建設一個沒有“浪費”的世界。 相反的，它可以讓我們廢物利用，變成一些有用的東西。如果一個城市的所有房屋都建有這樣的廁所，就不會有污水，也不需要昂貴的污水處理廠，更不會將污水通過排水渠流到湖泊和河流！ 那將會是個美好的未來！
第18頁是一個棋盤遊戲。 你需要和幾個朋友玩，並需要一個骰子。 以下是一些指示說明：在3女王的便壺：非法的使用女王的便壺。處罰：被懲罰待在她的廁所2圈。在6羅馬廁所的第一座位：對你有好處！第一位使用海綿！向前移動7個空格。

在9待在廁所排隊！只有在您獲得2或4時才移動。在12羅馬廁所最後座位：呸。 不想使用那個海綿？ 好吧，我們會讓你消磨时间時間。 停止轉一圈在15摩亨佐 - 達羅（Mohenjo-daro）：恭喜！ 你已經進入了所有時間最好的廁所之一！ 所以你可以再次投擲骰子。 如果你獲得2,4 或 6，那就移動相應的格子數量吧。 如果你獲得1,3 或 5，那你可以選擇板上的任何棋子（除了你的），並將它往後移動相應的格子數量。
在19哎呀。 把廁所弄髒了移回3個空格。在21無水馬桶：恭喜！ 你剛剛使用無水廁所！ 拿快捷吧！在23空中廢物！噢親愛的！ 你被飛行的廢物擲中了！ 只有當您獲得1或6時才移動。
eng:
It’s a big job, it’s number one priority and number two is
pretty important too, because you can never ignore nature’s call.
So when you gotta go, you gotta go! Some people can do this business
inside their houses, some have to go outside. Some pour water after
it’s done, others need not. It’s different in different parts of
the world, just as it was different at different times in history.

Toilets of the past

A very long time ago, more than 3,000 years ago,
the people of Indus Valley had beautiful houses with toilets built
inside them. People could finish their business in privacy and pour a
bucket of water which would flush the waste down a drain. This way,
they managed to keep their houses and streets clean.

The Indus Valley, situated in present day Pakistan and India, is one of the three oldest civilizations that we know of, the other two being Ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia. From what we can see of the ruins today, the people of Indus Valley had great building skills, were good at making metal and ceramic products, and planned their city-wide drainage systems very elaborately.

Around the same time, similar toilet arrangements were present in
other parts of the world. Homes in Egypt and Babylonia had toilets
built in, and the ruins in Skara Brae in Scotland and the Minoan
Crete in the Mediterranean show plenty of pipes leading out of what
definitely seems like a toilet inside a house. 


A little later, about 2,000 years ago in Rome, people used public
toilets. A long slab of stone had keyhole-shaped cuts at intervals.
People would sit on these openings and do their toilet business while
having a friendly chat with the person next to them. I told you it
was a “public” toilet!

How did they clean themselves, do you wonder? After I tell you, you
might wish you had never wondered. 



They took a long stick that had a sponge attached to one end and
dipped the sponge into water, and then used it to wipe their
backsides. After they felt clean, they simply handed the stick over
to their neighbour, who dipped it in water and used it again. Let me
give you a friendly tip here – if you ever find yourself in this
place, make sure you pick the very first seat!

Not everyone had to poop in public in Rome. If you were super-rich,
you would have a chamber pot at home into which you would do your
business. Once done, you would simply empty the contents onto the
street outside. And if someone happened to walk by at the time, well,
too bad for them!

About 500 years ago, Queen Elizabeth of England had a toilet
constructed inside her house. It had a pipe leading out into a sewage
pit outside. But she never used it much because the stench from the
sewer filled the toilet and she could not even breathe. So back to
the chamber pot she went.

Toilets of the present
Toilets these days don’t stink. How did they achieve that? In 1775,
the English inventor Alexander Cumming figured out a way. Instead of
using a straight pipe to connect the toilet to the sewage line, he
made it S-shaped. This made sure that while poop and pee and water
can go 

down
the drain, no
smell can come back up. Have you noticed that a little
water always stays in the toilet even after flushing? This is what
creates the "seal" and prevents the foul smell from entering the
room through the drain.

Just like olden times, different parts of the world today have
different kinds of toilets.Some places don’t have toilets at all.
Some toilets are made for sitting, some are made for squatting. Some
have a bucket with water for flushing, others have a tank filled with
water and a handle that releases the water. Some toilets have paper
to wipe the backside, some have a tap or a bucket of water to wash
up.

There are some toilets that don’t use water at all. Like the ones
on a plane. With all the turbulence, you certainly don’t want any
water in the toilet bowl! The waste is removed by a powerful vacuum
and stored in a tank below. After the plane lands, the waste is
disposed of.

There are also waterless toilets on the ground. They were designed
and built for places without easy access to water, such as remote
villages in Tamil Nadu and Maharashtra. They have been working well,
so wouldn’t it be a good idea to have such toilets everywhere?
Because the less water
we use, and
the less sewage we create, the better for the planet, right?

Toilets of the future

How do you make a waterless toilet?

The first step is to make sure that you don’t let the urine and the
faeces mix. No it’s not as gross as it sounds – it just needs the
pot to be designed in a clever way. Like having a sloping bamboo mat
act as a sieve that will allow the waste water to pass through, but
can hold the poop and send it to a different pit.

Since urine by itself is not harmful (it’s only the bacteria that
collect on open urine that cause the smell and the hazard), it can be
safely let into the ground or put to use. Here’s how: Hydrogen can
be separated from the urine and used to fuel a generator.Urine also has nitrogen, phosphorus and potassium that are great
ingredients for fertilizers.Now that urine is taken care of, what do we do with the solid waste?
Well, if it is properly mixed with ash and grass, and allowed to rest
in a pit, millions of bacteria will break it down into perfectly
useful compost for agriculture.

These toilets will help us build a world where there is no "waste." Instead it is turned into something of use. If
all houses in a city have such toilets, no sewage comes out of them,
no expensive sewage treatment plants are necessary and no sewage will
flow through the drains into lakes and rivers! What a great future for everyone!

On pg 18 is a board game. You’ll need a few friends to play with and a die. Below are instructions on what to do if you land here: 


	
	
	
	


At
3
Queen’s chamber pot:
Illegal use of Queen’s chamber
pot. Punishment: Banished into her toilet for 2 turns. 

At
6
Roman toilet first seat:
Good for you! First use of
sponge! Move ahead 7 spaces.

At
			9
Stuck in the toilet queue! Move only if you roll a 2 or a
			4.

At
12
Roman toilet last seat:
Yuck. Don’t want to use that
sponge? Okay, we'll let you kill the time. Lose a turn. 

At
15
Mohenjo-daro:
Congratulations! You have entered one of
the best toilets of all time! So you get to roll the die again. If
you roll 2,4,6 move that many spaces forward. If you roll 1,3,5 you
can pick any pawn on the board (other than yours) and move it that
many spaces back.

At
19
Oops. Left the toilet dirty. Move back 3 spaces. 

At
21
Waterless toilet:
Congratulations! You just used a
waterless toilet! Take the short-cut! 

At
23
Flying waste!
Oh dear! You got hit by flying waste! Move
only if you roll a 1 or 6.

zho: “我每天都只吃生胡萝卜,” 兔子对自己说到。
"我厌倦了生胡萝卜!"
“我能做些什么让它们更好吃呢?"
那天下午，她经过农夫家的房子，看到火上烧着一口锅。
正当她开始有点子了，农夫的狗跑出来叫着追赶她。
“嗯," 兔子思考着. "我现在该怎么做呢?"
兔子试着把胡萝卜放在阳光下烤。但这些胡萝卜还是和以前一样生。
然后,她试着把它们放在火里烧 。她尝了尝, 它们变苦了!
她想啊想啊想，思考该怎么办。
终于，她想到了一个点子！首先，她找到一个旧的乌龟壳。
然后, 她捡了一些木材
和三块石头。
耶！兔子终于找到办法煮她的胡萝卜！
她很兴奋邀请了她所有的朋友。
大家一起吃了一顿美味的煮熟的胡萝卜。
eng: Once, a rabbit thought to itself, "I have been eating raw carrots so far...
"Let me cook and eat it. "
"How do I cook?"
"Let me ask for help in this house"
But, there was a dog that started barking . He also chased the rabbit.
"Oh dear! What do I do now?" thought the rabbit.
He kept the carrots in the sun. The carrots didn't  cook.
He cooked the carrots in the fire. The carrots became too bitter!
"How do I cook and eat this? " Thought the rabbit furiously to himself.
He found a tortoise shell.
He gathered twigs.
He also found stones!
The rabbit lit the stove.
He also invited his friends to eat.
Everybody enjoyed eating the finely cooked carrots!

zho: 萨尼亚十分兴奋。今天是她的生日，她六岁了！爸爸正在住他最拿手的蔬菜咖喱餐包。而萨尼亚最要好的朋友 － 阿曼，卓娅，哈尔皮里特，裘德，凯伦，玛丽亚，普利亚（非常专横的一个人），烙汉和珊安 － 都会来参加派对。
砰砰！是玛丽亚。她带了份很大的礼物。哇哇哇！砰砰！砰砰！不久，九个客人都到齐了。太棒了！
萨尼亚说：“我们来玩躲猫猫吧！”萨尼亚喜欢躲猫猫这个游戏，因为她总能非常安静地藏起来，不让人找到。有一次，玛丽亚花了一整个小时都找不到她呢！普利亚（非常专横的孩子）大声说到：“过生日的孩子应该去倒数！”
彭彭彭！这次会是谁在门外呢？是裘德非常帅气的爸爸。他为一家大酒店开车。他说：“我需要去上班了。”
“裘德得回家找他的小妹妹了。对不起裘德。生日快乐，萨尼亚。”裘德很伤心地离开。萨尼亚也感到难过。现在她的派对上只剩下八位客人了。普利亚（那个专横的孩子）大声叫到：“快点！我们开始玩游戏了！”萨尼亚瞪了她一眼，但随后闭上了眼睛，开始倒数。
“1，2，3.....”凯伦卷到了毯子底下。“4，5，6.....”普利亚爬上阁楼去。“7，8，9.....”哈尔皮里特跑了出去。萨尼亚喊道：“十！准备好了吗？我来了！”
要找八个人！萨尼亚像疯子一样在屋子里跑来跑去，然后不小心被毯子给绊倒了。萨尼亚说到：“好痛！”毯子说：“好痛！”萨尼亚高兴地说：“我找到凯伦了！”可怜的凯伦！还要找多少人呢？七！
“汪汪汪！”萨尼亚的狗拉加嘴里咬着粉红色的长围巾，冲进了屋子。后面卓娅一直追着它跑。她喊道：“坏狗！”“调皮的狗！”萨尼亚笑眯眯地说：“我找到卓娅了！”这很简单啊！还要找多少人呢？六！
萨尼亚冲进了卧室。床垫低下没有人。行李箱里什么也没有。
突然，柜子打了个喷嚏：“阿嚏。”萨尼亚非常用力地拉开了门。烙汉又打喷嚏了：“阿嚏。”阿曼抱怨说：“这里有太多灰尘了。”萨尼亚心高采烈地拍手说道：“我找到烙汉和阿曼了！”还要找多少人呢？四！
萨尼亚爬上了屋顶。水箱后面有个东西动了一下。萨尼亚悄悄地靠近。“喵！”有只猫跳了出来，直接跑到晾衣绳那里。“啊啊啊啊！”妈妈地纱丽惊恐地叫了起来，然后掉在地上，堆了一地。萨尼亚欢呼道：“我找到珊安了！”还要找多少人呢？三！
“嘘嘘！走开！不要啊！”发生了什么事？萨尼亚匆匆地走进花园。她在芙蓉灌木叢后面看见两个吓坏了的女孩还有一只肥胖的蜜蜂。萨尼亚边逃离蜜蜂地区边大声喊：“我找到哈尔皮里特还有玛丽亚了！”还要找多少人呢？一！
这时，满屋子飘着蔬菜咖喱餐包的香味。萨尼亚的肚子开始叫了起来。妈妈大声叫道：“萨尼亚！切蛋糕了！我们一直都在等呢！”“祝你生日快乐！”每个人都开心地唱着歌。有一个喷怒地声音传了过来：“喂！你都还没找到我！”
萨尼亚忍住不笑地说：“我找到普里亚了！”“蛋糕？”哈尔皮里特咯咯地笑了起来。卓娅也笑。“你们竟然敢笑.....”普里亚握紧了拳头。轰的一声！她从阁楼里掉了下来，跌倒在一堆枕头上。
萨尼亚并没有笑。她扶起了普里亚，并给普里亚切了一块大蛋糕。普里亚说：“谢谢你。”她不再那么专横了。“萨尼亚，生日快乐！”萨尼亚笑了。还需要找多少人呢？零！
减法！萨尼亚的派对来了九个朋友。裘德离开后，就个人之中少了一人，也就是剩下八个朋友了。一组人之中去掉了一位朋友。我们可以这样写：9（朋友）－ 1（裘德） ＝ 8 （剩下德朋友）。
萨尼亚本来需要找六个朋友，但她后来找到了烙汉和阿曼。所以，六个朋友之中必须减去两个。拿掉或去掉两个朋友。我们可以这样写：6（朋友）－ 2（烙汉和阿曼）＝ 4（需要找的朋友）。这个从一个较大的数字去掉另一个较小的数字的算法称为“减法”。减法不仅用于朋友。
减法也能用在红豆子上..........如果你从9个红豆子中减去3个，你还剩下多少红豆子呢？9（红豆子）－ 3（红豆子）＝_______________（剩下的红豆子）如果从8卢比硬币中去掉4卢比硬币，你还剩下多少钱呢？8（卢比）－ 4（卢比）＝_______________（剩下的卢比）是不是很神奇呢？
eng:
Sania was excited. She was turning six today! 
Papa was making his Very Special Pav Bhaji. And Sania's BEST friends - Aman, Zoya, Harpreet, Jude, Karan, Maria,
Priya (who was very bossy), Rohan, and Shaan - were coming for the
party.

Knock-knock! It was Maria. She had brought a BIG present. Ooooh!  


Knock-knock! Knock, knock! Soon, all NINE guests had arrived. Hurray!

"Let's play I Spy!" said Sania. 


Sania loved I Spy because she knew how to stay very, very quiet.
Once, Maria could not find her for a whole hour!

"The birthday girl should count!" yelled Priya (who was very
bossy).

Knock-knock! Who could it be now?

It was Jude's Papa, looking smart. He drove cars for a big hotel. "I have been called in to work," he said. "Jude has to go home to his baby sister. I'm sorry, Jude. Happy birthday, Sania."

Jude left, looking sad. Sania was sad too. Now there were only EIGHT
guests at her party.

"Come ON!" yelled Priya (who was very bossy). "Let's
start the game!"  


Sania glared at her, but then closed her eyes and began to count.

"1, 2, 3..." Karan rolled himself into a mat.

 "4, 5, 6…" Priya hoisted herself into the loft.  


"7, 8, 9…" Harpreet ran out of the door.   


"TEN!" yelled Sania. "Ready or not, here I come!"

EIGHT people to find! Sania ran around the room like a mad thing, and
tripped over the mat. 


"Ow!" said Sania. 


"Ow!" said the mat.  


"I spy Karan!" sang Sania. Poor Karan! 


How many left to find? SEVEN!

"BOW BOW BOW!" Sania’s dog Raja dashed into the room with a
pink dupatta. Zoya came running in behind him. "Bad dog!" she
shouted. "Naughty dog!"

"I spy Zoya!" laughed Sania.That was easy! 


How many left to find? SIX!

Sania dashed into the bedroom. No one behind the mattresses. Nothing
inside the trunk.

"ACHOOOO!" sneezed the cupboard.

Sania yanked the door open. "ACHOOO!" sneezed Rohan again. "Too
much dust here," grumbled Aman. 


"I spy Rohan AND Aman!" clapped Sania.  


How many left to find? FOUR!

Sania climbed up to the roof.  Something moved behind the water tank.
Sania crept closer.

"Hisss!" The cat shot out, straight into the clothesline. 


"Yaaaaaa!" Mamma's saree yelled with fright and fell in a
heap on the ground. 


"I spy Shaan!" cheered Sania. 


How many left to find? THREE!

"SHOOO! GO AWAY! NOOOO!"


What was going on? Sania hurried into the garden. Behind the hibiscus bushes, she saw two scared girls and one fat bee. 

"I spy Harpreet!" shouted Sania, running away from the bee.
"And Maria!" 


How many left to find? ONE!

The smell of the Very Special Pav Bhaji filled the house. Sania's
stomach began to growl. 


"Cake-cutting time, Sania!" called Mama. "We are all
waiting!" 


"Happy birthday tooo youuuu!" sang everyone. 


"Hello!" yelled an angry voice. "You haven't found me yet!"

"I spy Priya!" Sania tried not to laugh. "Cake?" 


Harpreet
giggled. Zoya chuckled.

"How dare you laugh at..." Priya shook her fist. THUD! She
fell out of the loft onto a pile of pillows.

Sania did not laugh. She
helped Priya up, and cut her a big slice of cake.



"Thank you," said Priya. She didn't sound bossy anymore.
"Happy birthday, Sania."

Sania smiled. How many left to find? ZERO!

TAKE IT AWAY!

NINE of Sania's friends came to the party. When Jude left, there was
ONE LESS THAN NINE, i.e., EIGHT friends. ONE friend was TAKEN AWAY
from the group. We can write this as:

9 (friends) - 1 (Jude) = 8 (friends left).

When there were SIX friends left to find, Sania found Rohan AND Aman.
Now there were TWO LESS THAN SIX friends to find. TWO friends were
removed, or TAKEN AWAY. We can write this as:

6 (friends) - 2 (Rohan and Aman) = 4 (friends left). 


This 'TAKING AWAY' of a small number from a bigger number is called
SUBTRACTION. 


But subtraction does not work only with friends.

It works just as well with rajma seeds...

 If you TAKE AWAY 3 rajma seeds from 9, how many are you left with?

9 (seeds) - 3 (seeds) =  _____________ (seeds left)
And it works even with rupee coins.

 If you take away 4 rupee coins from a stack of 8 rupee coins, how
many do you have left?

8 (rupees) - 4 (rupees) =  _____________ (rupees left)
Isn't that amazing?
Jeetu is playing with his friends

They were counting numbers
Rohan said, " Jeetu it's your turn to count till hundred.
"Okay friend " said Jeetu and started counting.
His friend Sohan hides behind a tree.
Rohan hides near the  car.
Suman hides behind a door.
Aman hides under a basket.
Biju hides inside a drum.

But Jeetu has stopped after  39 .
He asked, "Which number comes after 39?"

He starts counting again 1 2 3.
His friend must hide again.
zho: 吉图正在和他的朋友玩耍。
现在轮到吉图数到一百了。
吉图开始数着。
Viju躲在一棵树后。
Raju 躲在车子附近。
Suman躲在一扇门后。
Aman 躲在篮子下。
Biju 躲在鼓里。
糟了！ 吉图停止了倒数。39之后是什么数字？
他重新数着 1-2-3。他的朋友继续躲起来了。

eng: Baba is making coconut chutney.“Huh! Where did the coconut shell go?”
Aapa wants to paint the sky.“Oh! Where did the blue paint go?”
Ammi is going to solve the crossword puzzle.“Huh! Where did the newspaper go?”
Daadi’s needle moves like magic through the clothes.“Oh! Where did the buttons go?”
“The house is too quiet,” says Baba.“Ameena must be up to something.”
“Where is Ameena? Have you seen Ameena?” asks Ammi.“Ameena must be up to something,” says Daadi.
“I am making an alien!” Ameena smiles.“Oh! So that is what Ameena was up to!” says Aapa.
zho: 爸爸正在做椰子酸辣酱。“哼！ 椰子壳去哪儿了？”
Aapa 想画天空。“哦！ 蓝色的油漆去哪儿了？”
阿米要解决填字游戏。“哼！ 报纸去哪儿了？”
达迪的针像魔法一样穿过衣服。“哦！ 纽扣去哪儿了？”
“房子太安静了，”爸爸说。“阿米娜一定是在做点什么。”
“阿米娜在哪里？ 你见过阿米娜吗？” 阿米问。“Ameena 必须有所作为，”Daadi 说。
“我在制造外星人！” 阿梅娜微笑。“哦！ 所以这就是阿米娜的目的！” 阿帕说。

eng: वाघमारे काकाचा तो वार्षिक केशकर्तन दिवस होता.   It was the Annual Haircut Day for Waghmare Kaka.

वाघमारे काका न्हाव्याकडे जाण्यासाठी घरात निघाले.

 Waghmare Kaka left home to go to the barber.

पण न्हावी म्हणाला, ''एवढे लांब केस कापण्यासाठी आज मला वेळ नाही.''

But the barber said, “Today, I have no time to cut such long hair!”

वाघमारे काका

 दुःखी झाले. ते मदत मागण्यासाठी आपल्या बायको कडे गेले.Waghmare Kaka felt sad. He went to his wife to ask for help.

पण त्यांची बायको म्हणाली, ''एवढे लांब केस कापण्यासाठी आज मला वेळ नाही.''  

 But his wife said, “Today, I have no time to cut such long hair!”

थोडा रागवून, 

वाघमारे काका

 आपल्या शिंपी मित्राकडे गेले. Feeling a little angry, Waghmare Kaka went to his friend, the tailor.

पण शिंपी म्हणाला, ''एवढे लांब केस कापण्यासाठी आज मला वेळ नाही.''

 But the tailor said, “Today, I have no time to cut such long hair!”

वाघमारे काका आणखी एका मित्राकडे गेले, सुताराकडे.
 Waghmare Kaka went to one more friend, the carpenter.

पण सुतार म्हणाला, ''एवढे लांब केस कापण्यासाठी आज मला वेळ नाही.''
 But the carpenter said, “Today, I have no time to cut such long hair!”

बिचारे वाघमारे काका. वार्षिक केशकर्तन दिवशी त्यांचे केस कोणीच कापू शकणार नव्हते.

 Poor Waghmare Kaka. No one could cut his hair on this Annual             Haircut Day.
रडत रडत,  ते गावाजवळच्या जंगलात पोहोचले. Crying, he went to the forest near the village.
ते एका गुहेजवळ बसून जोरात रडायला लागले. He sat near a cave and cried loudly.

''देवा, मदत कर! कोण माझे केस कापतील?''
 “Oh God, help me! Who will cut my hair?”
गुहेत शांतपणे झोपलेला वाघ त्याच्या आवाजाने जागा झाला. The tiger sleeping peacefully inside the cave was awake now.
ते वाघ जोराने गरजला आणि वाघमारे काकांवर उडी मारली!  The tiger roared loudly and jumped on Waghmare Kaka!

बिचारे वाघमारे काका इतके घाबरले, इतके घाबरले

, इतके घाबरले  की ...
 Poor Waghmare Kaka was so scared, so scared, so scared that ...

... त्यांच्या डोक्यावरचे सगळेच केस गळून पडले!

 ... all the hair fell off his head!
वाघमारे काका धावत गावात आले. वाघ पुन्हा झोपायला गेला.Waghmare Kaka ran all the way back to the village.                                   The tiger went back to sleep.

आता वाघमारे काकाला खूप दिवस केस कापण्याची गरज

 येणारच नाही.
 Now, Waghmare Kaka will not need a haircut for a very long time.
zho: 这一天是斯林格里的年度理发日。
斯林格里和往常一样离开家，前往当地的理发店。
可是理发师说，“今天，我可没有时间剪这么长的头发！”
伤心的斯林格里回家找他的妻子帮忙。
可是他的妻子说，“今天，我可没有时间剪这么长的头发！”
有点气愤，斯林格里去找他的朋友，裁缝。
但是裁缝说，“今天，我可没有时间剪这么长的头发！”
现在有点发愁了，斯林格里又找了他的朋友，木匠。
可是木匠说，“今天，我可以没有时间剪这么长的头发！”

可怜的斯林格里。貌似没有人愿意在这个
年度理发日里为他剪头。
流着泪，他一个人走开了，经过小镇的树林。
他坐在一个山洞旁边大声哭泣。
“这一天就快要过去了。我怎样才能兑现理发的诺言呢？神啊，帮帮我！”
在洞里安眠的老虎被他的吵闹声打扰了。
它出来，嘶吼着，朝斯林格里挥舞着它巨大的爪子。
可怜的斯林格里太害怕，太害怕，太害怕了，怕到。。。
所有的头发都从他头上掉下来了！

斯林格里一路跑回了镇上。
老虎回去继续睡觉了。
现在，斯林格里很长一段时间都不需要理发了。
我的心感觉到很多事情
晚上奶奶给我讲故事的时候是我感到最开心的时候
跟朋友一起玩的时候我感觉很笨
当我爸爸告诉我他没有钱的时候我感觉很不好
当妈妈拥抱我的时候我感觉到被爱
eng:
My heart feels a
lot of things.

I feel happy when
my granny tells us stories in the evening.

I feel silly when
I play with my friend.

I feel bad when
my dad says he does not have money.

I feel loved when
my mom gives me a hug.

Fireflies are small winged insects that glow in the dark but why do they shine and what creates this spark within them? They’re bright and twinkling like little stars! I wish I could have glowed like them but I can’t! Can anyone tell me why?
Imagine a dark, moonless night when you have gone camping with your classmates and you lose your way. What would you do? Will you not try contacting your friends by flashing your torchlight?

Well, fireflies or ‘lightning bugs’ as they are sometimes called do the same, except that they have an unlimited supply of light within themselves! That is why fireflies never worry about fused light bulbs or electricity tariffs. They seem immensely happy just flying around and glowing- this is their signal to say, “Hey, look! I’m here!”

The glow of the firefly is produced by a protein called luciferase and a pigment called luciferin. Proteins are special food used by our bodies to create muscles, bones and skin while pigments are natural colouring substances found in plants and animals. When these two meet inside the tiny belly of the firefly, they react with the oxygen already found in there.

A celebration takes place, a soft firework display, so to say and bright light is produced which is the ‘glow’ of the firefly! Fireflies therefore are bio-luminescent but they are not the only ones. Different types of fish and marine creatures in the sea also produce their own lights!

The glow of the firefly functions like a light switch and is periodically turned on and off by the insect. It does this by sending a special ‘message’ from its brain to the ‘light organ’ inside its body that is its abdomen and soon the chemical reaction begins and the glow is produced!

The grown up fireflies use their ‘glow’ to call out to their mates. In fact, female fireflies prefer ‘flashy males’ that can blink the longest or at a faster pace. Once they see this special glow, the females respond to it by switching on their own lights. The firefly-mates soon meet and baby fireflies get created!

The younger fireflies or the larvae, unlike their parents, use their glow mainly to chase predators away. The chemicals within their bodies are toxic and have a horrible taste so creatures that come to feast on them get put off and go hunting elsewhere for tastier munchies!

Fireflies are never actually alone! There are more than 2,000 species of fireflies on this earth. During springtime, especially on dark nights, you may spot a few of them flitting around brightly! Fireflies maybe tiny, smaller than your fingers perhaps, but grouped together, these glowing insects can light up an entire garden and all for free! Sounds incredible, doesn’t it?

Amazing facts about fireflies1. Fireflies are not flies but beetles! They are often called ‘lightning bugs’ but they aren’t bugs either. 2. Different species of fireflies glow in different colors that range from yellow to green. Fireflies that flit around in the dark emit a greenish glow while those found outdoors during twilight give out a yellowish light.

3. There are a few non-vegetarian fireflies that feed on mites and other fireflies!4. Adult fireflies aren’t the only ones that glow, their eggs and larvae glow as well! If you tap a firefly’s egg, it flashes in response to your touch.5. Fireflies live in all continents except Antarctica. They love tropical climate but also thrive in temperate zones. They flit around forests, meadows and gardens during summer everywhere except in Antarctica that is much too cold for them.

Do It Yourself1. Find out what else glows in the dark. Both, living and non-living.2. While playing in a group, imagine yourselves as fireflies. Carry a small torch in your hand and make different formations like fireflies.
3. Make a firefly with trash.For example, with a plastic bottle and glow stick.You can also try your own special ideas.
zho: 萤火虫是一种体型细小的有翅昆虫，能在黑暗的环境里发出光芒。为什么萤火虫会发光？是什么东西使萤火虫体内产生光？萤火虫就像小星星一样一闪一闪放光明。但愿我也能像它们一样发光——但我不能！谁能告诉我这是为什么吗？
设想你和你的同学在外露营，在昏暗得看不见月色的夜晚迷了路，你会怎么办？你会尝试用手电筒发光来联络你的同学吗？
萤火虫，有时也叫“火焰虫”，有用之不尽的光源。因此，萤火虫从来不担心诸如灯泡保险丝熔断或多交电费等问题。它们乐此不疲地到处飞舞、发出光亮，仿佛在说“嗨，瞧呀！我在这儿！”
萤火虫的光是在一种叫荧光素酶的蛋白质和叫荧光素的色素作用下而产生的。作为身体“特殊的食物”，蛋白质构成了人体的肌肉、骨骼和皮肤；色素是存在于动植物身上的一种有色物质。当上述两种物质在萤火虫的狭小的腹部里相遇时，在氧气的作用下发生化学反应，产生了光。
当喜庆的夜宴开始、烟花绽放——那星星点点的流光，正是萤火虫发出的亮色。萤火虫是一种会发光的生物体，但并不是唯一会发光的生物。有一些鱼类和其他海洋生物，也能发光。
仿佛有个电灯的开关在控制着，萤火虫的光会时亮时灭、如此不断地反复。萤火虫通过这样的方式来传递特殊的讯息——从大脑传递到腹腔内会发光的器官，经过一系列化学反应，就产生亮光，作为交流的讯息。
成年的萤火虫通过发光来吸引同伴。事实上，雌性萤火虫喜欢那些发光时间长或闪光频率高的“酷炫的男伴”。一旦它们发现此类求偶的光信号，雌性萤火虫也会发光作为回应。当雌雄萤火虫喜结连理，就会生下萤火虫宝宝。
和他们的父母不一样的是，年幼的萤火虫、即幼虫发光，是为了驱赶捕食者。它们体内的化学物质具有毒性，味道特别恶心，因此，准备享用萤火虫幼虫的捕食者会因此而放弃，转而去捕获其他味道更好的猎物。
萤火虫并不孤单。地球上至少有2000多种萤火虫生活着。在春季、特别是夜晚，也许你就能发现一些小光斑正到处飞舞。萤火虫也许比你的手指头还要细小，但是，当一大群发着光的萤火虫集结在一起时，就能照亮一整个花园——还是免费的呢！是不是难以置信呢？
有关萤火虫的惊人秘密1. 萤火虫是一种甲虫。2. 不同种类的萤火虫发出的光颜色各异，从黄色到绿色不等。那些在黑夜里飞行的萤火虫会发出偏绿色的光；而那些在傍晚时飞行的萤火虫会发出偏黄色的光。
3. 萤火虫是肉食动物，以小虫或其他萤火虫为食。4. 不仅仅只有成年萤火虫才会发光，其实它们的虫卵和幼虫也会发光。如果你轻轻地拍一拍萤火虫的虫卵，它会闪着光来回应你的拍打。5. 除了南极洲以外，萤火虫在各大洲均有分布。它们喜欢热带气候，也在温带气候生存、繁衍。夏天，它们四处周游于森林、草原和花园里——除了南极的冰天雪地，因为那里对于它们而言实在是太冷了。
做一做1. 找一找还有什么事物会在黑夜里发光，无论是有生命的还是无生命的事物。2. 想象自己就是萤火虫并和同伴一起玩游戏。手持手电筒，模拟萤火虫通过光信号进行交流的场景。
3. 废物利用，做萤火虫模型。例如，把塑料瓶改造成萤火虫的外观造型，并在瓶底粘上小灯珠。动脑筋，想想看你还有什么更好玩的奇思妙想来制作萤火虫模型。
为什么车轮是圆形的？
这辆巴士不动。
为什么手镯是圆形的？
我不要买方形的手镯。
﻿为什么薄餅是圆形的？
当我尝试滚动它的时候，它不是圆形的。
﻿为什么你的痣是圆形的？
﻿你觉得这个痣好看吗？
为什么眼睛是圆形的？
它们又园又大！
﻿为什么零是圆形的？我不知道。
eng:
Why are
wheels round?
This bus does not move.
Why are bangles round?

I will
not buy square bangles.

Why is
a chapati round?

It is
not round when I try to roll it.

Why is
your bindi round?

Do you
think this bindi looks nice?

Why are
eyes round?

They
are round and they are BIG!

Why is
zero round?
I don’t
know.

Durai had become a detective.

 

Back? He went to the store and bought a magnifying glass with a torch. All that remains is to detect anything!
Durai's grandfather asked him, "Is there really a detective lioness?" Hearing that he smiled shyly.
The lawn was wet. Seeing that, Thurai thought, 'I think it has been raining here for a while.'

Okay, the torch and magnifying glass work wonderfully! Upon entering the forest, it was discovered that it had rained there. What's next?

 

Suddenly, Durai saw some red objects on the ground. ‘What is all this?
They looked like ordinary mushrooms. But can a detective immediately believe what he sees? Don't want to explore and confirm?

Thuraya walked slowly and approached the objects. He took out his magnifying glass and thereby stared at them.

 

Oops! There sat a little girl holding a red umbrella.
Thurai looked at her through the magnifying glass and asked in a bold voice, ‘Hey girl, who are you? What’s so significant about a goat’s head? ”

The mushroom girl was frightened when she heard his heavy voice. Intoxicated, his eyes widened even more in the magnifying glass.

 

So, she moved back in fear and her umbrella ran away.
Durai realized in the magnifying glass that she was scared. In a loving voice, ‘Don’t worry, I won’t do anything to you. We will be friends. '

The woman looked at him incredulously. Then, in a soft voice, she asked, ‘Is it still raining?’

 

‘It never rains,’ said Thurai, ‘you don’t need that beautiful red umbrella anymore, tell your friends to fold the umbrella too.’
The woman smiled as she climbed on top of Durai's hat and said, "My name is Lalita, I have a mother, father, aunt, grandfather, grandmother ... we all live in this forest."
We don’t know how to build a house. So, it's always raining, so let's spread out an umbrella and sit on the ground. '

When he heard that, Durai smiled and said, "Don't worry Lalita, I told you how to build a house." I often say that I am a great architect. '

 

Plus, Duray’s detective dream was over, and the next dream began.
zho: 一天早上，卡蘇克想當一個真的偵探。然後，卡蘇克到了小店買了新的手電筒和放大鏡。
卡蘇克的爺爺告訴他，今天你就是個大偵探，快快去發現新奇的事物吧。卡蘇克非常的高興，興高彩烈往田邊的森林走去。
走入了森林。卡蘇克發現腳邊的小草們蓋滿了水珠。他說：嗯，我想這附近剛剛下過了一場雨。
卡蘇克帶的手電筒和放大鏡非常有用，他現在發現了第一個線索，以第一天當偵探來說，是很棒的。他發現了幾個紅色的小影子在綠色的草聳裡，那會是什麼呢？
那些紅色的影子看起來好像小香菇，但以一個專業的偵探來說，能這樣就結束嗎？卡蘇克想要再認真的確認一下，卡蘇克在香菇邊邊走著，拿出他的放大鏡再仔細看看。天啊，這是個重大發現，卡蘇克看到一個姆指大的小女孩拿著紅傘。
卡蘇克拿著放大鏡再仔細的看了看，拿出勇氣的大聲說"你是誰？你在這做什麼呢？"那個拿紅傘的小女孩被卡蘇克巨大的眼睛還有大聲的問話嚇了一大跳。手上的紅傘不小心掉了下來，小女孩也跌坐到了草地上。
從手中的放大鏡，卡蘇克清楚看到小女孩擔心的樣子。卡蘇克就說：別擔心，我不會傷害你，我們做朋友好嗎？
那小女孩看看了卡蘇克，望了幾秒鐘，然後說：現在還在下雨嗎？"雨停了好久了耶，不用再拿雨傘啦，快跟你的朋友們說不用再拿著雨傘啦"卡蘇克說著。
小女孩爬上了卡蘇克的偵探帽，對著卡蘇克微微的笑。"我的名字是拉麗斯，我們一家人住在這個森林裡，我們沒有房子也不知道怎麼建，所以每次下雨的時候都拿著雨傘遮著"小女孩說著。
"我可以教你建房子啊，我爸爸說有一天我會是建築師耶"卡蘇克說。就這樣，卡蘇克當大偵探的夢想結束了，然後開始了他的建築師夢想。
小牛，大牛 和 李娜 一起出玩。他们看见一只猫咪。
猫咪看见一只大鼠。“你看！”小牛喊道。
李娜看见一只小蚂蚁走进大鼠。
突然，一个巨大的影子落在他们身上。
一只大鹰飞到墙边。一只小蚁，一只猫咪，一只大鼠和一只巨鹰都同在一条街上。
这三个聪明的小孩会怎么做？
他们一起拍手！那巨鹰展开翅膀飞走。
李娜让蚂蚁爬上叶子。她将叶子放在墙上。蚂蚁看见一颗糖，将它捡起，立刻跑回家。
大鼠捡起一个吃了一半的白果，立刻回到排水沟里。猫咪说了一声 ‘喵 开始舔她的爪子.
大牛给它一杯牛奶。三个小孩和猫咪一起玩。
坐在树上的巨鹰眨了眨眼，向远方飞去。
eng: Sonu, Monu and Rina set out to play.They saw a kitten.
She was looking at a big rat."Oh look!" shouted Sonu.
Rina saw a tiny ant going towards the big rat.
Suddenly, a very big shadow fell upon them all.
A very big eagle came down to the wall.A tiny ant, a small kitten,a big rat and a very big eagle in the same long street!
What would the three clever children do now?

They clapped their little hands!
The eagle spread its big wings and flew away.
Rina made the ant climb onto a leaf. She left the leaf on the wall.The ant saw a grain of sugar. She picked it up and ran home.
The big rat picked up a half-eaten pakoda and went back into the drain.The small kitten said 'miaaww' and started licking her paw.
Monu got her some milk in a cup.The three kids played with her.
The very big eagle sitting on the tree blinked and flew far away.

zho: 一个月光明亮的晚上，在Mangu 农场的动物都在睡。除了Tinku！
“妈，我不累！”Tinku 喃喃说。不过妈妈早已睡着，没听到。Tinku 躺在肚子，转到背后，一直翻来覆去还是睡不着！
Tinku 于是去散散步，看能找到什么东西做。挂在天空中，他看到又白又圆的月亮对着他眯眯笑。Tinku想：“夜晚还真漂亮。”
远远的一棵大树看上去有几盏小小的灯。突然，一盏灯飞了下来！“你好！我是一只萤火虫。我会在夜里发光”，那盏灯说到。“我们能做朋友吗？”Tinku问到。“当然可以啊！”萤火虫回答。
有东西飞过，倒挂在树枝上。“小鸟，你的名字是什么？”Tinku问到。“我不是小鸟，我是蝙蝠。我在夜晚重看得到！”蝙蝠说。“我么能做朋友吗？”Tinku问了问。“那当然啊！”蝙蝠说。
草丛里有人在藏住！“你是谁？”Tinku问。“我是一只狐狸，我经常晚上去散步”，狐狸说。“我们能做朋友吗？”Tinku问到。“当然可以啊！”狐狸回答。
有两颗亮眼睛从树上盯住他。“你是谁啊？”Tinku问。“我是猫头鹰，我在晚上寻找食物”，猫头鹰说。“我么能做朋友吗？”Tinku 问。“当然可以！”猫头鹰回答。
哔～ 哔～！“是谁在啊？”Tinku问。“我是蟋蟀。晚上是我会发出哔哔的声音”，蟋蟀回答。“我么能做朋友吗？”Tinku 问。“当然可以！”蟋蟀回答。
Tinku和新交的朋友蹦蹦跳跳的一直玩到Tinku开始打哈欠。Tinku说：“我累了，该回家了。”Tinku交了很多新朋友，非常地开心。躺在妈妈旁边，他说：“妈妈，夜晚一点都不寂莫。”
“这些动物白天休息，晚上才会起来吃喝玩乐。你现在该睡觉了，不然明天没有精力跟白天的朋友玩。晚安了”，妈妈说。
Tinku在月光下，暖暖的睡着了。
eng: It was a bright moonlit night. All the animals in Mangu's farm were sleeping. Except Tinku!
“I am not sleepy, Ma,” murmured Tinku. But Ma did not hear him. She was fast asleep. He turned left, and he turned right. He lay on his tummy, and rolled on his back. But he could not sleep!
So he set off into the night to see what he could find. Up in the sky, Tinku saw the moon, white and round, smiling down at him. He felt very happy.‘Night is beautiful,’ thought Tinku.

Far away on the top of a tree, there were some tiny lights. One spot of light flew down! “I’m a firefly,” said the spot of light. “I glow in the dark!”“Will you be my friend?” asked Tinku.“Yes, I will!” said the firefly.

Something flew by and hung upside down on a tree. “What is your name, bird?” asked Tinku.“I am not a bird, I am a bat. I can see during the night!” said the bat.“Will you be my friend?” asked Tinku.“Yes, I will!” said the bat.

A few leaves moved in the bushes. Someone was hiding! “Who are you?” asked Tinku.“I am a fox,” said the fox. “I go strolling out at night.”“Will you be my friend?” asked Tinku.“Yes, I will!” said the fox.
Two shiny eyes looked at him from a tree. “Who are you?” asked Tinku.“I’m an owl,” said the owl. “I hunt for food during the night.”“Will you be my friend?” asked Tinku.“Yes, I will!” said the owl.
“CHIRRRRRP! CHIRRRRRP!”“Who is here?” Tinku asked.“I’m a cricket,” said the cricket. “I chirp when it is dark.”“Will you be my friend?” asked Tinku.“Yes, I will!” said the cricket.

Tinku and his friends jumped and tossed and rolled until Tinku yawned. “I am sleepy. I have to go home now,” said Tinku. He was happy that he had many new friends. Snuggling close to Ma, he said, “Night is not a lonely place, Ma. Night is full of wonderful beings.”“Yes!” replied Ma. “Your new friends are nocturnal, just like wild dogs.”

“Nocturnal animals eat, play and work at night. They rest during the day. You must sleep now. Sleep will give you energy to play with your day-time friends tomorrow. Good night, little one!” she said, hugging him tight.
The bright round moon shone all night long, spreading her calm light all around. And Tinku slept all through the night!

zho: 有一天，我遇见了艾格尼丝。她是一名老师。
艾格尼丝需要用拐杖走路。
﻿当我去小镇的时候，我看见了梅托波。他是一名电台主持人。
梅托波患有白化病。他的眼睛和皮肤都有问题。*白化病(Albinism)是由于身体内缺少黑色素等原因，导致眼睛呈淡粉色或红色程的一种皮肤病，并没有传染性。
莫拉是我的邻居。她是一名农场主人。
但是，莫拉的听觉有问题。所以，她用手语与人沟通。
奥赛罗是学校里最棒的足球员。我非常喜欢看他踢足球。
即使奥赛罗在一场意外中失去了双手，但是他依然为球队踢进了很多球！
eng: One day I met Agnes.Agnes is a teacher.
Agnes uses crutches to walk.
When I went to town, I saw Metobo. He is a radio DJ.
Metobo has albinism.He has problems with his eyes and with his skin.
My neighbour isMoraa. She is a farmer.
Moraa has a problem with hearing. She speaks using Sign language.
Osero is the best soccer player in my school. I like to watch him play.
Osero lost his hands in an accident. However, he scores many goals for his team!

zho: 从前有一个农夫，他总是不开心，爱抱怨。他的妻子却和他恰恰相反-她总是辛勤工作，有一个令人快乐的灵魂。但是这个阴郁的丈夫总是挑茬找错。他觉得自己的妻子很笨，做事不聪明。有一天晚上，阴郁的农夫带着坏脾气回家。他敲了门，但妻子正忙着，等了一两分钟才开门。这令农夫暴怒，就好像一只牙痛而眼睛变成斗鸡眼的鳄鱼。 他冲妻子大声喊叫，责骂小宝宝，还踩上了可怜的狗狗的尾巴。他的牙咬得咋咋响，贼贼亮，责骂的声音越来越高。当农夫骂得喘不过气的时候，他妻子说，“嘘！ 嘘！ 你为什么生这么大的气？我明天去地里干活，你在家做我的工作。看你喜不喜欢。”“这是个好主意！”，男人说。他觉得自己真的聪明，想给妻子一个教训。“让我来给你展示应该怎样做事！”

这样，第二天早晨，农夫让妻子去田地里干活。他自己留在了家里。第一件事，农夫开始搅拌奶酪。很快他就发现这个任务不像他想象的那样简单。另外，他干一会儿活就觉得很渴！所以他下到地窖里去拿一些麦芽啤酒。他刚刚打开麦芽啤酒桶的盖子，就听到一头猪来到了上面的厨房里。“喔！喔！那个捣蛋的猪一定在奶酪旁边，正在嘟嘟，嘟嘟，嘟嘟地吃！我一定要给它一个忘不掉的教训！”，农夫皱着眉头说。没有等着把啤酒桶盖盖上，他就尽可能快地跑上楼，一边还喊着，“赶快走开！溜开！离开！”可是当气急败坏的农夫到达厨房的时候。。。一切都太晚了！ 那头猪已经把奶酪打翻。它站在哪里，愉快地吃着，厨房的地上有一大片奶油。农夫使了那么大的劲狠狠地踢了猪，结果猪倒地死了。
接着，阴郁的农夫想起来他没有给地窖里的麦芽啤酒桶盖上盖子。他跑下楼梯。。。但是太晚了！ 所有的啤酒都从酒桶中挥发掉了。 他的喉咙渴得要命。 因为爬上爬下地跑楼梯，他一直在喘气。。。然后，他听到牛的叫声。

农夫根本没有时间想奶牛的事。他还没有给奶牛一根草吃，甚至也没有给它一口水。但是他有些懒，不想带着奶牛走老远的路去草地吃草。他想起来自家的屋顶有一些草。这个房子靠近一个陡的山坡。农夫想只要他从屋后铺下一个长长的，平平的木板，牛就能走到屋顶上去。但是现在，小宝宝在厨房的地上爬着。搅拌器里还有些残存的奶油，农夫不想宝宝打翻搅拌器，就把搅拌器拿起来放在身后。他得先给奶牛一些水喝，然后才能将它放在屋顶上。当农夫弯下身去井里汲水时，更大的麻烦出现了！ 所有的奶油都洒出来了。顺着农夫的头和肩膀流下去，直接流到了他的眼里，鼻子里和嘴巴里！ 然后搅拌器就轱辘轱辘地掉到井里去了。现在早已经过了午饭时间。农夫还没有干完一件他应该干完的事。他还没有搅拌黄油，或者打扫房间卫生，或者喂奶牛，或者喂小宝宝或者喂狗，或者。。。例举的单子还有很长很长。他只要想想自己什么还没有做就觉得累！

当农夫把牛赶到屋顶上吃草后，小宝宝已经非常饿了。他开始放声大哭，又长又亮，“咦-咦-咦！ 啊-啊-啊！ 咦-咦-咦！”阴郁的农夫决定先煮点稀饭。他生了火，在锅里放了水，准备做粥。突然，他想到一件令人害怕的事：房顶非常陡峭，万一牛从房顶上摔下来怎么办？肯定会把腿摔断，没准还摔了脖子！这样，农夫就来到屋顶给牛系上绳子。他把绳子的一头套在奶牛的脖子上，可是屋顶上没有地方能让他拴绳子的另一头。农夫只好把绳子的松的一头顺着厨房的烟囱扔下来，然后回到厨房。接着，他把挂在那的绳子系好，系在了自己的腿上！锅里的水开了，农夫开始做粥。正在这时，奶牛失去了平衡，开始摔下来！

现在，奶牛是一个又重又胖墩墩的东西。它是那样重，比农夫加上农夫的妻子，宝宝和小狗的重量，所有的加在一起还重。奶牛慢慢地从屋顶上滑下来，连同绳子上系的东西一起滑动。因为农夫把绳子的一端绑在了腿上，这样他就被奶牛的滑动拽到了烟囱上。并且被困在那，不能上也不能下。他就呆在烟囱上，直到妻子晚上回家。农夫的妻子看到奶牛悬在屋子边上，一边挣扎一边踢腿，就赶快拿了刀把绳子切断，奶牛重重的落到地上。这时候屋里面，阴郁的农夫跌倒向下，向下，向下！可怜的人，结果他的头跌到了稀饭锅里！猜猜怎样？ 他永远永远不会再教他的妻子怎样做她自己的活！
自己做北欧海盗船大概在1200年前，挪威是北欧海盗的故乡。他们是伟大的旅行者，坐着又大又美的船舰，航行整个欧洲和大西洋。想不想自己做海盗船，开始人生的冒险？
eng: There was once a farmer who was always glum and grumpy. But his wife was not like him at all – she worked hard and was a cheerful soul. But Gloomy Gus was forever finding fault with her. He thought she was stupid, and couldn’t do the smallest thing right. One evening, Gloomy Gus came home from the fields in a very bad mood. He knocked at the door, but his wife was busy, so she took an extra minute or two to open it. This made Gus as grouchy as a cross-eyed alligator with a toothache. He yelled at his wife, scolded the baby, and stepped on the poor dog’s tail. And his crooked teeth went snap-snap, flash-flash, as he kept shouting louder and louder. When he ran out of breath, his wife said, “Tch! Tch! Why are you making such a fuss? Tomorrow, I’ll go out and work in the fields, and you stay here and take care of my jobs. And let’s see how you like it.”“That’s a GOOD IDEA!” said Gus. He thought he was very smart indeed, and wanted to teach his wife a mighty big lesson. “I’ll show you HOW THINGS MUST BE DONE!”

So, early the next morning, he sent his wife out to work in the fields. Gus, of course, stayed behind at home. First, he began to churn the butter. But he soon found that the job was not as easy as he’d thought it would be. Besides, it made him ever so thirsty! So Gus went down to the cellar to get some ale.He had just opened the tap of the ale barrel, when he heard the pig come into the kitchen above.“Tsk! Tsk! That pesky pest of a pig must be at the butter churn…going slurp, slurp, slurp! I must teach him a lesson he won’t forget,” growled Gus. Without waiting to close the tap, he ran up the stairs as fast as he could, shouting, “Scat! Scarper! Scram!” But when Gloomy Gus reached the kitchen…it was too late! The pig had already knocked over the butter churn. And there it stood, grunting happily, in a large puddle of cream on the kitchen floor.Gus gave it such a long, hard kick that the pig fell down dead.

Then, Gloomy Gus remembered that he had left the tap open in the cellar. He ran down the stairs…but it was too late! All the ale had run out of the barrel. His throat was parched. And he was huffing and puffing from running up and down the stairs… and then, he heard the cow moo.

Gus had had no time to think of the cow. He had not given her any grass, or even a sip of water. But he felt lazy to take her all the way down to the meadow to graze. He remembered that there was some grass growing on the roof of his house. The house was close against a steep hill. He thought he would be able to get the cow up the roof if he laid a long, flat piece of wood across the back of the roof.But now, the little baby was crawling across the kitchen floor. There was still a bit of cream left in the churn and Gus did not want him to spill it. So he lifted the churn on to his back, and went out. He had to give the cow some water before putting it on the roof. When Gus bent forward to draw water from the well, there was more trouble! All the cream spilt out of the churn. It bubbled over his head and shoulder, right into his eyes and nose and ears! And then the churn fell glug-glug-glug into the well.  By now, it was long past lunch-time. Gus hadn’t finished any of the work he should have done. He hadn’t churned the butter, or swept the house, or fed the cow or the baby or the dog, or…it was a long, long list. And he felt tired even to think of all that he hadn’t done!

By the time he put the cow on the roof, the baby had grown VERY hungry. So, he began to bawl, long and loud, “E-e-e-o! A-a-a-a! E-e-e-o!” So Gloomy Gus decided to cook some porridge. He lit the fire and filled a pot with water for the porridge. And then, a dreadful thought struck him. The roof sloped very steeply. What if the cow fell off the roof? It would surely break its legs, or even its neck! So he went to the roof of the house to tie up the cow. He tied one end of the rope around its neck. But there was nothing on the roof to which he could tie the other end. So Gus slid the loose end of the rope down the kitchen chimney, and went back to the kitchen. Then, he tied the rope, which was hanging there, around his own leg. The water in the pot was boiling, and he started making the porridge. That was when the cow lost its balance and began to fall!

Now, the cow was a heavy, roly-poly creature. It weighed much, much more than Gus and his wife and the baby and the dog, all put together. The cow slowly slid off the roof dragging the rope with which it was tied. And as Gus had knotted one end of the rope around his own leg, this pulled him right up the chimney. And there in the chimney Gus remained stuck, unable to go up or down. There he stayed until his wife returned home in the evening. She saw the cow hanging halfway down the side of the house, struggling and kicking. So she quickly cut the rope, and the cow reached the ground with a thud. And inside the house, Gloomy Gus went tumbling down, down, DOWN! Poor man, he ended up with his head in the porridge pot! And guess what? He never, ever tried to teach his wife again, how to do her job!

MAKE YOUR OWN VIKING SHIP About 1200 years ago, Norway was home to the Vikings. They were great travelers, who sailed all over Europe and the Atlantic Ocean in big, beautiful ships. How about making your own Viking ship and embarking on the adventure of a lifetime? You NeedSheet of white chart paperBroomstickGum or pastePoster or water colour paintsBrushesScissorsRulerPencilOld matchbox with a few pebbles placed inside

1. Ship's body  2. (top) Sail  2. (bottom)

ShieldsTo Make the Ship1. On half a sheet of chart paper, draw the shape of the ship’s body given above, paint it and cut it out.2. On the other half of the sheet, draw the outlines of the sail and the shields as shown. Paint them and then cut them out.3. Fold each side of the ship inward as shown, along the lines A and B.4. Stick the two heads and the two tails together using gum. The ship’s body is no ready.

To Make the Sail1. Make two holes in the sail in such a way that the broomstick can be passed through them. Push the broomstick through the two holes as shown.2. Make a hole in the centre of the matchbox and push the sail into it.3. Now, place the sail in the ship by pushing the matchbox into the middle of the ship.4. Stick the shields to the side of the ship as shown. Are your bags packed? The Viking ship is now ready to sail the seven seas!

“Meera, I went to your school today!” Amma said one day. “Really?” Meera  said.“And the gate was wide open, and the watchman was missing!”“Oh! He  was  in  our  classroom, to  see  why  our  teacher  had  screamed!”“And why did your teacher scream?” Amma asked. “Because  Rohan  began  crying!”

“And why did Rohan cry?” Amma wanted to know.“Because  the  snake  he  had  brought  back  from  the  zoo  had  eaten  his  mouse! And  then  the teacher  screamed  and  the  watchman  came  running!”“But I went to your classroom, and there was nobody there!” said Amma.
“We  were  all  hiding  in  the  Staff  Room,” Meera  said.“Because  Rohan’s  snake  was  in  our classroom!”“But Meera, when I went to the Staff Room, I didn’t see anyone there!”

“That  is  because  we  had  all  run  away  to  the  Principal’s  Room,” Meera  said.“Because  Rohan  said  the  snake  was  following  us!”“But when I went to the Principal’s Room, it was empty!” Amma said.

“We  couldn’t  stay  there,” Meera  said, “because  Rohan’s  snake  was  looking  for  him.  We  climbed  up  to  the  terrace  and  stayed  there  till  the  bell  rang!”“And I waited and waited in your school, all alone!” Amma said.
“Not  all  alone,  Amma,  you  had  the  snake  for  company!” “The snake!” Amma said, sitting down with a thump on a chair.
zho: 「密拉，我今天走去你的學校！」蜜拉的媽媽有一天這麼說。「真的嗎？」蜜拉說到。「學校的大門是敞開的，但是守衛不見了！」「哦！他在我們的教室。他試著弄清楚為什麼我們的老師會尖叫！」「那你們的老師為什麼會尖叫呢？」媽媽問到。「因為羅罕忽然大哭！」
「那為什麼羅罕哭了呢？」媽媽好奇地問到。「因為他從動物園帶回的蛇吃了他的寵物鼠。然後老師失聲尖叫，同時警衛也迅速地跑過來。」「但是當我走進你的教室時，那裡沒有人！」媽媽說到。
「我們全都躲進教職員辦公室」蜜拉說到。「因為羅罕的蛇在我們的教室！」「但是蜜拉，當我走進教職員辦公室時，我沒有看見任何人！」
「那是因為我們都跑進校長室」蜜拉說到。「因為羅罕說那條蛇追著我們。」「但當我走進校長室，校長室是空的！」媽媽說到。
「我們不能待在那裡」蜜拉說到。「因為羅罕的蛇正在尋找他。我們爬上屋頂並停留在那裡直到鐘聲響起。」「而我在你的學校一直等待、一直等待、一直孤獨地等待！」媽媽說。
「你不是孤獨的，媽媽，那條蛇陪伴著你！」「對，那條蛇！」媽媽說到，接著砰一聲用力地坐到椅子上。
小沙亚总是不能好好地呆着。他喜欢到处跑、到处跳和滚......还有跌倒！
“你就不能安静1分钟吗？”爸爸说。“如果你又跌倒弄伤了，不要来找我哭哦，”爸爸说。
“你可不要打破东西啊！”爷爷说。“你在影响着我上课，”他的老师说。
可是小沙亚也不想啊，他的手和脚总是不由自主地跳着舞。
今天是星期天。这是小沙亚最喜欢的日子了 -- 因为今天小沙亚可以到妈妈工作的农场去。
去农场的路上，小沙亚必须要走过高高低低的秘密通道，开阔的农地，浓密的丛林和潺潺地溪流。
小沙亚像小兔子一样跳跃着，像小鹿般奔跑。“小心啊，泥地可是很滑的！”妈妈说。
他像蜈蚣一样爬着，像蛇一样滑行着。“小心草丛里的芒刺！”妈妈说。
他像蜘蛛和长臂猴一样在树林里摇来荡去。“曳~~~~~~~！”“要抓住比较粗壮的树枝啊，我的小猴子。”妈妈说。
他像鸭子一样拍水，像青蛙一样游泳。“只能在浅水处玩，知道吗？”妈妈说。
他像只在蜥蜴石头间爬行，像只山羊在石头间跳跃。“别滑倒了！”妈妈说。
小沙亚挥动着两个手臂像是拍动着翅膀一般，他想要飞上天空。他把自己想象成了一只秃鹰，在天空中滑翔、啸叫。
夜幕来临，当太阳渐渐西下蟋蟀开始低鸣，是时候该回家了。疲惫地小沙亚爬上了妈妈的背上。经过高高低低的路道、农田、树林和小溪，他们再次踏上回家的路。
回到家后，爸爸和爷爷看着小沙亚身上大大小小的瘀青和泥泞。忍不住都大笑了起来。
爷爷帮小沙亚冲凉。爸爸为他准备了晚餐。妈妈说着他最喜欢的故事哄他入睡。
梦里，小沙亚跑着、跳着、旋转着和打滚着...
... 和飞上了天空！
它们是怎么移动的？从小沙亚的动作里，你知不知道动物们、小鸟和昆虫因为各种不同的原因，也用着不一样的方法移动着？就像我们一样，他们为了美味的食物，舒服和温暖的家而移动着。有些是为了躲避被抓走和吃掉的危险而移动。你能找出其他动物是怎么移动的吗？
海豚能够从水里飞跃而出，你能像海豚一样飞跃吗？金钱豹是地上跑得最快的动物。它们跑得快如闪电，尤其是当他们遇到了自己的猎物。你能像金钱豹一样奔跑吗？
螃蟹能够打横着行走，你能像螃蟹一样打横着走吗？蚱蜢可以跳得非常高，尤其是当他们要躲避那些想要把它们吃掉的动物。你能跳得有多高呢？蜗牛爬得很慢、很慢、很慢、真的很慢。你能像蜗牛一样慢慢地爬吗？
eng:
Satya
can’t stay still.   


He
runs and jumps and spins and rolls...


...
and falls!

"Sit
quietly for a minute!" says Appa.  "If
you get hurt, don’t come crying to me," says Akka.

"Don’t
you dare break anything!" says Thaatha.  
"You're
disturbing the class," says his teacher.

But
what can Satya do if his hands and legs are always dancing?
Today is Sunday. It’s Satya’s favourite day of the week — the day he goes to the farm where Amma works.
It’s a long walk to the farm, through secret up-and-down paths, open fields, thick forests and gently flowing streams.
Satya hops like a hare and sprints like a deer.  "The mud is squishy. Be careful!" says Amma.
He crawls like a centipede and slithers like a snake."Look out for thorns!" says Amma.
He swings like a spider and leaps like a langur."Wheeeee!""Use the strong branches, my little monkey," says Amma.
He paddles like a duck and  swims like a frog."Stay in the shallows, okay?" says Amma.
He climbs like a lizard and jumps like a goat."Don’t slip!" says Amma.
Satya flaps his arms like wings and tries to fly away. He imagines himself soaring and gliding like a vulture.

Late in the evening, when the sun sets and crickets begin to hum, it’s time to go home.Tired Satya climbs on to his mother's back. They return through the up-and-down paths, fields, forests and streams.

At
home, Appa, Akka and Thaatha take one look at bruised and muddy
Satya, and burst into laughter.
Thaatha bathes him.Appa cooks him dinner.Akka tells him his favourite story as he falls asleep.

In
his dreams, Satya runs and jumps and spins and rolls...

... and
flies away!

How
do they move?


Oh, the way Satya moves! Did you know that animals, birds and insects also move in many different ways and for different reasons?Like us, they move mainly to find
delicious food, a cozy home and a warm family. Some of them also move
to escape from being caught and eaten by other animals.




Find out how some of these
creatures move!

Dolphins are famous for how they leap out of water. Can you leap?Cheetahs are the fastest land
animals. They can run really fast and sprint too, especially when
they hunt. Can you sprint?

Crabs can walk sideways. Can you
walk sideways?

Grasshoppers can jump really
high, especially when they want to escape from being eaten. Can you
jump really high?
Snails crawl. Slowly. Very, very slowly. Can you crawl slowly?
Hippo wants to dance.She jumps up and down on the dusty ground.

THUMP! 

THUMP!
“You’re getting dirt on me!” says Shongololo, sleeping in the sand.
“Go dance somewhere else.”
Hippo wants to dance. She rolls into the river and splashes her arms and legs.
SPLISH! SPLASH!
“You’re making me wet!” says Kingfisher, hunting for her breakfast.
“Go dance somewhere else.”
Hippo wants to dance. She twirls around and around in a field, kicking her legs up high.

SWOOSH! 

SWOOSH!
“Be careful! You nearly kicked me!” says Meerkat, bathing his babies.
“Go dance somewhere else.”
Hippo wants to dance.She flops into a puddle of mud and slides around on her nice big belly.
SQUISH! SQUASH!
“Why don’t you stop dancing?” asks Donkey, carrying his buckets.
“Why can’t you do something useful instead?”
Hippo is sad.She is too sad to dance.
She sits on a rock and cries. The tears roll down her cheeks and fall on the ground.

PLOP! 

PLOP!Grasshopper hears Hippo’s tears. He starts dancing around her feet.
HOP! HOP!
Hippo and Grasshopper start to dance, and the other animals come to look …
zho: 小河馬想跳舞，她在泥地上跳上跳下。

碰！

碰！
在睡午覺的千足蟲說：「喂！你弄得我全身都是泥了！」
「你到別的地方跳舞吧。」
小河馬想跳舞。 她滾進河裡，手舞足蹈。
撲通！撲通！
「你弄濕我了！」正在捉魚兒做早餐的翠鳥說。
「你到別的地方跳舞吧。」
小河馬想跳舞， 她在田裏轉啊轉， 把腳踢得高高的。
轉啊轉！
「小心點！你差點踢到我了！」 在給小寶寶洗澡的狐獴說。
「你到別的地方跳舞吧。」
小河馬想跳舞。她撲向一灘泥，用大肚皮左右滑動。
﻿啪啦！啪啦！

﻿
「為什麼你不能靜下來？」
挑著幾桶水經過的驢問。
「為什麼你不做點有意義的事？」
﻿﻿﻿小河馬很難過，她不想再跳舞了。
她坐到大石上，哭了起來。 淚珠滾下她的面頰，滴到地上。
「滴答！滴答！」 草蜢聽到淚水打在地上的聲音，忍不住圍著河馬跳起舞來。
一二三四！一二三四！
小河馬和草蜢一起跳舞， 很多動物都來看他們。

eng: ﻿We love going to Grandmother's village!
In Granny's garden stands a big mango tree.So many birds come and perch on it.
I like hiding on this tree.Nobody can find me here.
Dad searches for me near the well, and Mom searches near the cowshed.However, none of them find me.
Oh no!Granny's dog has found me.
Now I must climb down.Granny hugs me tightly.
zho: 我们要到村子里找奶奶。
奶奶的果园里有一颗很大的芒果树。有很多鸟喜欢到芒果树上。
我喜欢躲在芒果树里。这里没有人看得到我。
爸爸到井边找我。妈妈到牛舍边找我。没有人能找到我。
不好了！奶奶的狗找到我了。
我爬下芒果树。奶奶给我一个大拥抱。
索娜的妈妈在给一块纱丽（印度妇女传统服饰）绘制花纹。索娜说：“妈妈，我也想给衣服上花！”
妈妈听了，就拿给索娜一些布匹和颜料。
屋子里满是用来给衣服印花的工具。
妈妈说：“索娜，要不你坐在外面印花。要仔细听我印花的声音哦。”
索娜于是坐在屋外的一张小桌子旁，仔细地听着。
当屋子里静悄悄的时候，索娜知道妈妈正在静静地给印章上色。于是索娜也给印章上色。而当屋里传来“嗒、嗒”的声音时，索娜就将印章按压在布料上。
一段安静，“嗒”！一段安静，“嗒”！就这样，索娜和妈妈一起劳动，协作无间。
但还有一种声音：叮了咣啷， 叮了咣啷的，让索娜会心而笑。
过了一会儿，妈妈在屋里呼唤道：“索娜，你见过我那串钥匙吗？我找不见了。”
索娜跑到妈妈身旁，搂着妈妈的腰。
“嘿，索娜，别闹了！”妈妈一边说着，一边到处寻找。“我得找到钥匙，把颜料从柜子里拿出来。快来帮我找找。”
索娜抓住卷妈妈的腰间上身头巾的一角，往外一拉。叮了咣啷，钥匙缠在头巾的另一头呢。叮了咣啷！
“哦，赞！你怎么知道钥匙在这儿呢？”妈妈惊讶的问道。“妈妈，我在外面听得可仔细了，”索娜笑着说：“安静一会儿 - 嗒 - 咣啷，安静一会儿 - 嗒 - 咣啷！”“我的索娜真聪明！”妈妈开心的笑了。
eng: Sona’s mother was making prints on a sari with a block. Sona said, “Ma, I want to make prints too.”
Ma gave Sona a piece of cloth and some colours.
The room was full of things that helped in making printed cloth.
Ma said, “Sona, why don’t you sit outside and print? Listen carefully to the sounds of my printing.”
Sona sat at a small table outside.

When there was no sound from the room Sona knew that Ma was quietly putting colours on the block. Then Sona would also colour her block. When she heard the sound thupp, Sona would press her block on to the cloth.
Silence-thupp,silence-thupp,Ma and Sona worked together.
But there was another small sound that Sona could hear, chun-chanan-chun, that made her smile.
After some time Ma called out, “Sona, have you seen my keys? I cannot find them.”
Sona went to Ma. She held her around her waist.
“Sona, this is no time to play!” Ma said looking around. “I have to take out the colours from the cupboard. I need the keys. Try to find them please!”

Sona pulled the end of Ma's odhni* that was tucked into her waist. Chun-chanan-chanwent the keys tied to a corner of the odhni, chun-chanan-chan.
*Piece of cloth draped like a shawl.
“Oh! How did you know the keys were here?” Ma asked in surprise. “Ma, I was listening carefully,” laughed Sona.“Silence-thupp-chunn, silence-thupp-chunn!” “You are such a smart girl, Sona!” said Ma.
Why is the baby crying?
I think she is hungry.
Why is the boy sad?
I think he is missing his father.
Why is the girl happy?
She has a new dress.
Why is the old man laughing?
He read a good joke.
Why is the lady smiling?
Her children are reading quietly.
What is this lady feeling?I think she is feeling shy.
zho: 为什么这个婴儿在哭？
我想她是饿了吧。
为什么这个小男孩很难过？
我想他在思念他的父亲。
为什么这个小女孩很高兴？
她有一条新裙子。
为什么老爷爷在大笑？
他读了一个有趣的笑话。
为什么这个女士在微笑？
她的孩子们在安静地读书。
这个女士有什么感受？我想她感觉很害羞。

eng:
“I have a wiggly
tooth, Mama!”
                                                             This is Bunu’s
first loose tooth.                                                             She is excited, but also a little scared.
"Push it with your tongue,” Mama says.Bunu pushed and pushed and pushed.“It is not ready,” Mama says. “Wait for some time and it will fall out on its own.”

Bunu goes to Papa. “Papa,” Bunu says.
“I have a wiggly tooth!”
Papa shakes the tooth gently.  "It is not
ready,” he says. "Wait for some time  and it will fall out on its
own."
But Bunu does not want to wait. She runs to her room with a long piece of string.She ties one end of the string around her tooth and the other around the door knob.
Bunu sits on the floor and waits and waits and waits.
Finally Bunu gets tired of waiting and waiting and waiting.She unties the string from the door and sits on her bed with a loud sigh.

Chunnu, her sister,
walks in after some time. “That was a terrible
idea,” she says, pointing at the door. “Why don’t I pull the string, and your
tooth will come out like that?”

Chunnu snapped her
fingers. Bunu closes her eyesand opens her mouth. "One, two,
three!" Chunnu pulls."OWWW!” Bunu screams. "It is not
ready,” Chunnu says."Wait for some time and it will fall out on its
own."

“This tooth will
never come out!” Bunu says.
"When we were
small, we would throw our teeth on theroof and ask Musa to give us his in
return,” says Mama. “Because we wanted teeth as strong as a mouse’s.”
Bunu runs out and
cries, “Musa, Musa!Here is my big strong tooth for you.If you like it, please
come and take it away!”

That night, Bunu
dreams of a big mouse. 
Musa is holding
something gleaming between his teeth. 
He stops and stares
at her, then scurries away into a hole.

As soon as Bunu wakes up, she pushes the tooth with her tongue.But there is nothing there!Did she swallow it? Did someone pull it out when she was sleeping? Where is it?There it is! Right next to the pillow. Bunu picks the tooth up and dashes outside.

“Musa, Musa, please
take my tooth and give me a new one!” she says.She throws her
tooth on the roofand runs back inside to tell Mama.
zho: “妈妈，我有一颗牙齿在摇 ！”                                                                               这是布努第一颗松动的牙。她又兴奋又害怕。
妈妈说“用你的舌头推一推”布努推了又推，推了又推，推了又推。妈妈说，“还不是时候”“再等一会儿它就会自然掉了。”
布努去找爸爸。布努说“爸爸，我有颗牙齿在摇！“爸爸轻轻的摇了牙齿。”还不是时候，“在等一会儿就会自然的掉下来。
但是布努等不及了。她带着一条长线跑去她房间。她将线的一头绑在牙齿上，另一头绑在门把上。
布努坐在地上等了又等等了又等等了又等。
布努终于等的不耐烦了。她将门把上的线松开，坐在床上大声叹气。
她的姐姐春努过了一会儿走了进来。她指着门说“这是一个糟糕的主意。”不如我拉着线把你的牙齿拔出来？“

春努弹手指。布奴闭上眼睛，张开嘴。                                                                          ”一，二，三！”春努拉线。                                                                                    布奴痛叫了一声“啊！”                                                                             春努说，“还不是时候。”                                                                    在等一会儿它就会自然掉了。
布努说，“这颗牙永远都不会掉！”妈妈说，“小时候我们会把牙齿丢在屋顶，请木洒用它的牙齿来交换。因为我们想要有和老鼠一样坚固的牙。”布努哭着喊“木洒，木洒！”这是我又大又坚固的牙齿，喜欢的话就来把它拿走！”
那晚，布奴梦见一只大老鼠。木洒把一个发光的东西拿在它的牙齿之间。它停下来看着她，然后匆忙的回到洞里。
布奴一起床就用舌头推呀齿。那里什么都没有！她是不是吞下去了。是不是有人在她睡觉时把牙齿拉了出来？在哪？就在那！就在枕头边。布奴拿起牙齿冲出去。
“木洒，木洒，请给我新的牙齿吧！“她把牙齿丢上屋顶就跑回家跟妈妈说。

eng: Nanhi picked up her slate and chalk. She wanted to draw a long, l-o-n-g train.
Nanhi first drew an engine which gave out a lot of smoke, for the long, long train.
“Oh dear! Now where shall I make the coaches?” Nanhi wondered, for there was no more space on the slate.
Nanhi put the slate and chalk down on the floor and thought.
She drew a coach on the floor. Then a second coach, then another, and another, and another... Nanhi just kept drawing.
Until her chalk got over. Nanhi got up and took a look. Wow! Her train was as long as the verandah!
And off went Nanhi’s train – Chhuk-Chhuk-Chhak, from here to there, so very far!
zho: Nanhi有一个巴掌大小的黑板和粉笔。 她想画一副很长很长的小火车的画。
Nanhi首先画了冒烟的火车头。长长的长长的火车呀！
Nanhi突然想到''哎呀！车厢画在哪里呀'。黑板上已经没有空白可以画了。
Nanhi把小黑板和粉笔放在了地面上思考了起来。
Nanhi开始在地上画起了车厢。一个车厢接一个地不停地画了起来。
一直画到粉笔都用没了。Nanhi站了起来看了看。太棒了！火车好像有阳台那么长了。
Nanhi的火车开动啦！轰隆隆， 从这里可以开到很远很远的地方。

eng: One day, grandfather gave my brother and me some money."Go and buy books," he said.We were both very happy. We both love to read.
Should we go now? Should we go later?Should we go today? Should we go tomorrow?We decided to go right now.
Should we go to the big market? Should we go to the small shop?Should we go with somebody? Should we go alone?We decided to go to the small shop, just the two of us.
We like the small bookshop. It is small but it has many books.The man in the shop likes us. He always helps us.
Should I buy a book with a lot of pictures?Should I buy a book with many stories?Should I buy a thin book?I could not decide.

We do not know which book to buy. The man in the shop smiled at us. “Relax, come with me,” he said. “These books are about animals. Those are about machines. Those over there are about wars. Take what you want.”
I picked up some books. My brother picked up some books.I sat on the floor. He sat on the chair.And we read and we read and we read.
It was very quiet. There was no sound.One hour passed. Two hours passed.Finally, we knew which books to buy.

The man in the bookshop smiled at us. I got a fat book with many stories. My brother got a big book with many pictures.We ran home to our grandfather. We climbed on his bed.He put his arms around us and then we read, and read, and read.
zho: 有一天，爷爷给了弟弟和我一些钱。“去买几本书吧。”他说。弟弟和我都非常开心。我们俩都很喜欢读书。
我们应该现在去吗？还是待会再去？我们应该今天去吗？还是明天去呢？我们决定现在就去。
我们应该去大书城吗？还是去小书店呢？我们应该叫上谁一起去吗？还是我们自己去呢？我们决定去小书店，就我们两个人。
我们喜欢这家小书店。书店很小，但有很多书。管理书店的人喜欢我们。他总是提供给我们帮助。
我应该买一本有很多图画的书吗？我应该买一本有很多故事的书吗？我应该买一本薄薄的书吗？我决定不了。
我们不知道买哪本书。管书店的人对我们笑了笑。“放轻松，跟我来吧。”他说。“这些书是讲动物的。那些是讲机器的。那边那些是讲战争的。挑你们喜欢的吧。”
我选了一些书。我弟弟也选了一些书。我坐在地上。他坐在椅子上。然后我们读呀读呀读呀。
身边非常安静。一点声音也没有。一小时过去了。两小时过去了。终于，我们知道买哪些书了。
管书店的人对我们笑。我拿了一本厚厚的故事书。我的弟弟拿了一本厚厚的图画书。我们回家找爷爷了。我们爬上他的床。他伸手揽过我们俩，然后我们读呀、读呀、读呀。

eng: One upon a time, a monkey, mouse, rabbit and a bear were good friends.
They played hide and seek,  thief and police. They played together for long time.
Monkey said, "I am hungry, can you all please bring something to eat?". Everyone got something to eat for him. Rabbit bought some carrots.
The bear got some cabbage. Squirrel got some tomatoes. Mouse bought some radish. He washed all the vegetables, cut them and mixed all of them together.
Now it was time for them to eat.
Bear said, "Wow this is tasty, what is this called?". Mouse replied, "Snack mixture". Rabbit said, "mixed veggies".
Squirrel said, "This is a pickle". Monkey said, "This is salad, eat generously, it makes you stronger."
Mouse said, "I am going to eat this everyday now, I will be a lion when I grow up". Everyone started laughing.
zho: 从前，有五个好朋友一起住在森林里。他们是小猴子，小老鼠，小兔子，小松鼠和小熊。一天，他们出门去野餐。
他们玩了捉迷藏，又玩了警察抓强盗的游戏。接着，他们又比赛看谁跑得快，一直玩到他们累得玩不动了。
小猴子说：“该吃饭了，大家都去找点好吃的吧。”大家都跑去找好吃的。小兔子带来了胡萝卜，小老鼠拿来了水萝卜。
小猴拿来了苹果，小熊带来了卷心菜，小松鼠拿来了一筐西红柿。他们把食物洗干净了，然后切好混在一起。
现在可以吃啦！
小熊说：“哇，这是什么？看着好好吃！”小老鼠说：“这个叫查特”小兔子说：“我叫它盘克朗加，五种颜色混在一起。  ”
小松鼠甩了甩尾巴，说：“我们叫它神奇混合物吧！”小猴子说：“这叫沙拉。吃了它会让你变强壮。”
小老鼠说：“从现在起，我要多吃沙拉。我可要长成一头狮子呢！”大家听了都哈哈大笑。

eng: On a cliff there lived a young vulture with his mother.
When he was old enough to fly, his mother took him high into the air and they circle together, watching the ground below.“I want to show yousomething beautiful,” she told her son.
They saw an old gemsbok staggering through the heat. “Look there. That gemsbok won’t last long.”
Sure enough, the buck collapsed right there and died. The two vultures flew down. “This isn’t beautiful,” said the young vulture to his mother. “This is horrible!”
“I know,” said his mother.“Death is very difficult, and very sad. But it is also beautiful.” “No ways,” said the young vulture. “Yuck.”
“Just wait,” she said. “We will come back here soon and you will see.”
The next week, they visited the dead buck.Its skeleton was clean and white, and tiny plants had started to grow between the bones.
The week after that, the shoots had grown tall and blossomed. A butterfly sipped at the flowers and a songololo rested in their shade.
A week later, a pair of weavers was picking the leaves to build a nest. Bees were collecting pollen from the blossoms. And a spider had made her home between the buck’s horns.
And the week after that, they saw a young gemsbok nibbling the tasty shoots.

“Well?” said the vulture’s mother. “Look at the life one buck has given. He has given a spider a home and weavers a nest, fed bees and butterflies, sheltered a songololo, and helped the next generation of buck grow strong.” The young vulture smiled.
The two of them flew back to their nest high up on the cliff.
“It is not just our bodies we leave behind when we die,” said the mother vulture. “We also leave our lessons and our love and our memories.”

“Where do we leave all those things?” asked the little vulture.“We leave them in our children and in our family and friends. You are already my green patch on earth, Little Vulture. And you will be, forever.”
zho: 在悬崖上，住着一只年轻的秃鹰和它的妈妈。
当它长大到可以自己飞翔时，它的妈妈领着它飞到高空，它们一起转圈，俯视下面的地面。“我想给你看一些美丽的东西，”秃鹰妈妈告诉儿子。
它们看到一只南非劍羚在热浪中踉跄前进。“看。 那只南非劍羚撑不了多少时间了。”
果不其然，南非劍羚倒下，死了。 两只秃鹰飞了下来。 年轻的秃鹰对妈妈说：“这并不漂亮。”“这太可怕了！”
“我知道，” 它的妈妈说。“死亡是非常困难的，也是非常悲伤的。 可是也很美丽。”“怎么可能，”年轻的秃鹰说。 “恶心极了。”

“等着吧，”秃鹰妈妈说。 “

我们将很快回到这里，到时候你会看到的。”
下一个星期，它们再次来到了尸体的所在地。尸体的骨架干净洁白，骨头之间开始长出微小的植物。
在那之后的一周，芽长得很高，还开了花。一只蝴蝶在花朵上吸食着花蜜，还有一只千足虫在树荫下休息。
再一周后，一对织布鸟在摘树叶筑巢。蜜蜂从绽放的花朵中采集花粉。一只蜘蛛把巢建在尸体的角之间。
又过了一周，它们看到了一只年轻的南非劍羚在嗑咬着美味的芽。
“怎么样？”秃鹰的妈妈说。 “看看一具尸体带来的生命。 它给蜘蛛提供了一个家，让织布鸟编织了一个巢穴，给蜜蜂和蝴蝶喂食，庇护了一只千足虫，并帮助了下一代雄鹿成长壮大。”年轻的秃鹰微笑了。
它们俩飞回悬崖上高高的巢穴。
这位秃鹰妈妈说：“死后，我们留下的不仅仅是我们的尸体。”“我们还留下了教训，我们的爱和我们的记忆。”
“我们将所有这些东西留在哪里？”小秃鹰问。“我们将这些东西留给我们的孩子，我们的家人和我们的朋友。而你，我的儿子已经是我留在这地球上的寄托。 永远都是。”

eng:
Today,
we will climb up a ladder together. It is a rather unusual ladder. In
this ladder, the distance between the rungs gets bigger and BIGGER and BIGGER as you climb up the steps, growing 10 times at each step. Sometimes we will climb one step at a time and at other times we will skip many steps at one go.


The
funny thing is that we are not even sure which the last step is or
whether the steps go on forever. Let the exciting journey begin!

Step
0: 1 metre
What
do a five year old boy, a cricket bat and a newborn baby elephant
have in common? All of them have a height of about 1 metre (or 1m for
short)! It would be awkward to say that the ceiling of a room is 3
baby elephants high. So we make the sensible choice of saying that
the height of the ceiling is 3 metres.

Step
1: 10 metres
Now
that you have a feel for the size of one metre, we are ready to climb
to the next step of our ladder, at 10 metres. A three storey building
or a mango tree is roughly 10 metres high. A cricket pitch is about
twice that length. 
Can
you think of other objects that are about 10 m long or high?

Step
2: 100 metres
Have
you noticed that with every step we add a zero to the right of the
number we had before and the step number matches the number of
zeroes? Keep track of that as we climb along. 
If
you have run the 100m race on school sports day, or watched sprinters
do it on TV, you know exactly how far that is. Now imagine if the
100m track stood up! That would be about the height of two Gol
Gumbaz*-es. 
*The
Gol Gumbaz in Bijapur, Karnataka, is the tomb of Mohammed Adil Shah.
When it was built in 1656, it had the largest dome in the world. It
held the record until 1881!

Step
3: 1000 metres
Thousand
metres has a special name - it is called 1 kilometre or 1 km. You
would cover this distance if you ran the 100 metre race 10 times -
phew!  You would need to climb about 9 km to reach the top of Mount
Everest.

Step
6: 10,00,000 metres 

Now
let's skip 2 steps and go to step 6, which has six zeroes to the
right of 1.
The
distance from the northern tip of India in Kashmir to the southern
tip at Kanyakumari is about 4 times this distance, or 4 times
10,00,000 m, or 40,00,000 m. Because 40,00,000 m is quite a mouthful,
we usually say 4000 km, which is the same thing.

Step
8: 10,00,00,000 metres
How
far away is the bright, beautiful moon? It is right there on the 8th
step of our distance ladder at about 4 times 10,00,00,000 m, or
4,00,000 km away from the earth!

Step
11: 1,00,00,00,00,000 metres
Let
us skip two more steps and race to the blazing hot Sun. How far away
is it? It is about 10,00,00,000
 km PLUS another
5,00,00,000 km. That is very, VERY far away indeed!
But
the far, far away sun still lights up the world and makes us sweat in
summer. Amazing, isn't it?

Last
Step???
Is
there a last step on the ladder? We don’t know yet!  But with
powerful telescopes, scientists have been able to see way beyond the
sun. The farthest object that they have been able to spot is on the
26th
step, 10,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,000 m away! That is SERIOUSLY FAR!


Maybe
when you grow up, you can discover something even further away, on
the 28th or 29th step. Isn’t that an exciting thought?

Fun with MeasuringThe following activity done in a classroom setting is a great
way to give children a feel for large distances and can engage the children
either in a single group, or in teams.
 
1. Ask the children to cut long strips (each about an inch
wide) from old newspapers. 
 
2. Ask them to stick the strips end to end with tape or glue
to make longer strips, until they get a strip that is 1 metre long (they can
use a measuring tape for this). 
 
3.  Now ask the
children to use this 1 m long strip as a measure and make 10 similar strips and
stick them end to end to make a 10 m long strip. They can lie down next to this
strip, head to head and feet to feet, and see how many of them it takes to make
10 m. 
 
4. They can then stick ten 10 m strips together to make a 100
m strip that goes round the classroom many times. 
 
5. What about a 1 km strip? How many times does that go
around the classroom? Which team was able to create a 1 km long strip fastest?

Notes for Parents & Teachers:

 - 

When writing down big numbers with lots of zeroes after the 1, it is very easy for children - and adults! - to make mistakes. That is why the 'Powers of 10' notation is such a useful thing. Through this book, children can be taught how to use it - all they need to do is to count the number of zeroes to the right of the 1, and write that number as a superscript of 10. For instance, 1000, which has 3 zeroes after the 1, can be written as 103. And 10000000 (7 zeroes after the 1), can be compactly written as 107. Simple!
 - 

In this book, we stopped our 'How far is far?' game at the Sun. If you want to take the game further, you may want to bring in the nearest star beyond the Sun, Proxima Centauri, which is 1016 m away from the Sun. Or the distance from one end of the Milky Way to another, which is 1,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,000 (or 1021) m!
 - 

One thing you should know is that the distances that are given in the book are approximate, not exactly accurate. For example, 3984 km is given as 4000 km. This is not 'unscientific'. Rough estimates are very useful in science! Maybe you can do an activity with the kids to emphasize this. Is the length of a pencil closer to 101 cm or 102 cms? Is the weight of the school bus closer to 103 kgs or 104 kgs? Let the children come up with their own questions for their classmates too.
zho: 今天，我们一起爬梯子。这是一个相当不寻常的梯子。在这个梯子中，当你爬上台阶时，梯级之间的距离变得越来越大，越来越大，每一步增加 10 倍。有时我们会一步一步爬，有时我们会一次跳过很多步骤。       有趣的是，我们甚至不确定最后一步是哪一步，或者这些步骤是否永远持续下去。让激动人心的旅程开始吧！
第 0 步：1 米   五岁的男孩、板球棒和新生的小象有什么共同点？   它们的高度都在1米左右（简称1m）！说一个房间的天花板有 3 头小象高是很尴尬的。所以我们做出明智的选择，说天花板的高度是 3 米
第一步：10米   现在您已经对一米的大小有了感觉，我们准备爬到我们梯子的下一步，在 10 米处。一栋三层楼的建筑或一棵芒果树大约有 10 米高。一个板球场大约是这个长度的两倍。   你能想到其他大约 10 m 长或高的物体吗？

第 2 步：100 米   您是否注意到，每一步我们都会在之前的数字右侧添加一个零，并且步骤编号与零的数量相匹配？在我们攀爬时跟踪它。   如果您在学校运动日跑过 100 米比赛，或者在电视上看过短跑运动员的比赛，您就会确切地知道那有多远。现在想象一下，如果 100m 轨道站起来了！那大约是两个 Gol Gumbaz*-es 的高度。   *位于卡纳塔克邦比贾布尔的 Gol Gumbaz 是穆罕默德·阿迪尔·沙阿 (Mohammed Adil Shah) 的坟墓。它建于 1656 年，拥有世界上最大的圆顶。它一直保持到 1881 年！
第 3 步：1000 米   千米有一个特殊的名字——它被称为1公里或1公里。   如果你跑 10 次 100 米比赛，你就会跑完这个距离 - 呸！您需要爬上大约 9 公里才能到达珠穆朗玛峰的顶部。
第 6 步：10,00,000 米   现在让我们跳过 2 个步骤并转到第 6 步，其中 1 的右侧有六个零。   从克什米尔的印度北端到 Kanyakumari 的南端的距离大约是这个距离的 4 倍，或 10,00,000 m 的 4 倍，或 40,00,000 m。因为40,000,000米是一大口，所以我们通常说4000公里，这是同一个东西。
第 8 步：10,00,00,000 米   美丽的月亮离我们有多远？   它就在我们距离阶梯的第 8 级台阶上，距离地球大约 4 倍 10,000,000,000 米，或 4,00,000 公里！
第 11 步：1,00,00,00,00,000 米   让我们再跳过两步，奔向炽热的太阳。它有多远？大约是 10,000,000,000 公里加上另外 5,00,00,000 公里。那确实非常非常遥远！   但遥远的太阳仍然照亮世界，让我们在夏天出汗。 很神奇，不是吗？

最后一步？？？   梯子上有最后一步吗？我们还不知道！但是借助强大的望远镜，科学家们已经能够看到太阳以外的地方。他们能够发现的最远物体在第 26 步，10,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,000 米！那太远了！

也许等你长大了，你会发现更远的东西，在第 28 或第 29 步。这不是一个令人兴奋的想法吗？

有趣的测量   以下在课堂环境中进行的活动是让孩子们感受到远距离的好方法，并且可以让孩子们以一个小组或团队的形式参与其中。   1. 让孩子们从旧报纸上剪下长条（每条约一英寸宽）。 2. 让他们用胶带或胶水将条带首尾相连以制作更长的条带，直到他们得到一条 1 米长的条带（他们可以使用卷尺来做这个）。 3. 现在让孩子们用这个 1 m 长的条作为量尺，制作 10 个类似的条，并将它们首尾相连，制成 10 m 长的条。他们可以在这条带子旁边躺下，头对头，脚对脚，看看需要多少人才能达到10 m。 4. 然后他们可以将十个 10 m 的条带粘在一起，制成一个 100 m 的条带，可以绕教室多次。 5. 1 公里长的地带怎么样？它在教室里转了多少次？哪支球队能够最快地创造出一条 1 公里长的带状体？

给家长和老师的注意事项： ﻿ - 写下 1 后面有很多零的大数字时，这对儿童和成人来说非常容易！ - 犯错误。这就是“10 的幂”符号如此有用的原因。通过这本书，孩子们可以学会如何使用它——他们需要做的就是数一数 1 右边的零的数量，然后把这个数字写成 10 的上标。例如，1000，它有 3 1后面的零，可以写成103。而10000000（1后面的7个零），可以简洁地写成107。简单！  - 在这本书中，我们停止了“还有多远？”在太阳的比赛。如果你想更进一步，你可能想要引入离太阳最近的恒星——比邻星，它距离太阳 1016 米。或者银河系一端到另一端的距离，即 1,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,00,000（或 1021）米！  - 你应该知道的一件事是书中给出的距离是近似的，并不完全准确。例如，3984 公里被指定为 4000 公里。这并非“不科学”。粗略估计在科学上非常有用！也许你可以和孩子们一起做一个活动来强调这一点。铅笔的长度是接近 101 厘米还是 102 厘米？校车的重量是接近103公斤还是104公斤？让孩子们也为他们的同学提出他们自己的问题。

zho: 首先，我要造一座桥。然后，我要搭建非常高的塔。我还要修一条全世界最长的路。这条路会以我的房间为起点，直通月球！我要成为一名创造这些东西的土木工程师。
我也造发动机。有些发动机会用在火箭上，有些会用在太空飞机上。太空飞机将带着我们周游列国，火箭将带着我们一路飞向火星。我的奶奶也会跟着我一起去旅行！我要成为一名创造飞行发动机的航天航空工程师。
我不只是要造东西。我要用微小的粒子来发电。只要用一个小小的粒子的能量就能照亮我们的村庄。奶奶会高兴得想要举办一场盛大的庆典！我要成为一名从粒子里提取能源的核能工程师。
我要制造两部机器：一部能清洁海洋，另一部能清洁大气。动物们能健康地生活在这里，人们能呼吸新鲜的空气。我要用我的机器来拯救地球！我要成为一名制造地球清洁器的环境工程师。
我要给我家的宠物狗造一只耳朵（她在一次战斗中失去了耳朵）。我还要给奶奶制造一副新的牙齿。最后，我要给自己制造一双翅膀！我要成为一名制造人造身体器官的生物医学工程师。我将展翅高飞，到世界各地去，寻找更多创造的机会。
eng:
First, I will build a bridge. After that, I will build a very tall tower. And then, I will build the longest road
in the world. It will start at my room
and go right up to the moon!

When I build these structures,I will be a civil engineer.

I will build engines too.
Some engines will be in rockets
and some will bein planes.

The plane will take us from country to country and the rocket will fly us all the way to Mars.
My Anaideo* will come with me on all my trips!

When I build flying engines,
I will be an aerospace engineer.

*Anaideo means grandmotherin Assamese.

But I won’t stop at that.
I will produce electricity from small particles.
One tiny particle will light up our whole village.
Anaideo will be so happy that she will throw a big feast!

When I make power like that, I will be a nuclear engineer.

I will build a machine to clean the sea.
And another to clean the air.
The animals will be healthy
and people will breathe easy.
I will save the earth
with my machines!

When I make machinesto clean the planet,
I will be an environmental engineer.

I will build a new ear for Pempem
(she lost it in a fight... grrrr).
Then I will build a new set of teeth for Anaideo.
Finally, I will build wings for me!

When I build artificial body parts,
I will be a biomedical engineer.

And I will soar over theworld
looking for more things to build.
Hi, I am Khaidi. I am seven years old.I have a car, a lovely long car. Papa made it for my birthday.
I love my car and love to drive it all day long.Drooomm... here I go ...drooomm... there I go.Drooomm... I go everywhere.
I visit my relatives driving my car,and in school, my friends want my car.I love my grandma and she loves to see me drive.
With my car I can go round and round my home.With my car I can go around the earth.I can go around the sun, the moon and the stars.
My little brother loves riding on my car.Mummy tells us not to do so, but do we care!
Now, here I am without my car and...my brother without his tooth!But still we go drooomm...with my brother on my back!

我很喜歡我的車，我喜欢一整天開着它。喲。。我来这里了。。喲。。我去那里了。喲。。我哪裡都去。
我開着車去拜訪我的親戚，在學校裡，我的朋友也想要我的車。我愛我的奶奶，她很喜歡看我開車。
開着我的車，我可以一直繞着我的家走。開着我的車，我可以繞着地球走。我可以繞着太陽，月亮，和星星走。
我弟弟很喜歡騎在我的車上。媽媽告訴我們不要這樣做，但我們不管！
現在我沒有我的車...我弟弟也沒有他的牙齒！但是我們還是去哟。。。跟我弟弟在我背上！
小蚂蚁喜欢阅读。小蚂蚁经常被嘲笑。“ 蚂蚁们不阅读。蚂蚁们必须喂食。蚂蚁们必须收集它们所需的食物。”
小蚂蚁会整天都在阅读，它会读到晚上。
其它的蚂蚁们把它们找到的食物储存到地底为冬天而准备。
它的父母很生气，小蚂蚁觉得很内疚。
在秋天，落叶飘落。
蚂蚁们必须把食物储存到地底。
蚁王想要填满仓库，所以所有的蚂蚁必须再努力。
小蚂蚁对它读过的地方开始大喊。“ 餐馆是我们需要的，一个大家都去吃的地方。书里是这样说的。”
蚂蚁们一一进军， 它们朝夕阳前进。
然后有一只蚂蚁说道“嘿，这里有一个！ “
蚂蚁们一一进军，有的扛着汉堡，有的扛着面包。
当他们返回时，女王很高兴。仓库满了。它们疯狂地欢呼。
蚂蚁被它的父母拥抱。
它的小妹妹握着它的手说道 ”我想现在我明白了。“”你喜欢阅读的方式。。。让我想要看一看。“
eng: Little Ant loved to read. Little Ant was often teased. “Ants don’t read. Ants must feed. Ants collect the food they need.”
Little Ant would read all day, he’d read and read the day away.
The other ants took what they found to store for winter underground.
His mum and dad got really mad, and Little Ant felt really bad.
In autumn when the leaves fall down.
The ants must keep food underground.
The Queen wants food to fill the store, so all the ants must work some more.
Little Ant begins to shout about a place he read about. “A restaurant is what we need, a place where people go to feed. It says so in the books I read.”
The ants go marching one by one. They march into the setting sun.
And Little Ant said “Hey, there’s one!”
The ants go marching one by one, carrying a burger, carrying a bun.
When they return the Queen is glad. The stores are full. They cheer like mad.
Ant gets hugs from mum and dad.
His baby sister takes his hand “Now I think I understand.” “The way you love to read a book … Makes me want to take alook.”
My name is Mia. I am going to the market with my Ma.
I am the best at hide-and-seek in the world!             You will never find me in the market.             And I will find the things on my Ma’s shopping list before you.
Find:      (1) 10 red chillies                           (2) 2 green tomatoes      (3) 1 potato      (4) 1 fat pumpkin
Oh no!                  How did you find me?
Find:      (1) 6 yellow bananas                                   (2) 3 oranges      (3) 1 red apple      (4) 1 green papaya with stem
You found me and the fruits on my Ma’s list!      It won’t happen again.
Find:       (1) 5 roses                                                    (2) 1 purple garland       (3) Jasmine flowers       (4) Flowery shorts
This is not fair!       I am the best at hiding in the world!
Find:     (1) 1 lungi with dots                                              (2) 1 sari with green stripes     (3) 1 school uniform with squares     (4) 1 plain black T-shirt
Did Ma tell you where I was hiding?        Let me see how you find me now.
Find:    (1) 3 pinching crabs                                  (2) 1 angry squid    (3) 7 prawns    (4) 2 fish on ice
You got lucky so far.              But you will never find me in my own house!
Find:      (1) 1 big pot                                                           (2) 1 wooden spoon      (3) 1 box of matches      (4) 1 bottle of water
You found me AGAIN!                                   Okay, I cannot play anymore.                                   I have to go eat lunch.
I would have won if Ma had not asked me to stop playing.          I am the best at hide-and-seek in the world!

动物们，看着我！我是个人类！我什么都知道！
瞧，这是我的眼睛。我可以用眼睛来看东西。
那又怎样？我们也有眼睛。而且我们在黑暗里都能看清楚！
好吧，那你们看我的鼻子。我用鼻子来呼吸。
那又怎么样？我们也有鼻子，而且我们的鼻子更漂亮！
好吧，这是我的牙齿，可以用来咀嚼和咬东西。
牙？哈哈哈，你看到我们的牙了吗？你可以咀嚼，但是我们这才叫咬～ 嘿嘿嘿...
好吧。听！我能用耳朵听到很多声音！
小东西！我们能听到你听不到的声音！你都想象不出来！
我能用我的脚走、跑，甚至跳舞！
哦，我们有四条腿！我们会跳，我们会跳舞我们还可以列队游行！
我会编辫子！
呃！我们的毛发也很漂亮！如果我们愿意的话，我们也可以编辫子，呃，也许！
瞧！我可以用手来工作！
手！把你的手收起来吧！
啊哈！我告诉你，我是最棒的！我什么都知道！
真的吗？你看见我的尖爪子了吗？
是的！但是你的指甲里面全是泥！
你瞧，这是我们可爱的尾巴。
尾巴！我们早就不要了！否则我们怎么穿裤子啊？
我们会吼叫！
吼叫？你听到过我妈的吼叫吗？
那又如何？你们只是动物而已 - 我就知道！
人类也是动物。我们知道的！
你也许是对的，瞧瞧我弟弟！我妈妈说他特别野，他绝对就是个动物。
是的，你不也是吗？相信我们，我们都是动物。我们都属于这里，就和你一样。
eng: ACT-1
Look at me, animals! I am a human being! I know everything!
Look, these are my eyes. I can see everything with them.
So what? We have eyes too. And we can see in the dark!
Fine, but look at my nose. I breathe through my nose.
So what? We also have noses and ours are prettier than yours!
And yes, my teeth. I use my teeth to chew and bite.
Teeth? Ha! Ha! Have you seen our teeth? You can chew. But WE CAN BITE! Hiee..Hiee…Hiee…
Yes, but listen! I can hear a lot with my ears!
Little one! We can hear sounds which you cannot imagine at all!
And I can walk, run and even dance with my feet.
Oh! We have four feet! We can jump, we can dance and we can parade too!
I can plait my hair.
Uh! Our hair is pretty too. We could plait it if we wanted to. Maybe!
Look! I can work with my hands!
Hands! Keep your hands to yourself!
ACT-2
Aha! I told you! I am the best! I know it all!
Really?Have you seen our sharp claws?
Yes! But your nails will pick up dirt!
Now see, these are our lovely tails.
Tails! We gave them up long ago!How else could we wear our shorts?
And we can roar!
Roar? Have you heard my mother?
So then! You are only animals - I know that!
Humans are animals too. We know that!
You may be right. Look at my brother!Mother says he is wild. He is definitely an animal.
Yes! And so are you! Believe us! We are all animals.We all belong here. Just like you.
