eng: Elephant Haathibhai is too fat.
His ears are buzzing !
There's a long tree trunk in front.
A short tail hangs behind!
On Sunday, we stayed at home and cleaned.
On Monday, we went to our uncle’s house.
On Tuesday, we went to the local market.
On Wednesday, we went swimming.
On Thursday, we went to the zoo.
On Friday, we went to the fair.
On Saturday, we went for a picnic.
zho: 周日，我们呆在家里打扫卫生。
周一，我们到叔叔家去。
周二，我们去了当地市场。
﻿周三，我们去游泳。
周四，我们去动物园。
周五，我们去嘉年华会。
周六，我们去野餐。

eng: A long time ago, in the forest of Happy-Land, birds and trees could talk to each other.
There was a bird family with three children: Blue, Pink and Yellow. They all lived on a big wise tree called Mamango.
Mama Birdie’s voice was beautiful! She would wake up early to sing her song.
But drought set in on the land. Rivers dried up and leaves fell off.
Mamango thought long and hard. “Maybe we should get the magic worm that brings rain. But who can go?”
“I will go. I am not afraid,” Mama Birdie said.
Everyone missed Mama Birdie, and her song. Would she ever find her way back home?

“What if we sing Mama’s song?” Yellow asked. “Mama said if we sing her song, she will find her way back.” 

“But I don’t know how to sing!” cried Pink.
“Have you tried singing?” Mamango asked.
“I have tried singing,” said Yellow. “I can teach you.”
Early the next morning, Yellow sang Mama’s song: And rain started falling. “It’s a beautiful morning! We wake up and shine!”
Eventually, all the birds joined Yellow in song. Mama Birdie found her way back to Happy-Land. And from then on, birds sang at dawn.
zho: 很久很久以前，在乐土的森林中，鸟儿和树会互相交谈。
一个鸟类家庭中有三个孩子：蓝色，粉红色和黄色。 他们都住在一棵叫做Mamango的大智慧树上。
鸟儿妈妈的声音很好听！她早起来唱歌。
但是土地上却出现干旱。河流干涸了，树叶落下来了。
Mamango 想了很长时间，“ 也许我们应该带来雨水的魔虫子。 但是谁可以去？”
“我去。我不怕，”鸟儿妈妈说。
谁都很想鸟儿妈妈，也想她的歌。她会找到回家的路了吗？
“我们唱她的歌，好不好?”黄色问。“妈妈说，如果我们唱她的歌她找得到回家的路。”“但是我不知道怎么唱歌！”，粉红色喊道。
“你已经试过唱歌吗？”Mamango 问。
“我试过," 黄色说。“我可以教教你。”
第二天一大早，黄色唱了妈妈的歌： 雨开始下了。 “这是一个美丽的早晨！ 我们醒来发光！”
最终，所有的鸟儿都加入了黄色的演唱。 鸟儿妈妈回家了。 从那时起，鸟儿在黎明时唱歌。
阿助是個住在城市的小男孩。但是每當暑假開始時，他一定去鄉下的奶奶家玩。
每年暑假他總是會在奶奶家學到新東西，今年他學到了在鄉下，牛奶不是從塑膠的牛奶罐裡面來的。
這天傍晚他到了奶奶家，奶奶把他帶到了房子後面的牛棚裡。四隻溫和的棕色奶牛正在享用奶奶為他們準備的牧草。
幾隻頑皮的小牛愉快地嬉鬧著，阿助很喜歡看著他們。他覺得牠們非常可愛。
奶奶說：「阿助，記得你剛剛喝的那一杯牛奶嗎？ 就是從這隻乳牛來的喔！」 「我喝的牛奶來自乳牛？」阿助非常驚訝問道。「你是說剛剛擠下來的牛奶就是我喝的那杯？」
“是的，阿助，”奶奶笑了笑。 “來看看我的乳牛們。這是卡瓦麗，你剛剛喝的牛奶是牠給的，這是卡皮菈，那個是甘佳，角落的那頭是戈偉莉。“阿助站在那裡，懷疑地看著這些乳牛。“來吧，阿助，”奶奶哄著阿助。 “摸摸他們，他們不會傷害你的。“
阿助一靠近他們，小牛們便吽叫著快步跑向的母牛，並想知道他們是否可以相信這個陌生人。 他們的母親便舔一舔他們，讓他們知道阿助是一個朋友。
阿助提起勇氣，伸手摸摸戈偉莉的脖子。 感覺很柔軟但也有許多皺紋，有點像的奶奶的脖子。 戈偉莉哞哞地叫著，想跟阿助成為朋友。
“你知道牛奶怎麼從乳牛擠出來的嗎？”奶奶問。
“不知道耶，奶奶”，阿助覺得自己有點笨。“我只知道在都市裡，牛奶都用塑膠瓶送到家門口“
“來吧，讓我告訴你。” 奶奶說。她拉著阿助，把他帶到卡皮菈的旁邊。而卡皮菈的小牛也在附近。
奶奶先讓小牛喝飽。然後她用水清洗了卡皮拉的乳房。 坐在她的後腳旁邊，她用拇指和其他手指輕柔地按下乳房開始擠奶。
阿助看到牛奶從乳房注入並且慢慢地填滿整個桶子。桶子表面有許多的牛奶泡沫。 這些牛奶泡沫讓阿助覺得很驚奇也很有趣。
“奶奶，”阿助興奮地說，“你看那表面形成許多泡泡！”“是的，阿助” 看著他興奮的樣子奶奶笑著說。 “當我拉動乳房時，牛奶就會噴出來撞擊桶子表面的牛奶，並且跟空氣混合形成氣泡。 這就是讓新鮮牛奶的味道與瓶裝牛奶不同的地方喔！”
“哇！我不知道！” 阿助說。奶奶在廚房裡煮了新鮮的泡沫牛奶，並為阿助倒了一杯。味道很好，所以阿助他很快就把一杯喝完了。
“奶奶，當我回到城市，我會告訴我所有的朋友牛奶怎麼來的！”阿助說。“我會告訴他們，在我奶奶家裡的新鮮牛奶有多好喝。”奶奶高興地笑了起來，“是啊，我的小阿助” 她說，“然後每個人都知道誰是班上最聰明的男孩！”
eng:
Raju
lived in the city. But in the summer, when school was out, Raju headed straight
for his Ajja’s house in the village.

Every
summer, he learnt something new at Ajja’s house. This time, he was to learn
that in the village,

milk does not come out of plastic sachets!

The
evening he arrived, Ajji took him to the cowshed behind the house. 
Four
gentle brown cows were munching on the hay Ajji had collected for them.

A
couple of frisky young calves jumped around playfully. Raju enjoyed watching
them.
He
thought they were very sweet.

“Raju,
remember the glass of milk you just had? This is the cow that the milk came
from!”
said
Ajji. “The milk I drank came from a cow?” asked Raju, very surprised.
“You
mean you just milked her and there was my glass of milk, ready to drink?”

“Yes,
Raju,” smiled Ajji. “Come and meet my cows.
This
is Kaveri, whose milk you just drank, this is Kapila, this one is Ganga, and
there at the far corner is Gowri.”
Raju
stood where he was, looking at the cows doubtfully. “Come, Raju,” coaxed Ajji.
“Come and touch them.
They
won’t hurt you.”

As
Raju moved among them, the calves moved closer to their mothers and mooed,
wondering if they could trust this stranger. Their mothers licked them, letting
them know Raju was a friend.

Raju
picked up courage and reached up to touch Gowri’s neck. It felt all soft and
wrinkly, somewhat like Ajji’s neck. Gowri mooed at Raju’s touch, wanting to be
friends.

“Do
you know how milk comes out of the cow, Raju?” asked Ajji.
“No, Ajji,” said Raju, feeling a little silly. “All I know is that in the city, our milk comes to our door in plastic sachets.”

“Come,
let me show you,” said Ajji.
Taking
him by the hand, she led him to Kapila. Kapila’s calf was close by.

Ajji first allowed the calf to suckle, and

drink as much milk as she needed. 



















Then
she washed Kapila’s udders with water and cleaned them. Sitting on her
haunches, she began to milk the cow, pressing the udders gently between finger
and thumb.

As
Raju watched, milk spurted from the udders into the vessel below. The vessel
began to fill up slowly and the milk began to turn frothy at the top. Raju was
surprised and pleased to see the frothy milk.

“Ajji,”
he said excitedly, “see how the bubbles are forming at the top!”

“Yes, Raju,” said Ajji, smiling at his excitement. “When I pull on the udders, powerful jets of milk come out. They hit the surface of the milk in the vessel with great force, mixing with the air and forming bubbles. That is what makes fresh milk taste so different from milk that comes out of a packet!”
“Wow! I had no idea!” said Raju.Ajji boiled the fresh frothy milk in the kitchen, and poured out a glass for Raju. It tasted so good that Raju finished it in a few quick gulps.

“Ajji,
when I go back to the city, I shall tell all my friends where milk comes from,”
said Raju.
“I
shall tell them how good fresh milk tastes at my Ajji's house.”



















Ajji
laughed happily. “Do that, my little Raju,” she said. “Then everyone will know
who is the cleverest boy in the class !”

zho: 我们刚刚把冬季学校的校服拿了出来。其实现在还没有这么冷。在梵语里，冬天被称作"Shishira Ritu"。我在冬天特别喜欢吃热腾腾的东西。
Amma 昨天带我们去了花生节派对。在班加罗尔(印度的一个大城市)的公牛寺附近的公路两旁，有堆得像小山一样的花生。各种花生口味，应有尽有。有晒干的花生，煮沸的花生，盐津的花生，还有烤花生。
Amma说，在古吉拉特邦(印度的一个城市)，人们在冬天还会欢度一个叫做Ponkh的节日。农民伯伯们会在煤炉上烤着小米。每个人都会吃着新鲜、绿色、丰满且非常嫩的小米粒，这种小米粒在印度语里面叫做Ponhk
我在派对上穿了一件亮蓝色的毛衣。 沿途有很多摊位。 Manu想要去坐旋转木马，我想给奶奶买一个温暖且柔软的披肩。
天气慢慢转冷了。我一路擦这首走到学校。 我的新红色手镯一直发出很好的声音！ "哦，多好啊"，我大声说。当我说话的时候，我可以看到在我嘴边慢慢升起一片冰冷的云朵。
我的朋友Rajni住在西姆拉(印度的一个城市)。 在她祖父的村子里，人们会把雪包放在竹篮里，然后在屋顶上形成锥形雪堆。 之后孩子们去带上所有长者的祝福。 Rajni还告诉我有关雪人比赛的事情。
在斯利那加(印度的又一个城市)，当下第一场雪的时候，那里的人会说“Nausheen Mubaraq！” 他们会将一些雪花包裹在一张纸上，并送给朋友。 然后那个朋友会为你慷慨捐款！
我特别喜欢在雪地里玩耍，并且还会有一个naan和rogan josh一起享受这个雪地里的狂欢。 Rajni说树木们被雪覆盖的时候，看起来非常可爱。
每个人都喜欢喝热茶，而Rajni却喜欢跟Jaggery一起喝牛奶。 她们说，因为外面实在太冷，她们没有办法不戴外套、帽子、手套和消声器出门，但是一起玩扔雪球打雪仗是冬季里非常有趣的一项游戏。
我真的希望，在下一个寒假，我可以去西姆拉或是斋沙默尔。 在斋沙默尔，那里没有雪，只有沙子。我想去看沙漠展览会，骑骆驼，看民间舞蹈和木偶戏，还想去参加绑头巾比赛！
不久我们将会庆祝Sankranti(印度教的一个节日，在一月份发生)。 Janu说她的家人会在那一天做tilgud (一种印度糕点)。 Rohan说他的家人会在那一天做yellu(另一种印度糕点)。 Narsi说他会在那时候吃chigdi(一种用咖喱做的印度菜肴)。
你知道吗，所有这些甜点都是用芝麻和石蜜做的！ 他们一定是在冬天吃对我们的健康有好处。我喜欢冬天。因为我喜欢在冬天当朋友拥抱我的感觉。我喜欢在奶奶旁边的椅子上偎依着她，跟她一起看书。
而我的大树永远不会被雪覆盖。瞧，它完全没有树叶。
但是，我其实希望它快快长满叶子，长出芒果，这样就会吸引很多鸟、松鼠和鹦鹉。到时候一定会很欢乐。
eng: We have just taken out our winter uniforms for school. It is not so cold yet. Winter is called Shishira Ritu in Sanskrit. I love to eat hot things in this season.
Amma took us to the Groundnut Fair yesterday. There were big hills of groundnuts on both sides of the road near the Bull Temple in Bengaluru. Dry nuts, boiled and salted nuts, roasted nuts!

Amma says people in Gujarat have a Ponkh 
festival in winter. Farmers roast bundles of millet on coal stoves. 
Everyone eats the fresh, green, plump and tender beads of millet grains 
called ponkh.
I wore a bright blue sweater to the fair. There were many stalls all along the road. Manu wanted to go on the merry-go-round. I wanted to buy grandma a warm, soft shawl.
It is so cold now. I rub my hands together as I walk to school. My new red bangles make a pretty sound! Oh, how nice, I say aloud and I can see a frosty cloud in front of my mouth as I talk!

My friend Rajni lives in Shimla. In her grandfather’s village, they pack snow into bamboo baskets to make cone shaped snow heaps on roof tops. Then the children go to take the blessings of all the elders. Rajni also told me about the Snowman Competition.
In Srinagar, they say “Nausheen Mubaraq!” when the first snow falls. They wrap some snowflakes in a sheet of paper and send it to a friend. The friend has to throw a feast for you after that!
I would love to play in the snow and have a feast of naan and rogan josh too. Rajni says that the trees look lovely when they are covered with snow.

Everybody likes to drink hot tea and she likes to drink milk with jaggery. They can't go out without their jackets, caps, gloves and mufflers, but it is fun to throw snowballs at each other, she says!

During the next winter holidays I hope I can go to Shimla or to Jaisalmer. In Jaisalmer, there is no snow, only sand.I would like to go to the Desert Fair and ride on camels, watch folk dances and puppet shows, and take part in the turban tying contest!
Soon we will be celebrating Sankranti. Janu says her family makes tilgud. Rohan says his family makes yellu. Narsi says he has chigdi during the Sankranti season.

Do you know, all these are made with sesame seeds and jaggery! They must be good for our health in the winter.I like winter. I like it when my friends hug me. I like to snuggle in the chair next to Granny and read a book.
My tree will never be covered with snow.
But I want it to be full of birds and mangoes and squirrels and parrots very soon.

zho: 在這間屋子裏，住了一隻小老鼠。有一天，小老鼠爬上書桌探險。 「咦，這東西看起來很好吃！」
突然一把聲音叫起來：「哎呀！誰在咬我，好痛！」

「你是誰？」小老鼠問。        「我是一隻鼠。」聲音回答說。  
「但我才是鼠呢。」                        「我也是一隻鼠！」
小老鼠哈哈大笑：「你這是什麼老鼠？你有什麼本事？」
小老鼠跑到廚房，帶回一塊蛋糕。 「看！這是老鼠能做的事情。真的鼠能吃東西，你不能。」

「小老鼠，睜大眼睛看好吧。」 
聲音說完以後，電腦上出現了一個大蛋糕。

小老鼠不服氣：


「真老鼠能做的事，你都做不了。」

牠從書桌上拿起一支鉛筆，起勁啃起來。

 「看看這支鉛筆，這才是真正的老鼠能做的事情！」

滑鼠也不示弱，找來一幅有幾條大樹幹的畫：















「看，這樣更厲害吧？」
老鼠手舞足蹈，說：「跳舞你不會吧？」

突然，屋裏住的貓咪出現，張牙舞爪。

















老鼠大叫 ：「糟糕了！救命啊！」

「怎麼辦？  怎麼辦？

」老鼠一邊大叫，一邊逃跑。

滑鼠十分機靈，立即找來一段影片，只見一隻狗在兇惡地吠叫：「汪！汪！汪！」


貓咪嚇得跑掉了。

小老鼠給滑鼠一個擁抱。















「謝謝你救了我！你跟我都是好鼠，我們是朋友。」
eng: One day, a little mouse climbed onto the table to explore. "Oooh, yum! This looks tasty."
"Oww! Owww! Who’s hurting me?" cried a voice.
"Who are you?" asked the mouse."I’m a mouse," was the response. "But I'm a mouse.""I’m a mouse too."
The first mouse laughed. "Haha! What kind of a mouse are you?What can you do?"
The mouse ran to the kitchen and brought back some cake. "Look! This is what a mouse can do.A real mouse can eat cake. YOU can't."
"Little mouse, watch and learn," responded the other mouse. She pulled up a picture of cake on the computer screen.
The first mouse was unconvinced. "You can’t do what a real mouse can do."
He picked up a pencil from the desk and chewed at it. "Look at what I did to this pencil - this is what a real mouse can do!"
The other mouse pulled up a picture of some logs onto the screen. "I can do more than that. Look!"
"Well, can you dance like me?" asked the first mouse.
Suddenly, the house cat appeared, hissing. "OH NO!Help!" cried the first mouse.
"What do I do? What do I do?" the first mouse cried, running away.
The other mouse acted quickly, bringing up a video of a barking dog on the screen to scare the cat away. "BOW! BOW! BOW!"

The first mouse gave the other mouse a hug. 

"Thank you! You saved my life. You’re a good mouse, just like me."

zho: 小猫，回来！我们一起玩儿。
坐在你的篮子里。呆在这儿！
小猫，回来！太高了。
小猫，回来！别出去。
小猫，回来！这不是你的。
小猫，回来！你找到什么了吗?
小猫，回来！它不是你的朋友！
小猫，你好！你回来了吗？
你坐在你的篮子里。午睡时间到了。
小猫？
eng: Come back, cat! Play with me.
Sit in your basket. Stay right here!
Come back, cat! That’s way too high.
Come back, cat! Don’t go outside.
Come back, cat! That’s not yours.
Come back, cat. What have you got?
Come back, cat.  That’s not your friend!
Hello, cat! Are you back?
Stay in your basket. It’s nap time now.
Cat?

"This is the story of the giant
Bey-asura, the asura who loved to sing," says Apu, beginning his
story.

Dida and Pia move closer to Apu to listen.

"Bey-asura LOVED to sing, but
his fellow asuras HATED his voice," says Apu. "So they sent him
away to the top of the mountain, where no one could hear him sing."

Apu climbs up on Dida’s big
bed, pretending it is a tall mountain. In his scariest asura voice,
Apu as Bey-asura begins to sing."'Saaaaaaa…' Bey-asura
began, warming up.

'Rayyyyyyyyy….' he sang
louder. 


The sun’s rays dimmed a little
in alarm. 


'Gaaaaaa….' he yelled even
louder. 


Bey-asura was feeling happy now.
So he decided to do some Kathak dance."

" 'Dha-dhin-dhin-dha,'
Bey-asura kept time, stamped his feet and twirled.

Feeling more and more happy, he
sang along, 'Maaaaaa… Paaaaa….' 


The mountain, which had been
sleeping in peace, woke up, all frightened. The asura’s singing and dancing made the mountain tremble.


KABOOM! Fell the rocks. 

DHADAAAAM! The rocks shook the
Earth."

"Do you know what happened when
the rocks fell?" Apu asks his audience.

Dida shakes her head, with a
naughty smile. 





"I will tell you what
happened," Apu says. "The earth shook! As the mountain trembled,
everything started moving. Even Bey-asura, a gigantic giant, swayed
from side to side!"




"The earth swung this way…"
says Apu, rolling on the floor. "Then it swung the other way."
Apu rolls some more.

Just then, the earth actually
starts to move!  

The bed shakes just like the
mountain in Bey-asura’s story.

 "Apu, stop singing!" yells
Pia. "You are frightening the mountain."

"It’s not me," says Apu.
"The whole room is shaking."

Dida, Apu and Pia fall silent.
Even Bholu doesn’t bark.  Then, there is another bigger
jolt.  

"The floor is shaking!" yells
Apu. 


"It’s all Bey-asura’s
fault!" cries Pia. 


"No, no," says Dida, calmly.
"It is an earthquake."

"There’s no time to run
outside. Quick, go under the bed," says Dida.  

They all sit under Dida’s tall
bed and hold on to its legs.

But the earth continues to shake.

TUMBLE! The dolls on the shelf
shake and fall.

SPLASH SPLASH! The water in the
jug starts splashing around.

"Whoooa!" Apu yells as he
feels the floor shake. "Aaaaoooo!" whimpers Bholu. 


Apu’s stomach feels like
Bey-asura is stomping inside it.

Finally, the shaking stops. Dida
waits for two minutes to see if it starts again. But now the earth is
firm. It has stopped quaking!

 They all crawl out from under
the bed. "We can go outside now," says
Dida.

"Shouldn’t we have run out?" asks Apu."Only if you are near an exit," says Dida. "If you are upstairs and in a strong building, you should go under the bed or a sturdy table and hold on so it does not move away from you. If there is nothing, go to a corner of the room and stay away from windows, doors and anything that can fall like light bulbs and fans."

Apu, Dida, Pia, and Bholu go out
of their house.  

Some of the flower pots have
fallen and are smashed.

A crack has appeared on the
outside wall of their house.

People are standing on the road,
talking to each other. Is it safe to go back indoors?

Apu picks up a fallen plant. He puts his hand on the earth.  

"Bey-asura will sing softly
next time," he promises the earth.

Did Bey-asura really make the earth shake with his singing?No, earthquakes have been occurring ever since the earth was formed, even when it was a really young planet.The top layer of the earth, the one that we can see, is called the crust. Underneath it is another layer called the mantle. Then there is the inner and outer core. The crust is made up of tectonic plates that glide over the mantle, and move very slowly and rub against each other.Sometimes, the plates get caught against each other. Then the plates are not able to slide as they usually do and tension builds up. When the plates suddenly move away, energy waves are released. This makes the earth quake as the waves travel through the ground. And that’s how an earthquake happens!The spot where the plates move apart is called the focus. The place on the earth right above the focus is called the epicenter.

Layers of the Earth The layers mentioned here are shown in the picture on the left. 1. Crust2. Mantle 3. CoreEarthquakes are measured on a scale called the Richter Scale that ranges from 1-3 (small, very less damage), 4-6 (moderate), 7-10 (very severe). The instrument that measures earthquakes is called a seismograph (shown as 4 in the picture).

Where in India and the world can earthquakes happen?The tectonic plates run under the surface of the earth throughout the globe and have been mapped by scientists. In India, the most earthquake-prone areas are Kashmir, the middle and central Himalayas, the north-eastern states, parts of Bihar and the Rann of Kutch. Places like Delhi, Jammu and Kashmir, Maharashtra, Andaman and Nicobar Islands also get earthquakes often. More earthquakes happen here because the Indian land mass is moving and pushing against Asia.Places where earthquakes strike often are called high seismic zones  (shown on pg 21). Some other places around the world that have seen devastating earthquakes are Japan, Indonesia, Italy, Turkey, Chile, Alaska and California in the United States.

What to do if you are in an
earthquake1. Don’t
	panic.2. If
	you are indoors and in a high rise building or a building that is
	strong, drop to the ground and take cover under a bed or a sturdy
	table, and hold on. Stay away from objects that can break away from
	the walls and fall on you. Do not go near a door unless it is very
	strong.3. If
	you are near an exit or in an old, unsteady building, move out
	quickly and calmly.4. If
	you are outside during the earthquake, find an open spot away from
	buildings, streetlights and walls, and stay there.5. If
	you are on a steep hillside, move away from the side of the hill in
	case of landslides and falling rocks.
zho: “这是一个关于阿修罗王的故事。他是一位爱唱歌的巨人。” 阿咘开始说起故事。娣达和皮亚靠近阿咘，聆听着他说的故事。“阿修罗王非常喜欢唱歌，但是其他的阿修罗却非常讨厌他的声音。”阿咘说。“因此，他们把阿修罗王送到山顶上。在那里，不会有人听到他的歌声。”
阿咘爬上娣达的大床，假装那张床是一座高山。他以最恐怖的声音来模仿阿修罗王唱歌。“‘沙……’阿修罗王正在开嗓。 ‘嘞……’他唱得更大声了。阳光突然变得暗淡，仿佛被他的歌声震撼了。 ‘嘎……’他大声地喊道。此刻，阿修罗王感到非常高兴，便跳起了卡塔克舞。”
“‘达-丁-丁-达……’阿修罗王跟着音乐的节拍，做出踏地和旋转的动作。他感到越来越高兴，便跟着音乐唱了起来：‘嘛……啪……’原本睡得安稳的山被吓醒了。阿修罗王的歌舞把那一座山吓坏了，它不停地颤抖。哐啷！岩石跌落了！嘎吱！岩石撞击地球，使地球震动了！”
“你知道岩石落下时，发生了什么事吗？”阿咘向他的听众提问。娣达摇摇头，调皮地笑了。“让我告诉你发生了什么事。”阿咘说。“地球震动了！随着山的移动，所有的东西都开始晃动了。就连阿修罗王，那庞大的巨人，也在左右晃动着！”“地球是这么晃动的。”阿咘一边说，一边在地板上翻滚。“然后，地球又往另一个方向晃动。”阿咘继续翻滚。
就在这时，地球竟然真的开始晃动了！迪达的床就像阿修罗王故事里的山一样，不停地摇晃着。“阿咘，不要再唱了！”皮亚大声喊道。“你吓到这座山了。”“并不是我。”阿咘说。“整个房间都在摇晃着。”
娣达、阿咘和皮亚瞬间变得安静。甚至连布卢也不吠了。接着，突然有一阵更强烈的震动。“地板正在晃动！”阿咘大声喊道。“都是阿修罗王的错！”皮亚哭喊着。“不是的，不是的。”娣达平静地说。“这是地震。”
“我们已经没有时间往外逃了。快，躲到床底下。”娣达说。他们都躲到娣达的床下，并且抱着那高高的床脚。不过，地面还是持续地晃动着。
扑通！架子上的洋娃娃开始摇晃，然后从架子上掉落。哗哗！水壶里的水开始四处飞溅。“哇！”阿咘感受到地板晃动时，大声喊道。“呜呜！”布卢小声哽泣。阿咘的肚子感到不舒服，就像是阿修罗王在他的肚子里用力地踩着。
终于，所有的晃动都停止了。娣达等待了两分钟，看看晃动会不会重来一次。不过，现在的地面已经平稳了。它已经停止晃动了！他们从床底下爬出来。“我们可以出去了。”娣达说。
“我们刚刚不是应该往外跑吗？”阿咘问道。“如果我们当时离出口处非常近，我们就应该往外跑。”娣达说。“如果你在一栋坚固的高楼里，你应该躲到床底下或是坚固的桌子底下，并且抱着它的脚，不离开它。如果你的四周并没有任何东西，那就躲到房间的一个角落。要远离窗户、门以及任何可能掉落的东西，例如：灯泡和风扇。”
阿咘、娣达、皮亚和布卢走出家门。有一些掉落的花盆已经碎了。房屋的外墙上也出现了一道裂痕。许多人站在马路上交谈着。如果现在回到室内，安全吗？
阿咘捡起一盆掉落的盆栽。他把手放在地面上。“下次，阿修罗王会轻声地唱。”他向大地承诺。

阿修罗王的歌声真的使大地震动了吗？不是的，当地球还是一颗很年轻的星球时，地震就不断地发生了。地球的外层叫做地壳，它就是我们可以看见的地面。地壳的下一层是地幔。接着就是外核和内核。地壳是由板块构建而成，而这些板块在地幔上慢慢地移动，产生了摩擦。有时候，板块卡着了。被困着的板块承受着压力。当板块突然移动时，能量就会释放出来。当这些能量贯穿地面时，地震就发生了。这就是地震的起因！板块突然移动的位置称之为震源。震源向上垂直投影的地表位置称之为震央。
地球的构造此处提及的构造如左图所示。1. 地壳2. 地幔3. 核心地震的规模是以里氏震级来测量。震级范围包括1-3级（损坏力相当小），4-6级（中等），7-10级（非常严重）。 测量震级的仪器称之为地震仪（图中显示为4）。

印度的哪些区域会发生地震呢？世界的哪些地方会发生地震呢？科学家已经绘制了一张地图，列出了地壳下板块遍布的位置。在印度，会密集发生地震的地方是克什米尔、喜马拉雅中部地区、东北部的政区、比哈尔邦的部分地区和卡奇沼泽地区。另外，德里、查谟和克什米尔、马哈拉施特拉邦、安达曼和尼科巴群岛也会经常发生地震。这里经常发生地震的原因是因为印度的土地正在往亚洲的方向移动。地震经常发生的地方称之为地震高风险区（如第21页所示）。其他同样遭受强烈地震袭击的国家还包括了日本、印度尼西亚、意大利、土耳其、智利、美国的阿拉斯加州和加利福尼亚州。

如果发生地震了，该怎么办？1. 不要惊慌。2. 如果你在高楼里，或是在坚固的建筑物里，请贴近地面，然后躲在床底下或是坚固的桌子底下，并且抱着床脚或桌脚。远离任何可能会从墙壁上掉落到你身上的物品。千万不要靠近门，除非那是一扇非常牢固的门。3. 如果你离出口处非常近，或是在老旧又不坚固的建筑物里，请迅速并冷静地离开。4. 如果发生地震的时候，你正在户外，请待在一个远离建筑物、路灯和墙壁的辽阔场地。5. 如果你正走在陡峭的山坡上，请远离山腰，以避开山崩和掉落的岩石。
母鸡妈妈坐在她的蛋上。她等啊等，等着鸡蛋孵出小鸡。
山羊妈妈路过。她问母鸡妈妈“你要和我一块儿去市集么？““我正忙着孵蛋呢“母鸡妈妈答到。
一，二，三，四，五，六。六个圆圆的鸡蛋！
猪妈妈路过。她问，“你想和我去市集吗？““我正忙着孵蛋呢”母鸡妈妈回答到。
一，二，三，四，五，六。六个圆圆的鸡蛋！
奶牛妈妈路过。“你要和我一块儿去市集么？“她问母鸡妈妈。
“我正忙着孵蛋呢“ 母鸡妈妈回答到。
母鸡妈妈等啊等，疑惑着，“什么时候才能看到我的小鸡宝宝啊？“
母鸡妈妈突然感觉有什么东西。发生了什么？
一，二，三，四，五，六。破壳！破壳！破壳！破壳！破壳！破壳！
六只小鸡宝宝出生了。
母鸡妈妈和她的可爱的小鸡们开心地在一起。
然后她想起来，今天是赶集日！山羊妈妈，猪妈妈和奶牛妈妈都已经出发了。母鸡妈妈现在准备好了。她要带着她的小鸡们一起去市集。一，二，三，四，五，六！
母鸡妈妈和她的六只小鸡在市集上渡过了美妙的时光。太好玩了！她的小鸡们没有让她白等。
eng: Mother Hen sits on her eggs.She waits and waits for her eggs to hatch.
Mother Goat passes by.“Will you go to the fair with me?” she asks Mother Hen.“I'm busy with my eggs,” Mother Hen answers.
One, two, three, four, five, six. Six round eggs!
Mother Pig passes by.  “Will you go to the fair with me?” she asks.“I'm busy with my eggs,” answers Mother Hen.
One, two, three, four, five, six. Six round eggs!
Mother Cow passes by. “Will you go to the fair with me?” she asks Mother Hen.
“I'm busy with my eggs,” answers Mother Hen.
Mother Hen waits and waits. “When will I see my chicks?” she wonders.
Mother Hen feels something. What's happening?

One, two, three, four, five, six. Crack! Crack!

Crack! Crack!



Crack! Crack!
Six chicks have hatched.
Mother Hen is happy with her lovely chicks.
Then she remembers. There is a fair today!Mother Goat, Mother Pig and Mother Cow have already left. Mother Hen is ready now. She will take her chicks to the fair.One, two, three, four, five, six!
Mother Hen and her six chicks have a fantastic time at the fair.What fun! Her chicks were worth the wait.

Do you run when you see a cockroach?Or scream when you see a bee?Look closely instead.
Insects are amazing.They help scientists make machines.
Grasshopper Robots are tiny.But they leap very high.Just like real grasshoppers.One day, they may explore places that no one has ever been.
RoachBots run around and squeeze through tiny cracks. Just like real cockroaches.One day, they could help find people who are lost or trapped.
RoboBees can fly and perch on plants. Just like real bees. One day, RoboBees might travel to Mars in a spaceship, collect mud and gas and bring it back to us.
Water Strider Microbots can walk on water. Just like real water striders. One day, they could clean our lakes and oceans.
The next time something crawls or buzzes around, look carefully. It might be a RoachBot or a RoboBee. You never know.

A bot is a computer program or little machine that can performsimple, repetitive tasks.

zho: 呃——真恶心啊！
你是否一见蟑螂会撒腿就跑？你是否一见蜜蜂会尖声大叫？请你再仔细地瞧一瞧。
昆虫其实很奇妙。它们帮助科学家发明机器人、创新创造。
蝗虫机器人 (Grasshopper Robots)体型虽小，却跳得高，和真的蝗虫难分高下。总有一天，它们会跃过山川，去探秘人迹罕至的地方。
蟑螂机器人 (RoachBots) 到处晃荡，还钻进狭长的裂缝里。总有一天，它们会在搜寻失踪或被困人员时派上用场。
蜜蜂机器人 (RoboBees) 不仅能飞、还能稳稳当当地停在植株上，一点儿也不比真的蜜蜂逊色。总有一天，蜜蜂机器人会跟随宇宙飞船前往火星，采集一些火星上的土壤和空气样本，并带回地球。
迷你水黾机器人 (Water Strider Microbots; 水黾 shuǐ mǐn)能在水面上行走自如，就像真的水黾一样。总有一天，它们会帮助我们把湖泊和海洋清理干净。
下一次，如果你察觉有什么东西在身边爬、或者是嗡嗡叫，请仔细地瞧一瞧。那或许会是一只蟑螂机器人或蜜蜂机器人。谁又能料想到呢？！
微型机器人是一种能够执行简单、重复的命令或任务的自动运行程序或机械装置。﻿         蟑螂机器人                                                                         蝗虫机器人
蜜蜂机器人     迷你水黾机器人

zho: 大海里有一群神奇的鱼儿游来游去。尽管它们看起来和普通的鱼儿没什么两样，但是，它们是由金属、泡沫、硅胶、塑料等材料构成的。
哔——哔
金枪鱼机器人和真的金枪鱼一样，游得又快、又远。它还是海底世界的巡逻警察，能追捕走私者和海盗。
沙沙——        沙沙——沙沙——
SoFi 机器鱼是身体柔软的机器人，它和真的鱼一样有鱼鳍和尾巴。它在深海里拍摄，记录深海动物的一举一动。深海里的鱼儿并不害怕它，常和它一起玩耍。
水母机器人由凝胶制造。它用柔软的、透明的触须抓小鱼。它能隐形，悄无声息地四处游荡。
鳗鱼机器人的身体又黑又长，长着一双红眼睛。将来，它或许能蛰居海底，修复破损的海底管道和机器设备。
章鱼机器人看起来就像一只小章鱼。将来，它或许能搜救遭遇船难的乘客。它或许还能杀死海洋里有害的微生物。
终有一日，这些神奇的机器鱼会游得更远、更深。它们将为我们揭示更多深海里的秘密。

咚咚！妈妈把门打开。 “拉古舅舅！” 阿米希和索尼叫道，还给他送上一个大大的拥抱。
拉古舅舅是妈妈唯一的弟弟。他会说最好听的故事，也常常把最棒的礼物送给他们。但是，拉古舅舅有一个毛病。
拉古舅舅非常懒惰。他可以连续几个小时都坐在椅子上。有时，他坐着阅读。有时，他坐着看电视节目。有时，他只是坐着睡觉。他不做任何家务，也不去市场买生活用品。妈妈再也无法忍受他的懒散了。
“拉古，怎么样?”妈妈问道。“你是打算一如既往地坐在你最心爱的椅子上度过这个假期吗？”“噢，不是这样的！”拉古舅舅说。“这次，我将会去探索水下洞穴，登上高耸的山峰，还会在丛林里追逐老虎。” “哪里，哪里？” 阿米希和索尼惊呼。 “我们也要去！” “啊！开什么玩笑！”妈妈并不相信。拉古舅舅露出了神秘的笑容。
隔天，阿米希和索尼无意中听到拉古舅舅在他的房间里和别人说话。“哇！” 舅舅惊叹。 接着，“这也太神奇了吧！”再过了一会儿，“啊，不好了！”两个孩子冲进了他的房间。“怎么了，拉古舅舅？”
只见拉古舅舅戴着一副黑色的大眼镜坐在他最心爱的椅子上。他的四周并没有其他人！阿米希和索尼好奇地看着彼此。 “没事吧，舅舅？”阿米希问道。阿米希目不转睛地看那副黑眼镜。它几乎遮挡了舅舅的整张脸。 拉古放声大笑，然后摘下了那副眼镜。“过来试试吧！”他对索尼说。“这是什么？”索尼问道。那副眼镜实在太重了，她必须用双手握着。
拉古舅舅小心翼翼地帮索尼戴上那副眼镜。不过，眼镜太黑了，她一开始什么都看不见。随后，拉古舅舅按下一个按钮。突然，索尼就在大海里了！她的四周全是五颜六色的鱼儿。 她望向左边，看见一只大乌龟在她身旁游着。那只乌龟如此靠近，索尼还以为自己可以触碰到它。 然后，她望向另一边...“啊！”她吓哭了，因为她看见一只大鲨鱼就在她的身旁。
“让我看看，让我看看！” 阿米希说。他试图帮已经饱受惊吓的索尼取下眼镜。 “下一个就到你啦，阿米希。”拉古舅舅说。“我为你准备了一场最适合你的冒险。”阿米希戴上眼镜后，舅舅按下另一个按钮。 “哦，我看见一群花鹿！还有一群叶猴！” 阿米希在一片丛林里。他可以听到各种鸟叫声。当他抬起头的时候，他看见一群野雁排成V字型，在空中飞翔。

“这感觉太真实了。”索尼说。“戴着眼镜时，我好像真的在水里游泳一样！” “是的。”拉古舅舅说。“所以人们把它称之为‘虚拟实境’。”索尼感到相当困惑。“‘虚拟’的意思不就是‘不真实’吗？”她问道。“‘实境’怎么可能是不真实的呢？”“那是一道好问题。”拉古舅舅说。“我们把它称之为虚拟实境是因为它让你觉得你眼前看到的一切仿佛都是真的。它是如此逼真。”“救命啊！” 阿米希哭道。“有一只老虎要把我吃了！”拉古舅舅笑了。“不用担心，你很安全！”他告诉阿米希。 “这好像在看电影一样，但是却比看电影更棒。”索尼兴奋地说。 “是的。”舅舅说。“当我们在电影院观看电影时，萤幕只是把画面呈现在我们的前方。但是一旦戴上了虚拟实境的眼镜后，我们会觉得画面已经延申到我们的四周了。”
“那么，你们想不想在暑假期间和我一起探索虚拟实境呢？”拉古舅舅问道。阿米希摘下眼镜，然后思考了一阵子。“我想我还是比较喜欢真实的实境。”他说。 “为什么呢？”拉古舅舅惊讶地问道。 “我在森林里看到一颗多汁的芒果。”阿米希说。“我现在好想要吃一颗。可是，我在虚拟实境里无法真的吃到。”“我也要一颗！”索尼说。两个孩子往厨房奔去。“等等我啊！”拉古舅舅说。他终于离开了他心爱的椅子，紧追在他们的后面。

虚拟实境简介1。 “虚拟实境”一词在1983年，首次出现于达米安·布劳德瑞克的科幻小说 《猶大曼陀羅》。2。 虚拟实境利用先进的电脑科技，透过眼镜里的小屏幕，创造出一个像现实世界的三度空间。3。 虚拟实境的眼镜里附有能够检测你的眼睛动态的感应器。举个例子，当你往上看的时候，眼镜就会呈现出你在现实世界里往上看的画面。 因此，如果你和阿米希一样处在一片丛林里，当你往上看的时候，小屏幕就会呈现出天空的画面，而不是树林的画面。
4。 人们不仅仅使用虚拟实境来玩游戏或是探索新的世界。它也可以训练人们完成困难的任务。消防员可以使用虚拟实境来练习如何把人从火海里救出。航空员则可以事先体验外太空的生活以及探索新的世界。这样，我们不用踏入太空船就可以体验行走在火星上的感觉了！ 5。 儿童可以使用虚拟实境的眼镜吗？大多数的科学家都认为戴上虚拟实境的眼镜就像是看着手机的小屏幕，因此我们要留意使用的时长和频密度。
eng: Knock, knock!Amma opened the door.“Raghu Mama!” Amish and Soni cried. They gave him a big hug.
Raghu Mama always told the best stories. He brought Amish and Soni fun presents.But there was one problem with Raghu Mama.

Raghu Mama was lazy! He would sit in his chair for hours and hours and hours, reading or watching TV. Or just sleeping.He would not do any work around the house. He would not go to the market to buy food.Amma was fed up of his laziness.

“So, Raghu,” said Amma. “Are you going to sit in your favourite chair all the time?”"Oh no!" said Raghu Mama. "I'm going to explore caves that are underwater. I'm going to climb tall mountains. I'm going to chase tigers in the jungle!"“Where, where?” said Amish and Soni. “We want to come too!” “Hah!” said Amma. “What a joke!” Raghu Mama smiled quietly.
The next day Amish and Soni heard Raghu Mama talking to someone. “Wow!” he said. Then, “That’s AMAZING!”A little later, “OH NO!” The children ran into his room.“What happened, Raghu Mama?”

Raghu Mama was in his favourite chair. He was wearing a pair of big black goggles. There was no one else in the room! Soni and Amish looked at each other. “Is everything okay, Mama?” Amish asked.Mama laughed. He took off the goggles. “Try this,” he said to Soni. “What is it?” asked Soni. The goggles were  heavy.  She had to hold them with both hands.

Raghu Mama  put the goggles on Soni’s face. The goggles were dark and she couldn’t see anything. Then Mama pressed a button.Suddenly Soni was in the ocean! There were colourful fish all around. There was a big turtle swimming beside her. "WOW!" said Soni.Then she turned her face to the other side . . . “Eek!” she cried as a big shark swam very close to her.

“Let me see, let me see!” said Amish.“It is your turn now, Amish,” said Raghu Mama.  Amish put the goggles on. Mama pressed a button. Amish was in a forest full of trees. He could hear different bird sounds. “Ooh!" he said, "I can see chital! I can see langurs!”

“It feels so real,” said Soni. “When I wore the goggles I thought I was swimming underwater!” “Yes,” said Raghu Mama. “It is called ‘Virtual Reality’.” “But ‘virtual’ means ‘not real’.” Soni said.  “You're right,” said Raghu Mama. “It is Virtual Reality. You thought you were in the ocean, right? It was almost real.” “It is like watching a movie,” said Soni. “Yes,” said Mama. “When we wear Virtual Reality goggles, it feels like the movie is all around us.”

"Do you want to explore Virtual Reality with me?" asked Raghu Mama.Amish and Soni thought for a bit. “We like the REAL thing,” they said. “But why??” Raghu Mama asked. “I saw a juicy mango in the jungle,” said Amish. “And now I want to eat one. I can’t eat the mango in the jungle. I can eat the mango in the kitchen.” “I want one too!” said Soni. Both of them ran to the kitchen. “Wait for me!” said Raghu Mama. He jumped off his chair and ran after them.

zho: 安娜感到非常兴奋，因为她将从家乡果阿搬到孟买去。但是她也感到非常伤心要离开她的舅舅，奶奶，朋友，还有最重要的是。。。满豆。
满豆是一只非常严肃的狗狗，平常一整天都在安静地睡觉。但是，当小区内有人举办婚礼的时候，它便会凄惨地吼叫着，直到安娜的舅舅停止演奏小提琴。安娜爱满豆。她知道它会保护她，远离陌生人和危险。当然还有舅舅吵闹的小提琴声音！
孟买是一个喧嚣的城市。 安娜想念鸟叫声，教堂的钟声还有乡村的音乐。她唯一不想念的就是舅舅的小提琴声。有时放学之后，安娜会和父亲一起去送信和包裹。
安娜会迫不及待地搭上电梯。有一天，她偷偷地按下了所有的按钮。电梯在每一层都打开了！每一层的墙壁上都有一个红色的扬声器盒子。而且每一层都有一个看起来非常奇怪的花洒头在天花板上。“是谁会想在这个地方洗澡呢？”她好奇。
安娜试图把事情搞清楚。这个红色的扬声器盒子从来没有播放过任何音乐。那个花洒头呢？没有任何一滴水从那里滴下来过。它甚至还没有一个水龙头！
一天下午，当安娜和父亲来到五楼曼珠奶奶家门前的时候，他们听到了最可怕的嚎叫声。“爸爸，那恐怖的声音到底是什么呢？”“我想应该是火警的警报声，安娜。来，我们必须立刻到火灾逃生楼梯。”
安娜看着全部人都涌到安全点去。“别担心安娜，这只是在二楼发生一场非常小的火灾。你有听到警报声吗？你看消防车来了，它来帮助我们了。”突然，那个奇怪的花洒开始到处喷洒水。
哦，是谁躲在角落呢？是曼珠奶奶的小猫！它被火灾和那些水吓坏了。
小猫无助的眼神让安娜勇敢起来。她冲向前拯救那只小猫。现在她已经鼓起勇气了，她问：“爸爸，到底那个花洒是怎么打开的？”

“

安娜

，

这些是喷水灭火装置 

。 当发生火灾时

，


它们会自动开启

，


”父亲说道

。



“爸爸

，


但是水龙头在哪里呢

？



”她又问道



。安娜的父亲看了看那个喷水装置



。他也不确定



。

“

安娜

， 这个装置没有水龙头 
，


”曼珠奶奶说道
。     “ 那根红色的水管里面总是储满了水 ，用一个灯泡塞得紧紧的。
 当周围发生火灾时

，灯泡会升温并爆开 ，水就会喷洒 出来。 ”


“原来如此


，


”父亲说道

，他也刚学到了这个新知识

。

哔哔哔

。



。



。一个巨大的白色梯子就在他们面前升起。
“ 先请有孩子和老人的家庭  ，


”
一个消防员对着他的喇叭宣布

。

当他们爬上消防的云梯，曼珠奶奶紧握安娜的手，紧紧地盖着她的眼睛。然而安娜却睁大了眼睛

。


“ 安娜，你今天变成了一个勇敢的女孩 

，”父亲骄傲地说道

。“ 火警是否吓到了你

？

”



安娜紧抱他并点点头

。


“火警今天救了我们全部人，你知道吗

？ 它是一个好东西，”他温柔地说道



。


“爸爸
，它有一点像满豆 ，”安娜小声回答道

。她的父亲满脸疑惑

。


“ 火警每天都安安静静

。 只有在救我们的时候它才会制造声响

。

”

科技在很多方面都给我们提供了帮助。火灾时，无论是在学校

， 电影院或是其他建筑物

，

自动灭火系统都能够救我们一命



。

以下是当我们在听到火警时应该做的事情:1. 冷静地站起来，走向最近的消防通道。不要乘坐电梯，因为电梯在火灾发生时通常会停止使用。

2. 快跑会使你吸入更多烟，或者可能导致事故或踩踏。切记千万不能跑，而是快走。如果可以，用湿毛巾盖住你的脸。3. 不要朝火堆丢任何的水，因为这很有可能造成火势蔓延或导致触电。4. 请大人去关掉电源地总开关

。不要触碰任何电器产品或开关

。

5. 如果逃生通道已经充满烟雾，最好是爬行或匍匐前进，这样你就会 吸入较少的烟雾。6. 一旦逃出火灾建筑，前往最靠近的防火聚集地或安全的开放地点

。

7. 在一个地方等待，直到家人或是监护人找到你

。

8. 如果你受伤了，向附近的大人寻求帮助

。
eng:
When
Ana moved from her hometown in Goa to Mumbai, she was very excited. But she was
also sorry to leave her uncle, her grandmother, her friends and most of all…
Mando.

Mando was a serious dog who slept
peacefully all day. But whenever there was a wedding in the neighbourhood, he
howled woefully, until Ana’s uncle stopped playing his violin! 
Ana loved Mando. She knew he would always protect her from strangers and
dangers. And from her uncle’s noisy violin!

Mumbai was a noisy city. Ana missed the
sounds of the birds, the church bells and the village music. The only thing she
didn’t miss was her uncle’s violin!
Sometimes, after school, Ana would go with her father as he delivered
letters and parcels.

Ana would
wait eagerly for her ride up in the lift. One day, she sneakily pressed all the
buttons. The lift opened on every floor! 
 
Every floor had a red speaker box on
the wall. 
Each floor also had a strange-looking shower-head on the ceiling. 
‘Who would want to take a bath here?’
she wondered.

Ana tried to figure things out. The red speaker box never played any
music. And the shower? Not a drop of water ever dripped from it. It did not
even have a tap!

One afternoon, while Ana and her father
were on the fifth floor at Manju Aaji’s door, they heard the most horrible
wailing. 
“Papa, what’s that terrible noise?” 
“I think that’s the fire alarm, Ana.
Come, we must get to the fire escape floor immediately.”

Ana looked at all the people who had
rushed to the safety point.  “Don’t worry Ana, it’s a very small fire on the
second floor. Do you hear that siren? That’s the fire engine - it’s here to
help us.”





















Suddenly, the strange shower began to
spray water all around.

Oh, and who was that in the corner?

Manju Aaji’s kitten! She was terrified of the
fire and the water.

The sight of the helpless little kitten
made Ana feel brave. She dashed to its rescue. 

Now that she had gathered some courage,
she asked, “How did the shower come on, Papa?”

“These are fire sprinklers, Ana. When
there is a fire, they turn on automatically,” her father said.
“But where is the tap, Papa?” she asked
again. Ana’s father looked at the sprinkler. He wasn’t sure.

“There is no tap, Ana,” said Manju
Aaji. “That red pipe is always full of water and is plugged tight with a bulb.
When there’s a fire nearby, the bulb heats up and bursts. So the water comes
rushing out.”  “Ah,” said Papa, who had just learnt something.

BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP... 
A large white ladder rose up right in
front of them. 
“Families with children and the
elderly, please,” a fireman announced into his horn.
BEEP BEEP BEEP BEEP...A large white ladder rose up right in front of them.“Families with children and the elderly, please,” a fireman announced into his horn.

As they
climbed onto the fire lift, Manju Aaji clutched Ana’s hand, and shut her eyes
tight. But Ana kept her eyes wide open.

“You were a brave girl today, Ana,” her
father said proudly. “Did the fire alarm scare you?”
Ana hugged him and nodded. 
“The fire alarm saved us all today, you
know? It’s a good thing,” he said softly.
“It’s a bit like Mando, Papa,” Ana
whispered back. Her father looked puzzled.























“The fire alarm is quiet every day. It
only makes noise to save us from trouble.”

Technology helps us in many ways.
During a fire, the automatic fire systems in schools, cinema halls and other
buildings save our lives. 























Here are some things we should do when
we hear a fire alarm: 
1. Get up calmly and walk
towards the nearest fire exit at a steady pace. Do not take the lift as lifts
are usually disabled during a fire.

2. Running will make you inhale more smoke or may cause an accident or stampede. So do not run; walk fast. If possible, cover your face with a wet towel.

3. Do not throw any water at the
fire as this could make the fire spread or cause electrocution.
4. Ask a grown-up to switch off the electrical main switch. Do not
touch any electrical appliances or switches. 
5. If the exit way is filled with smoke it is better to crawl or creep
out so that you inhale less smoke.
6. Once out of the building, walk towards the nearest fire assembly
point or safe open area.
7. Wait in one place until your family member or caretaker has 
found you.
8. If you are injured, request
the nearest grown-up for help.

zho: 我是個圓圈名叫Goloo。大家都喜歡我。你可以隨時隨地找到我！
太陽公公長的像我。當天氣太熱的時候，大家會撐起遮陽傘。傘也長得像我。
到了夜晚，彎彎的月亮看起來就像我在微笑。貓頭鷹圓圓的眼睛看起來就像我在看著。
大到西瓜，蘋果，橙子，番茄， 小到檸檬和甜甜圈，還有好多好吃的甜品，它們都看起來和我一樣。
動物們也很喜歡用我來點綴它們的身體。看看獵豹和梅花鹿，它們的皮膚上都有我的痕跡。你也能在瓢蟲和蝴蝶的身上找到我喔！
你也能在遊樂場上找到我，比如各種球類，呼拉圈和好多好多有趣的遊戲裡。
交通工具沒了我就哪兒也去不了，想想看卡車，飛機， 小汽車和自行車。
但是有一個地方我可不受歡迎喔！那就是你的成績單上! 不好意思了如果我出現在你的成績單上那我會很難過的！你可要加油好好學習，讓我不要出現！
eng: I am Goloo the circle.Everyone likes me.You can find meeverywhere, any time!
The sun looks like me.When it's too hot,you need an umbrella which alsolooks like half of me.
At night, the moonlooks like me with a smile.I look at it throughthe owl's round eyes.
Huge watermelons, apples, oranges, tomatoes, even the tiny lemons - all look like me... and mithai! Juicy rasgullas, syrupy gulabjamuns, lovely laddus... are among the many sweets that look like me.
Animals want me to decorate them.The cheetah, the chital deer, have me all over their skin.I'm there on ladybirds and butterflies too!
In the playground,I'm there as a ball,a hoopla ring andmany other joyful games!
Why, your trucks,aeroplanes, cars, cycles,would not be able to move...if it weren't for me.
And yet there is one place where I am not welcome.On your report card! Sorry friends!I also feel sad when that happens.You will have to work hard to change that!

zho: 基烏上學遲到了。但她找不到她的紅色瓶子。
那是她的瓶子嗎？還是一個火箭？
基烏看著黑板，而想著， “那些是在海裡游的魚嗎？”
基烏盯著鞋上的一滴綠色斑點，想著，“這很粘，看起來像果凍。 難道是一隻青蛙嗎？”
基烏跑著回家跟奶奶說，“我有神奇的魔力！ 我能看到別人看不到的東西 。”
奶奶點點頭而問，“那麼我們是不是應該去眼科醫生那，告訴她你的魔力？”
尼基塔醫生拿了一張圖表給基烏看。“那些螞蟻正在圖上行進嗎？ “基烏問道。
尼基塔醫生幫基烏試戴眼鏡。最大的螞蟻變成了E.
“難道我失去我的魔法了嗎，醫生？”基烏問道。 “閉上眼睛做夢。 你的魔法會回來的，“尼基塔醫生說。
“基烏，你想要什麼顏色的眼鏡？”奶奶問道。“給我綠色的吧，”基烏笑著說。
眼鏡的情況基烏沒有戴眼鏡而看不太清楚。你能幫她嗎？
以下的形狀叫什麼呢？
花裡面藏了多少圓圖？
你在這顆星星上看到了幾個三角形？
窗戶裡有幾個方塊？
eng: Chiu is late for school.But she cannot find her red bottle.
Is that her bottle?Or is it a rocket?
Chiu looks at the blackboard and wonders,“Are those fish swimming in the sea?”
Chiu stares at the green blob on her shoe and thinks,“It is slimy and looks like jelly. Is it a frog?”
Chiu runs home to Ajji and says,“I have magic powers! I see things others cannot.”
Ajji nods and asks,“Shall we go to the eye doctor and tell her about your magical powers?”
Dr Nikita shows Chiu a chart.“Are those ants marching on the page?” asks Chiu.
Dr Nikita helps Chiu try on glasses.The biggest ant becomes an E.
“Have I lost my magic, doctor?” asks Chiu.“Close your eyes and dream.Your magic will be back,” says Dr Nikita.
“Chiu, what colour glasses would you like?” asks Ajji.“Green for me,” says Chiu with a smile.
The Case of the Spectacles Chiu is not wearing her spectacles and cannot see very well. Can you help her?
Name the following shapes.
How many circles are hidden in the flower?
How many triangles doyou see in this star?
How many squares are there in the window?
Achoo!went the monkey.
Achoo!went the bird.
Achoo!went the porcupine.
Achoo!went the boar.
Why did all the animals sneeze?
Which sneeze was the biggest?
Achoo!went the deer.
ACHOO!went the buffalo.
Which sneeze was the biggest?
Can you make a bigger one?
AAACHOO!went the tiger.
Was that the biggest?
Can anyone make a bigger one?
Maybe...  an elephant can?
AAAAA...
CHOO!
Cover your sneeze, please!
The end.
zho: “阿嚏”猴子打了个喷嚏。她的感冒糟糕透了。“那可真响。我差点从树上掉下来，”噪鹃从树叶里探出头来说道。
“真的？”猴子问。“如果我打得响，   那你觉得大象的喷嚏会有多响？”“我只能猜猜，”噪鹃说。“大概有这么响...                                                ...阿嚏!”
“那可不够响！”豪猪说。“大象的喷嚏要比那响得多的多！”“阿——嚏”他吹着他的小腮帮子，尖尖的鼻头抖动着。
“呼噜 呼噜，”野猪说。“那可不够响。    大象的喷嚏必须是巨大的！”
然后她深吸了一口气，“阿阿——嚏，呼噜 呼噜”
“怎么这么吵啊？”鹿问。“你知道大象的喷嚏有多响吗？”猴子问。“我从来都是很文雅地打喷嚏，”鹿吸了吸鼻子说。“但是大象的喷嚏一定是像这样的一个巨大的恶心  的喷嚏！
...阿阿阿——嚏！...阿阿阿——嚏！真不好意思。”
“阿阿阿——嚏！”
所有的动物们都吓了一跳。水牛加入了队伍里。“这才是大象的喷嚏，”他自豪地说。鹿，野猪，豪猪，噪鹃，还有猴子都钦佩地看着他。
“不算糟，但是还是不够！”一个低沉的声音咕噜咕噜地说。水牛的鼻子颤抖了一下。老虎从树丛的后面跃出来。她将头往后一甩，张开大口，然后打出了你能想象到的最响亮的喷嚏。
大象走进了空地。“打扰一下，”他对老虎说，“你也感冒了吗？   我感冒了，而且我现在要打个喷嚏。”
“什么？”老虎咆哮道。“什么？”水牛吼道。“什么？”鹿吠道。“什么？”野猪咕哝道。“什么？”豪猪尖声叫道。“什么？”噪鹃鸣叫道。‘哦，哇塞！’猴子想到。
“阿...阿阿...阿阿阿...”整个森林都在等待着。‘就要来了，’猴子想。

“阿...阿阿...阿阿...                                                                                            阿阿阿...阿阿阿阿...                                                                          阿阿..阿阿..."
“感觉真舒服！”大象说。“没有能比打喷嚏更好清理鼻子的方式了。”接着他朝四周看了看，诧异地说道，“大家都去哪儿了？”
噪鹃开始大笑。“你现在知道大象的喷嚏有多响了吧？”他问猴子。“对，”猴子说，“可是...”“别再问问题啦！”噪鹃哀嚎着急急忙忙地飞走了。

eng:
When Rohan woke up, he began to play with Jimmy, his dog.“There’s something you should do first!” said Riya, his big sister. “BRUSH YOUR TEETH!”

WOOF!

“I don’t want to brush my teeth! Jimmy doesn’t brush his teeth!”“Animals take care of their teeth too, but in other ways! We must brush our teeth to keep germs away!”“Germs?”“Germs are very tiny creatures that you cannot see. If you don’t brush properly, they stay in your mouth and hurt you!”
“Ouch!”“YES! That’s why we must take good care of our teeth by brushing twice a day - morning and night!”“But brushing is no fun!”“I’ll tell you a secret, Rohan! Psst…”  Rohan smiled.

Mummy called out, “It’s breakfast time!” “There’s something we should do first!” said Riya. “WASH OUR HANDS!”
WOOF!

“But Jimmy never washes his hands!”Riya laughed, “He doesn’t use his hands or paws to eat like we do! We must wash our hands with soap to get rid of germs.”“Are germs on our hands too?”“Germs are EVERYWHERE!”WOOF!
“Aaaah-chhhooo!” Riya covered her mouth with her hands as she sneezed.“Don't do that! My teacher says that we should sneeze into our sleeve, not our hands!" said Rohan.
“Why?”“Because when we sneeze into our hands, germs stick to them. If we don’t wash our hands, we spread germs and make others sick!”

“Here comes Germy!” Riya shouted, chasing Rohan and waving her
dirty hands. 

 “EEEEEEEK!”WOOF!

Later Riya showed Rohan the proper way to wash hands. “Wet your hands and turn off the tap. Then rub in some soap on the palms, the back of the hands and between the fingers. Scrub hands for twenty seconds! Now, it’s time to rinse off and dry!”“But that’s a long time!”“Remember my secret?”Rohan smiled.

When they came back home after playing, Riya nudged Rohan, “There’s something we should do first!”
Mummy teased, “Play some more?”“TAKE A BATH!”“Mummy, don’t you know that germs are everywhere? We can’t see them, but they stick to our skin and clothes!”“That’s why we must bathe every day…” “…to get rid of them!”

"Start by getting yourself wet,” said Mummy. “Then apply soap all over!” Riya and Rohan giggled as Mummy’s ticklish fingers soaped them up.“Then it’s time to rinse off!”“And dry with a clean towel!”“SUPERCLEAN!”WOOF! “It’s Jimmy’s turn next!”
“Do you want to listen to a story?” asked Papa.

“There’s something we should do first!” reminded Riya. “Tidy UP!”Rohan yawned. “Do we have to?”“Remember you couldn’t find your ball the other day? Putting things away in the proper place makes it easy to find them later!”“And keeps our house neat!” 
“You both are so smart!” said Papa proudly. “Bedtime!”“Papa! There’s something we should do first!” said Riya, pulling Rohan along.“Make the germs disappear with our magic secret!”Rohan nodded.

A few minutes later, Mummy and Papa heard a familiar tune. “So that’s your secret!” said Papa. “Humming a song to make brushing fun!”“And while washing our hands too!”“That’s a great idea!” said Mummy.WOOF!Rohan and Riya enjoy taking care of themselves. Do you? They make up a game with the germs and guess who wins?

Germs say, yucky, mucky and dirty is FUN!I say, I brush and wash and I know I have won!Germs say, never bathe, it’s a waste of time!I say, smelling nice with soap is so fine.Naughty germ says don’t pick up your things, The house looks better that way.I say, I tidy up because I like my thingsThat is a good way to end my day!And I feel better in every wayI feel better in every way! I FEEL BETTER IN EVERY WAY!!!!!Now make up your secret song and hum it when you have to do boring things!
zho: 羅漢醒來後，他開始和他的狗狗吉米一起玩。“你忘了做什麼了！” 他的姐姐麗亞說。 “刷牙！”汪！
“我不想刷牙！ 吉米不刷牙！”“動物也要照顧牙齒，但要用其他方式！ 我們必須刷牙以防止細菌滋生！”“細菌？”“細菌是非常細小的生物，你看不到的。 如果你沒有好好刷牙，它們會留在你的嘴裡造成蛀牙！”“對的！ 這就是為什麼我們必須每天早晚刷兩次牙來保護好我們的牙齒！”“但是刷牙不好玩！”“我會告訴你一個秘密，羅漢！”羅漢笑著。
媽媽叫："吃早餐了！""有件事我們應該先做！" 麗亞說。"洗我們的手！"汪！
“但是吉米一點都不想洗手！“麗亞笑道："牠不像我們一樣用手或爪子吃飯! 我們必須用肥皂洗手，才能消除细菌。""我們手上也有细菌嗎？""到處都有细菌！"汪！“啊楸！“麗亞一邊用手摀著嘴，一邊打噴嚏。"不要這樣做! 我的老師說，我们應該對著袖子打噴嚏，而不是對著手打!"羅漢說。“為什麼？“"因為當我們打噴嚏的時候，细菌會粘在手上。如果我們不洗手，就會傳播细菌，讓别人生病！"
“細菌來了！“ 麗亞大喊着，追著羅漢揮舞著髒手。“啊啊啊啊！”汪！
後來麗亞告訴羅漢正確的洗手方法。"把手弄濕，關上水龍頭。然後在手心、手背和手指間擦上一些肥皂。搓手二十秒! 现在，是時候冲洗乾淨並擦乾了！""可是那要花很長的時間啊！"“記得我的秘密嗎？“羅漢笑著。
玩完回家後，麗亞搖了搖羅漢："有件事我們先做！"媽媽開玩笑說，“是還要再玩嗎？““要洗澡了！“"媽媽，妳不知道细菌無處不在嗎？我們看不見它們，但它們会黏在我們的皮膚和衣服上！""所以我們每天都要洗澡...""......擺脫它們！"
"先把自己弄濕。"媽媽說。"然後把肥皂塗滿全身！" 麗亞和羅漢呵呵笑著當媽媽邊搔癢邊弄泡泡。“現在該用水沖乾淨了！“”然後再用乾淨的毛巾擦乾！“”超級乾淨！“汪！“接下來就輪到吉米了！”
“你想要聽一個故事嗎？“爸爸問
"我們有件事要先做！"麗亞提醒。"整理乾淨！"羅漢打著哈欠，“我們一定要嗎？”"還記得那天你找不到球了吗？把東西放在合適的地方，以後找起來就方便了！"“而且可以保持家裡整潔！““你們真聰明！”“爸爸驕傲的說。 “該睡覺了！”"爸爸! 有件事我們應該先做!" 麗亞拉著羅漢說。"用我們的魔法秘密讓病菌消失！" 羅漢點點頭。
幾分鐘後，爸爸媽媽聽到了熟悉的曲子。"原來這就是你的秘密呀！"爸爸說。"哼著歌，把刷牙變得更有趣！""而且還可以邊洗手！""这是個好主意！"媽媽說。汪！羅漢和麗亞喜歡照顧自己。你喜歡嗎? 他們用细菌做了一個遊戲，猜猜誰贏了？
细菌說，呸，髒兮兮的，髒兮兮的就是FUN!我說，我刷刷洗洗就知道我赢了!病菌說，從來不洗澡，浪费時間!我說，用香皂聞起来很香，真好。調皮的细菌說，不要撿你的東西。這樣的房子看起来更好。我說，我收拾是因為我喜歡我的東西。這是一個很好的方式來結束我的一天！而且我覺得自己各方面都好了我覺得在各方面都更好!我覺得各方面都好了!!!!現在编好你的秘密歌曲，然后哼著它當你不得不做無聊的事情！
Sonu洗澡後穿上一件藍色的襯衫。 Monu和Rina穿上藍色的襪子。
哦，今天我們都穿著相同的顏色！ 來吧，讓我們看看一些其他的顏色！
這裡是Dadi 的紅辣椒，不要碰他們！
啊哈，Bholu正在切紫色的茄子。
Rani Didi有陽光般的黃色檸檬。
看看這些顏色好好玩。現在又可以吃五顏六色的食物！ 好好吃哦！我們應該吃一個粉紅色的chuski嗎？
還是一個乳白色的印度牛奶冰淇淋？
我們可以喝點綠色的茴香水。
或者我們可以來點甜的棗？
但 Ramu 的番石榴是最好的。
綠色在外面，內部是粉紅色，並含純白色的鹽 和紅辣椒粉！
eng:
Sonu wore a blue shirt after his bath. 

Monu and Rina wore blue socks.

Oh,
we are all dressed in the same colour today!
Come, let us see some other colours!

Here
are Dadi's red chillies, don't touch them!

Aha,
Bholu is cutting purple brinjals.

Rani Didi has sunshineyellow
lemons.

Colours are fun to see. Now to
eat something colourful too! Yummy! Should we eat a pink chuski?
Or a creamy white kulfi?

We can drink tangy green
jaljeera.

Or we can have sweet brown
dates?

But Ramu's guavas are the
best.

Green on the outside,pink
inside, with pure white salt and red chilli powder!
Where are all my shoes? I know I left them here!
I haven’t seen your shoes. Go ask Snail!
No shoes here. Go ask Giraffe.
I’m in a hurry – go ask Frog.
Shoes? How many? Go ask Flamingo.
Seen your shoes? No, not me.
Will I ever find my shoes?
Shoes, eh? You should ask the Monkeys.
Hello hello? We’re busy. Go ask Owl, she knows everything!
Hmm. I have an idea. Why don’t you ask Lion?
These are yours? I’ll give them all back if you come to my party!
zho: 咦，我的黃色小鞋都去哪兒了？明明之前放在這裏！

小刺猬說：
「鞋子？我沒看見呀。你去問問蝸牛吧。

」

小蝸牛說：
「鞋子？我沒看見呀。你去問問長頸鹿吧。

」

長頸鹿說：
「我正趕時間呢！你去問問青蛙吧。

」

青蛙說：


















「鞋子？有多少只？你去問問紅鶴小姐。」
紅鶴說： 「有沒有看到你的鞋子?沒有，我沒有呀！」
我的鞋子，能找到嗎？
狐狸先生說  :「鞋子?你去問問猴子們吧！」

猴子們說:「
喂喂？我們忙著打電話！你去問問貓頭鷹吧，她什麼都知道。

」

貓頭鷹說：
















「鞋子嗎?我知道在哪兒。你去問問獅子吧！」

獅子說：
















「這些是你的嗎？都還給你，但你要來參加我的派對啊！」
我的小叔叔要結婚了。婚禮將辦在村子裡。我們都要去參加婚禮。我們要坐火車去。
我們是第一個到火車站的：我爸爸，媽媽，我弟弟還有我。
我們有一個大行李箱跟兩個小行李箱。我們還有一個紅水瓶。
火車還沒來。很多人都來了。他們都在等火車。其他親戚在哪呢？
在那！我爺爺來了。他走得很慢。他在找我們。我奶奶走在他後面。
我口好渴哦，可以喝個清涼的飲料嗎？我弟弟肚子餓了，他想吃洋芋片。
「等等，」我媽媽說。「我們都還沒上車啊。肚子餓了可以吃糖果，口渴了可以喝水。但是我們等到上車了再吃吧。」
我爺爺帶了一個很小的袋子。他還拿了一個拐杖。我奶奶的袋子很大。我想裡面一定有很多好吃的東西。
我的胖阿姨到了，還有他那瘦瘦的先生也來了。他們的行李箱裝滿了衣服。他們兩個都喜歡打扮得美美的。
突然有一陣噪音。火車來了，火車來啦！大家都趕著要上車。那個要結婚的年輕人在哪？我們都準備好了，但是他在哪？我爸爸去找我叔叔，我爺爺也開始四處找。
我媽媽看起來很擔心。但是我奶奶卻在一旁微笑著。「他來了！」奶奶說。我叔叔急忙地跑向我們。「真是抱歉，真是抱歉」他說。我們都上了火車。火車開離了車站／
eng: My youngest uncle is getting married. The wedding is in the village. We are all going to the wedding. We are going by train.
We are the first to come to the station. My father, my mother, my brother and I.
We have one big bag and two small bags. And we have a red water bottle.
The train has not yet come. Many people are coming. They are all waiting for the train. Where is the rest of the family?
There! I can see my grandfather. He is walking slowly. He is looking for us. My grandmother is behind him.
I am thirsty. Can I have a cold drink? My brother is hungry. He wants to eat chips.
"Wait," says my mother.  "We are not even on the train.  I have sweets if you are hungry. I have water if you are thirsty. But wait till the train comes."
My grandfather has a very small bag.He also has a stick. My grandmother's bag is big.I think there are many good things to eat in it.
My fat aunt has arrived. Her thin husband is here too. Their suitcase is full of clothes. They both like to dress up.

There is a big noise. The train is coming. The train is coming! Everyone wants to get in. Where is the young man, who is getting married? We are all ready. But where is he? My father goes to look for my uncle. My grandfather looks too.

My mother looks worried. But my grandmother is smiling."There he is!" grandmother says. My uncle is running towards us. “So sorry, so sorry,” he says. We all get on the train. The train leaves the station.
Who do we play with?Let’s play with friends.What shall we play with?Let’s play with stones.
Who do we play with?Let’s play with friends.What shall we play?Let’s play on the swing.
Who do we play with?Let’s play with our younger sister.What shall we play?Let’s skip with our rope.
Who do we play with?Let’s play with our brother.What shall we play?Let’s play on the slide.
Who do we play with?Let’s play with our older sister.What shall we play?Let’s ask riddles.
Who do we play with?Let’s play with our cousins.What shall we play?Let’s play hide-and-seek.
Who do we play with?Find a friend.And if you are alone?Kick the Chungi ball* with your feet.*A ball made with rubber bands.
zho: 我们和谁一起玩？和朋友一起玩吧。 我们玩什么？来玩石头吧。
我们和谁一起玩？和朋友一起玩吧。 我们玩什么？让我们在秋千上玩耍吧。
我们和谁一起玩?和我们的妹妹一起玩吧。 我们玩什么？ 让我们跳绳。
我们和谁一起玩？ 和我们的兄弟一起玩吧。 我们玩什么？ 让我们在幻灯片上玩。
我们和谁一起玩？ 跟姐姐一起玩吧。 我们玩什么？ 我们来猜谜语。
我们和谁一起玩？ 让我们和我们的堂兄弟们一起玩吧。 我们玩什么？ 来玩捉迷藏吧。
我们和谁一起玩？ 找朋友。  如果你一个人呢？ 用脚踢中球*。
「葛儒」與狗狗「皮球」喜愛玩耍。 他們會玩球，且並肩齊跑。

葛儒與皮球去他們的房間裡玩耍。媽媽非常生氣地責罵:「

皮球

 

!


別把屋裡弄得一團糟。

葛儒
!把牠帶到外面去。」
葛儒與皮球到外面去玩耍。馬諾哈爾叔叔非常惱怒地吼著:「 葛儒 !你們兩個到底要製造多少噪音?噓!」

葛儒與皮球到公園去玩耍。馬達胡蘇丹爺爺

非常暴躁地抱怨著:「 葛儒 !皮球不准到這兒。

走吧 ...現在就離開...去、去!  」
葛儒盯著海邊，難過地說:「皮球，我們可以在哪裡玩呢?」「噢，對了!我知道我們可以去哪裡了。」
葛儒與皮球到海灘去玩耍。他們都把舌頭伸了出來，興高采烈地享受風兒吹拂他們的臉頰。沒有人說:「皮球!不可以!」也沒有人說:「葛儒，把皮球帶到其他地方去。」
葛儒丟出他們的紅球，喊著:「皮球!去撿!」球滾向大海，皮球追著它，直衝進水中。
葛儒喊著:「不!皮球，別到那裏去，快回來!」但是皮球那毛茸茸的頭已經沒入水中。
葛儒開始哭泣。他與皮球相處的每個記憶都在眼前重播。

「汪!汪!」皮球自豪地叼著球划水而來。葛儒說:「皮球，我竟不知道你會游泳。」

「汪!汪!」皮球的回應彷彿牠始終都知道自己會游泳。
葛儒與皮球現在每天都去海灘。他們玩球，且並肩齊跑。他們也在波浪間玩耍，跳躍著互相潑水呢。
eng: Gurru and Peechu the dog love to play. They play ball and run along side by side.
Gurru and Peechu go to their room to play.“Peechu, don’t make a mess in the house. Gurru, take him outside,” scolds a very angry Mummy.
Gurru and Peechu go outside to play. “Gurru, how much noise do you both make? Shush!” yells a very irritated Manohar Uncle.
Gurru and Peechu go to the park to play. “Gurru! Peechu isn’t allowed here. Come on… Leave now… Shoo!” complains a very cranky Madhusudan Ajoba.
“Where can we play, Peechu?” Gurru says sadly, staring at the sea.“Oh yes! I know where we can go.”

Gurru and Peechu go to the beach to play. Both Peechu and Gurru stick their tongues out and gleefully enjoy the wind against their faces.No one says “Peechu, don’t!”No one says “Gurru, take Peechu somewhere else.”
“Fetch, Peechu!” Gurru throws their red ball.The ball rolls towards the sea. Peechu runs after it, straight into the water.
“No, Peechu! Don’t go there! Come back,” Gurru yells.But Peechu’s furry head is already disappearing into the water.
Gurru starts crying.Every memory with Peechu flashes before his eyes.
“Bhow bhow!” Peechu paddles through the water proudly carrying the ball.“Peechu, I didn’t know you could swim,” says Gurru.“Bhow bhow!” replies Peechu as if she always knew she could swim.
Gurru and Peechu now go to the beach every day.They play ball. They run along side by side.They also play among the waves, jumping and splashing water at each other.
Kamal had a dog. He was called Bhaunkoo.
One day, Kamal was feeding Bhaunkoo and he gave him a roti. Down came a monkey and snatched the roti away!He climbed up the wall on the terrace before settling down to eat.
A crow saw the roti from the corner of his eye. He swooped down and made off with the roti before the monkey could take a bite. He flew to the pipal tree in the courtyard.
There was a peacock perched on the pipal tree. He caught sight of the roti. The crow flew off to save it. Bhaunkoo barked loudly, “Bhaun, Bhaun, Bhaun, Bhaun!”
The crow panicked. He cawed, “Kaanv, Kaanv!”
As he opened his beak, the roti fell down. It fell in the courtyard.
Bhaunkoo snapped it up immediately. The roti was back where it belonged!
zho:
卡马尔养了一条狗。

他被称为邦库

。

一天，卡玛尔给邦库喂食，他给了他一份烤肉。一只猴子下来了，把烤肉抢走了！

他爬上露台的墙壁，然后坐下来吃饭。
一只乌鸦从他的眼角看到了烤肉。在猴子咬一口之前，他俯冲下来，带着烤肉飞走了。他飞到院子里的菩提树上。

菩提树上栖息着一只孔雀。他看到了烤肉。乌鸦飞走了救它。 










邦库

大声叫道：“ 










邦， 










邦， 










邦， 










邦！”

乌鸦惊慌失措。他叫道：“










堪尔

，










堪尔

！”
当他张开嘴时，烤肉掉了下来。掉在了院子里。
邦库立即将其抢夺。烤肉又回到了它所属的地方！

eng: The tank in Ranj’s village was almost dry. Ajji began to pray for rain. Amma collected all the buckets and pots and vessels in the house and filled them up. “We need to store as much water as we can,” she said.Appa collected tools to dig a little deeper. “We just need enough until the rains arrive,” he said.

Ranj got out her notebook and pencil. She put on her thinking cap, and followed her parents to the tank. She examined the tank bed closely. It was cracked and dusty.Ranj wondered, “Where did the water in the tank go? Did it run away? Was it stolen? This is a mystery!”

Ranj loved solving mysteries: Like the time Ajji couldn’t find her reading glasses. Ranj had found them in her book, marking the page she was reading.Then the other time — Why were elephants visiting the ragi fields? Turns out it was because their long, long trunks could smell the ripening grains, all ready to eat.“I’ll find that water,” Ranj muttered to herself.
Ranj walked to the other side of the tank, past dead fish and dried reeds.“Do you know where the water could have gone?” Ranj asked a fisherman.“Downstream?” the fisherman suggested.

Ranj followed the dry stream bed down the hill. At the bottom was another tank. It had lots of goats, but no water.Ranj asked the goatherd, “Do you know where the water might be?”“Upstream,” the goatherd suggested.“That’s where I came from,” Ranj said. “No water there.”“Further up, then?” the goatherd said. “That’s where your water comes from.”

Ranj climbed up to the tank. Then she climbed up some more to a tank further up the hill. There was no water, no birds. There was only one person there.“Sapna, I can’t find any water. Any idea where it’s gone?” Ranj called to her. She knew Sapna from school.

“Downstream,” Sapna called back.Ranj was suddenly angry. She stomped her foot.“NO!” she shouted. “It’s not. I have searched and searched. It’s not upstream or downstream. Got it?”“How about up there?” Sapna suggested.
Ranj and Sapna looked up at the sky. The sun glared back at them. Everything was white-hot and dusty.“No,” they agreed together. “No water there.”

Ranj collapsed into the boat with Sapna and gnawed on a lotus stem. She was hot and tired.

“Manju’s parents left the village,” Ranj said. “They went to the city where they have water. Maybe we should all go.”

“You go,” Sapna snapped. “No one asked you to be here.”


“Fine,” Ranj said. And she stomped back home.But it wasn’t fine! There was still no water, still no rain.

The next day, Ranj brushed her teeth with muddy tank water in a tiny glass.“Thooo!” she spat.In school, the class was half-empty. More families had left the area.
Ranj just couldn’t bear it. She missed all her friends! In the middle of Environmental Studies class, she turned and ran out of school.

She ran and ran until she was panting. She finally sat at the side of the road.“I have to find the water!” she huffed.
“Can I help?” said a voice. It was Sapna who had seen Ranj running away from school.Ranj beamed. “Yes!”“We have to do this properly,” Sapna said. “Like real Sanitary Engineers.”“Like who…?” Ranj asked.“Sanitary Engineers build pipes and tanks and drains. I am going to be one when I grow up,” Sapna said.
Ranj and Sapna decided to draw a map of their village and all its tanks and streams, showing all the places where the water might have flowed.

Where could the water possibly have gone?


Finally, they sat back and pored over the map. “We haven’t seen that tank yet,” Ranj pointed to one of the tanks they had drawn.“Let’s go,” Sapna agreed.

Ranj and Sapna began climbing up the hill. The stream here was dry as well. “Maybe we shouldn’t have missed school. This tank is probably dry as well,” Sapna said sadly.
When they reached the tank, Ranj and Sapna realised they were wrong. This tank was full!

Sapna pointed at a small pump at the end of the lake. There was a tanker just below the bund, collecting water as it flowed. A man stood by, guiding the tanker.“Mystery solved,” Ranj spat. She had never felt so angry after solving a mystery.

“Where are you taking our water?” Ranj wanted to know.“The city,” the man said. “They have more people, so they need more water.”“That’s not fair!” Sapna said.The man shrugged, “That’s how it is.”
“My friend is a Sanitary Engineer,” Ranj yelled. “She knows what’s fair.”The man laughed. “Sanitary Engineer it seems! You’re just children!”Sapna said quietly, “Yes, but I know you can’t just take our water away.”

“Go home,” the man said. “You can’t change anything!”

“We’ll break your pump!” Ranj shouted, running at the pump with a stick.“Oho!” said the man. “Shouldn’t Sanitary Engineers be building pumps, not breaking them?”“Yes… no… not like this…” Sapna said, unhappily.But Ranj said, “I’m a detective! I can do what I want.”
Ranj had a better idea. She hugged the pump. “You can’t turn it on now!”Sapna ran up to hug the pump too.“Hey!” said the man. Now he was really angry. “Just go home,” he said.

That was when the clouds broke. Thunder roared, lightning slashed, rain poured. Sapna started to laugh.“The monsoon is here!” Ranj shouted.“I’m going home, even if you aren’t,” the tanker man said.It rained and rained.

WOOSH, the bund overflowed, and the stream rushed down, splashing them.



“The water has been found! Mystery solved!” Ranj said.“WOOOOOO!” They yowled with joy.

Water WordsTank: A name for a man-made place to collect water. Tank sizes can vary from small pools to large lakes.Bund: A small wall – usually made of mud or stones – to stop and hold water in a tank.

Stream: A small channel through which water flows.


Spring: A place where underground water comes up to the surface.Water table: Level of water under the ground. Wells have to be dug deep enough to hit the water table to get water.
zho:
Ranj村裡的水缸幾乎干掉了。 奶奶開始祈禱求能落雨。 媽媽收集了房子裡所有的水桶，壺，和罐子，然后將它們裝滿。
“我們需要盡量儲存水，”她說。 爸爸收集了能更深入挖掘的工具。 “我們隻需足夠撐到下一場雨，”他說。
Ranj拿出她的筆記本和鉛筆。她戴上思考帽，跟著父母一起去了水缸。 她仔細檢查了水缸地低下。 水缸底已破裂而塵土飛揚。 Ranj思考著，“水缸裡的水去了哪裡？它逃跑了嗎？它被偷了嗎？這是一個謎！“

Ranj喜歡解開謎底：就像那時奶奶找不到她的老花眼鏡一樣。
Ranj在書頁裡找到了她的眼鏡﹔她用它來做標簽。
還有另外一次—為何大象要去小米田？ 原來，它們巨長的象鼻已聞到了快成熟，可以准備開始吃的谷物。
“我會找到水的，”Ranj自言自語地說道。

Ranj走到水缸的另一邊，經過了死魚和干蘆葦。
“你知道水會去哪兒嗎？”Ranj問了一位漁夫。 
“下游？”漁夫建議著。

Ranj沿著干燥的溪床往山坡下走。 底部是另一個水缸。 它裡頭有很多山羊，但沒有水。Ranj問牧羊人，“你知道水可能在哪裡嗎？”
牧羊人建議，“上游”。
“我是從哪裡來的，”Ranj說。 “那裡沒有水。”
“更往上呢？”牧羊人說。 “那是水的出發點。”

Ranj爬上了水缸。 然后她再爬到山上的一個水缸。 那裡沒有水，也沒有鳥。 隻有個人。
“Sapna，我找不到任何水。你有什麼概念它會在哪嗎？“Ranj叫到。 她是從學校認識Sapna的。

“下游，”Sapna回應道。 Ranj突然生氣了。她跺著腳。 
“不！”她喊道。 “不是。我尋了又尋。 上游或下游也不是。 了解了嗎？” 
“上面那裡怎麼樣？”Sapna建議。 Ranj和Sapna仰望天空。太陽猛瞪著他們。 一切都是白熱和充滿灰塵的。 “不，”她們一致同意。“那裡沒水。”
Ranj倒塌在Sapna的小船上，啃著蓮花莖。 她又熱又累。 “Manju的父母已經離開了村庄，”Ranj說。“他們去了有水的城市。 也許我們都應該去。”

“你去吧，”Sapna厲聲說道。 “沒有人叫你留在這兒。”
“好，”Ranj說。 然后她怒氣匆匆地走回家。
但一切都不好！ 村裡仍然沒有水，仍然沒有雨。
第二天，Ranj用一個小玻璃杯裡的泥水沖洗了她的牙齒。
“噢！”她把泥水吐了出來。 在學校裡，班裡是半空的。 更多家庭已離開了該地區。
Ranj無法忍受。 她想念她所有的朋友！ 在環境研究課程中，她轉身奔跑，離開了學校。

她跑呀跑，直到她氣喘吁吁。 她終於坐在路旁。
“我一定要找到水！”她怒氣沖沖地說道。
“我可能幫你嗎？”一道聲音說道。 是看到Ranj逃學的Sapna。
“拜托！” Ranj微笑著。
“我們必須用正確的方式，”Sapna說道。 “就像專業的衛生工程師一樣。”
“像誰...？”Ranj疑問道。
“衛生工程師建造管道，水箱和排水管。 是我長大后的志願，”Sapna說。
Ranj和Sapna決定繪制她們村庄所有水缸和溪流的地圖，顯示水可能流到的所有地點。

水究竟消失到哪了？
終於，她們坐下，好好研究地圖。 “我們還沒有看到這個水缸，”Ranj指著她們畫的其中一個水缸。
“我們走吧，”Sapna同意道。
Ranj和Sapna開始爬上山坡。 這裡的溪流也是干的。
“也許我們不應該翹課。 這個水缸也可能是干的，”Sapna灰心地說道。

當她們抵達水缸時，Ranj和Sapna領悟到她們錯了。
這個水缸是滿的！
Sapna指著湖底的一個小泵。在外灘下方有一個水缸，流動時同時收集水。 一位男人站在旁邊，指引著水缸。  “謎題解決了，”Ranj厲聲說道。 她從來沒有解開謎題后感到如此憤怒。

“你想把我們的水帶到哪裡？”Ranj想知道。
“城市裡，”那位男人說道。 “他們那裡有更多的人，所以需要更多的水。”
“這不公平！”Sapna說。 那位男人聳了聳肩，“沒辦法。”
“我的朋友是一名衛生工程師，”Ranj喊道。 “她知道什麼是公平的。” 那位男人笑了。 “衛生工程師耶！ 你們都隻是小孩子！“
Sapna低聲地說，“話是這麼說，但我知道你不能就隨意把我們的水盜走。”
“回家吧，”那位男人說道。 “你是無法改變任何事情的！”

“那我們就打破你的泵！”Ranj喊道，握著棍子往泵上跑。
“噢！”男人說。“衛生工程師不是應該建造泵，而不是破壞它們的嗎？” 
“是的......不......不是這樣......”Sapna納悶地說道。 但Ranj說，“可是我是個偵探！ 我可以做任何我想做的事。”
Ranj靈機一動。 她抱著泵。“看你現在如何啟動它！”  Sapna也跑過去抱了泵。 “嘿！”男人說道。 現在他真的生氣了。 “回家吧，”他說。

這時雲層開始破裂了。 雷聲咆哮，閃電劃破，雨傾盆而下。 Sapna開始大笑起來。
“季風來臨了！”Ranj喊道。
“你們不回家，我回，”水缸男子說道。 雨下了又下。

嘩啦嘩啦，外灘溢出，溪水沖下來，洒到了她們。
“水被發現了！ 謎底解決了！”Ranj說道。
“耶！”她們高興地吼叫著。

水的詞語 水缸：人工收集水的名稱。 水缸的大小可以從小型游泳池到大型湖泊。
外灘：一堵小牆 – 通常由泥土或石塊制成 – 用來阻止和保存水在水箱裡。

溪流：水流過的小通道。 泉：地下水涌到地面的地方。
地下水位：地下水位的高度。 井必須挖得夠深才能到達地下水位置取水。

eng: Boochandis are everywhereBoochandis are here, there, and in your hair
Boochandis who have clawsBoochandis who have furry paws
Boochandis who have all their teethBoochandis who have eaten too many sweets
Boochandis who scowlBoochandis who are smelly and rather foul
Boochandis who go ach-chooBoochandis whose noses are full of goo
Boochandis who giggleBoochandis whose stomachs wiggle and jiggle
Boochandis who glow in the nightBoochandis who can’t be seen even in the light
Boochandis who love a treatBoochandis who chomp on your hands and feet
Boochandis who are sneakyBoochandis whose behinds are slightly leaky
Boochandis who can flyBoochandis at your window to peep and pry
Boochandis who roamBoochandis who may be inside your home!
zho:
你認識小鬼嗎?

小鬼無處不在。噓...也許你的後面就藏了一隻。
有些小鬼張牙舞爪，有些小鬼多手多脚。
有些小鬼牙齒很整齊，有些小鬼吃太多甜食。
有些小鬼愛吼叫，有些小鬼脾氣有點臭。
有些小鬼常常打噴嚏，有些小鬼一直流鼻涕。
有些小鬼嘻嘻笑，有些小鬼捧腹大笑。
有些小鬼怕黑，有些小鬼愛躲起來。
有些小鬼張手要糖，有些小鬼愛跺腳。
有些小鬼愛嚇人一跳，有些小鬼做錯事，心知不妙。

有些小鬼愛偷看，

有些小鬼神不知鬼不覺。
小鬼無處不在，看！你家裏就有一隻快樂的小鬼！
在又深又黑的森林裡住著一條叫Serpy的蛇。蛇沒有腳。蛇不能直立行走，不能跑動，沒有翅膀。蛇不能飛翔，也不能在水裡直著游泳。
不過Serpy幻想著直著走路，奔跑，飛翔和游泳。他每天都在想著這些。
“如果我有腳的話，我就能走出直線了。如果我有翅膀的話，我就能飛出直線了。”
“但是哎呀，我怎麼比大家奇怪呢？我不能直著走路，我不能直著奔跑，我不能直著飛翔，我不能直著游泳。我只能扭著身子爬行。簌簌，簌簌，簌簌。
有一天，Serpy看到一群鳥兒從天空中飛過。 它們飛上，飛下，在空中轉圈，可是沒有一隻鳥兒是直著飛翔的。Serpy開始了思考!
有一天Serpy在草原上看到了一群小鹿。小鹿們跑來跑去，在路上蜿蜒前進，可是沒有一隻小鹿是直著走路的。Serpy開始了思考!
Serpy來到河岸。魚兒在水裡搖擺著身子游來游去，可是沒有一條魚是直著游泳的。 Serpy開始了思考!
Serpy 坐在河岸邊想著。就在這時候一隻螃蟹爬了過來，Serpy給它讓了路，它繞著彎路爬了過去！螃蟹有這麼多條腿可是還是不能直著走路！這讓Serpy想得更多了!
Serpy想，我真的需要翅膀嗎？我真的需要腿嗎？ 它們和我行動的方式不同啊。
我走自己的路就好了！我爬行的方式不會變，別人的方式也不適合我。
到你來試試啦！1. 畫出5個圖形是能用直線拼出來的。2. 說出五種動物行動的方式。3. 看看你的周圍。能不能找出至少五個用直線構成的生物。
eng:
In
a thick, dark forest lived Serpy, the snake.


A
snake does not have legs. 
A snake cannot walk. It cannot run. A
snake does not have wings. 
A snake cannot fly. A snake cannot
swim in a straight line.

But
Serpy wanted to walk, run, fly and swim in a straight line. That was
all he could think of.

‘If
I had legs, I would walk in a straight line. If I had wings,  I
would fly in a straight line.’

‘But
oh, I am so weird! 
I can’t walk straight, can’t run
straight! 
I can’t fly straight, can’t swim straight.



I
can only slither
zig zag,
zig zag, zig zag.’

Serpy
saw some birds flying in the sky one day. They were going up, going
down, going around in circles and arcs. Not a single bird was flying
straight.

This
made Serpy
think!

Looking
across the plains one day, Serpy saw some fawns.

The
fawns ran here and there. They ran in the most 
zigzag way. Not
a single fawn walked in a straight line.



This
made Serpy
think!

Serpy
went towards the river.

The
fish in the river wiggled and waggled as they swam.
This
made Serpy

think!

Serpy
sat on the river bank, lost in thought. Just then a crab came by.
Serpy moved aside. The crab walked past. But not in a straight line!
The crab had half a dozen legs and yet could not walk straight!


This
made Serpy think some more!

Serpy
thought, did he really need wings? Did he really want those legs? Now
zigzag, then criss-cross, is not the way he moved.

‘I
am fine the way I am. My slithering ways are always the same.My
zigzag ways are the same each day. And the rest of them aresilly any
which way!’

Do
it yourself! 
1.
Draw five geometric shapes made out of straight lines.
2.
Name five animals that move in funny ways.

3.
Look around you. See if you can spot at least five living things that
are made up of straight lines.

zho: “冰淇凌！冰淇凌！"店老板叫道。
瑞芭跑去找妈妈。“妈妈！妈妈！我想吃冰淇凌！”“先把你的作业做完，”妈妈说。
瑞芭不开心了。妈妈问：“你做完你的作业了吗？”“嗯...还没有。我的笔记本都用完了！我需要买一本新的了。”

妈妈给了瑞芭50

塔卡

。“去买一本笔记本吧。我们还需要一块肥皂。”
瑞芭去了商店。店老板给了瑞芭一本笔记本和一块肥皂。“多少钱啊？”瑞芭问道。
“笔记本是20塔卡，肥皂是20塔卡，”店老板说。“所以一共加起来40塔卡。这是你的找零。”
当瑞芭回到家，她算了算找零。瑞芭给了店老板50塔卡。笔记本20塔卡，肥皂20塔卡。
“我应该只收到10塔卡的找零，”瑞芭想。“为什么店老板给了我20塔卡找零呢？”
“那真是太好了!”瑞芭想。“那我就能用额外的零钱买冰淇凌了！”但是瑞芭又感到很羞愧。“我应该回去把多余的零钱还给店老板。”
瑞芭冲回店铺。那里有好多种类的冰淇凌她想吃。“噢，要是能吃一个冰淇凌就好了！”她想。
当瑞芭进到店里，她看到另一个小女孩刚刚买了冰欺凌。她正要回家。店老板叫住了她。“等一下！”，他说。“你给了我太多的钱，这是你的找零。”
店老板给了小姑娘她的零钱。瑞芭向前走了走。“你给了我额外的10塔卡。请你收回这些零钱。”
“你真是个诚实的女孩啊！”店老板为瑞芭的诚实行为感到非常开心，他免费送了瑞芭一个冰淇凌！瑞芭非常开心地吃着冰淇凌回家了。
eng:
“Ice
cream! Ice cream!” The shopkeeper called.

Reba
ran to her mother.
“Ma!
Ma! I want ice cream!”
“Finish your homework first,” said Ma.
Reba looked unhappy. Ma asked, “Are you done with your homework yet?”“Mmm…No. But my notebook is full! I need to buy another one.”
Ma gave Reba 50 taka*. “Go buy a notebook. We also need a bar of soap.” *Taka is the name of currency used in Bangladesh.
Reba went to the shop. The shopkeeper gave Reba a notebook and a bar of soap. “How much?” asked Reba.

“The notebook is 20 taka, and the soap is 20 taka,” said the shopkeeper. 

“That means the total cost is 40 taka. Here’s your change.”
When Reba came back home, she calculated her change.Reba gave the shopkeeper 50 taka. The notebook was 20 taka, and the soap was 20 taka.

“I should only get 10 taka back,” thought Reba.

“Why did the shopkeeper give me 20 taka back?”

“That's great!” thought Reba. 

“I can buy ice cream with this extra money!”

But Reba was ashamed of herself. “I should go back and give the shopkeeper the correct change.”
Reba rushed back to the shop. There were so many kinds of ice creams that she wanted!“Oh, if only I could have an ice-cream!” she thought.

When Reba got to the shop, she saw another girl who had just bought ice cream. She was about to go home. The shopkeeper stopped her. “Wait!” he said. 

“You've given me too much money. Come back, take the change.”
The shopkeeper gave the girl her change. Reba stepped forward. “You gave me 10 extra taka.Please take your money back.”
“You’re such an honest girl!”The shopkeeper was so happy with Reba’s honesty that he gave her an ice cream for free! Reba happily licked herice cream all the way home.

zho: 图咔和波伊喜欢收集东西。不管是河边光滑的鹅卵石光滑，还是卷曲的蕨叶，或是校服上脱落的鲜红色纽扣，图咔和波伊都把他们收集起来。每天放学后，他们会相约在河边那棵弯曲的椰子树下。他们在那儿等待他们最好的朋友。到了五点正，英吉就像一辆老旧的校车一般，气喘呼呼地抵达了。英吉是一只友善的狗。它的眼睛是巧克力的颜色。它的尾巴总是不停地摆动。
图咔、波伊和英吉一起走。他们低下头，在光滑的道路上、草丛中和长满青苔的石头堆里寻找有趣的物品。他们最喜欢收集的物品就是种子！图咔和波伊收集了一些长得像瓢虫的红色种子。他们还收集了粘在他们衣服上刺刺的草屑。他们也收集了许多盾柱木的荚，它们长得像大豆一样。
每当图咔和波伊摇晃那些荚时，那些荚总会发出令人愉悦的刷刷声。波伊喜欢创作出有趣的歌曲去搭配种子发出的声音。
“英吉是最好的狗，它喜欢大花和小青蛙，也喜欢鸟类、种子、蚂蚁和蜗牛，不过它最喜欢自己的尾巴！”她一遍又一遍地唱着这首歌，逗得图咔哈哈大笑，英吉也开心地吠着。
图咔、波伊和英吉坐在一棵罗望子树下。图咔最喜欢的种子就是这棵树的莢果。图咔喜欢把它那酸酸的果肉都吮吸干净，直到他可以看见里面闪闪发亮的棕色种子。在吮吸果肉的时候，图咔的脸总会皱成一团，十分滑稽。他脖子后方的毛孔也会收缩，形成许多小疙瘩。
突然，他们的耳边传来微弱的声音，说着：“哈喽……” 图咔和波伊疑惑地望着对方。他们并没有看见其他人。“在上面啊！在上面啊！”同样的声音又再次对他们说。图咔和波伊往上看，再往下看，然后再四处张望，可是他们却没有看见任何人的踪迹。

“是我啊，我是帕夏。我就是这棵罗望子树。”英吉听到后便开始大声吠，它的尾巴也摆动地比平时更剧烈一些。啪啪，啪啪，啪啪…… 它的尾巴来来回回地摆动着。“英吉，你好”罗望子树帕夏说。“我已经好几天没见到你了！”图咔和波伊像木头人一样傻傻地站着，一动也不动。他们睁大眼睛，嘴巴也呈现出巨大的 “O”形。波伊最终还是害羞地微笑着说：“罗望子树，帕夏，你好。很高兴认识你。我是波伊！”紧接着，她给罗望子树一个大大的拥抱。
帕夏傻笑着说：“我从来没有被一个小女孩拥抱过！感觉好痒啊！”“而我们也从来没有见过会说话的树！”图咔高兴地说。“这对我们来说都是一场奇遇。”帕夏听到后，便大声笑了起来。树枝上的叶子因此变成更鲜明的绿色。“你们俩今天在做什么呢？”帕夏问道。“我们正收集着各式各样的物品呢！”图咔和波伊说。
图咔和波伊向帕夏展示了他们篮子里的花、小卵石和黏稠的莢果。“你们竟然有收集种子的爱好，太棒了！”帕夏说。“你们知道我以前也是莢果的种子吗？再看看现在的我。我已经长大了，拥有许多树枝，也有一大家族的麻雀、松鼠和乌鸦与我一起生活。”“这是什么意思？”图咔问道。英吉兴奋地狂吠。“汪！汪！汪！”英吉说。图咔觉得它的吠听起来像是在问：“怎么会这样？怎么会这样？怎么会这样？”
帕夏解释说：“你们所收集的那些种子都是树的宝宝。” “它们是宝宝啊？”波伊问道。她的眉毛皱成了弯曲的黑线。“所有种子都会长成罗望子树吗？”波伊问道。她正回想着她究竟收集了多少颗种子放在家里。 “不是的！”帕夏答道。“种子会长成各式各样的植物。”“你的篮子里有水果吗？”帕夏问道。图咔点点头，掏出一颗小红苹果和一条软软的香蕉。
“就是这个！”帕夏兴奋地说。“现在，请你大口地咬这颗苹果，咬到它中间的位置。你会看见那儿有几颗棕色的小种子。”“它们就像闪亮的小虫子！”波伊说。“它们很漂亮，对吧？”帕夏问道。“这些小种子会长成苹果树。”“现在，请你将香蕉扒成两半，看看你会发现什么东西。”帕夏说。
“我看见种子了！”图咔兴奋地说。“它们看起来像一只正在睡觉的毛毛虫！”“种子的种类繁多，有不同的形状，也有不同的大小。”帕夏说。英吉在一旁把剩余的苹果吃了。“它们都是树的宝宝吗？”波伊问道。“没错！”帕夏说。“它们的内部都是一棵小植物，而这些植物正期待着有一天可以出来看看世界。”
到了傍晚，图咔、波伊和英吉走路回家。他们沿路都在仔细地观察身边的树木。椰子树的叶子在风中翩翩起舞的姿态真的好漂亮！凤凰木的红色花朵在蔚蓝的天空下真的好美！用手掌触摸芒果树的树皮是如此粗糙的感觉！一棵那么大又那么重要的树竟然是从一颗很小的种子开始，真是太奇妙了！
每个放学后的傍晚，图咔、波伊和英吉依然会相约见面。不过，图咔和波伊现在开始收集一些可以当成花盆的物品，把他们所收集的种子都种植在里面。旧鞋子、空椰子壳甚至是塑料瓶都可以变成他们的花盆。有时，他们也会停下来与帕夏聊聊天。
帕夏的超级种子指南你好！我是帕夏，是一棵罗望子树。但，我也有其他的名称。我的印地语名字是Imli，泰米尔语名字是Puli，孟加拉语名字则是Tentul。我的学名是Tamarindus indica。让我向你介绍我的种子朋友吧！你或许在餐盘上见过它们。

Molagu俗称：红辣椒学名：Capsicum annum辣椒有各式各样的形状、大小和颜色。它的足迹遍布世界各地。它的种子是圆形的，长得小而且扁平。它为一些印度料理，如：豆酱和炸蔬菜饼，增添了香气。触摸它的时候必须要很小心，因为它会使你的手指有灼烧感！Kaapi俗称：咖啡学名：Coffea Arabica你知道你父母每天早上喝的那杯咖啡吗？它是由咖啡豆做成的。咖啡豆经过晒干和烘烤后，就会被磨成粉。印度南部的丘陵地区是咖啡灌木生长得最好的地方。Chakka俗称：菠萝蜜学名：Artocarpus heterophyllus莓果、苹果、香蕉、西瓜和菠萝蜜以及其他的水果都有种子。有些种子是不能吃的，如：芒果的种子。菠萝蜜的种子在水中浸泡后便可用于烹饪咖喱。

Thenga俗称：椰子学名：Cocos Nucifera棕色椰子的外壳很坚硬。它几乎所有的部位都对我们有益。它毛茸茸的外壳可用于制作绳子，肉质的部分可以食用，而椰子水则是可口的饮料。尤其是天气热的时候，椰子水是很棒的消暑饮料。你知道那个涂抹在头发上的油吗？它也是椰子做成的。Kappalandi俗称：花生学名：Arachis hypogoea所有的植物都喜欢泥土的表面。可是，花生却非常喜欢地底下，以至于它选择生长在地底下。因此，有些人称它为地豆。这些小种子无论是生吃或是蒸煮，又或是烘烤，都非常美味。

Choru俗称：稻米学名：Oryza sativa稻米是其中一种最受欢迎的谷物！在印度这个国家，它的用量比其他种子还要多。稻米其实有一个粗糙的棕色外皮，它像外套一样保护着里面的种子。Chocolate俗称：可可学名：Theobroma cacao （意为神的食物）稻米或许是最受欢迎的种子，不过可可绝对是图咔和波伊最喜爱的种子。可可的种子可制成巧克力。每颗可可的果实都有大约30至50颗种子。这些种子经过烘烤后，再混入糖和牛奶，便可制成可口的巧克力块。
eng: Meet Tooka, Poi and Inji the dog.Tooka and Poi love to collect  things...
They like to collect buttons, pebbles, twigs....... but their favourite thing to collect is seeds.
They loved being outside.
They have so much fun when they go seed collecting.They sing songs, laugh, bark and dance.
Tooka loves the fat pods on the tamarind tree.The seeds are covered with squishy fleshy bits that are SOUR! Look at Tooka's face when he bites in to it!
One day, when they are our seed collecting, they suddenly hear a voice!'Helloooooo'Who could it be?
It was the tamarind tree! "Hello! My name is Pacha!" Tooka and Poi were shocked. They had never met a talking tree before.
Poi hugged Pacha! She was so excited.
Poi and Tooka showed Pacha all the things they had collected that day. "Lovely!" Pacha said. "Did you know, I was once a seed too?""Really? How?" asked Tooka.
"All those seeds you are collecting are actually baby trees!" said Pacha. "Do all seeds become tamarind trees?" asked Poi.

"No, no!" said pacha. "Different seeds grow in to different things." "But that apple you are carrying. Can you see the little seeds in the middle? One dat they will become apple trees." explained Pacha.
Tooka bit in to the banana he was holding and looked at the tiny black seeds inside. "Seeds come in all shapes and sizes" said Pacha.
That day, as they walked home, Tooka and Poi looked at all the different trees around them with wonder.
Tooka, Poi and Inji now collect something extra... things to plant their seeds inside! Empty bottles, coconut shells... even old shoes!
And they always make sure to stop and say hello to Pacha!

You can find lots of different seeds in your kitchen at home! Red chilly seeds look small but can be dangerous! So don't touch them.The coffee powder your parents use to make their morning cup is made from ground coffee seeds!Do you like jackfruit? The seeds in the middle of the fruit can be used to make yummy curries!
Coconuts and peanuts ...
...and even yummy chocolate. They all come from seeds! Will you plant a seed today? Remember to water it and give it plenty of sunshine.Tell us what it grows in to!

zho: 一只豺狼和一只兔子是最好的朋友。
兔子说：“让我们去抓一只螃蟹。”
兔子很快在泥里发现了一个洞。 他瞥了一眼，看见一只胖蟹坐在里面。
他很小心的把手放在深深的洞里。
螃蟹咬着他的尾巴，紧紧抓住。 可怜的兔子大声叫喊。 豺狼听见他喊，跑了过去。
豺狼抓住他的耳朵，用力拉着他。 当他看到尾巴移动时，螃蟹再次咬住了兔子的尾巴。
兔子的尾巴被切断，留在洞里。
故事完毕

概念印度多样化的语言风景，为儿童提供了丰富的故事。不幸的是，许多部族语言没有书面书籍或读书阅读乐趣的儿童文学。随着越来越多的部落儿童上学，现在比以往任何时候都要用他们的语言创造一个儿童文学。反映自己的世界，开辟世界的文学，因为书籍是以最互动的方式告知，娱乐，教育和娱乐的神奇，强大的东西。书籍让每一个孩子都以自己独特的方式成为独立而终身的知识者。要让每个孩子真正有意义的教育，她必须拿好书读自己的语言。该项目Pratham Books和IgnusERG在伯纳德·范·莱尔基金会的支持下，创造了十本儿童阅读乐趣的书籍，用于从奥迪亚的Munda，Kui，Saura和Juanga语言阅读乐趣。这些故事由这些部落的作者和插画家在一系列的讲习班中进行了说明。这一系列的书籍叫做Adikahani。对于在主流话语中找不到足够代表性的文化来说，这是一个重要的第一步。

合作伙伴IgnusERG是一个致力于支持教师和提高教育质量的资源人士协会，特别是在政府学校。他们着重努力，使平等的教育和解决边缘化儿童的需求。Bernard van Leer基金会是设在海牙的国际赠款基金会。其任务是改善在社会和经济困难环境中长大的幼儿的机会。它特别关心支持母语教育。这个故事是由儒家作家团体撰写的，包括布纳·卡纳赫（Buna Kanhar），菲利曼·普拉丹（Filiman Pradhan）和普拉蒙德·迪瓦尔（Pramod Digal）。在幼儿保育和教育委员会的背景下，他们都会定期与儿童互动。萨拉坦·扬加（Sanatan Juanga）以萨拉壁画风格为基础，魁北克语语言由Khondhamal，Gajapati和Odisha的Rayagada地区的超过1万人口使用。它与Gondi语言有关。 Odia脚本中语言的拼写不是很明确的，因为许多新的声音是第一次在打印中呈现。
eng:
A jackal and a rabbit were the best of friends. 
One day the jackal’s wife was not feeling well. The jackal called the
rabbit and said, “My wife has fever. She does not feel like eating anything.
Now she says she could eat a crab.”

The rabbit said, “Let us go and get a crab for her.”
Both the friends set off to find a crab. The rabbit
went in one direction and the jackal in another.

The rabbit soon spotted a hole in the mud. He peeped in and saw a fat crab
sitting inside. 
‘This will be perfect,’ thought the rabbit.

He carefully put his hand in the hole which was quite deep. 























When his hand could not reach the crab, the rabbit put his tail into the
hole.

The crab bit his tail hard and held it tight. The poor rabbit cried loudly.
The jackal heard him and came running to him. 
The rabbit gasped, “Don’t just look at me. My tail is caught inside, pull
me out.”

The
jackal caught him by the ears and pulled with all his might. When he saw the
tail move, the crab bit the rabbit’s tail again. 
The
rabbit yelled in pain and jumped.

His
tail got cut and was left behind in the hole. 
His
ears had become very, very long after the jackal had pulled them.

Since
that day the rabbit’s tail is short and his ears long.

The ConceptIndia’s diverse linguistic landscape has a rich seam of stories for children. Unfortunately, many tribal languages do not 

have literature for children in book form or books for reading pleasure. As increasing numbers of tribal children go to school, it is now more necessary than ever to create a body of children’s literature in their languages. Literature that reflects their own world and opens up the world beyond because books are magical, powerful things that inform, amuse, educate and entertain in the most interactive way. Books make every child an independent and life-long seeker of knowledge in her own unique way. For education to be truly meaningful to every child, she must get good books to read in her own language.

The ProjectPratham Books and IgnusERG, with the support of Bernard van Leer Foundation have created the first ten books for children’s reading pleasure in Munda, Kui, Saura and Juanga languages from Odisha. The stories were written and illustrated by authors and illustrators belonging to these tribes in a series of workshops. This series of books is called Adikahani. It is a significant first step towards giving a voice to cultures that do not find adequate representation in mainstream discourses.

The PartnersIgnusERG is a guild of resource persons working to support teachers and enhancing the quality of education, particularly in government schools. They focus their efforts on bringing equity in education and addressing the needs of marginalized children. Bernard van Leer Foundation is an international grant-making foundation based in The Hague. Its mission is to improve opportunities for young children growing up in socially and economically difficult circumstances. It has a particular interest in supporting mother-tongue based education.This story was written by the Kui Writers’ Group consisting of Buna Kanhar, Filiman Pradhan and Pramod Digal. With a background in ECCE, they all interact with children regularly. It has been illustrated by Sanatan Juanga, using the Saura mural style as a base. The Kui language is spoken by more than 1 lakh people in Khondhamal, Gajapati and Rayagada districts of Odisha. It is related to the Gondi language. The spellings of the language in Odia script are not definitive as many new sounds are being rendered in print for the first time.

zho: 飞过早上的天空， 鸟儿们肚子饿了。 有一只幸运的鸟儿， 抓到一个美味的蠕虫做早餐！
不同颜色的蝴蝶，飞过一朵朵鲜花。  但有一只不一样，  因为它和花同一个颜色。
一群欢快的风筝，  欢快的跳来跳去。 但有一个不一样， 你能找到吗？
大大小小的方块， 你都见过的。  但有一个不一样，  藏在哪里，你知道吗？
在这一片绿叶当中，  有棵又大又老的树。 有一根树枝，有一点红， 你能找到吗？
飞机在天上飞，  留下一条笔直的尾巴。  但其中一个很奇怪，因为它的尾巴弯弯的 。
一排叽叽喳喳的鸟儿， 坐在上面，你看到吗？  但有一只喜欢安静的， 是那只呀？
一群白云，  在明媚的夏日里闪闪发光。 但有一朵云说要下雨，  并且不在乎别人怎么想。
漫长的一天结束了， 而夜晚才刚刚开始。 在所有的路灯中，  找到一个像太阳一样闪闪发光。
蝙蝠在太阳出来时睡觉，  在晚上起床。  你能找到那个奇怪的蝙蝠  还在睡懒觉吗？

天空有很多星星

，  闪闪发光。  发现一个不一样， 因为它头上有一个环。
eng: Flying across the morning sky,Are birds in a hungry mood.Spot the one who has caught,A yummy worm for its food!
Butterflies of different colours,Are flitting flower to flower.But there’s one that stands out,Because it’s one colour all over.
A cheerful bunch of kites,Is merrily hopping about.But one’s not quite the same,Can you find the odd one out?
Big and small squares,Are shapes you see everywhere.There’s one grill that’s different,Where is it hidden, here or there?
Look among the green leaves,Of this big, old tree.There’s a branch with a speck of colour,Wherever can it be?
Planes flying across the sky,Leave behind a straight trail.But one of them is rather odd,And instead makes a curvy tail.
A line of chattering birds,Are sitting above, can you see?But one likes to be quiet,Whichever could it be?
A flock of white clouds,Gleams on a bright summer day.But one decides to be rainy,And doesn’t care what the others say.
A long day is done,And the night has just begun.Of all the streetlights,Find one that shines like the sun.
Bats sleep when the sun is out,And wake when it's night.Can you find the odd one,Who is still sleeping tight?
Outer space has many planets,Shiny and brightly lit.Spot one that’s unique,Because it has a ring around it.

Londi was a
dreaming girl. Up in the sky, she didn’t see clouds.

Instead Londi saw
flying geese, jumping fish, and fluffy sheep running home.

One afternoon,
Gogo came outside, looking tired.
“Londi, stop
dreaming!” she said. “It’s time to go and fetch the water.”

Londi stood up
and smiled at her feet.
“Let’s go, feet!
You know the way there!”

Londi started
walking to the tap. She hopped over the rocks.
She crept past Mama Neli’s house.

She dashed down the path.
The line at the tap was long. “Oh no!” Londi said to her feet.

“We’ll have to
wait. 
Let’s stay in
line. No dreaming away!”

Ooh! Londi
thought. But what’s that shining over there?
I wonder who lost
their shoe?

Did it belong to
a girl like me? 
 
Or something
else…

And what’s that
under there?
Cheep! Cheep!

And what’s that
big shadow? Uh oh, it’s Gogo!
“Londi, your
bucket nearly rolled away!”
“Sorry, Gogo. I
dreamed too far, again.”

They filled up
the bucket together. Londi watched the big sun sink into the hills.
 


















“Come let’s go,
my dreaming girl,” said Gogo.
“Look, Gogo! There’s a pink pig in the sky!”“Oh Londi… It’s just a cloud,” Gogo sighed.Londi took Gogo’s hand and they walked home together happily.
zho: 伦蒂是一个爱做梦的女孩。望着天空，她看到的不是云朵。
伦蒂看到的是飞翔的大鹅，跳跃的小鱼，还有毛茸茸的绵羊们奔跑着回家。
有一天下午，戈高走了出来，她看上去很疲惫。“伦蒂，别再做梦了！”她说道，“你现在该去打水了。”
伦蒂站起身来，笑着盯着她的脚丫。“我们走吧，脚丫！你知道怎么去那儿！”
伦蒂向水龙头走去。她蹦蹦跳跳跃过路上的石头。
她偷偷爬过奈莉妈妈的房子。
她沿着小路飞奔。水龙头前排着很长的队。“噢不！”伦蒂对着她的脚丫说道。
“我们必须得等着啦。让我们好好排队吧。不能再胡思乱想了！”
噢！伦蒂想。但是那边那个闪闪发亮的东西是什么呢？会不会是有人丢了一只鞋？
它的主人会是一个像我一样的女孩吗？或者别的什么…
在那里的又是什么呢？叽！叽！
还有那个大大的影子又是什么？啊噢！那是戈高！“伦蒂，你的水桶几乎已经要滚走了！”“对不起，戈高。我又沉迷在梦里了。”
于是她们一起灌满了水桶。伦蒂看着巨大的太阳沉入了山丘里。“我们走吧，我的爱做梦的女孩。”戈高说道。
“看，戈高！天上有一只粉红色的猪！”“噢伦蒂……那只是一朵云。”戈高叹了一声气。伦蒂牵起了戈高的手，然后她们高兴地走回了家。

eng: Mouse was looking for a new house.
This looks like a nice house.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Puppy. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were bouncy and muddy.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Parrot. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were noisy and wild.
“You can come and sleep with me,” said Fish. “Thank you,” said Mouse.
That night, Mouse’s dreams were cold and wet.
Mouse needed somewhere warm and dry.
Mouse found a bookshelf nearby.
That night, Mouse had warm and cosy dreams.
Good night, Mouse.
Good night, Mouse.
zho: 小老鼠在找新的家。
这家看上去不错。
小狗说： “你可以住在我的家。”
那天晚上，小老鼠梦到自己在泥土里上跳下跳。
“你可以住在我的家，”鹦鹉说。
那天晚上，小老鼠梦到四周吵吵闹闹。
"你可以住在我的家，”小鱼说。
那天晚上，小老鼠梦到  自己又冷又湿。
小老鼠需要一个又暖和又干爽的地方。
小老鼠找到一个书架。
那天晚上，小老鼠梦到自己又暖和又舒服。
晚安，小老鼠。

eng: An old woman had chickens and an old rooster.
Her grandson visited her. She decided to kill the old rooster.
The old rooster ran away to the big city.
The old rooster met the cat running away from her boss.
The old rooster and the cat met the dog running away.
They were joined by a horse which was running away too.
The animals came to a house. They saw thieves inside!
The animals sang loudly to chase away the thieves.
They ate the food they found in the house.
The thieves returned later. The animals attacked them.
The thieves ran away forever.
The animals lived together happily in the house.
zho: 有一位老奶奶养了一群母鸡和一只公鸡。公鸡老了，早晨常常忘记打鸣。
一天，老奶奶的孙子来看她。老奶奶请他留在家里吃顿饭。她决定杀了那只老公鸡。
公鸡知道后，赶忙逃跑，决定到别的地方避一避难。
公鸡遇到一只从主人家里逃跑的猫。于是，它们俩结伴一起上路。
在路上，公鸡和猫还遇到一只从主人家里逃跑的狗。于是，它们仨结伴一起上路。
接着，一只从主人家里逃跑的驴子也加入了它们。
天黑了，它们来到一座小房子，只见房子里面有一伙坏强盗。
公鸡、猫、狗和驴子在外面大喊大叫地唱起歌，想讨口饭吃。没想到，却把里面的强盗吓跑了。
它们进房子里面找些东西吃。然后，它们在房子里面睡着觉。
一个强盗偷偷摸摸地回到房子来瞧一瞧。他把正在睡觉的动物们吵醒了。于是，公鸡、猫、狗和驴子趁黑又把强盗吓跑了。
强盗们以为房子闹鬼了，再也不敢回来。
后来，公鸡、猫、狗和驴子在这里长住下来。它们相亲相爱地过起日子。

eng: Lara the ladybird was a special bug.

Unlike all her
friends, she had bright yellow wings.

Everyone loved
her yellow wings.

Each morning,
Bibi Butterfly said hello.
And Manto Mantis
always waved.

Even Sesa, the
sulky spider, was happy to see her.

At school, she
played with lots of friends.

But Lara wanted to be like the other ladybirds. “I wish I had red wings like you,Mama,” she
cried.

So one day, to
cheer her up, Lara’s mother painted her wings bright red.
The next morning, nobody greeted Lara on her way to school.

And when she got
there, none of her
friends said hello.

Lara sat all
alone. No one noticed her new red wings.

Until Miss Miya
