I was cursed by the witch to protect this magic mirror, but now that she's dead, her curse has lifted. You have given me my freedom back! Take this mirror as my gift to you, and use it to help anyone who needs it.”
zho: 从前不久，一群朋友在一个村庄里玩耍。忽然，一阵突如其来的强风将他们吹走了。“这是什么地方？” 他们问道。 “我们在哪？ 这个地方好安静好可怕啊。”其中一个孩子喊：“看！ 那里有间屋子。 我们去看看是否有人能帮帮我们吧。”
孩子们一起走到房子前，透过窗户看向屋内。 屋内里，他们看到一张摆满美味佳肴的餐桌。 突然，大门魔术般自己打开了。一个奇怪的声音叫道：“ “你们看起来都饿了。 进来吃点东西吧。”
山姆起了疑心。 他警告伙伴们说：“我认为我们不应该吃这里的食物。”“但好饿啊！” 伙伴们哭喊着。 “我受不了这饥饿感了，食物越看越好吃。”其中一位朋友对山姆说：“你如果不想吃的话就不要吃，但不要阻止我们。”
朋友便进屋吃东西了，只留下山姆紧紧抓住妹妹的手。“山姆，我真的好饿，” 她哭了。 “我也想吃东西！”山姆摇了摇头。 “不可以啊，索亚。 记得爸爸妈妈叮嘱过我们 — 不要为了填肚子吃东西， 也不要因为虚荣而行动。 而且，你难道不觉得这间房子很奇怪吗？”
突然之间，山姆和索亚惊见伙伴们居然变成了... 怪兽！ 山姆握住索亚的手，夺门而出，跑进森林里。
屋里，出现了一个老女巫。 女巫数了数怪兽后，脸上顿时流露出愤怒。“还有两个孩子在哪里呢？”她尖叫着，紧追着山姆和索亚飞走了。
山姆和索亚一直在森林中奔跑，试图寻找一个藏身之处。他们跑着跑着，遇到了一只白色的大老鼠。 大老鼠说道：“进来我巢穴吧。 我来帮你们躲起来！”“我好害怕啊，山姆！” 索亚一边和山姆跑进白老鼠的巢穴， 一边对山姆说。 “如果女巫找到我们怎么办？”山姆安慰妹妹。“别想这些，女巫可能会闻到我们的恐惧。”
从白老鼠的巢穴里，孩子们清楚地听到女巫搜寻他们时的哀号和尖叫声。终于， 她飞走了，白老鼠说：“你们很明智， 没有吃女巫屋子里的食物。”“她为什么要这样对我们的朋友？”山姆和索亚问。老鼠告诉他们，女巫的主人命令她把一百个孩子变成怪物，并把他们带到他面前。老鼠说：“女巫把这一百个孩子带到他面前，便会获得长生不老的回报。”
“我要怎么做才可以帮助我的朋友们变回人类呢？”山姆问。“这很难，”老鼠难过地说。 “如果你三天之内没有找到咒语，他们将永远都是怪兽。”“糟了！ 我为他们害怕，山姆，” 索亚哭道。“别害怕，索亚。 我们要坚强。” 山姆边说边拥抱着妹妹。
“你知道我们怎么样才能帮助我们的朋友吗？”山姆问老鼠。“知道。” 老鼠回答。“你们必须到神秘的寺庙， 并且找到魔镜。 魔镜会帮助你们救回你们的朋友！”“那这座神秘的寺庙在哪里呢？”山姆问。“它在遥远的东方。 抓紧启程吧！”老鼠说。
当他们离开时，山姆说：“索亚，你必须找到一个村庄，告诉他们我们的朋友发生了什么事。 我会一路向东，寻找魔镜。”
山姆边走， 边想起爷爷曾经告诉他的一段话： “你的话语将帮助你找到途径。”路上，山姆遇到了一个女人。“不好意思，” 他说。 “请问你知道通向神秘寺庙是哪条路吗？”“你得沿着这条路走，直到一个大湖。 湖的对岸就是你在找的神秘寺庙。”她告诉他。
在旅途中，山姆来到了悬崖的边缘。 当他低头往下看时，他注意到有一只小鹰在小溪中挣扎。他不假思索，跳入水中，并且将它救出。 当他从水中出来，一只大老鹰飞向他。“非常感谢你救了我的孩子！”老鹰吱道。 “你想来我的窝里取取暖吗？”山姆爽快地答应了。
趁山姆在鹰巢里取暖，老鹰送了他一枚戒指。她告诉山姆：“我在收集树枝筑巢时发现了这枚戒指。它看起来像是一枚具有强大力量的戒指。 你拿去吧， 也许它可以帮助你救回你的朋友。”“非常感谢你，老鹰，” 山姆说。 “请问你知道怎么才能到达那座神秘寺庙吗？”“你坐到我的背上， 我带你去吧。”老鹰说完， 便带着山姆一起飞上天空。
终于，他们到达了大湖的岸边。 老鹰在岸边放下山姆，并且告诉他：“记住，相信自己。”“我会记住的。 谢谢你，老鹰。”山姆回答。
山姆转向湖面一看，顿时开始担心起来。 大湖里全是凶恶无比的鳄鱼！他随手扔了一块木头，看看鳄鱼的反应。 一条鳄鱼猛扑上去，并一口气j将木头咬成两半。山姆不知如何赶在三天期限前到达寺庙， 感到又沮丧又绝望。
他看了看大湖的周围， 发现树上挂着许多藤蔓。山姆灵机一动！他把藤蔓绑在一起，做成一条粗粗的绳子，使出全身力气， 试图将自己荡到大湖的对岸。 眼看山姆就要成功到对岸了， 这时。。。啪！藤蔓断了， 而山姆也掉进湖里。 他瞬间被鳄鱼重重包围。
山姆跌入湖中的同时，戒指也从他的手指上滑落水中。 戒指碰到水的那一刹那，整个湖冻结了，鳄鱼更是都成了雕像， 一动也不动！ 山姆从湖里一路跑到寺庙。他在寺庙门口毕恭毕敬的鞠躬， 并且礼貌地向庙里的僧侣们示意。 “各位尊敬的师傅，我向您们鞠躬。 请问有人在吗？”回复他是一片沉默。山姆蹑手蹑脚踏进寺庙后，发现一道耀眼的光。 他仰头一看， 高架上居然有一个魔镜但正当他要伸手去拿魔镜时，一个小精灵出现了。
“你这个无礼的孩子！ 你居然想偷我的魔镜？ 我要把你吃了!” 小精灵吼道。“不要啊，拜托你不要吃了我！” 山姆急哭了。 “我需要魔镜， 这样我才可以救回被巫婆变成怪兽的朋友们。 我保证，我一定会把它带回来的。 到时如果你还想吃了我，再动手吧。”“我怎么知道我能相信你？”小精灵生气地问。“我从来不撒谎，”山姆说。 “我保证我一定会回来。”
“嗯……”精灵说。 “你可以把魔镜带走，但记住，你不可以违背诺言。”“我不会的。”山姆说。 “但是我担心我能及时赶回朋友们的身边。”小精灵说：“你只需将镜子发出的的光照到到墙上，然后穿过光斑。这样， 你就可以赶在第三天结束前到达朋友们的地方。”
山姆按照小精灵的指示，发现自己真的回到女巫的屋子里。不好了！ 山姆看到女巫正试图绑架妹妹索亚还有一群村民。山姆大声一喊，女巫便转向山姆开始诅咒他，但索亚朝她丢了一块石头。 女巫便试图诅咒索亚，但很快地，女巫就闯进了白老鼠的巢穴。女巫正想转身诱捕山姆时，却发现他已经消失了。
山姆跑到妹妹身边，一起用魔镜照着女巫。 看到两个小孩竟如此勇敢地和她对峙，她大为恼火，向他俩抛出了火球。可是，魔镜居然将火球反射回女巫。 她一声尖叫， 然后碎成灰烬。
山姆和索亚跑到女巫的屋子里，将镜子照在他们的每个朋友身上。朋友们一看到自己的倒影， 便立刻变回自己原来的样子了！他们快乐欢欣地跳着舞，鼓着掌。山姆却是开心不起来， 因为他必须按照承诺回到小精灵那里。
突然，精灵出现在他面前！小精灵说：“你是一个勇敢诚实的孩子。”你既会信守诺言，也会关心别人。 我是被女巫下了诅咒，要保护这个魔镜的，但现在她死了，她下的诅咒也就解除了。 你把自由还给了我！ 这面魔镜就当是礼物送给你了， 你就用它来帮助需要它的人吧。”

eng: One day, during science class, she looked out of the window and saw an eagle gliding in the sky. How happy the bird must be! She also liked to see planes flying. “Here, what's your name? Should you not be looking at the board?” asked the new teacher in Sarla's class.Sarla got up hastily and said, “Sorry Madam, I was watching an eagle. I wish we could fly like a bird, or like an aeroplane....”“What is your name?”“Sarla.”

“Oh how nice! ” said the teacher.“You must spend some time in the library, Sarla. I'm sure there are many books about birds and flights, and machines that fly like aeroplanes.” 



Over the next few days, Sarla happily learnt a lot about birds, and about aeroplanes.

Sarla learnt that  human beings can fly too, but not like birds. We can fly to any city in the world in an aeroplane, one of mankind’s greatest inventions. 



Birds are aerial creatures that do not need an external machine to fly. Usually, a bird's wings are bigger than the rest of its body. The wings are very light, making it possible for birds to fly.

Aeroplanes are huge and very heavy. Just like birds, aeroplanes have wings on both their sides which help them to fly. The wings of the plane are shaped just like those of birds - curved on the top and flat on the bottom which helps them to fly high up in the sky.
Birds flap their wings to fly, but of course we have never seen an aeroplane flapping its wings! Birds flap their wings as they use the wind to push their body upwards
Planes also have tails, just like birds, to keep them steady and help them change direction.ٴ

Planes know where they have to go because they are steered by pilots. The pilots control the plane from a place in the front of the aeroplane called the cockpit.

A plane is actually a giant bird. It is not only shaped like a bird, it also allows us to fly, though not like birds! Sarla wants to be a pilot and fly aeroplanes when she grows up.

Let's take off!Have fun with friends with these activities:1. Make paper planes and see whose plane goes the farthest. Is it the paper or the way it has been made that makes a paper plane go faster? Observe what happens when each plane is launched. Is there a difference if you blow over, or into or under the plane before you shoot it off? 2. Fly-Don't fly Game: Get a group of friends to 'fly' around the room, without touching each other. The den stands in a corner and calls out the names of flying or non-flying objects. When a non-flying object (like table) is called, the 'planes' must 'land' (sit down). Whoever makes a mistake is the next den.
zho: Sarla喜欢观察鸟飞翔。有一天，在自然科学课上，她望向窗外，看见了一只鹰 划过了天空。她能感觉到那只鸟是那么的幸福快乐。她也喜欢看着飞机飞行。"注意这里，你叫什么名字？你不是应该看着黑板吗？" Sarla她们班新来的老师问道。Sarla犹豫地站起来说， "对不起，老师，我在看一只老鹰。我希望我们能像鸟或者飞机一样可以飞翔...""你叫什么名字？""Sarla."
"哦，多好听的名字呀！你知道吗，第一个印度女飞行员的名字也叫Sarla？我的名字，Hamsa，意思是天鹅。你知道，天鹅是最大的飞行鸟类之一，”老师说. "你应该花点时间去图书馆，Sarla. 我很肯定那里有很多关于鸟类和飞行的书，也有关于飞行机器的书比如飞机." 接下来的几天里，Sarla很高兴地学到了很多关于鸟类和飞机的知识。
Sarla学到了人类也是可以飞的，但是不像鸟那样。我们可以坐飞机飞到世界上的任何一个城市，飞机是人类最伟大的发明之一。有了这个伟大的机器的帮助，我们可以体验到飞行旅行的乐趣。鸟类是天生的不需要外界机器帮助就可以飞行的生物。通常，一个鸟的翅膀比它的身子还要大很多。鸟的翅膀非常轻，有助于鸟类飞行。
飞机很大并且很重。像鸟类一样，飞机两边也有翅膀来帮助它们飞行。飞机的翅膀形状和鸟类的非常像--末端有翘起的曲线而根部很平整，这样可以帮助飞机向上飞向天空。
鸟儿上下煽动它们的翅膀来飞行，但是我们从来没有见过飞机可以拍打翅膀！鸟儿煽动翅膀来利用风把它们的身体向上推。 飞机其实也是利用风的力量来让自己飞行的。这个机器利用它身体里的引擎来制造向下的风力。
引擎是一个很强大的机器，它就像飞机的大脑一样。和鸟儿用它们的头脑和逻辑来引导它自己的飞行一样，引擎帮助飞机把自己推离地面并且向上飞。当飞机的引擎燃烧燃料的时候，它们产生速度很快的热气来推动引擎后方的空气从而使飞机向前移动。
汽车和其他的带有引擎的交通工具也会往前移动。但是它们不能像飞机一样飞上天空。风流过形状像鸟儿翅膀的飞机翅膀上方和下方，把飞机向上抬升上天空并且保持它不会掉下来。像鸟儿一样，飞机也有尾巴来保持它们稳定和改变方向。
飞机需要很长的路来起飞和降落。这些长长的路叫做跑道，在起飞进入空中以前，飞机需要在跑道上非常快速的移动。飞机需要一定的速度才能升到空中。大部分的飞机需要速度足够快才能起飞。跑道是机场非常重要的一部分，因为跑道为飞机提供了足够的时间来提升速度以达到最终的起飞。

飞机知道它们应该飞去哪里因为它们被飞行员操控。飞行员在一个位于飞机前端的叫做机长室的舱内控制飞机。他们通过很精密很先进的设备和机场（飞机起飞降落的地方）保持联系。就像在路上有交通信号灯和警察帮助我们一样，空中交通指挥员会告诉飞行员飞行的时间和目的地；以及什么时候可以安全的起飞和降落。一架飞机其实就是一只巨大的鸟儿。它不仅仅是形状像鸟，它也实现了人类的飞行，虽然并不像鸟儿那样飞！Sarla长大想成为一名飞行员并且驾驶飞机。
你知道吗？印度的第一架飞机叫Harlow，它第一次飞行是在1941年的六月。印度的第一个飞行员执照在1929年二月由印度和缅甸飞行俱乐部颁给了JRD Tata。
世界上最快的飞机是Lockheed SR-71 黑鸟，它飞行的速度比声音还要快。Sarla Thakral是印度的第一个女性飞行员。她也是第一个飞行时间超过1000小时的女性飞行员。

让我们起飞吧！和朋友们一起完成下面这些活动：1.做纸飞机，然后看看谁的飞机飞得最远。制造飞机的纸还是制作飞机的方法哪一个可以让飞机飞得更快？观察每一架飞机飞出以后发生了什么。如果你扔出飞机前吹飞机的上方，或是吹向飞机，或是飞机的下方会不会有什么不同？2. "飞还是不飞"游戏：找一群朋友来绕着教室“飞行”，不能互相碰到 。主持人站在一个角落，说出可以飞和不能飞的物体的名字。如果一个不能飞的物体（比如桌子）被喊出，“飞机们 ”就必须“降落”（坐下）。谁要是错了谁就成为下一个主持人。
一天早上，林迪在她的房间里发现了一只大象。“看啊！”她叫道，“我的房间里有一只大象！”“不可能，”妈妈回答道，“大象不能生活在房子里。大家都知道的。”大象打了个呵欠。
早餐的时候，林迪的爸爸让她把牛奶递过来。“我做不到。”林迪说，“大象把牛奶都喝完了。”“并没有大象啊。”爸爸说，“大象不能生活在城市里。每个人都知道的。”大象打了个嗝。
学校里，老师嘟囔着，“黑板怎么了？它变得皱巴巴的！”“那不是黑板。那是我的大象！”林迪说。“学校里没有大象。”老师说，“每个人都知道的。”大象吃了老师的三明治。
早餐时，大象跟着林迪到了操场上。它不小心撞倒了秋千。“走开！”林迪说，“你不是真的大象，你不应该出现在这儿！每个人都知道的！”大象垂头丧气。它走开了，用长长的鼻子擦着眼泪。
放学了，林迪找不到她的大象了。“大象！”她叫道。“你在哪儿呀？”
林迪独自回家。她觉得很孤单。于是她走了出门，坐在台阶上等着。
这时，她看见了长长的鼻子。然后是长长的牙齿。然后是大大的耳朵。大象沿着马路走了过来。
林迪跑过去紧紧地抱着大象。“对不起。”她说。“我不是故意的！”“我知道你是真的。”“你是我的大象。”大象用长鼻子把林迪卷起来，放到后背上，驮着她继续沿着马路走着。
林迪向她的邻居们挥手。“你好，格林先生！你好，格林太太！”“看林迪！”格林先生说，“她怎么在那么高的位置？也许她长高了！”“别傻了！”格林太太说，“小女孩不回那么高的。每个人都知道的。”
大象带着林迪去了湖边，她沿着象鼻子滑下来，就像滑滑梯一样。“耶！”她尖叫道。他们整个下午都在玩，笑着互相泼水。
晚上，大象用长鼻子卷着她送上床。“晚安，大象。”林迪说。“谢谢你陪我度过了可爱的一天。”大象轻轻拍着她的头，蜷缩着在林迪的窗户外面睡着了。
“大象是世界上最好的朋友。”林迪自言自语。“没人知道，除了我和我的大象。”
eng:
One morning,
Lindi found an elephant in her room.
“Look!” she
called. “There’s an elephant in my room!” 
“No there isn’t,”
her mother called back. “Elephants don’t live in houses. Everybody knows that.”
The elephant
yawned.

At breakfast, Lindi’s
dad asked her to pass the milk.
“I can’t,” said
Lindi. “The elephant drank it all.”

“There isn’t an
elephant,” said her dad. “Elephants don’t live in the city. Everybody knows that.”
The elephant
burped.

At school, the
teacher grumbled, “What’s wrong with this chalkboard? It’s all wrinkly!”
“That’s not the
chalkboard. That’s my elephant!” said Lindi.
“There are no
elephants at school,” said the teacher. “Everybody knows that.”
The elephant ate
the teacher’s sandwiches.

At break-time,
the elephant followed Lindi to the playground.
He knocked over
the swings by mistake.
“Go away!” said
Lindi. “You’re not real and you shouldn’t be here! Everybody knows that!”
The elephant
drooped. He walked away, wiping his eyes with his trunk.

After school,
Lindi couldn’t see the elephant anywhere.
“Elephant!” she
called. “Where are you?”

Lindi went home
without him. She felt lonely.
So she went
outside, and sat on the steps, and waited.
And waited. And
waited.

And then … She saw
a trunk. And tusks.
And ears.
The elephant was
coming down the road!

She ran up and
hugged him.
“I’m sorry,” she
said. “I didn’t mean it!
I know you’re
real. You’re my elephant.”

The elephant lifted her up and put her on his back, and she rode down the street.

She waved to her
neighbours.
“Hello, Mr Green!
Hello, Mrs Green!”
“Look at Lindi!”
said Mr Green. “How did she get up there? Maybe she grew!”
“Don’t be silly,”
said Mrs Green. “Little girls don’t grow that high. Everybody knows that.”

The elephant took
Lindi to the lake, and she slid down his trunk like it was a slide.
“Wheeeee!” she
shrieked.
They played all
afternoon, laughing and splashing and spraying each other with water.

That night, the
elephant tucked her into bed.
“Good night,
Elephant,” said Lindi. “Thank you for a lovely day.”
He patted her
head, and curled up to sleep outside her window.

“Elephants are
the best friends in the world,” Lindi said to herself. “Nobody knows that, except for me and my elephant.”
Once upon a time, not so far away, a baby called Phyllis was born for ballet.Two people in love, her Mom and her Dad, could not have known yet what a dancer they had.
When Phyllis was four she had us transfixed: impressing her teachers with ducky feet flicks.Before school and after, she danced every day. Nothing pleased Phyllis more than ballet.
The world would soon see, when, only fifteen, she travelled to London to live out her dream.Far from home and her friends, she was starting afresh. The Royal Ballet school would soon be impressed!
When she danced Swan Lake it was fit for the Queen! After years pirouetting, it was time to be seen! She took to the stage, leaping, twirling about, with everyone smiling! They clap and they shout!
From Mexico to Canada, the US to France, everyone asked her to visit and dance.With the Royal Ballet, and all of her friends, she spread love for dancing so it never would end.
Still, Phyllis missed home, they’d been too long apart. She longed to return and to make a fresh start.So she leaped and she bounded to her beautiful land, to walk once again on South African sand.

Dance isn’t just fun, as Phyllis well knew: she worked day and night, and with hard work she grew. Always smiling and tireless, through good times and tough, she aimed for her best. ‘Good’ was never enough.
Romeo and Juliet, Swan Lake and Giselle. She captured each audience under her spell.With Gary Burne beside her, Eduard Greyling too, her dancing was magic in every review.
Reward comes eventually, when you’re put to the test. And one day South Africa would call her the best. ‘Prima Ballerina Assoluta’, greatest dancer of all, her title forever. Phyllis wanted no more.
Soon Phyllis found love when she met Philip Boyd, a dancer himself! They were both overjoyed. In love, they soon married,and together they’d dance. No match could be better when given the chance!
They didn’t have children but never were sad, for they had a way to help all moms and dads.Their school, Dance For All, would give children a chance, from all walks of life, to learn and love dance.
Her gift to the world and all her success help others to realise they can be their best. They dance for us now, inspired by her feats, inspiring us, too, as we dream in our seats.
zho: 在很久很久以前，在一个不太遥远的地方，一个名为菲丽丝的婴儿为芭蕾舞而诞生。她的爸爸和妈妈，一对相爱的夫妻，还不知道他们即将迎接一名舞蹈家。
四岁的菲丽丝表现得非常出色。她小踢腿的动作在老师们的心中留下了深刻的印象。每天上学前和放学后，她都在跳舞。没有什么比跳芭蕾舞更让菲丽丝感到满足。
不久后，这个世界看着只有十五岁的她，远到伦敦去追逐她的梦想。远离自己的家乡和朋友，她开启了新的人生。皇家芭蕾舞学院很快就会肯定她的表现！
女王非常喜欢她表演的天鹅湖！练习了多年的足尖旋转后，她的努力终于被看见！她在台上跳跃和旋转，台下的每个人都微笑着欣赏！他们一边鼓掌，一边欢呼！
从墨西哥到加拿大，还有美国和法国，各个国家的人都邀请她去表演舞蹈。她与她的朋友带着皇家芭蕾舞的精神，将这份对跳舞的热爱散播于世界各地，让这份热爱得以延续。
可是，菲丽丝想家了。她已经离开家很长一段时间了。她期待回家后可以开始新的生活。因此，她一路跳跃地回到那美丽的国土，再次走在南非洲的沙地上。
舞蹈带来的不仅仅是欢乐。菲丽丝深知，她日日夜夜辛苦地排练，才使她在汗水中得已成长。不论是在愉快的时刻，或是在艰难的时刻，她一直保持微笑，也不曾感到疲惫。她的目标是要做到最好。“好”对她而言并不足够。
无论是罗密欧与朱丽叶、天鹅湖还是吉赛尔，她如魔法般的演出捕捉了每个观众的目光。无论是与盖瑞·伯恩共舞，或是于爱德华·格雷林共舞，她的表演总会获得好评。
经历各种考验后，你终究会得到回报。在未来的某一天，她会是南美洲最优秀的一位舞蹈家。“首席芭蕾舞者”和“最杰出的舞蹈家”，都会是她永远的头衔。菲丽丝已经别无所求。
不久后，菲丽丝遇见一名舞蹈员，菲利普·博伊德。她爱上了他！他们俩都十分高兴！相爱的他们很快就结婚了。他们总会一起跳舞。没有哪一对舞者比他们俩更匹配了！
他们没有自己的小孩，但他们并不感到悲伤，因为他们正在帮助着其他孩子的父母。他们创办的学校，名为大家舞蹈学校，让不同背景的孩子都有机会学习舞蹈并爱上舞蹈。
她成功的故事鼓励着其他人去成就最好的自己。她启发了那些正在为我们跳舞的舞蹈家，也启发了怀抱梦想的我们。
这是苏木的家。苏木懒得吃饭。如果他的饭菜里有蔬菜，他会生气。索姆不相信吃蔬菜会给你力量和改善你的健康。
Somu 努力说服 Amma 不要在他最喜欢的烹饪中使用蔬菜。但是妈妈，妈妈自己呢？他知道什么对他的孩子最好。
光看蔬菜就够了，Somu习惯打结。甜椒、西兰花、胡萝卜、豌豆和萝卜是 Somu 不喜欢的东西！
有一天，Somu 放学回家后得到了一个惊喜。厨房是空的——空的！他的肚子开始咕咕叫。他饿了。他的妹妹索尼也是。
阿玛睡在房间里；他冷得瑟瑟发抖！索尼开始担心了。苏木马上想了想，拨通了祖母的电话。奶奶说你给妈妈做热菜汤就好了。
索尼按照奶奶告诉她的方式在纸上写了下来。他对祖母说了声“谢谢”，然后开始工作。索木打开冰箱，站着看着里面的蔬菜。后来，Somu 和 Soni 列出了制作蔬菜汤所需的材料。
取出所有需要的蔬菜并清洗干净。小心地慢慢切断它们。
当 Soni 感叹 Amma 身体不舒服时，Somub 很生气，因为她在“喂菜”。奶奶叫她煲汤，这些以为很简单的孩子，现在才知道做菜不容易！苏木现在才知道，以前给大家做饭、照顾大家的阿玛每天都过得这么辛苦！
Somu 和 Soni 耐心地等待蔬菜煮熟。汤终于煮好了，他把它放在碗里，递给了阿玛。
Somu 和 Soni 都在没有家里长辈的帮助下准备汤！他们的幸福是无限的。现在妈妈可以喝汤，早日康复……
妈妈喝完汤就清醒了！他感谢孩子们的辛勤工作，并拥抱了他们。邻居们也很惊讶！现在，Somu 看到蔬菜就不会生气了。相反，他吃得很开心。 Somu现在相信吃蔬菜会给你力量，改善你的健康！ Amma、Somu 和 Soni 吃蔬菜。吃过了吗
eng: This is Somu's house. Somu is lazy in eating. If he got vegetables in his meal, he would get angry. Somu did not believe that eating vegetables would give you strength and improve your health.
Somu tried hard to convince Amma not to use vegetables in his favorite cooking. But mom, mom herself? He knew what was best for his children.
Just seeing vegetables is enough, Somu used to tie knots. Bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, peas and radishes are what Somu didn't like!
One day, Somu got a surprise when he came home after school. The kitchen was empty - empty! His stomach started rumbling. He was hungry. So does his sister Soni.

Amma was sleeping in the room; He was shivering in the cold! Soni started getting worried. Somu immediately thought and called his grandmother on the phone. Grandma said it would be good if you make hot vegetable soup for mom.

Soni wrote down on paper the way Grandma had told her. He said "thank you" to his grandmother and started working. Somu opened the fridge and stood looking at all the vegetables inside. Later, Somu and Soni made a list of what they needed to make the vegetable soup.
Remove all the required vegetables and wash them well. Carefully cut them off slowly.

When Soni lamented that Amma was not feeling well, Somub got angry because she was "feeding vegetables". When grandma told her to make soup, these children who thought it was very simple, now they know that cooking is not easy! Somu now realizes that every day, Amma, who used to cook for everyone and take good care of everyone, was having such a hard time!
Somu and Soni waited patiently for the vegetables to cook. When the soup was finally ready, he put it in a bowl and gave it to Amma.
Both Somu and Soni prepare the soup without the help of the elders of the house! Their happiness knew no bounds. Now mom can drink soup and get well soon...

Mom sobered up after drinking the soup! He appreciated the hard work of the children and hugged them. Neighbors were also surprised! Now Somu doesn't get upset when he sees vegetables. Instead he eats happily. Somu now believes that eating vegetables will give you strength and improve your health! Amma, Somu and Soni ate vegetables. have you eaten

zho:
你好！
我的名字是露露。
我有很多朋友，
讓我來介紹你認識！
太陽先生， 早上好！你讓大地變得明亮温暖。

小草，你好！
你綠綠油油的，
讓我們有地方跑，
可以開心玩耍。

天空，你好！
很大很大的一片，
藍得真美，
還有白雲在飛。

月亮小姐，你好！
你就像一盞明燈，
讓黑夜不太黑暗。

小星星，你們好！
一閃一閃亮晶晶，
掛在天空放光明。

風兒，你好！
你可以很強大，
也可以很温柔。
吹得葉兒團團轉，
令人感到舒服。

小雨點，你好！
謝謝你帶來雨水，
讓天氣變得涼快。

閃電大俠，你好！
你會突然在天空中劃過。
雷公先生，你好！
你總是很大聲，嚇人一跳。

小小露水，你好！
你們滋潤了大地。

大樹先生，你好！
你長得強壯健康，
讓我們有樹蔭休息，
有美味的果實吃。

鳥兒，你好！
你的美妙歌聲，
讓每天變得更美好。
eng: My name is Lolo. I have many friends. Come out with me to say hello!
Hello Sun, big and bright. You fill the day with your bright light.
Hello Grass, soft and green. You give us all a place to play.
Hello Sky, broad and blue. You fill the sky with the colour blue.
Hello Moon, up in the dark. You make the night not so dark.
Hello Star, big and white. You make the night so very nice.
Hello Wind, strong and free. You blow things around, and make it cool.
Hello Rain, pouring down. You bring water, and cool our ground.
Hello Lightning, from high above. Your bright flashing light gives us a fright.Hello Thunder, roaring in the rain. You make a boom noise, so very loud.
Hello Dew, drops of water. You make the ground soft and wet.
Hello Tree, big and strong. You give us shade and fruit to eat.
Hello Bird, flying in the sky. You fill our days with lovely songs.

“Imma... Appa... come
quick!” cried Langlen.

Langlen’s
parents found her crouching by the almirah watching three kittens
playing with each other, mewling softly. 

“Imma...”
started Langlen.

“Shhh,
softly,” said Imma. “Kittens are easily scared.”

Suddenly, a
big orange cat jumped in from the window. She ignored them and
briskly went by and lay down. The three kittens rushed over and
started suckling. 

Langlen and
her parents tiptoed out.

Langlen
asked, “Wasn’t the grey one the Mamma-Cat’s kitten as well?” 

“It was,”
replied Appa.

“They why
wasn’t it orange? Like the Mamma-Cat?”

“Maybe
the Pappa-Cat is grey.”

As Langlen
was thinking about it, Appa continued, “The grey kitten has
colouring like the Pappa-Cat, just like Langlen has curly hair like
Appa!”

“But
everyone says I look just like Imma. See, we even have clefts on our
chins, which makes it look like our chins are divided.”

“You have
a bit of both of us, because you are our
sweet Langlen,” said Imma hugging her tight.

“Does the
grey kitten also have a bit from both Pappa-Cat and Mamma-Cat?”

“Yes. All
creatures with two parents have traits
from both parents,” explained Appa.

“A trait?
Oh wait, let me guess. Would my curly hair be called a trait?”

“Yes,
that’s a trait, Langlen. Any quality or characteristic you have is
a trait. Can you think of others?” asked Imma.

“Hmm... my
height?”

“Yes,
that’s another. The colour of your eyes, shape of your ears, length
of your fingers and toes, and shape of your nose are all some of your
characteristics,” explained Imma. 

“My curly
hair is a trait from Appa and cleft chin is a trait from Imma. Did
you get those traits from your
parents?”

“YES! You
catch on quick. And they got their traits from their
parents,” said Imma.

“But,”
asked Langlen puzzled, “neither my grandmas nor my grandpas have
cleft chins. Where did you get the trait from?”

“Sometimes
traits skip a generation or more. My grandfather, whom I called Pupu, had a cleft chin. His children, which included my mother, did not have that
trait. Then I got it and passed it on to you.”

“This
makes me just a collection of traits from all of you,” said
Langlen, a little sadly. 

Imma
quickly hugged her. “No, Langlen. The passing of traits from
parents to children is called heredity.
We might share traits, but each one of us is different. Your
combination of traits makes you unique!”

“Look at
me, Langlen,” said Appa. “I’m completely unique. Very tall,
with long and curly hair on my head, face and ears. I am also the man
with the widest feet in the world. What would you do if you had long
curly hair on your ears?"

“Hmm.... I
would plait it, Appa, and put colourful rubber-bands!”

Imma smiled
at the two of them. “Women don’t have ear hair, Langlen, but you
seem to have got your father’s trait for silly humour!”
﻿

Appa went
out of the room and Langlen snuggled into Imma’s lap. “I have one
more question. *Ebok always says you had dimples like her. Where did
they go?”

Laughing,
Imma said, “I did get my mother’s trait for dimples. But then,
every trait has many influences. Some influences made it come and
others made it disappear.”
*Ebok: Grandmother in Manipuri

Appa came
back with a covered plate. “I am the influence which has made these
yummy things magically appear on this plate!” So saying, he pulled
the napkin off the plate. It was filled with hot vadas.

“And we
are the influences which will make them disappear?” said Langlen,
stuffing her mouth without waiting for an answer.

Understand
the Difficult Words:
Imma:
Mother in Manipuri

Ebok:
Grandmother in ManipuriPupu: Grandfather in Manipuri
Cleft:
Divided

Traits:
Characteristic in a person, e.g., curly hair, cleft chin, dimples

Heredity:
Passing of traits from parents to children
Generation:
All the people that are born and live in about the same time
Unique:
One of a kind
Influence:
To have an effect on something
Vadas:
Fried savoury dish

Make Your Own Family TreeAs you may have already guessed, Langlen's mother is from Manipur and father from Tamil Nadu. Would you like to map out your own family tree just as Langlen did (pg 7 & 8)? Grab a paper and pen, and do it right away! If you get lost, you can always ask your parents for help.

WHAT WOULD YOUR IMAGINARY PET LOOK LIKE?Straight or curly hair? Round nose or triangular nose? One leg, two legs or many more legs? A tail like a dog's or lion's? Draw your own imaginary pet with all kinds of traits. Mix it up and let your imagination run wild!
zho: “妈妈…… 爸爸……快过来！”兰格恩哭喊着。兰格恩的父母发现她蹲在橱柜旁，看着三只小猫正在玩耍。小猫轻声地啜泣。“妈妈……”兰格恩说。“嘘，小点声。”妈妈说。“小猫很容易受到惊吓。”
突然，一只大橘猫从窗口跳进来。它轻快地走过他们面前，无视他们的存在，随后便躺了下来。那三只小猫立刻冲过去，然后开始喝奶。 兰格恩和她的父母踮着脚离开了。
兰格恩问道： “那只小灰猫难道不是那只大猫的孩子吗？”“它是啊！”爸爸回答。“那么，它为什么不是橘色的？为什么它和它的妈妈不一样呢？”“或许它的爸爸是灰色的。”兰格恩还在思考着，爸爸便接着说：“那只小灰猫的毛发和它爸爸的毛发一样都是灰色的，就像你的头发和爸爸的头发一样都是卷卷的！”
“可是，大家都说我长得像妈妈。你看看，我们的下巴都有一条美人沟，它使我们的下巴看起来像分裂了一样。”“因为你是我们的甜心兰格恩，所以你身上有我们两个的特征。”妈妈紧抱着她说。“那么，那只小灰猫身上也有它的爸爸和妈妈的特征吗？”

“是的。任何有父母的生物都会遗传它的父母的特征。”爸爸解释。 “特征？等等，让我猜猜。我的卷发也是一个特征吗？”“是的，兰格恩，那是一个特征。你的任何特点和特质都是一个特征。你还可以想到其他的特证吗？”妈妈问。“嗯，我的身高呢？”“是的，那也一个特征。你眼睛的颜色，你耳朵的形状，你手指和脚趾的长度，和你鼻子的形状都是你的特征。”妈妈解释。“我的卷发是遗传自爸爸，我的美人沟是遗传自妈妈。那么，你们的特征也是遗传自你们的父母吗？”“是的！你理解得很快。他们的特征也遗传自他们的父母。”妈妈说。

“可是…… 外公和外婆都没有美人沟。你怎么会遗传这个特征？”兰格恩困惑地问道。“特征有时是隔代遗传的。我的外公有美人沟。他所有的孩子，包括我的妈妈，都没有遗传这个特征。反而是我遗传了他的美人沟，然后再把它遗传给你。”“那么，我只不过是遗传了你们所有人的特征。”兰格恩有些难过地说。妈妈赶紧抱着她。“不是的，兰格恩。父母把特征遗传给孩子。我们的某些特征或许是一样的，但是我们终究是不一样的人。你集结了各种特征，使得你独一无二！”
“看看我，兰格恩。”爸爸说。“我是独一无二的。我长得很高。我的头上有又长又卷的头发。我的脸上有又长又卷的毛发。我的耳朵有又长又卷的耳毛。我是世界上脚掌最宽的男人。如果你也有又长又卷的耳发，你会怎么做呢？”
“嗯…… 爸爸，我会把它编成辫子，并绑上五颜六色的橡皮筋！”妈妈对着他们俩微笑。“女人没有耳毛，兰格恩，但你似乎遗传了你爸爸的幽默感！”
爸爸离开了房间。兰格恩依偎在妈妈的大腿上。“我还有一个疑问 。外婆说你以前和她一样都有酒窝。它们到哪里去了？” 妈妈笑着说：“我确实是遗传了我妈妈的酒窝。但是，每一个特征都附有许多影响因素。有些影响因素使它可以显现出来，有些影响因素却使它消失。”
爸爸端着一个盘子回来了。那个盘子被一块布盖着。“我就是那个可以使美食神奇地出现在盘子上的影响因素。”说着，他把布掀起。盘子里装着热腾腾的炸豆饼。“而我们就是那个可以使它们消失的影响因素，对吗？”兰格恩说。她的父母还没有回答，她就已经迫不及待地把食物塞进嘴里。
了解生字：美人沟：下巴的中间有一条浅浅的沟特征：一个人身上的特点, 如：卷发、美人沟、酒窝遗传：父母将自己的特征传给孩子 代：差不多同一时间一起生活的人独一无二：特别 影响因素：使事物发生变化的原因
画出你的家族树你或许已经猜到了, 兰格恩的妈妈来自印度曼尼普尔邦，而他的爸爸来自印度泰米尔纳德邦。兰格恩画出了她的家族树（第七页和第八页），你想不想也画出你的家族树呢？拿出一张纸和一支笔，马上画吧！如果你不太确定，可以请爸爸妈妈帮忙噢！
你想象中的宠物长什么样子呢？它的毛发是直的还是卷的？它的鼻子是圆形还是三角形的? 一条腿，两条腿还是很多条腿？像狗的尾巴还是像狮子的尾巴？ 画出你想象中的宠物的特征。把那些特征拼凑在一起，尽情地发挥你的想象力吧！
有一天，妹妹和我一起走在馬路旁邊。
一輛大卡車正從山上往下開。
一輛小汽車正在加速上坡。
大卡車司機正在講電話，他沒有專心看著路。
大卡車撞上了小汽車!
救護車和警察都一起來幫忙
兩輛拖車來了。一輛拖走大卡車，另一輛拖走小汽車。
妹妹和我看見了全部經過，我們都嚇到了。
eng:
One day my sister
and I were walking near the road.

A big truck was
driving down the hill.

A car was
speeding up the hill.

The truck driver
was talking on his mobile phone. He was not looking at the road.

The truck smashed
into the car!

An ambulance and
the police came to help.

Two tow trucks
came. One towed the truck. The other towed the car.

We saw
everything. 
We were shocked.

One
day, an ant went looking for food. She found a sprouted green mung bean in the kitchen.

The
ant tried to pick up the green mung bean. It was very heavy. The ant
then started to pull it to take it home. Her home was far away.

On
her way home, someone had left a tap open.Water was flowing from
it.
The
tiny ant thought it was a river! Somehow, she crossed it. Her home
was very far away.

Then
the ant saw a bucket. She held on to the green mung bean and tried to
climb it. She tried hard but she kept slipping down.

Soon
another ant came up to her. They talked to each other. Now, they both
went around the bucket while pulling the green mung bean.

Further
ahead, a woman was cleaning her house. Swoof! The ant fell to one
side and the green mung bean fell on the other.
The
ant ran to get her green mung bean. Her home was still very far away.

Next,
the ant came close to a sleeping dog. The dog sneezed loudly! The
green mung bean rolled off near the dog’s mouth.

The
ant carefully went near the dog. The dog opened one eye and looked at
the ant. The ant took the green mung bean and began walking. Her home
was very far away.

Close
by, a chick was pecking on some grains. It saw the green mung bean
and tried to peck on it. Ah, now my green mung bean is gone, thought
the ant sadly. Just then, the chick’s mother called out from under
the papaya tree.  Cluck!
Cluck! Cluck!

The
chick left the green mung bean behind, and ran towards its mother. Once again, the ant picked up the green mung bean and started walking
home. Her home was still... Oh, it was right in front of her now!

Do
you know your beans?
The
ant in this book found a green mung bean with a sprout. Sprouted
beans are very good for our health. We can make sprouts with pulses
like rajma, chickpea, black gram and horse gram.
Bean
Games
Get
to know the different kinds of pulses by playing this game with your friends. Ask an adult to give you different kinds of pulses from your kitchen, like chickpea, rajma, toor dal, soy bean, mung bean and peas and learn their names.
Put
them all in one bowl. Blind-fold
one person. She has to feel the pulses and guess the name. See how
many she gets right. Another way to play this game is to make all the players close their eyes. Then, everyone tries to separate the different kinds of pulses into different groups.
zho: 這天，一隻螞蟻正在找食物。她在廚房發現了一顆剛發芽的綠豆。
螞蟻嘗試撿起綠豆。綠豆太重了，於是螞蟻決定托著它回家。她家在好遠好遠的地方。
在回家的路上，有人忘了關水龍頭，水流涓涓流下。小小的螞蟻以為這是一條河！最後，她成功渡過了。
後來螞蟻看到一個桶子。她舉起綠豆並試著爬上桶子。她很努力的爬，卻一直滑下來。
很快的又來了一隻螞蟻。他們開始聊天。現在，他們一同走到桶子邊，協力的拉著綠豆。
再往前走，一個女生正在打掃房子。咻！螞蟻被吹到一邊，綠豆則滾到另一邊。螞蟻趕快跑去把她的綠豆撿回來！
接下來，螞蟻悄悄經過一隻正在睡覺的狗狗。狗狗大聲的打鼾著！綠豆卻滾到了狗狗嘴邊...
螞蟻小心翼翼的靠近，狗狗睜開一隻眼睛，看著螞蟻。螞蟻拿起綠豆掉頭就走。家，還在遙遠的另一端。
不久，又遇到一隻正在啄稻穀的小雞。綠豆也被它搶走了。「啊喔... 現在我的綠豆沒了」螞蟻傷心的想著。
雞媽媽出現了，小雞放下綠豆衝去找媽媽！螞蟻再次撿起綠豆，一步一步走回家。還有好長好長的路途等著她...

﻿你認識豆子嗎？文中的螞蟻找到一個剛發芽的綠豆。小豆芽對健康很好，可以搭配鷹嘴豆、黑豆、扁豆等料理出影養的美食。與豆子相關的小遊戲藉由和朋友們玩小遊戲來認識不同種類的豆子。請一位大人幫忙從廚房拿出不同種的豆子，如鷹嘴豆、紅豆、黃豆、綠豆、碗豆，並學習他們的名字。把那些豆子通通放入一個碗裡。矇上一位玩家的雙眼，讓她用觸覺感受豆子並猜出豆子的名字。另一種玩法是讓所有玩家都閉上雙眼，然後大家一起嘗試將不同種類的豆子分堆。

eng: Pa is getting my hat.
Pa is tall.
Ma is getting my shirt.
Pa is taller than Ma.

My sister Lalita is getting my book.

(In English we call younger sister also as 'Sister')
Ma is taller than my sister.
My brother Vinay is getting my bag.
My sister Lalita is taller than my brother Vinay.
And my brother Vinay is taller than me.
I’m the shortest in the family.
Oh wait! There is our puppy, JoJo.
Jojo is getting my slippers.
Ha ha! JoJo is the shortest.
Yes! JoJo is shorter than me.
I’m shorter than my brother Vinay.
My brother Vinay is shorter than my sister Lalita.
My sister is shorter than Ma.
Ma is shorter than Pa.
Wow! Pa is the tallest, and JoJo is the shortest.
zho: 爸爸在给我拿帽子。
爸爸个子很高。
妈妈在给我拿上衣。
爸爸比妈妈高。
姐姐在给我拿书。
妈妈比姐姐高。
哥哥在给我拿包。
姐姐比哥哥高。
哥哥又比我高。
我是家里最矮的那个。
诶，等一下！我们有只狗狗—卓卓。
卓卓帮我拿拖鞋。
哈哈！卓卓是最矮的那个！
是的！卓卓比我矮。
我比我的哥哥矮。
我的哥哥比我的姐姐矮。
我的姐姐比妈妈矮。
妈妈比爸爸矮。
哇！爸爸是最高的，而卓卓是最矮的。

eng:
Nita's
hanging upside down,
her
long hair tickling at the ground.


The trees, the grass, the everythingis all the wrong way round.

Her feet, they poke into the sky.Little Navi's walking by.
He says, 'I've seen you here before.You're upside down again! What for?'

Her feet swim lightly in the air.
She
tries to hide behind her hair.


'It's
h-h-h-hard to t-t-talk', she says to him.
'I'm
not the same. I don't fit in.'

Navi
takes her by the hand.
He
wants to help her understand.


They
climb to Navi's look-out spot.
From
up here they can see a lot.


They
perch and have a quiet stare
at
children playing here and there.

Those
kids are not the same at all.Abe's round.

Chi's
freckled.
Lala's extra tall.
BamBam's wild and must run free,

while
Lulu's reading quietly.

Look
at Freya's crazy hair.
And Tim wears glasses everywhere.

And
me, I am just skin and bone.
And
you are you. You're not alone.
Each
human's sort of strange, you see.
That
makes you just the same, like me.



This
world is really one big game.
To
play, we can’t all be the same.

Nita
feels the right way round,
thanks
to the new friend she’s found.


Upside
down was never fun.
Now
she plays with everyone.
zho: 妮塔倒挂着，长长的头发飘到了地上。那些树呀，草呀什么的，在她眼里全都反过来了。
她的脚伸到了天上。小纳威路过，问妮塔：“我在这里见过你，你怎么又倒挂着啦？”
妮塔看着纳威的脚在风中轻轻晃动。她想躲进头发后面。“我不-不-不会说-说-说话，我和大家都不一样。”
纳威拉着她的手，带她一起去找答案。他们爬上了一棵大树，从高高的树上可以看得很远很远。
他们看到很多其他小朋友，大家都各有不同。阿比是胖胖的。
琪琪脸上有小雀斑。
拉拉长得很高很高。
那个活泼又好动的是班班。
而露露呢，则在角落里安静地读书。
弗莱娅有一头蓬松的头发。
提姆走到哪儿都戴着一副眼镜。
而小纳威呢，则是精瘦精瘦的。“所以你看，我们每个人都不一样呀。你并不孤单。”小纳威对妮塔说。就是因为每个人都是不一样的烟火，这个世界才多姿多彩。
妮塔终于不再难过困惑啦。她也不再一个人倒挂着了，和小朋友们一起开心地玩耍起来。
曼珠对钥匙和锁非常着迷。她特别喜欢听见钥匙打开锁时发出的轻柔的金属声。曼珠最喜欢的玩具就是妈妈绑在曼珠的纱丽上的一串钥匙。曼珠喜欢探索钥匙孔深处的秘密。每天，曼珠去上学的路上都会经过村子里的锁匠兰吉特的店铺。她喜欢听锁匠用工具制作新钥匙的时候，工具间发出的摩擦声。
有一天，曼珠的妈妈需要为她的衣橱配一把新钥匙。曼珠陪她一起去了锁匠兰吉特的店铺。兰吉特拿起一片扁扁的金属片。“这是什么？”曼珠问。
“这是一把原始钥匙。”兰吉特回答。然后他举起曼珠妈妈给他的钥匙，说：“你能看到这些像山峰一样的尖锐的部分和像河谷一样弯曲的部分吗？你家的衣橱锁里也有这些像山峰和河谷一样的部分。这把钥匙的山峰和河谷正好可以和那把锁里的构造匹配。所以当你转动钥匙的时候，那把锁才会开！我现在就要把这把旧钥匙上像山峰和河谷一样弯弯曲曲的部分复制到这把新钥匙上。然后这把新钥匙就能打开衣柜啦！‘’
回到家，曼珠一刻不停地谈论着锁匠。她把锁匠说的话告诉隔壁的穆妮拉阿姨，甚至还对着一只看上去非常无聊，花了半分钟舔自己脸的小猫谈论那个锁匠。当晚，曼珠的表姐丽珠来家里作客时，曼珠也忍不住和她谈论起来。丽珠在大学读书，未来想成为一名工程师。
“丽珠，你知道如果你想给锁配一把新钥匙，你必须把旧钥匙上那些像山峰和河谷的部分复制到一把空钥匙上吗？”曼珠问。
“真的吗？如果是这样，那么妈妈就能保管好钥匙了。否则谁都能复制这把钥匙，然后偷我们的东西！”丽珠说。“是的！”“这就是我正在研究的东西！”丽珠说。
“嗯？制作钥匙？”曼珠问。“和制作钥匙很类似，我们把需要保管好的东西锁起来，就像把纱丽存放在衣柜里一样，对不对？”丽珠答。曼珠点点头。“那么假如你需要保管的东西是信息呢？”“比如？”曼珠问。“比如你存进银行账户里有多少钱，或者你最好的朋友的秘密，或者是祖母传给你妈妈的秘制菜谱。”“哦，我们必须好好保管这些东西。”曼珠认同地说。
“如果我们必须保护好这些信息，我们就必须把它放到安全的地方，锁起来！有很多安全的地方，比如我的电脑，我经常把大学的课堂笔记存在里面。”丽珠说。“如果你想看我写的东西，你必须在这里输入密码。”说着，丽珠打开电脑。“什么是密码？”曼珠很想知道。
“密码就像一把钥匙。就像拼图一样，只有当钥匙和锁的形状匹配的时候，衣柜的门才能打开。如果要打开我的电脑，就必须输入一个和我之前设置好的密码相匹配的密码。如果你把密码告诉了别人，那么他们也能打开你的电脑了。所以你不要轻易把密码告诉别人。”“嗯，如果我有一台电脑，我该怎么设置密码呢？”曼珠大声提问。
“如果有些人把出生日期，宠物的名字，或者住址设置成密码，那么他们的密码就会很容易被猜出来。一个好的密码应该有些难度。越长的密码越难猜。如果密码里面同时包含数字和字母，就更好了。但是也不要设置一个太难记的密码。”就在这时，曼珠的妈妈来叫丽珠，丽珠跑出去和阿姨打招呼。叮！丽珠的手机响了。
那会是什么？是新游戏吗？丽珠有最好玩的游戏！曼珠过去经常在晚上缠着丽珠玩游戏。今天她要自己玩。曼珠在丽珠的手机上按下一个键。屏幕亮了起来。一个数字键盘出现了。需要输入密码！
曼珠输入了1234.“密码错误”屏幕上提示。然后她试了0000，但是手机还是没能解锁。她试着输入丽珠的生日，10-10-97。“嘿！”丽珠喊道。
“我已经用密码把我的手机锁起来了，而且我没有把密码给调皮的小女孩。”曼珠听了，吐了吐舌头。
“现在你知道密码有多么重要了吧，曼珠。他们就像钥匙一样把我们的东西保管好。”丽珠说。“是的，可我知识想玩一些手机游戏！”曼珠说。“那你需要问一下我”丽珠说道，输入了密码。“我给你看个新游戏——猜密码！”
和曼珠一起玩：这个游戏里有猜密码的线索，试试看你能不能找出来。手机密码：1.曼珠比丽珠小9岁。如果曼珠用自己的生日年份设置密码，这个密码会是什么呢？2.如果丽珠的密码是把出生日期倒过来，密码会是什么样呢？3.还记得曼珠尝试的第一个密码吗？顺序颠倒一下，会是什么呢？答案：1.20062.7901013.4321

你找到这些线索了吗？记住，如果你可以解开，那么别人也可以。所以我在这里提供一些注意事项供你参考：1.不要把密码设置得太短（比如123，xyz，abcd都是弱密码）2.用脑子记住你的密码，这样你就不需要用笔记下来了。如果你写下来，可能会有人找到这些密码。3.大小写字母都要有（ComPUteR）4.不要用那种特别容易猜的词语（比如你的学校名称，狗狗的名字，或是住址）密码可以打开手机，电脑，银行的保管库，网站上的账号和其他很多东西。现在指纹和视网膜也可以当做密码了。这些被称作生物识别密码。
你的手指在屏幕上滑动的特定轨迹也可以被设置成密码。就像这样：
eng: Manju was fascinated by locks and keys. The soft metallic sound of a key turning in a lock made her happy. The key bunch Mummy kept tied to her saree was Manju’s favourite toy.She loved to explore the mysterious depths of keyholes. Manju passed the village locksmith Ranjith’s shop on her way to school every day. She loved to listen to the rasping of the tools as he made new keys.
One day, Mummy needed to get a new key for her almirah. Manju went with her to Ranjith’s shop.Ranjith picked up a flat piece of metal. “What is this?” Manju asked.

“This is a blank key,” replied Ranjith.Then he held up Mummy’s key and said, “See these pointy bits that look like mountains? And these curvy bits that look like valleys? Your almirah lock also has mountains and valleys inside it. The key’s mountains and valleys fit that pattern. So when you turn the key, the lock opens!I am copying the mountains and valleys from the old key to the new one. So the new key will also open the almirah.”

Back home, Manju couldn’t stop talking about the locksmith. She told
Munira Aunty, who lived next door. She even told her cat, who stopped licking
his face for half a minute and looked bored. When her cousin Riju came to visit
that evening, she told her too. Riju was studying to be an engineer.
“Do you know, Riju didi,” Manju said, “if you want to make a new key for a lock, you have to copy the pattern of mountains and valleys from the old key to a blank key?”

“Really?” said Riju. “Then it’s a very good thing that Mummy keeps the keys safe. Otherwise anyone could copy the key and steal our things!”“That’s true!”“This is the sort of thing that I am studying,” said Riju.

“What, making keys?” asked Manju.“Something similar,” replied Riju. “We lock up things we want to keep safe, like the sarees in our almirah, right?”Manju nodded.“But what if the thing you want to keep safe is information?” “Like what, Riju didi?” asked Manju.“Like how much money you have in your bank account. Or your best friend’s secret.Or the notebook of recipes passed down from our grandmother to your mother.”“Oh yes, we need to keep those safe,” agreed Manju.

“If we have to protect this information, we have to
put it in a safe place and lock it! There are many safe places. Like my
computer, where I keep my college notes,” said Riju.
She opened her laptop. “To see my work, you have to
type the password here!” 

“What’s a password?” Manju wanted to know.

“A password is like a key. The almirah’s lock opens only when the pattern on the key fits the pattern in the lock, like a jigsaw puzzle. My computer will only open if the password I type matches the password I have set. If you tell anyone the password, they can open it too! So you have to be very careful whom you give your password to.” “Hmmm… When I get a computer, what should I set as my password?”  Manju wondered aloud.

“Some people’s passwords are really easy to guess – their date of birth, their pet’s name, or the name of their street. A good password is difficult to guess. The longer it is, the harder it is to guess. It is better if it has letters and numbers. But a password should also be easy to remember.”Just then, Mummy called Riju, who ran off to greet her aunt. TING! went Riju’s mobile.

What might that be? A new game? Riju had the best
games! Manju often spent her evenings pestering her cousin to let her play.
Today, she would play them by herself.
Manju pressed a button on her
cousin’s phone. The screen lit up. A keypad with numbers appeared. It needed a
password!

She pressed 1234. “Incorrect password” appeared on the screen. Then she
tried 0000, but the phone did not unlock. She also tried Riju’s birthday,
10-10-97.
“Hoi!” That was Riju.

“I’ve locked my phone with a password,” she said.
“And I don’t give it to nosey little girls.” Manju stuck her tongue out.

“Now do you see why passwords are so important, Manju?” Riju said. “They’re like keys to the things we want to keep private.” “Yes, didi,” said Manju. “I only wanted to play some games!” “And you only had to ask!” Riju said, typing in her password. “Let me show you a new game – Guess the Password!”

Play with Manju This game gives you clues to passwords. See if you can crack them. Phone passwords 1. Manju is nine years younger than her cousin. If Manju chooses her birth year as her password, what would it be?  2. If Riju’s password is her date of birth backwards, it would be... 3. Remember the first password Manju tried on Riju’s phone? What’s that in reverse order? Answers:  1. 2006 2. 790101 3. 4321

Did you solve the clues? Remember, if you did, others can too. So here are some simple dos and don’ts: 1. Don’t keep passwords that are too short (123, xyz, abcd are weak passwords). 2. Remember your password so that you do not have to write it down. If you write it down, someone might be able to find it.  3. Use both upper and lower cases (ComPUteR).4. Don’t use words that are easy to guess (The name of your school, dog or town).Passwords are used to ‘unlock’ or open mobile phones, computers, safety vaults in banks, our accounts on websites, and many other things.Fingerprints and retina scans are also used as passwords. These are called bio-metric passwords.
A password could also be a set pattern you trace on the screen.                                                      Like this:
Good morning!
Morning!
How are you?
I'm fine, thank you!
Hello!
Hi!
Good evening!
Good night. Sweet dreams.
zho: 早上好！
早！
你好吗？
我很好，谢谢！
你好！
你好啊！
晚上好！
晚安。好梦。

eng: This is Mary. Mary is 5 years old, just like you.
One day, Mary was not feeling very well. Her tummy was hurting very much. She did not know what to do so she yelled for her mom.
Her mom came running to her room to find out what was wrong with Mary. Mary did not look very good, so she decided to take Mary to the hospital to find out what was wrong with her.

On their way to the hospital, Mary was very scared of what the doctor was going to do to her. She even started crying. Her mom, hugged her tight and assured her that everything was going to be all right and that the doctors are going to make her feel better.
Once at the hospital, Mary was very calm. The doctor examined her hear, throat, ears and found that Mary had a stomach bug and that she needed to take some medicine in order to feel better.
On their way home, they went to the pharmacy to pick up Mary's medicine in hopes of it making her feel better.
Once at home, Mary felt so much better thanks to the medicine the doctor gave to her.
zho: 她叫玛丽，像你一样十五岁。
一天她觉得不舒服，她的头很疼，她不知道做什么？她对她的妈妈大叫。
她的妈妈快快地进了她的房间，想知道她怎么了。玛丽来起来不好，所以她决定带玛丽去医院，想知道她怎么了
在去医院的路上，玛丽很怕，她怕医生对她要做什么。她开始哭了。
到医院后，玛丽很安静，医生检查了她的心跳，耳朵，和喉咙。发现她感冒了，她需要吃一点药，就会好了。
在回家的路上，她们去药房拿了药，她们希望玛丽吃了药会觉得好一些。
到家以后，玛丽吃了医生的药，感觉好多了。
去買東西時，
我一定會帶自己的購物袋，這樣就不用浪費膠袋。
﻿我不會到處亂拋垃圾，不能回收的東西，要放入垃圾筒。
如果是可以回收的資源，我會分類好，然後放入回收箱。
如果有朋友亂拋垃圾，
我會提醒他們怎樣做才對。
當沒有人在房間，我會順手關燈。
我從不浪費食物，吃多少就拿多少。
﻿我不會整天只看電視﻿，﻿
我會跑到外面，和朋友玩耍。
我不會讓水龍頭一直開著，水是很珍貴的，一點一滴也要珍惜。
我請家人和朋友也一起節省用水，例如可以用洗澡水來淋花。
不再需要的書和玩具，我會送給別人，或和朋友交換。
可以的話，我們會使用公共交通工具，讓城巿少一點廢氣。
自行車也是很好的出行工具呢！
步行更是最好的運動！
紙是用樹木造的，我珍惜用紙，一張紙可以兩面用。
﻿我也愛惜樹木和植物，珍惜大自然給我們的一切。
給家中的植物淋水，照顧它好好長大。
因為大自然很神奇，給予我們生命的色彩。
我們愛護地球，因為我們都是地球的孩子！﻿
eng: When I go shopping...
I do not use plastic bagsbut I use cloth bags instead.
I never litter.I put all my rubbishin the bin.
I recycle and sort my rubbish into different bins.
When I see other people littering...
I remind them of the right thing to do.
I always turn off the lightswhen I am the last personto leave the room.
I do not overfill my plate,so I do not waste food.
I try not to watch too much TV...
...and spend my timeplaying outside instead.
I turn off the tap while brushing my teeth, to make sure I do not waste water. Water is precious.
I remind my family and friendsto re-use their bathwaterto water the plants.
I give away or exchange booksand toys I do not need anymore.
Instead of travelling by car, myfamily and I try to take the bus...
or cycle...
or walk.
I save our treesby drawing on both sidesof the paper.
I plant herbs and flowers in the garden and help to keep our earth green...
I water themto help them grow.
I make my own coloursfrom flowers and vegetables.
We are the children of Gelsenkirchen!

zho: 阿木住在一間茅草屋。
圖拉尼住在方形的屋子。
這間房子是長方形的。
這間房子的屋頂是三角形。
這位男生在蓋自己的房子。
這間房子是新的。
這間房子是舊的。
我想住這個房子裡。
eng: Mzi lives in a thatched house.
Thulani lives in a square house.
This house is a rectangle.
The roof of this house is a triangle.
This man is building his own house.
This house is new.
This house is old.
I wish I lived in this house.

zho: 库纳尔非常喜欢上网。他经常用他妈妈的手机去看视频。“不要看太久，不然你会陷进去”妈妈提醒他。
“我在哪里？”库纳尔降落在了一个奇怪火车站的站台上。在他周围，有非常多的火车呼啸驶过。一个信号在他的头上弹出。那是“核心路由器”
“我是怎么来到这里的呢？库纳尔惊叹道。“我怎么才能出去呢？”这是库纳尔看到一位女士站在月台上。她看起来非常繁忙的在指挥所有的火车。“打扰一下，阿姨。这些火车都是去哪里的呢？库纳尔问到。
“我是交通控制处，”她说，非常忙，“但是你可以叫我TCP，这些或者正载着数据去到互联网的不同地方。”
库纳尔观看着她的双手在TCP的屏幕上来回的移动东西。“哇哦，”库纳尔说。“你在做什么，TCP阿姨？”“我当然是在网络上指挥数据交通喽，”TCP回答道。“所有的事情必须移动的非常快，非常快，非常快！”火车们呼啸而过，运载着数据去到不同的方向。
“这里”TCP说到。“你将会被加密，这样其他人就不会在半路中把你抢走。”TCP将一个帽子和傻傻的带有鼻子和胡子的眼镜给了库纳尔，并让他带好，作为伪装。“你确实是非常敏感的数据！”她说。“再见，TCP阿姨！”库纳尔高兴的回复到。
库纳尔移动的非常快。他的手和腿很痛。这时-他突然出现在了家中，他回家了。“我亲爱的！”妈妈说。“非常开心你能回来。接下来，你要通过阅读了解学习互联网，但是不要在迷失在互联网中了。”库纳尔热爱互联网，但他更热爱在家。
什么时互联网？互联网是让不同的电脑，手机，平板电脑相互链接的名称。它是一个可以将信息扩散到世界每个角落的系统。它让我们将数据通过电缆，光纤，无线电波和卫星网络传输到不同的电脑设备上。每一个连接到网络上的设备都有一个独特的号码叫做IP地址。
eng:
Kunal loved the Internet. He was always asking Mummy for her phone so he could watch videos.

“Don’t watch for too long or you’ll get pulled in!” Mummy warned him.

First, Kunal watched a video of cartoon ninjas. 
Next, he watched one of a volcano spewing lava. 
Then, he watched one of a baby playing with a dog. 
With each video, Kunal’s face came closer
and closer to the screen.
Suddenly—SCHWOOOOOP!—
Kunal was sucked into the Internet.

“Where am I?”
Kunal had landed on a platform in a strange train station.All around him, trains whooshed in and out through tunnels.A sign popped up above his head. It read “Core Router”.

“How did I get here?” Kunal wondered. “And how will I get out?”
Then Kunal saw a woman on the platform. She looked very busy directing the trains.
“Excuse me, aunty. Where are all these trains going?” Kunal asked her.
“I’m Transmission ControlProtocol,” she said, busily,“But you can call me TCP.These trains are taking data to different parts of the Internet.”

Kunal watched TCP as her hands swiftly moved things around on a large screen.“Wow,” Kunal said. “What are you doing, TCP Aunty?”“I’m routing data through the Internet, of course,” replied TCP.
“Everything has to go fast, fast, fast!” The trains whooshed away, carrying data in every direction.

“TCP Aunty, if all the devices on the Internet are connected,
can you help me get back home?”

“Of course!” TCP said. She looked Kunal up and down.

“We’ll send you by packet switching. First, we’ll break you
into a few thousand pieces. Then we’ll send all your bits
by different paths and put you back together later.”

“Here,” said TCP. “You’ll need to be encrypted so that nobody else
can grab you on the way.”

TCP handed Kunal a hat and silly glasses with a nose and moustache attached.“You’re very sensitive data indeed!” she said.

“Goodbye, TCP Aunty!” Kunal replied, cheerfully.

Kunal was moving fast,very fast. His arms and legstingled. And then—POP!He was back home.

“My dear!” Mummy said. “It’sgood to have you back.
Nexttime, learn about the Internetby reading about it,
not gettinglost inside it.”

Kunal loved the Internet,but he loved being homeeven more.

What is the Internet?

The Internet is the name for all the different computers, phones and tablets that are connected to each other. It is a system that is spread across the entire world. It lets us transfer data from one computer to another through copper wires, fibre-optic cables,
radio transmissions and satellites in space. Every device that is connected to the Internet has a unique number called an IP address.

How Does Data Travel?

Many kinds of data are sent through the Internet, such as emails, web pages, videos, chats and pictures.

The Transmission Control Protocol (TCP) is a set of rules and procedures used by computers to transfer data by first breaking it into chunks called packets. Then the packets are put back together again (in the right order!) when they reach their destination. This method of data transfer is called packet switching.

In circuit switching, the entire data is sent through a single path.
This is a less efficient method than packet switching.

zho: 這是一位胖國王。
胖國王有一隻瘦狗。胖國王和他的瘦狗去散步。
狗看見一隻鳥。狗追著鳥跑。
國王追著狗跑。
他們跑呀跑。跑呀跑，跑了好多天。
國王抓到狗了。
胖國王變瘦了。
eng: This is a fat king.
The fat king has a thin dog.The fat king and his thin dog go for a walk.
The dog sees a bird.The dog runs after the bird.
The king runs after the dog.
They run and run.They run and run for many days.
The king catches the dog.
Now the fat king is thin.
Now the fat king is thin.

Once upon a time, a young woman named Thuza lived with her husband Theingi. They were a happy couple. But, Theingi believed he was an alchemist and could turn dirt into gold.Theingi was always busy with his experiments to turn dirt into gold and so never went for a proper job. Thuza asked her husband to get a job so that they had the money for day-to-day expenses. But, Theingi continued with his experiments and said, "Soon I will be able to turn dirt into gold."A worried Thuza told her wise old father Thet about Theingi's stubbornness. Thet asked Theingi to meet him at his house one day.

The next day, Theingi went to his father-in-law Thet's house. Thet told him that when he was young, he too was an alchemist. Thet said, "You have to grow banana trees. Once the leaves are big, you need to tell a magic spell which I will teach you. A silver powder will fall from the banana leaves. You have to collect the powder. Once you gather 1 kilo of silver powder, I will teach you how to convert dirt into gold."Then he taught Theingi the magic spell. Theingi went back home eager to try the experiment.

Theingi came home and bought a field near his home and planted banana saplings. He put good manure in the soil and watered the saplings well. He removed all the pests and weeds. In a few months, the trees grew big with big leaves and bore fruit.Theingi went near the leaves and told the magic spell Thet had taught him. A few drops of silver powder fell. Theingi was overjoyed and collected the powder and stored it in a secret vessel in his house.

But, the powder collected from one field was very little. So, he bought another field and grew new banana trees in the field. And repeated the magic spell and collected silver powder.To gather 1 kilo of silver powder, Theingi bought 10 fields and grew bananas. At last, he had gathered 1 kilo of silver powder.He was very happy and rushed to see Thet. Theingi told, "Dear Thet. I have collected 1 kilo of silver powder. Now, tell me how to convert dirt to gold with this silver powder."

Thet told Theingi, "Let us first go home and see all the bananas you grew in all the fields."Thet and Theingi went to Theingi's house. Thet asked Thuza, "What did you do with the bananas that Theingi gave you?"Thuza happily said, "I sold all the bananas and got money. I will show it to you."Saying so, Thuza took them to a loft in the house that had many bags. Thuza opened one bag and poured all the gold coins inside it on the ground. Theingi was surprised to see so many gold coins and wondered how much more will be there in the other bags.Then Thet said, "Theingi. See how you have converted the dirt in the fields to gold. The magic spell for making money is hard work."Theingi thanked his father-in-law Thet for the life lesson.

BANANAGIC! After Theingi’s magic powder from bananas, how about surprising your friends with some magical bananas?! Tell them about a new variety that you have just discovered – one that grows in slices! MAKE YOUR OWN MAGICAL BANANAS YOU’LL NEED:A few ripe bananasA toothpick or sewing needle

HOW TO MAKE IT:1. Push the toothpick into the banana somewhere along the seam. 2. Without taking it out, carefully rotate the toothpick left and right inside the banana. You should cut all the way through the fruit, but not through the peel, mind you. Also, try and keep the toothpick hole as small as possible – the smaller, the lesser it will be visible.

3. Remove the toothpick and repeat the above step at another spot on the banana, say after an inch. Keep making internal one-inch slices until you have at least five or six. Do these two steps with all the bananas you have. That’s it – your magic bananas are ready to eat. Offer the “new variety” to your friends. When your friends peel the banana, imagine the look on their faces when they find that it is already sliced? While inside the skin! Isn’t that some yummy banana magic?
zho: 很久很久以前，在伊洛瓦底河岸边的一个小村庄里，住着一个叫做图扎的年轻女人。她嫁给了一个叫做登吉的英俊潇洒的年轻小伙子，并过着幸福的生活。但是图扎有个一烦恼 -- 她的丈夫觉得自己曾经是一个炼金术士，并且总是在梦想着各种能把泥土变成金子的办法。从早到晚，每一天，登吉都把时间花在做实验上，希望可以找到一个突破口。很快，他们的钱花完了，年轻的图扎就必须要想办法给两人买食物。“你应该尽快找一个工作，”她跟她的丈夫请求说。“我们不能再这样继续下去了！”但是登吉没有听她的话。“我马上就可以找到突破口了！等到我们可以变成无法想象的富有的时候，我为什么还要工作呢？我们马上就可以把所有我们能找到的土都变成金子了！”图扎十分灰心丧气的找到了她充满智慧的父亲德，想要找到一个解决的办法。德听到他的女婿居然想要变成炼金术士的时候十分吃惊。他想了一会儿，然后要求要见一见登吉。图扎开心的回家了，她知道她充满智慧的父亲一定会圆满的解决这件事情。

第二天，登吉去了他岳父的家，心里已经做好了准备会挨一顿大骂。可当他到了的时候却是大吃一惊。德把他叫到了一边并小声地告诉他，“当我和你一样年轻的时候，我也是个炼金术士！”他们两个花了一整个下午讨论登吉的实验。最后， 老人站起来说，“登吉， 你已经将我在你这么大时候做的所有事情都做到了！你马上就会找到突破口了！恭喜！但是你似乎还缺少一样十分重要的原料。你需要这样原料才能把土变成金子。我最近才发现了这个。但是我已经太老了，没有办法完成这个任务。完成这项任务需要付出极大的努力。。。”“让我来替你完成吧父亲！”登吉大叫出声。他十分的兴奋。他所有的努力终于要结出果实。“告诉我这个原材料是什么！”“很好，你很有激情！”德说。他靠近得更近了一些，小声说，“孩子，这个秘密原材料就是一种只有在香蕉叶子上才有银色粉末。你必须自己亲自种植香蕉，然后再施上一些咒语。然后当这些植物长大了以后，这些叶子上的粉末就会有魔力了。”

“父亲，我们得需要多少这种粉末啊？”登吉兴奋地问。“一千克，”德回答说。“一千克！”登吉大叫起来。“那得要上百棵香蕉树啊！”“恐怕就是这样啊孩子，”老人说。“所以我才说我没办法亲自完成了。。。”“别伤心父亲！”登吉说。“我可以完成的！”那天晚上，老人把魔咒教给了他的女婿，并借了一些钱给他去开始工作。第二天，登吉就在他家附近买了一小块地，把它清理干净。就像德教给他的那样，他亲自挖好了树坑，种上了小树，并且仔细的施了咒语。每一天他都去地里去看护这些小树。勤奋地给它们除草，除虫。当这些小树长大了， 结了果实的时候，他就小心的把叶子上的银色粉末收集起来，仔细地放在一个盒子里。

每片叶子上只有一丁点的粉末，所以登吉只好买了更多的田地，种上了更多的香蕉树。但是他下定了决心要做成这件事情。他花了好多年的时间，终于收集到了足够多的魔力粉末。他冲到了他的岳父那里，从来都没有这么激动过。他马上就可以把土变成金子了！“父亲，看。。我终于收集到了一千克的魔力粉末！”他大叫出声。老人也很开心。“太好了！”他说。“他好了！你做的很好，登吉。我真为你骄傲。现在我就告诉你怎么把土变成金子。 但是，首先，咱们得去把图扎叫来。我们需要她的帮助。”登吉有一点迷惑，但是却一点也不浪费时间地跑回家把妻子带了回来。“图扎，”老人问，“当你的丈夫在收集粉末的时候你是怎么处理那些香蕉的？”“怎么了？我把它们都卖了父亲，”图扎回答说。“我们就是这样才能活下来呀。”

“那么你应该有一些积蓄了吧。登吉种了很多香蕉。。”老人继续说。“是呀。”图扎回答。“可以让我们看看吗？”德问。“当然了，我把一直把它们放在家里安全的地方，”图扎喜出望外的说。三个人一起去了登吉的家。图扎已经攒了好几袋子的钱放在了阁楼里。德打开了一个袋子，往里看了一眼，然后就笑了。他把一袋子的钱都倒到了桌子上。金币叮当作响地堆成了一座小山。然后他去田里取来了一把土，放在金山的旁边。“你看，登吉，”他望着他的女婿说，“你已经把土变成了金子！”那天以后登吉再也没有从香蕉叶子上收集过魔力粉末了。他“炼金术士”的岳父已经把最好的能把土变成金子的方法教给了他。他已经不再需要那些魔力粉末了。
香蕉的魔力！﻿看完了登吉从香蕉上获得的魔力粉末，你也来用一些魔力香蕉让你的朋友吃惊一些怎么样？告诉他们你刚发现的新品种 - 一种一片一片长的香蕉！制作你自己的魔力香蕉你需要：﻿一些成熟的香蕉一个牙签或者针
如何制作：﻿1. 把牙签从香蕉的侧边的任何一个地方插入香蕉里。2. 不要把牙签拿出来，小心的在香蕉里面从左到右挪动牙签。把香蕉的果肉切断，但是注意不要把香蕉皮弄破。牙签孔越小越好- 越小就越不容易被发现！
3. 把牙签取出来， 在香蕉上每隔大约一英寸的其他部分重复以上步骤。一直重复到你至少有五到六片香蕉片为止。然后把你所有的其他香蕉也按照这个办法重复。就是这样了！你的魔法香蕉已经做好了！把这个“新品种”给你的朋友，并告诉他们你是从附近的田地里发现的这个新品种！当你的朋友剥开香蕉皮，你能想象他们看到已经切好的香蕉时的表情吗？这不就是好吃又神奇的香蕉魔法吗？

eng: The rains did not come. The land was very dry.

This monkey left
home to look for water and food.

She walked over
hills and valleys.

She came to a
place named Tirkol.

Monkey was very
happy in this place.

She ate fruit and
got fat. But she missed her friends.

So Monkey made
the long journey home.

The other monkeys
were joyful to see her.

"Where is
this wonderful place with fruit?" they asked her.

"I will take
you there," said Monkey.

The other monkeys
loved Tirkol. They decided to stay there forever.

But the monkeys
from Tirkol were worried.

"These new
monkeys will eat all our fruit," they said.

The Tirkol
monkeys went to attack the new monkeys.

"Why fight?"
asked an elder. "There is enough fruit for all!"

This was true. So
the monkeys decided to live together peacefully.
zho: 雨天一直不來。大地變得很乾燥。
這隻猴子離開家去尋找水和食物。
她攀過丘陵和山谷。
她來到了一個地方叫Tirkol。
猴子在這個地方非常得開心。
她吃了好多水果，因此變得胖胖的。但是，她開始想念她的朋友了。
所以，猴子展開了她長途的旅程。
她的朋友們看到她都非常開心。
猴子們問道：這個充滿了水果的地方是在哪兒啊？
猴子說：我會帶你們去的。
其他的猴子們都很愛Tirkol這個地方。他們決定要永遠的住在這裏。
但是，住在Tirkol的原住猴子開始擔心了。
他們說：這些外來的猴子會把水果吃光的 。
因此，Tirkol的猴子們攻擊了新來的猴子。
Tikrol 的長老猴子突然喊道：為什麼要打架啊？這裏的水果足夠我們大家一起吃啊。
大家都認同長老猴子說的話。因此，猴子們從此過這平安開心的日子。

狮子是丛林之王。有一天，他发现了这座城市的国王。

他坐在一头大象上面，骄傲而直立。我也会这样做，狮子想。

他在丛林中召唤了大象。他告诉了他他想做什么。

可怜的大象惊慌失措。他说：“Maharaj，你为什么要模仿这座城市的国王？”

狮子很坚定。
他骑着大象坐着，但他看起来并不富贵。
他看起来很傻！

猴子说：“国王们坐在嚎叫上。 他们不骑光背大象！”
狮子说：“为霍达制造者发送！”

霍达制造商来了。

他做了一个皇家的霍达。

它被放在大象的背上。

狮子跳起来，坐在里面。
大象一走几步，霍达就开始摇晃。它没有被正确绑定。它撞到了树枝上，翻倒了！

狮子砰的一声摔倒了！

他再也不坐在大象上面了。
 他说：“我认为，最好走路。”
eng: The lion was the king of the jungle. One day, he spotted the king of the city. He sat atop an elephant, proud and erect. I will do the same, thought the lion.
He summoned the elephant in the jungle. He told him what he wished to do.The poor elephant was alarmed. He said, “Maharaj, why must you copy the king of the city?”
The lion was adamant. He sat astride the elephant but he did not look regal.He looked silly!
The monkey said, “Kings sit on howdahs. They don’t ride bare-backed elephants!” The lion said, “Send for the howdah maker!”
The howdah maker came. He made a royal howdah. It was placed on the elephant’s back. The lion jumped up and sat in it.
As soon as the elephant took a few steps, the howdah began rocking. It had not been tied properly. It hit the branch of a tree and overturned!
The lion fell down with a huge thud! He never sat atop an elephant again. He said, “I think, it is best to walk.”

zho: 一隻大象要去喝水
兩隻長頸鹿要去喝水
三隻水牛與四隻鳥也要去喝水
五隻羚羊與六隻疣豬正走向水源
七隻斑馬正跑向水源
八隻青蛙與九條魚正在水裡游泳
一隻獅子吼叫，他也想要喝水。誰害怕獅子呢？
一隻大象在與獅子一起喝水
eng:
One elephant is
going to drink water.
Two giraffes are going to drink water.

Three buffaloes
and four birds are also going to drink water.
Five antelopes and warthogs are walking to the water.
Seven zebras are running to the water.
Eight frogs and nine fish are swimming in the water.
One lion roars. He also wants to drink. Who is afraid of the lion?
One elephant is drinking water with the lion.

When Loco, the lovely new train was rolled into the railway shed, all the older trains admired its fine face and figure. “Oh, you will soon go to all kinds of strange and new places. What wonderful adventures you will have!” they promised. But Loco did not want any adventures — it was, you see, a frightened little train — not little at all, of course, but it was so scared of everything that it felt tiny!

It didn't want to leave the railway shed. It shrank when the cows in the fields bellowed, but felt comforted by the friendly, older trains around. It was scared even when a dog ran barking towards it, and wished it could hide somewhere safer! But how was it to hide anywhere, and how could it always stay in the shed?

A wise old train who had been all over the country saw how frightened Loco looked, and pointed out that it was much bigger than dogs and cows.But Loco was not sure. “Oh, but they are all so strong and fierce. I don’t want to go anywhere alone,” it said. So the old train said, “But you won’t be alone, dear Loco. The engine driver and the guard will be with you.”

Loco knew the guard. He was a pleasant fellow who waved the flag when trains had to leave. Loco saw that he was quite small. It didn't think the guard could protect it from anything. Loco also knew the engine driver Babu and it trusted his kind face.

Soon the big day arrived when Loco was rolled out of the yard for its maiden journey. Loco was to go all the way across from Tamil Nadu near the sea to Jammu next to the mountains. Babu, the engine driver pushed some buttons, and twisted some knobs, and off chugged Loco from the station, its heart in its mouth.

“Oooo,” it cried in fright but what do you suppose happened? It came out sounding exactly like a sharp train whistle! Some mynahs pecking nearby quickly flew off cackling. And as it thundered on, off flew all the crows and sparrows and other birds perched on wires along the railway track in great fright. Loco was really surprised that anybody could be frightened of it, and laughed.

At once, the ground shuddered, and dogs nearby took to their heels! Soon Loco was far from its home. Seeing a big bull sitting on the track, Loco was so scared that it let out a piercing shriek, “Oooo!” And the bull lifted its tail and sprang away, its legs flaying about wildly as it ran for dear life.

Loco could hardly believe that such a big, powerful creature could be afraid of it, a mere train! It felt much braver and decided that now it wouldn't even fear lions and tigers. But guess where Loco had to go next?

Deep inside a dark cave in the mountains. Babu, the driver didn’t even flinch as he merrily punched some buttons to switch on the engine lights, but Loco was horrified. “Noooo, I don’t want to go in there,” it wailed, but it just came out as a great long whistle. Through the deep cavern hurtled dear Loco, its great beams lighting the pitch black tunnel.
When it emerged on the other side, it let out a big sigh of relief “Oooo!” It came out as another long whistle of course, but then, it was never afraid of anything anymore.

Now Loco chugs merrily across fields and over bridges, over mountains and through forests, whistling when it feels happy, and to tell everyone else to move out of its way. Have you taken a trip on Loco?
zho:
当新的颗粒状火车Loko被插入火车谷仓时，老火车称赞他的脸和身体的美丽。“哦，你很快就会去各种陌生的地方，”她保证说。你将会有很棒的冒险经历!”

但是Loko不想冒险——正如你所看到的，他是一辆害羞的小火车——虽然他真的一点也不小，但他对一切事物的强烈恐惧让他觉得自己很渺小!

他不想离开火车谷仓，当奶牛在田野里摇晃时，他缩水了，但比他更大的友好火车让他放心。

当我亲吻一只跑来跑去的狗时，我也很害怕，希望它能找到一个更安全的地方去！但他怎么能藏在任何地方，怎么能一直呆在谷仓里呢？

有一辆明智的旧火车访问了整个国家，它看到洛科有多害怕，并提醒他它比狗和牛大得多。

但Loko不确定，”他说，“哦，但她非常强壮和暴力。我不想一个人去任何地方。”“但你不会孤单的，亲爱的洛科，司机和警卫会和你在一起，”旧火车回答说。
Loko认识警卫。当火车有兴趣出去时，他是一个挥舞科学的有趣人。Loko认为他很小，他认为他无法保护他免受任何伤害，因为Loko认识发动机司机Babu，并信任他和他脸上可见的善良。

那一天很快就到了，Loko离开广场开始处女航的那天，Loko计划穿过靠近大海的泰米尔纳德邦甚至邻近的查谟州之间的所有道路。

当Loko离开车站时，司机Babu按下了几个按钮并管理了几个把手来大声移动Loko。他的心在恐惧的喉咙里跳动。
他尖叫着害怕“oooo”，但你认为当时发生了什么？他的哭声像火车哨声一样引起了共鸣！旁边吃的一些按钮在被挥动时迅速飞走了。当他的声音越来越大时，所有在铁路附近的电线上荡秋千的乌鸦和其他鸟类都非常害怕地飞翔。Loko非常惊讶地发现有人会害怕他，他笑了。

有一次，地面在他脚下颤抖，附近的狗逃跑了！

Loko很快离开了他的房子。当他的眼睛看到一只公牛坐在跑道上时，Loko非常害怕，他尖锐地尖叫道：“哦！”公牛抬起尾巴，出发跑去，度过他宝贵的生命。

Loko简直不敢相信，一个和所有可能害怕他的人，他只是一列火车！他感到更勇敢，并决定从那一刻起，他甚至不会害怕狮子和老虎。

但猜猜Loko接下来要去哪里？

在山心深处一个黑暗的洞穴里。司机Babu没有眼皮，但愉快地按下了几个按钮打开火车上的灯，但Loko惊慌失措地喊道：“不，我不想进去”，但他的哭声只是一个长长的、吵闹的哨子。

通过亲爱的Loko，深邃的洞穴正在奔跑，被它的光芒照亮了非常黑暗的隧道的黑暗。
当他走到隧道的另一边时，他松了一声“oooo”，当然，它以哨子的形式再次浮出水面，但直到那时，他才不再害怕任何东西。
现在，Loko正在愉快地砍伐田野和过桥，越过山脉和穿过森林，当他高兴时会发黄，为了告诉大家让开他，你曾经背着Loko旅行过吗？

eng: Arya always wanted to fly.

When she was four years old, she wanted to be Rosamma.Arya saw her at the circus. Rosamma was a trapeze artist.Arya wanted to fly in the air from swing to swing. Her clothes would glitter like Rosamma’s. Hundreds of people would clap for her.She would eat cotton candy every day. Her best friend would be a clown.
Trapeze artists climb a tall ladder, stand on a narrow board, hold the fly bar, and swing! Another trapeze artist is usually waiting to catch them on the other side.

When Arya was eight years old she wanted to be Kalpana
Chawla.
She made herself an orange space suit. She wore it day and
night.
"Arya, aren’t you feeling hot in that suit?"
"Astronauts have to get used to the suit, Amma. Space is not
as safe as Earth is. My suit will protect me."

Kalpana Chawla grew up in Haryana, India. As an astronaut, Kalpana flew around the earth 252 times! 
Kalpana died doing her job when the spacecraft she was inside broke apart while returning to Earth.

When Arya was twelve years old, she wanted to be Amelia Earhart.
She built a model plane for her school project. It couldn’t
fly, but she still got the second prize. 
Arya even got a haircut like Amelia!

Amelia was the first woman to fly across the Atlantic Ocean
alone.
Amelia’s dream was to fly around the world along the
equator. She took off on her dream flight but went missing somewhere above the
Pacific.

Soon, Arya heard of Angulia Bai, Kumudammal and Sarla
Thakral, the first Indian women to fly a plane. Angulia Bai was just sixteen
years old!
"I can’t wait till I’m a teenager!" 
"So you can drive?"
"No."
"So you can vote?"
"No."
"Then what?"
"So I can fly."
On 30 May, 1935, nineteen-year-old Kummudammal and sixteen-year-old Angulia Bai became the first women to obtain the ‘A’ pilot licence in India. They trained at the Madras Flying Club.

When Arya was eighteen years old, she wanted to become a
fighter pilot.
"Who are they, Chechi?" asked her little brother Raju,
seeing a poster on her wall.
"They are Bhawana, Avani and Mohana, the first women to fly
fighter planes in India."
"Are they your friends?"
Arya laughed. "Maybe some day, Raju…"

Mohana, Bhawana and Avani are fighter pilots. Before them, only men were allowed to become fighter pilots in India. They protect the country’s borders from high up in the air. During disasters like floods and earthquakes, they take part in rescue missions.

Arya saved up money to attend flying school.
She spent years studying. She sat along with pilots to learn
from them. She worked hard and ate a lot of carrots! Amma always said carrots
are great for the eyes.

Finally, she is ready to sit at the cockpit herself.  
Today is a special day for Arya. That’s her in the cockpit.
She’s very excited because there are two special passengers on her plane this
morning.

"Ladies and gentlemen, this is your Captain, Arya. Welcome
aboard!""Chechi!" "That’s my daughter!"Click here to read Raju's version of the story.
zho: 阿雅一直很想飛。
四歲的時候，她想要成為羅莎瑪。羅莎瑪是一個空中飛人，阿雅在馬戲團見到她。阿雅想要在鞦韆之間飛翔，她的衣服會像羅莎瑪一樣飄揚。數百名觀眾會為她鼓掌。她每天都會有棉花糖可吃。她最要好的朋友會是小丑。
空中飛人先爬上高高的階梯，站在一片窄窄的板子上，抓住鞦韆的懸吊桿，然後盪！另一個空中飛人會在另一邊接住她。
阿雅八歲時想要成為卡芭娜・秋拉。她幫自己做了一件橘色的太空衣，每天從早到晚都穿。「阿雅，你在太空衣裡面不熱嗎？」「阿瑪，太空人必須要習慣穿著太空衣。畢竟太空不像地球那麼安全，我的太空衣會保護我。」
卡芭娜・秋拉在印度的哈雅納長大。她以太空人的身份環繞地球 252 次！卡芭娜死於工作崗位上，她所乘坐的太空梭再返回地球的途中解體。
阿雅十二歲的時候想要成為阿美莉雅・愛華特。她在學校的專題做了一架模型飛機。她的飛機飛不起來，但仍得到了第二名。她甚至剪了一個像是阿美莉雅的髮型。
阿美莉雅是第一個獨自飛越大西洋的女人。她的夢想是沿著赤道繞行地球一周，開始了夢想中的航程之後，她在太平洋上空某處失蹤了。
很快地，阿雅知道了安古莉雅・貝、古牡丹瑪爾和沙拉・賽奎爾，她們是印度第一群駕駛飛機飛上天的女子。當時安古莉雅・貝只有十六歲。「我等不及要長大了！」「因為可以開車嗎？」「不。」「因為可以投票嗎？」「不。」「那是為什麼？」「因為可以開飛機！」
1935 年五月三十日，當時十九歲的古牡丹瑪爾和十六歲的安古莉雅・貝成為第一個在印度獲得 A 級飛機駕駛執照的女生。她們在馬達斯飛行俱樂部受訓。
阿雅十八歲的時候想要成為戰鬥機駕駛。「姊姊，他們是誰？」她的弟弟拉虎看著一張她牆上的海報問道。「他們是芭哇娜、阿凡尼和瑪哈娜，印度第一群駕駛戰鬥機的女生。」「她們是你的朋友嗎？」阿雅笑了，「未來某一天或許吧，拉虎。」
芭哇娜、阿凡尼和瑪哈娜是戰鬥機駕駛。在她們之前，在印度只有男生能夠成為戰鬥機駕駛。他們在高空中保護著國家的疆界，當發生地震、水災等災難時，他們會參與救援行動。
阿雅為飛行學校存錢。她花了好幾年唸書、從其他駕駛身上學習。她努力工作而且吃了很多的紅蘿蔔！阿瑪總是說紅蘿蔔對眼睛很好。
最後，她準備好要坐在駕駛艙裡了。今天對她來說是一個特別的日子——她將會坐在駕駛艙裡面！她非常興奮，因為今天早上飛機上有兩位很特別的乘客。
「各位先生女士，我是機長阿雅，歡迎各位搭乘本日的航班！」「哇！那是我女兒！」

eng: Have you met my Aaji?Everyone says that my Aaji has a tail.
Aaji’s tail follows her all day long,Mumma says it even does a pirouette when Aaji sings my favourite song.I wonder, why haven't I seen it yet?
Papa says the tail is growing long and strong.It even answers Aaji's phone when she gets a call.What! Why haven't I seen the tail yet?
My teacher says the tail helps my Aaji a lot.It even helps water the plants in the pots.Sigh! I haven't seen it yet.
The bus driver told me the tail sits next to Aaji in the bus.And imitates everything that she does.Someone please tell me, why haven't I seen the tail yet?
One day I asked Aaji,"Everybody says that you have a tail.But why haven't I seen the tail yet?"
Aaji laughed out loud,and pulled out her phone. Look! It's me. And that's me, it's me again.It's me everywhere!
Now I know why everyone says that my Aaji has a tail. Because it was always ME following Aaji on her small and big trails.
zho: 你見過我的奶奶嗎?大家都說我的奶奶有條尾巴。
奶奶的尾巴每天都跟著她，媽媽說，當奶奶唱我最喜歡的歌曲時，她的尾巴甚至會跳起旋轉舞蹈來。可是，為什麼我看不到它？
爸爸說那條尾巴長得很強壯。當奶奶接電話時，它甚至可以幫她接電話。什麼！ 為什麼我還是沒有看到尾巴？
我的老師說，尾巴幫助我的奶奶做很多事情。它甚至能幫助奶奶給植物澆水。嘆！ 可我還沒有看到！
巴士司機告訴我，當奶奶在公車上時，她的尾巴就坐在她旁邊，並模仿她所做的一切。有沒有人可以告訴我，為什麼只有我沒有看到這條尾巴？
有一天我問奶奶，“每個人都說你有條尾巴。但是為什麼我還沒有看到尾巴呢？
奶奶大聲笑了起來，並拿出了她的手機。 看！ 其實這條尾巴是我啊！那裡是我，這裡也是我。我無處不在！我就是奶奶的尾巴：）
現在我知道為什麼每個人都說我的奶奶有條尾巴了。因為不管奶奶在哪裏，我總是跟在她身後。

媽媽走開一下，
要乖啊！
﻿哎呀！
不要！
砰！
呀！
不可以！
哼！
噢！
不好了！
不是我！
eng:
I won’t be long. 
Be good!
Oh!
Oh, no!
Oh, NO!
Crash!
Oh!
Oh, no!
Hiss!
Oh!
Oh, no!
OH, NO!
It wasn’t me!

zho: 蘇娜的叔叔是做挫冰的。有些人叫挫冰 "秋司機"。有些人叫他 "哥拉"。某天，蘇娜去叔叔家看他怎麼做挫冰。
叔叔試著做出不同顏色跟不同口味的糖漿。他把做好的糖漿放在四個大的鍋子裡。蘇娜說："叔叔，讓我來幫你做一些糖漿!"
" 不用啊 蘇娜 你就坐著看我怎麼做就行了吧？”叔叔加了調色劑和濃縮液到一個鍋子裡。“啊啊 這個氣味直衝我的喉嚨。 這就是黑莓汁 不是嗎！？"
"沒錯，蘇娜，就是這個讓挫冰有一個強烈的氣味“ 叔叔說道。"但我有聞到其它氣味，不是很好聞喔" 蘇娜回應。
叔叔開始在另一個鍋裡調新的口味。蘇娜深呼吸並說道：”啊 這有種大地的氣味，是石榴冰！“
"哇塞，蘇娜，你好棒！" 叔叔說道，一邊走向另一個鍋子。"但我還是可以聞到一些不好的氣味"，蘇娜說道，一邊摸著她的鼻子。
"現在我即將在這裡加入玫瑰口味"，叔叔說道，一邊在第三個鍋子裡攪拌著。"這個聞起來好點吧？還帶點甜味吧"
"叔叔 有東西燒焦了啊！！" 忽然間，蘇娜大叫。"我想有些東西黏在鍋子底部了！"
叔叔四處查看，發現有一鍋裡牛奶正在滾。他馬上把這鍋牛奶拿開爐火。
"你好棒棒  蘇娜” 叔叔說，一邊把牛奶倒入另一個乾淨的鍋子。"妳救了堅果冰！""這個牛奶也正好趕上了！"
叔叔把第一個堅果冰給蘇娜。他親切地拍拍蘇娜的背，然後說：”我們聰明的蘇娜！“
eng:
Sona’s
uncle was a chuski maker. Some people call an ice-candy ‘chuski’. Some people
call it ‘gola’.
One
day, Sona went to Uncle’s house to see how he made chuski.

Uncle
was trying to make syrups of different colours and flavours. He was getting
them ready in four huge vessels.
“Uncle,
let me also help you make the syrups!” said Sona.

“No,
no, Sona! Why don’t you just sit and watch me working?”
Uncle
added a colour and essence to one vessel. “Ah-hh-h, that smell goes straight to
my throat! That is kala-khatta, right?”

“You
are right, Sona. That gives the chuskis a tangy taste,” said Uncle. “But I can
smell something else too. Not a good smell!” said Sona.

Uncle
added a flavour to another vessel. Sona took a deep breath. “Ah, this is an
earthy-sweet smell! Pomegranate chuski!”

“Wow,
Sona, you are right again!” said Uncle and went to another vessel. “But I can
still smell something that is not nice!” said Sona, holding her nose.

“Now,
I am adding the rose flavour here,” said Uncle and he stirred the liquid in the
third vessel. “Does it smell nice and sweet?”

“Something
is burning, Uncle!” shouted Sona, suddenly. “I think something is stuck to the
bottom of the vessel!”

Uncle
looked around. The milk was boiling in one vessel. He quickly took it off the
stove.

“Good
job, Sona!” said Uncle, as he poured the milk into another clean vessel. “You
have saved the rabdi* chuski! The milk had just begun to catch.”*thickened milk sweet
dish.

Uncle
gave the very first rabdi ice-candy to Sona. He patted her on her back lovingly and said, “Our very smart Sona!”
Can you see the little cloud peeking from behind the curtain? That’s Cumulo. She’s hiding.Cumulo’s face is bright pink. She is sweaty. She wants to hide so no one can see her. Do you know why?
“Cumulo! What are you doing inside?” It’s Cumulo’s cousin, Pufflo.She doesn’t want to tell him what happened. What if he laughs at her?Cumulo tells him anyway.

Pufflo smiles. “When I first went to the park, I couldn’t float either. I would just hang there,” he tells her. “I thought everyone was laughing at me. I wanted to run away!” Cumulo can’t believe it! “What did you do?” she asks.

“I just thought about how much I wanted to float! And you know what?” says Pufflo. “Pretty soon, I forgot about everyone else! I was just floating and having fun. Come on, let’s go to the park together.”Cumulo isn’t sure. What if all the clouds laugh at her? “We will float together,” says Pufflo. “Just think about floating and having fun!”
Some other clouds join them and float upside-down too. They all spend the afternoon together, floating upside-down. Cumulo is so happy that she turns orange, then yellow, then purple!
zho: 噓！你看見窗後的小臉嗎？是小雲呢，她想躱起來，不讓人看到。你知道為什麼嗎？

「小雲，你在裏面做什麼？

」

原來是小雲的表哥朵朵來找她。小雲有點不知所措，朵朵會不會笑她？




但她還是告訴他了。

朵朵笑著說：


















「我第一次去公園的時候，也是不會飄浮呢，總是上下倒轉。我怕大家都會笑我，很想跑走！」




小雲睜大眼睛問:「那你怎麼辦？」
其他的雲朵竟然也加入他們，一起上下倒轉 !整個下午，大家都一起玩，小雲笑得很開心，她的周圍出現了一個彩色的光環！
基烏上學遲到了。但她找不到她的紅色瓶子。
那是她的瓶子嗎？還是一個火箭？
基烏看著黑板，而想著， “那些是在海裡游的魚嗎？”
基烏盯著鞋上的一滴綠色斑點，想著，“這很粘，看起來像果凍。 難道是一隻青蛙嗎？”
基烏跑著回家跟奶奶說，“我有神奇的魔力！ 我能看到別人看不到的東西 。”
奶奶點點頭而問，“那麼我們是不是應該去眼科醫生那，告訴她你的魔力？”
尼基塔醫生拿了一張圖表給基烏看。“那些螞蟻正在圖上行進嗎？ “基烏問道。
尼基塔醫生幫基烏試戴眼鏡。最大的螞蟻變成了E.
“難道我失去我的魔法了嗎，醫生？”基烏問道。 “閉上眼睛做夢。 你的魔法會回來的，“尼基塔醫生說。
“基烏，你想要什麼顏色的眼鏡？”奶奶問道。“給我綠色的吧，”基烏笑著說。
眼鏡的情況基烏沒有戴眼鏡而看不太清楚。你能幫她嗎？
以下的形狀叫什麼呢？
花裡面藏了多少圓圖？
你在這顆星星上看到了幾個三角形？
窗戶裡有幾個方塊？
eng: Chiu is late for school.But she cannot find her red bottle.
Is that her bottle?Or is it a rocket?
Chiu looks at the blackboard and wonders,“Are those fish swimming in the sea?”
Chiu stares at the green blob on her shoe and thinks,“It is slimy and looks like jelly. Is it a frog?”
Chiu runs home to Ajji and says,“I have magic powers! I see things others cannot.”
Ajji nods and asks,“Shall we go to the eye doctor and tell her about your magical powers?”
Dr Nikita shows Chiu a chart.“Are those ants marching on the page?” asks Chiu.
Dr Nikita helps Chiu try on glasses.The biggest ant becomes an E.
“Have I lost my magic, doctor?” asks Chiu.“Close your eyes and dream.Your magic will be back,” says Dr Nikita.
“Chiu, what colour glasses would you like?” asks Ajji.“Green for me,” says Chiu with a smile.
The Case of the Spectacles Chiu is not wearing her spectacles and cannot see very well. Can you help her?
Name the following shapes.
How many circles are hidden in the flower?
How many triangles doyou see in this star?
How many squares are there in the window?

Once upon a time, a fox and a quirquincho (armadillo in Quechua, the language spoken by the Incas who originally inhabited the land) were very good friends. They spent a great deal of time together and had lots of fun. One day, the quirquincho decided that he was not going to waste his time doing nothing, and instead decided to do a spot of farming. He immediately set out to work and started to build a fence around a plot of land.

His friend, the fox, was quite perplexed by the quirquincho’s behaviour. He wondered why his best friend was working so hard instead of having some fun in the sun. Seeing the quirquincho toiling away at the fence, the fox asked, “Why are you making the fence, best friend?”“To sow some crops and earn some money, fox,” replied the quirquincho. The fox was surprised by the answer. He started to suspect his best friend. Why did the quirquincho want to make money?

Was he trying to become richer and more famous than him? Did he want to earn a good name from the other animals and get all the attention?Soon, suspicions such as these got the better of the fox and he quickly made a cunning plan. Since he had more money than the quirquincho, he decided the best thing to do would be to join up with his friend, invest in the crops, make him toil, and reap the benefits himself.

This way, he wouldn’t have to work too hard but would still end up making more money than the quirquincho. So off he went to his sweating friend and said, “You must have used up all your money buying the land and putting up the fence. Why don’t I give you the money to buy the seeds to sow, dear friend? Of course, if I’m paying for the seeds, then I get to decide what part of the crop belongs to me. Fair is fair after all, isn’t it?” The quirquincho was a smart cookie too. He immediately saw through the fox’s cunning plans. But he also knew that without the fox’s money, there was no way he would be able to grow any crops. So he decided to agree, for the moment. 

“Thank you, dear friend – what would I have done without you? All my efforts would have come to nothing if not for a friend like you.” “Ah ha! The silly fool’s falling for my plan,” thought the fox gleefully. “Okay friend, so you’ll do as I tell you to, right?

Then, this first time, whatever grows beneath the land will belong to you, and everything that grows above it will belong to me,” he said greedily. For a moment, the quirquincho was alarmed. But then he said to himself, “I’m not going to let him get away with this… I’ll teach that greedy pig a lesson!”Bright and early the next morning, the quirquincho started to prepare the field for sowing. And guess what he decided to sow? POTATOES! The fox was furious.

When the crop was harvested, all the potatoes went to the quirquincho, while all he got were the leaves! Not to be outdone easily, the fox said, “This crop has been very bad for me. The next time, you take what grows above and I’ll take everything that grows below.” Again, he felt gleeful for having outwitted his friend.The clever quirquincho set out to work again. This time round, he tilled the land, watered it and planted… WHEAT! Yet again, when the crop was reaped, all the wheat came to the quirquincho and the fox got only the roots and the leaves!

Now the fox was really angry! Each one of his attempts to get the better of the quirquincho was proving to be disastrous. “That scoundrel’s really having his cake and eating it too. Does he think I’m going to let him get away this easily? My money’s being spent and he’s the one getting richer… I must teach him a lesson!” So he thought hard and long for a few days. When he hit upon what he thought was a brilliant plan, he called the quirquincho. “Friend, the last two crops have been no good for me. I’ve spent all my money, but ended up with just leaves and roots which have no value. So it’s only fair that when you sow the next crop, I get both what grows above and below the ground. You can have everything that lies in between!” Accordingly, the quirquincho got the field ready for sowing. And what do you think he planted this time? CORN!

The crafty fox had been outwitted again.

When the crop was harvested, the quirquincho took all the corn that lay ‘in between’, while the greedy fox was left with mere roots and stalks. He got so angry with the quirquincho that he spat and fumed and swore never to work with him again! As for the intelligent quirquincho, he now had enough money to buy his own seeds and didn’t need the fox’s help ever again.

BLAST OFF!Hola! That’s ‘hello’ in Spanish, the most commonly used language in South America. And Argentina, from where the story of the quirquincho and the fox comes, is part of South America. So, what exactly is the South American magic all about?The glorious empires of the Incas and the Aztecs were founded here. They flourished amidst a natural world no less magnificent, leaving behind a rich history and heritage.

At the heart of South America lies the Amazon rainforest, which is perhaps the richest ecological region on our planet. Along the continent’s middle are the Andes, a spectacular wall of snow-capped peaks and sulphurous volcanoes. Not to forget the glorious, sunny beaches that dot the rugged South American coastline. No wonder then that this continent is one of the finest travel destinations in the world! And hey, before you say ‘hasta la vista baby’ (goodbye, until we meet again) and set out to explore splendid South America, watch out for those volatile volcanoes!
MAKE YOUR OWN ‘VOLCANO FUEGO ROJO’!YOU’LL  NEED:A paper plateClayA short cardboard tubeBaking sodaVinegarRed vegetable colour

HOW  TO  MAKE  IT:1. Mould the shape of a volcano using the clay and place it on the paper plate.2. Make an opening on top of the volcano big enough for the cardboard tube to fit in.3. Push the tube through the opening.4. Fill the tube with baking soda and add 6 drops of the vegetable colour to it.5. Slowly, pour vinegar into the tube and watch your ‘fuego rojo’ (red fire) erupt! (Beware of angry parents!)
To make your volcano more realistic, use thick cardboard as a base and surround the volcano with trees, rocks, etc.
zho: 從前有一隻狐狸和一隻犹狳，他倆是非常要好的朋友，整日形影不離，一塊兒歡樂放浪。一天，犰狳決心不再荒誕度日，他要開始從事農耕。說做就做，立刻買塊地，圍起籬笆。

狐狸覺得很奇怪，好朋友犰狳為什麼要這麼辛苦，不去享受陽光和歡樂呢？看著犰狳在籬笆旁努力幹活兒

，不禁問道：「 我的好朋友，你為什麽在蓋籬笆呢？

」

「要播種收耕，才能賺錢呀！」犰狳回答。狐狸覺得很訝異，犰狳為什麽需要賺錢，真太可疑了。

犰狳是想變成有錢的名人嗎？他想要博得好名聲，吸引所有動物的注意嗎？狐狸越想越覺得奇怪，狐疑猜忌佔據了他整個思維，不久便想出了一條妙計。狐狸比犰狳還有錢，所以最好的方式就是投資朋友的農耕事業，
犰狳做苦工，他坐享其成。這様就不用辛苦工作還能比犰狳賺更多錢。

於是狐狸去找那汗流浹背的朋友，跟他說：「
親愛的好朋友，
你買地和築籬笆可能把積蓄都用完了吧！ 這樣好了，我出錢買種子來播種。出錢的人決定收成如何分配，這様再公平不過了，是不是？」「頭一回  ，長在地底下的都歸你，長在地上的都歸我。」貪心的狐狸提議。
犰狳覺得有些不對勁，但他告訴自己：「我絕不會讓狐狸得逞的，得給那壞蛋一個教訓！亅第二天一早，犰狳開始整地準備播種。你猜他種什麼？馬鈴薯！狐狸簡直要氣瘋了。

收成的日子到了，所有的馬鈴薯都歸犰狳

，狐狸只拿到馬鈴薯葉！狐狸不輕言服輸，他對犰狳說：「這次收成太糟糕了，下回地上長出來的歸你，地底下的歸我。」想到自己比朋友魔高一丈，狐狸真是太得意了。聰明的犰狳又開始耕作了。整地，澆水，這回他種的是小麥！

收成時，麥子都歸犰狳，而狐狸只拿到麥根和麥稈！這次狐狸可真氣炸了！每次要佔犰狳便宜都搞到更糟的下場。「那小無賴佔盡所有便宜，要開銷就用我的錢，賺了就是他的，

以為我會白白放過
這種人嗎？一定得好好教訓他一頓！」狐狸左思右想了好幾天，終於想到一個絕

妙

好招。他去找犹狳，跟他說：「我的好

朋

友．前兩次收成我都沒賺到，錢全花下

去

了，但只收到毫無價值的樹根爛草。為了公平起見，下回地上和地下長出來的統統歸我，你只能有中間的部份！」犰狳回到他的農田去播種。猜猜這次他種什麽？玉米！

犰狳
再度智勝一籌。

收成時，犰狳得到長在中間的玉米，貪心的狐狸則只有玉米株的根和梗子。狐狸氣得七竅生煙，發誓從此以後再也不和犰狳合夥了！聰明的犰狳現在攢了足夠的錢，可以自己買種子，再也不需要靠狐狸來投資了。

~~~這個狐狸與犹狳的故事源自阿根廷，阿根廷位於南美洲。西班牙語是南美最普遍的語言。南美洲

有什麽迷人之處呢？輝煌的印加帝國與阿兹特克文明便是在此誕生的。這兒的天然環境風景壯麗，蘊育繁
榮的古文明，留下豐富的文化遺產。

南美洲的心臟地帶座落著全球生態最豐富的亞馬遜雨林
。安地斯山脈縱貫全洲南北，白雪覆頂的高山與磺氣四溢的火山
交錯矗立
，形成一道壯觀的山牆。粗獷的海岸線有陽光燦爛的沙灘間些點綴其中。難怪南美洲會成為全球最佳觀光地。但道別啓程前，請先留意那裡喜怒無常的火山唷！
動手做火山材料紙盤黏土短短的硬紙圓筒小蘇打醋紅色食用色素顏料

步驟1. 黏土做成火山形狀，置於紙盤上。2. 火山頂挖出一個
大小可容下紙筒的開口。3. 將紙筒推入火山口。4. 紙筒內裝滿小蘇打和六滴食用色素。5. 慢慢將醋倒入紙筒，觀賞紅色的火山爆發。（小心爸爸媽媽可能會生氣唷！）
如果要讓火山更逼真，可以用硬紙版為底，火山周圍放些樹木模型和石塊。
法蒂是一个像风一样奔跑的小女孩，她喜欢笑，并且总是非常努力的完成她所被交代的事。
今天是学校的运动日。法蒂踢足球，参加了三场比赛。
放学后，她和她的好朋友哈瓦一起走回家。哈瓦说：“法蒂，你跑得好快！”
法蒂回到家，发现她的母亲在厨房里。她说：“妈妈，晚上好。”法蒂的母亲回答：“晚上好。 你好吗？”
法蒂说：“我们今天在学校有运动日，而且我跑得很快。我很热，很累，很饿。”
妈妈笑着说：“亲爱的小法蒂，你出生时就腿快！我会煮欧克汤，晚餐很快就可以吃了。”
妈妈把一些棕榈油放在一个大的烹饪锅里，放在火上。当油热起来时，她加入洋葱和大蒜，搅拌它们直到它们变软。然后她放入胡椒，西红柿，加入一些水和六块蒸牛肉。
妈妈说，“法蒂，请帮助我搅匀汤。”法蒂说：“是的，妈妈。”
法蒂搅匀了一次汤。她说，“这汤味道好香。”
法蒂搅匀了两次汤。她说，“这汤味道非常香。”
法蒂搅匀了三次汤。她说，“这汤闻起来非常，非常，香。”
然后，法蒂看着她的母亲。母亲没有在看法蒂。她正在切绿叶，准备把它放入汤。
法蒂从锅里拿了一块肉，把它吃了。法蒂说，“嗯......”
法蒂再次看着她的母亲。母亲没有在看法蒂。她正在切鸡蛋，准备把它放入汤里。
法蒂很快从锅里取出第二块肉，把它吃了。法蒂说：“嗯...... 嗯......”
法蒂一再次看着她的母亲。母亲没有在看法蒂。她正在切欧克，准备把它放入汤里。
法蒂很快从锅里取出了第三块肉，也把它吃了！法蒂说：“嗯...... 嗯... 嗯......”
不久，母亲拿着绿叶，鸡蛋和欧克来到了火堆。法蒂仍然拿着大木勺。
母亲微笑着说：“谢谢你帮助搅匀汤，法蒂。”法蒂不知道该说些什么。
母亲把绿叶，鸡蛋和欧克放入汤中，从法蒂取了勺子。她开始搅匀汤。
母亲看进锅里。 她可以看到汤在烈火中冒泡。 母亲在锅里寻找那六块肉。“一......二......三......”母亲说。 母亲只看到了三块肉。母亲什么也没说。 法蒂什么也没说。
当母亲端上汤时，法蒂没有得到任何肉。法蒂说：“妈妈，对不起。 我不会再那样做了。”他从后就没有这样做了。那个故事就这么结束了。
eng: Fati was a little girl who ran like the wind, who loved to laugh and who always tried hard to do as she was told.
Today was Sports Day at school. Fati played football and ran in three races.
After school, she walked home with her good friend Hawa.Hawa said, “Fati, you are a fast runner!”
Fati arrived home and found her mother in the kitchen.              She said, “Mother, good evening.”         Fati’s mother replied, “Fine evening. How are you?”
Fati said, “We had Sports Day at school, and I ran very fast. I am hot, tired and very hungry.”
Mother laughed and said, “My dear little Fati, you were born with fast legs!I will make okro soup and dinner will be ready soon.”

Mother put some palm oil in a big cooking pot and placed it on the fire.When the oil was hot, she added onions and garlic and stirred them until they were soft.She then put in pepper, tomatoes, added some water and six pieces of steamed cow meat.
Mother said, “Fati, please help me to stir the soup.”Fati said,”Yes, Mother.”
Fati stirred the soup once. She said, “This soup smells delicious.”
Fati stirred the soup twice. She said, “This soup smells very delicious.”
Fati stirred the soup three times. She said, “This soup smells very, very delicious.”
Then, Fati looked at her mother.Mother was not looking her way.            She was cutting green leaves for the soup.
Fati took one piece of meat from the pot and ate it.Fati said, “Mmm...”
Again, Fati looked at her mother.Her mother was not looking her way.She was cutting garden eggs for the soup.
Fati quickly took a second piece of meat from the pot and ate it.Fati said, “Mmm... Mmm...”
Once more, Fati looked at her mother.Her mother was not looking her way.She was cutting okro for the soup.
Fati very quickly took a third piece of meat from the pot and ate that too! Fati said, “Mmm... Mmm... Mmm...”
Soon, Mother came to the fire with the green leaves, garden eggs and okro.Fati was still holding the big wooden spoon.
Mother smiled and said, “Thank you for helping to stir the soup Fati.”    Fati did not know what to say.
Mother put the green leaves, garden eggs and okro in the soup and took the spoon from Fati.She started to stir the soup.

Mother looked into the pot. She could see the soup bubbling on the hot fire. Mother looked for the six pieces of meat in the pot.“One...two...three...,” said Mother. Mother saw three pieces of meat and no more.Mother said nothing. Fati said nothing.
When Mother served the soup, Fati did not get any meat. Fati said, “Mother, I am sorry. I will not do that again.” And she never did. And that was the end of that.

zho: 放學后，我們在菩提樹樹下玩耍。捉迷藏，毽子，跳皮筋，三個字，老鷹追小雞等等。
拉竹叔叔的茶店就在樹的附近。天氣很熱的時候，他會留下一壺青檸汁和杯子給我們。
我們如何將青檸汁平均分給我們八個人呢？阿曼的口袋裡有一根繩子。我們將它剪成與壺裡飲料高度相同的長度。
我們將線對折。然后再將分成兩半的線再對折兩次。現在我們有八個相等的線了。我們將折疊的繩子放在茶壺的旁邊，並在茶壺上標記相等的部分。
曼努和莎拉一同提起了水壺，小心翼翼地將青檸汁倒入玻璃杯中。
真美味，我們都想要更多。拉竹叔叔說：“你們可以再做一些。”“制作方法貼在板上。”
青檸汁的做法十分之一的青檸汁十分之二的糖漿十分之七的冷水攪拌均勻便可享用。
我們有水，糖漿和青檸汁，但我們不知道如何測量十分之一。
古裡亞說：“我們已經標上八個部分。 我們再標記兩個就得出十個部分了。”阿魯將青檸汁倒至第一個標記。我倒了兩份糖漿，使混合物上升到第三個標記。曼努將冷水倒入第10個標記。
我們倒了八杯青檸汁，還剩下一些青檸汁。我們把它倒入 的一大杯裡。
拉竹叔叔說 拉竹叔叔說：“沙巴斯！這是我喝過最好喝的青檸汁了！但是，但是如果配上一些熱騰騰的炸蔬菜就更美味了。”“萬歲！ 謝謝你，拉竹叔叔！”
