昨晚，雨下得很大，河水溢出了河岸。


村民们兴奋起来，开始捕捉鱼了！
Thao Thong 用鱼钩和线钓鱼，钓到了条纹的蛇头鱼
Nang Khambai 用鱼笼捕捉到了银鲨
Nang Bouakhao 的渔网捕捉到了虾
布恩爷爷用投网钓了一条亚洲红尾鲶鱼
Thao Kood 用刺网捕鱼并抓到泥蟹
彭奶奶用吊网捕鱼，钓到了河鲤
坎皮尤叔叔用陷阱捉到了鲶鱼
卡姆苏克阿姨去旋转捕鱼，捉到了一条阔头鲶鱼
邵素用竿和线钓鱼，钓到了一条巴沙鱼

中午，村民们享受着他们的渔获。

他们把所有的鱼都煮熟了，一起在河边吃午饭
eng:
Last night, it
rained so hard that water overflowed the river banks. The villagers got excited and started fishing!

Thao Thong fished
with a hook and line, and caught a big striped snakehead fish.

Nang Khambai fished
with a fishing cage and caught a silver barb.

Nang Bouakhao’s fishing
net caught shrimp.

Grandfather Boun
used a cast net to catch an Asian red-tailed catfish.

Thao Kood fished
with gillnets and caught mud crabs.

Grandmother Pheng
fished with lift nets and caught river carp.

Uncle Khampiew used
a trap and caught catfish.
Aunt Khamsouk went spin fishing and caught a broadhead walking catfish.

Thao So fished with
a pole and line and caught a basa fish.

At noon, the
villagers enjoyed their catch.  They cooked all the fish and had lunch together by the river.

zho: 長頸鹿寶寶和媽媽住在小小的屋子。
長頸鹿寶寶好愛媽媽！

長頸鹿媽媽每天到

甜橙果園工作。
長出來的甜橙，都送到熊叔叔的麵包店做成果醬。
長頸鹿媽媽在熱烘烘的太陽下曬著工作，很是辛苦。
長頸鹿寶寶很想幫一下媽媽。
他找來很多桌子和椅子，然後把它們叠起來。

一張椅子，一張桌子，一張椅子，一張桌子，他開始往上爬，越爬越高

...
...直到他接近了太陽！太神奇了！太陽看起來就像一個大橙子。
長頸鹿寶寶想到了一個方法，對著太陽張大口。
咦？世界怎麼變黑暗了？長頸鹿媽媽什麼都看不見，熊先生也什麼都看不見。

大家什麼都看不見，都很害怕，只有喜歡黑暗的貓頭鷹，暗地裏歡喜。

到底發生什麼事了？
原來，長頸鹿寶寶把太陽吞到肚子裏了！
長頸鹿寶寶的肚子火燒一樣，難過得大哭起來。熊叔叔聽到，趕快跑過來救他。
長頸鹿寶寶把事情都告訴熊叔叔。

熊叔叔說：















「別擔心，我來幫你。」


兩人一起做了一塊很大的麵團。

熊叔叔讓長頸鹿寶寶用肚子裏的火烤麵包。

長頸鹿寶寶張開口，把熱熱的氣都吹出來。呼！現在感覺好多了。
烤出來的麵包圓呼呼的，往天上飛走了。到底它要去哪裏？
長頸鹿媽媽還是會很熱，怎麼辦？熊叔叔給寶寶一把傘送給媽媽。太好了！以後媽媽不用太辛苦了。
到底大麵包去哪兒了？你不覺得太陽的形狀很像圓圓的大麵包嗎？
eng:
Baby Giraffe lives with Mother Giraffe in a
small house.
He loves Mother Giraffe so much!
Mother Giraffe works in an orange grove.

The oranges are used to
make marmalade in Mr. Bear’s bakery.
Mother Giraffe works quite hard under the sun.
Baby Giraffe decides to help Mother Giraffe.
He gathers up chairs and tables, tables and chairs.He piles them on top of each other.

One chair, one table. One chair, one table.
He starts to climb up. Higher and higher he goes...
...until he reaches the sun!Amazing! The sun looks just like an orange.
Baby Giraffe has an idea. He opens his mouth wide.

Oh no. 
What happened?


















Mother Giraffe and Mr. Bear cannot see
anything.

No one can see anything!The owls are overjoyed. Owls love the
dark. 
But where is the light?
Baby Giraffe has eaten the sun.

His stomach is on fire. He bursts into
tears.Uncle Bear hears him crying and runs over.
Baby Giraffe tells him everything.

Uncle Bear says, “Don’t worry. I will help
you.” 
Together, they bake a huge loaf of bread.

Uncle Bear tells Baby Giraffe to use the fire in his
stomach to bake the bread. 
Baby Giraffe blows. Whoosh! Now he feels much
better.
The baked bread floats higher and higher. Where is it going?

Baby Giraffe is still sad. Mother Giraffe will still be hot.Mr. Bear gives him an umbrella as a gift
for Mother Giraffe. Hooray! Mother Giraffe won't be so hot anymore.

But what about the bread? Well, if you look
closely, you might notice that the sun looks just like a loaf of bread.

It is Rani's first day at school.Her mother is holding her hand and walking her to school."I am grown up now", Rani says to her mother. "Let go my hand, let go!"Her mother holds her hand even more tightly.
There were many children reaching the school already.Some children came by bus, by car, some by rickshaw, cycle.And some came by walking, just like Rani.
Rani and her mother reached the school gate, and her mother let go off her hand.Her mother stays at the gate. Now Rani has to go inside alone.There are many new faces all around her.

She takes one step, then another. She looks back, her mother was getting smaller and smaller as she walks away. She thinks. will my mother disappear and feels scared so runs back to her.She doesn't feel so grown up and holds her mother's hand and says "Don't go away".

All the students were inside by now, Rani was the only one outside.The teacher comes out and smiles at Rani. Rani smiles back at her teacher and let go off her mother's hand. Her mother says, "Rani, I will be here when you come out."Her mother waves to her and goes away.
Rani went inside. She was now happy, her mother will be there after school!
zho: 今天是我第一天上学。妈妈握着我的手走着。“我现在长大了”我说。“快走吧！”妈妈把我的手握得紧紧地。
学校附近有很多小孩。有的坐巴士来。有的父母开车来。有的坐三轮车。有的骑自行车来。有的像我一样走过来。
我们到达校门时，妈妈松开我的手。她待在校门外面。我必须一个人进去。我周围有很多新面孔。
我往前走一步。我又往前走一步。我回头看着妈妈。她变的越来越小了。她会消失吗？我往回跑。我现在感觉不那么成熟了。我握住她的手。“别走”我说。
所有的人都进去了。外面只剩下我一个人了。老师从里面走出来。她对我笑一笑。我对她笑一笑。妈妈说，“罗尼，你出来的时候我会在这儿等你的。”我松开她的手。她对我摆摆手。
我往里面跑去。我放学的时候，妈妈一定会在外面等我呢！
畢瑪很愛睡覺，而且很難早起。洗衣工拉姆因此而經常大罵畢瑪。
一天，一隻名叫高力的牛問畢瑪：『畢瑪，你在傷心什麼？』畢瑪說：『我每天都無法早起，拉姆因為這樣天天對著我大罵。可以請你每天早上叫我起床嗎？』『當然好啊。』高力回答。隔天清晨，高力很大聲的哞哞叫，但畢瑪還是沒有起床。
一天傍晚，在從河邊回去的路上，畢瑪遇到一隻名叫莫提的狗。『我每天早上都無法準時起床，可以請你以後叫我起床嗎？』畢瑪問莫提。『當然好啊。』莫提答應，並在隔天早上一直汪汪叫。但，畢瑪起床了嗎？並沒有！

當天傍晚，畢瑪遇到一隻名叫基努的公雞。他對基努說：『你在早上啼鳴時大家都會起床。你也可以一起叫我起床嗎？』基努答應了。隔天早上，基努

啼鳴地又長又響，但畢瑪仍然沒有起床。
隔天傍晚，畢瑪看到一隻名叫卡嚕的烏鴉，開心地在啼叫。『卡嚕，可以請你在早上叫我起床嗎？』他問。卡嚕說：『有什麼不可以的呢？我會用啼叫讓你起床的。』隔天早上，卡嚕用盡全力地啼叫，但畢瑪還是沒有起床。
畢瑪很難過。隔天早上，一隻蒼蠅飛到畢瑪地鼻子上。『哈啊......啾......哈啾！』畢瑪起來打了個大噴嚏。
『哇！我起床了。我是怎麼起來地？』他納悶地問。『是我叫你起來的。』蒼蠅說道。『可以請你每天這麼早叫我起床嗎？』『當然。』蒼蠅答應。畢瑪好開心。現在早早起床對他來說不是一個問題了！
eng: Bheema is Ramu washerman's donkey.his problem is that he is not able to wake up on time.this is why he gets scolded.

One day, Gauri, the cow, asked him, “Bheema, why are you so sad?”Bheema said, “I cannot get up early and Ramu shouts at me every day. Will you wake me up every morning, please?”“Yes, I will,” said Gauri. Early next morning, Gauri mooed loudly, but Bheema did not wake up.

Coming back from the river in the evening, Bheema met Moti, the dog.“I can never get up in the morning on time. Will you wake me up?” Bheema asked Moti.“Yes, I will,” said Moti and the next morning he barked and barked but did Bheema did not wake up.

That evening Bheema met Cheenu, the rooster.He said to Cheenu, “You crow in the morning and everybody wakes up. Will you wake me up too?” Cheenu agreed. The next morning, Cheenu crowed long and loud, but Bheema did not wake up.

The next evening, Bheema saw Kalu, the crow, cawing away happily.“Kalu, will you wake me up in the morning, please?” he asked.Kalu said, “Why not? I will caw and wake you up.”The next morning Kalu cawed all he could but Bheema did not wake up.
Bheema was sad.The next morning, a fly came and sat on his nose.“Aaah…chhoooo… ahchhoo!” Bheema got up with a big sneeze.

“Wow! I woke up. How did I wake up?” he asked in wonder.“I woke you up,” said the fly.“Will you wake me up like this early every morning?” “Sure,” said the fly. Bheema was happy. Now he would have no problem getting up early every morning!

My name is Nuoy. This is my village.

Today Ek comes to visit. Ek is my cousin from the city.
I show Ek my family.“Here is my mother and my father.”“Here is my grandma and my grandpa.”
I show Ek our river.“Look! A villager is fishing!”
I show Ek our big rice field.It is filled with yellow rice!
“And this is where we keep rice. ”“Rice must stay dry!”
“This is our village temple.”“The monks keep the yard tidy.”
“This is our mango grove.”“The mangoes are ripe and juicy.”Ek, be careful!
“Don't worry, Ek! We can rest here.”“It's our house.”
“This is our market.”“Aunty makes delicious treats!”
“Ek, don't eatthem all!”
“I love my village,” Nouy says.“I love your village too!” Ek agrees.What else can we see tomorrow?
zho: 我是诺伊。这是我的家乡。今天，益克来探望我。益克是住在城市的表哥。
我向表哥介绍我的家人。“这是我的爸爸、妈妈。”“这是我的爷爷、奶奶。”
我们越过河流。“看！有一位村民在捕鱼！”
我们经过广阔的稻田。那儿遍地都是金黄色的稻米。
“这是我们存放稻米的地方。”“稻米必须保持干燥。”
“这是我们村子的寺庙。”“和尚们保持院子干净。”
“这是芒果树。”“这些芒果可香甜呢！”“表哥！小心！”
“我们可以在这里休息。”“这是我们的小亭子。”
“这是我们的市集。”“这阿姨做的小吃很美味！”
“表哥，别吃完！”“留给我！”
“我喜欢我的村子。”诺伊说。“我也喜欢你的村子！”益克认同。“明天我们还可以看见什么呢？”
咚咚！妈妈把门打开。 “拉古舅舅！” 阿米希和索尼叫道，还给他送上一个大大的拥抱。
拉古舅舅是妈妈唯一的弟弟。他会说最好听的故事，也常常把最棒的礼物送给他们。但是，拉古舅舅有一个毛病。
拉古舅舅非常懒惰。他可以连续几个小时都坐在椅子上。有时，他坐着阅读。有时，他坐着看电视节目。有时，他只是坐着睡觉。他不做任何家务，也不去市场买生活用品。妈妈再也无法忍受他的懒散了。
“拉古，怎么样?”妈妈问道。“你是打算一如既往地坐在你最心爱的椅子上度过这个假期吗？”“噢，不是这样的！”拉古舅舅说。“这次，我将会去探索水下洞穴，登上高耸的山峰，还会在丛林里追逐老虎。” “哪里，哪里？” 阿米希和索尼惊呼。 “我们也要去！” “啊！开什么玩笑！”妈妈并不相信。拉古舅舅露出了神秘的笑容。
隔天，阿米希和索尼无意中听到拉古舅舅在他的房间里和别人说话。“哇！” 舅舅惊叹。 接着，“这也太神奇了吧！”再过了一会儿，“啊，不好了！”两个孩子冲进了他的房间。“怎么了，拉古舅舅？”
只见拉古舅舅戴着一副黑色的大眼镜坐在他最心爱的椅子上。他的四周并没有其他人！阿米希和索尼好奇地看着彼此。 “没事吧，舅舅？”阿米希问道。阿米希目不转睛地看那副黑眼镜。它几乎遮挡了舅舅的整张脸。 拉古放声大笑，然后摘下了那副眼镜。“过来试试吧！”他对索尼说。“这是什么？”索尼问道。那副眼镜实在太重了，她必须用双手握着。
拉古舅舅小心翼翼地帮索尼戴上那副眼镜。不过，眼镜太黑了，她一开始什么都看不见。随后，拉古舅舅按下一个按钮。突然，索尼就在大海里了！她的四周全是五颜六色的鱼儿。 她望向左边，看见一只大乌龟在她身旁游着。那只乌龟如此靠近，索尼还以为自己可以触碰到它。 然后，她望向另一边...“啊！”她吓哭了，因为她看见一只大鲨鱼就在她的身旁。
“让我看看，让我看看！” 阿米希说。他试图帮已经饱受惊吓的索尼取下眼镜。 “下一个就到你啦，阿米希。”拉古舅舅说。“我为你准备了一场最适合你的冒险。”阿米希戴上眼镜后，舅舅按下另一个按钮。 “哦，我看见一群花鹿！还有一群叶猴！” 阿米希在一片丛林里。他可以听到各种鸟叫声。当他抬起头的时候，他看见一群野雁排成V字型，在空中飞翔。

“这感觉太真实了。”索尼说。“戴着眼镜时，我好像真的在水里游泳一样！” “是的。”拉古舅舅说。“所以人们把它称之为‘虚拟实境’。”索尼感到相当困惑。“‘虚拟’的意思不就是‘不真实’吗？”她问道。“‘实境’怎么可能是不真实的呢？”“那是一道好问题。”拉古舅舅说。“我们把它称之为虚拟实境是因为它让你觉得你眼前看到的一切仿佛都是真的。它是如此逼真。”“救命啊！” 阿米希哭道。“有一只老虎要把我吃了！”拉古舅舅笑了。“不用担心，你很安全！”他告诉阿米希。 “这好像在看电影一样，但是却比看电影更棒。”索尼兴奋地说。 “是的。”舅舅说。“当我们在电影院观看电影时，萤幕只是把画面呈现在我们的前方。但是一旦戴上了虚拟实境的眼镜后，我们会觉得画面已经延申到我们的四周了。”
“那么，你们想不想在暑假期间和我一起探索虚拟实境呢？”拉古舅舅问道。阿米希摘下眼镜，然后思考了一阵子。“我想我还是比较喜欢真实的实境。”他说。 “为什么呢？”拉古舅舅惊讶地问道。 “我在森林里看到一颗多汁的芒果。”阿米希说。“我现在好想要吃一颗。可是，我在虚拟实境里无法真的吃到。”“我也要一颗！”索尼说。两个孩子往厨房奔去。“等等我啊！”拉古舅舅说。他终于离开了他心爱的椅子，紧追在他们的后面。

虚拟实境简介1。 “虚拟实境”一词在1983年，首次出现于达米安·布劳德瑞克的科幻小说 《猶大曼陀羅》。2。 虚拟实境利用先进的电脑科技，透过眼镜里的小屏幕，创造出一个像现实世界的三度空间。3。 虚拟实境的眼镜里附有能够检测你的眼睛动态的感应器。举个例子，当你往上看的时候，眼镜就会呈现出你在现实世界里往上看的画面。 因此，如果你和阿米希一样处在一片丛林里，当你往上看的时候，小屏幕就会呈现出天空的画面，而不是树林的画面。
4。 人们不仅仅使用虚拟实境来玩游戏或是探索新的世界。它也可以训练人们完成困难的任务。消防员可以使用虚拟实境来练习如何把人从火海里救出。航空员则可以事先体验外太空的生活以及探索新的世界。这样，我们不用踏入太空船就可以体验行走在火星上的感觉了！ 5。 儿童可以使用虚拟实境的眼镜吗？大多数的科学家都认为戴上虚拟实境的眼镜就像是看着手机的小屏幕，因此我们要留意使用的时长和频密度。
eng: Knock, knock!Amma opened the door.“Raghu Mama!” Amish and Soni cried. They gave him a big hug.
Raghu Mama always told the best stories. He brought Amish and Soni fun presents.But there was one problem with Raghu Mama.

Raghu Mama was lazy! He would sit in his chair for hours and hours and hours, reading or watching TV. Or just sleeping.He would not do any work around the house. He would not go to the market to buy food.Amma was fed up of his laziness.

“So, Raghu,” said Amma. “Are you going to sit in your favourite chair all the time?”"Oh no!" said Raghu Mama. "I'm going to explore caves that are underwater. I'm going to climb tall mountains. I'm going to chase tigers in the jungle!"“Where, where?” said Amish and Soni. “We want to come too!” “Hah!” said Amma. “What a joke!” Raghu Mama smiled quietly.
The next day Amish and Soni heard Raghu Mama talking to someone. “Wow!” he said. Then, “That’s AMAZING!”A little later, “OH NO!” The children ran into his room.“What happened, Raghu Mama?”

Raghu Mama was in his favourite chair. He was wearing a pair of big black goggles. There was no one else in the room! Soni and Amish looked at each other. “Is everything okay, Mama?” Amish asked.Mama laughed. He took off the goggles. “Try this,” he said to Soni. “What is it?” asked Soni. The goggles were  heavy.  She had to hold them with both hands.

Raghu Mama  put the goggles on Soni’s face. The goggles were dark and she couldn’t see anything. Then Mama pressed a button.Suddenly Soni was in the ocean! There were colourful fish all around. There was a big turtle swimming beside her. "WOW!" said Soni.Then she turned her face to the other side . . . “Eek!” she cried as a big shark swam very close to her.

“Let me see, let me see!” said Amish.“It is your turn now, Amish,” said Raghu Mama.  Amish put the goggles on. Mama pressed a button. Amish was in a forest full of trees. He could hear different bird sounds. “Ooh!" he said, "I can see chital! I can see langurs!”

“It feels so real,” said Soni. “When I wore the goggles I thought I was swimming underwater!” “Yes,” said Raghu Mama. “It is called ‘Virtual Reality’.” “But ‘virtual’ means ‘not real’.” Soni said.  “You're right,” said Raghu Mama. “It is Virtual Reality. You thought you were in the ocean, right? It was almost real.” “It is like watching a movie,” said Soni. “Yes,” said Mama. “When we wear Virtual Reality goggles, it feels like the movie is all around us.”

"Do you want to explore Virtual Reality with me?" asked Raghu Mama.Amish and Soni thought for a bit. “We like the REAL thing,” they said. “But why??” Raghu Mama asked. “I saw a juicy mango in the jungle,” said Amish. “And now I want to eat one. I can’t eat the mango in the jungle. I can eat the mango in the kitchen.” “I want one too!” said Soni. Both of them ran to the kitchen. “Wait for me!” said Raghu Mama. He jumped off his chair and ran after them.

When Rohan woke up, he began to play with Jimmy, his dog.“There’s something you should do first!” said Riya, his big sister. “BRUSH YOUR TEETH!”

WOOF!

“I don’t want to brush my teeth! Jimmy doesn’t brush his teeth!”“Animals take care of their teeth too, but in other ways! We must brush our teeth to keep germs away!”“Germs?”“Germs are very tiny creatures that you cannot see. If you don’t brush properly, they stay in your mouth and hurt you!”
“Ouch!”“YES! That’s why we must take good care of our teeth by brushing twice a day - morning and night!”“But brushing is no fun!”“I’ll tell you a secret, Rohan! Psst…”  Rohan smiled.

Mummy called out, “It’s breakfast time!” “There’s something we should do first!” said Riya. “WASH OUR HANDS!”
WOOF!

“But Jimmy never washes his hands!”Riya laughed, “He doesn’t use his hands or paws to eat like we do! We must wash our hands with soap to get rid of germs.”“Are germs on our hands too?”“Germs are EVERYWHERE!”WOOF!
“Aaaah-chhhooo!” Riya covered her mouth with her hands as she sneezed.“Don't do that! My teacher says that we should sneeze into our sleeve, not our hands!" said Rohan.
“Why?”“Because when we sneeze into our hands, germs stick to them. If we don’t wash our hands, we spread germs and make others sick!”

“Here comes Germy!” Riya shouted, chasing Rohan and waving her
dirty hands. 

 “EEEEEEEK!”WOOF!

Later Riya showed Rohan the proper way to wash hands. “Wet your hands and turn off the tap. Then rub in some soap on the palms, the back of the hands and between the fingers. Scrub hands for twenty seconds! Now, it’s time to rinse off and dry!”“But that’s a long time!”“Remember my secret?”Rohan smiled.

When they came back home after playing, Riya nudged Rohan, “There’s something we should do first!”
Mummy teased, “Play some more?”“TAKE A BATH!”“Mummy, don’t you know that germs are everywhere? We can’t see them, but they stick to our skin and clothes!”“That’s why we must bathe every day…” “…to get rid of them!”

"Start by getting yourself wet,” said Mummy. “Then apply soap all over!” Riya and Rohan giggled as Mummy’s ticklish fingers soaped them up.“Then it’s time to rinse off!”“And dry with a clean towel!”“SUPERCLEAN!”WOOF! “It’s Jimmy’s turn next!”
“Do you want to listen to a story?” asked Papa.

“There’s something we should do first!” reminded Riya. “Tidy UP!”Rohan yawned. “Do we have to?”“Remember you couldn’t find your ball the other day? Putting things away in the proper place makes it easy to find them later!”“And keeps our house neat!” 
“You both are so smart!” said Papa proudly. “Bedtime!”“Papa! There’s something we should do first!” said Riya, pulling Rohan along.“Make the germs disappear with our magic secret!”Rohan nodded.

A few minutes later, Mummy and Papa heard a familiar tune. “So that’s your secret!” said Papa. “Humming a song to make brushing fun!”“And while washing our hands too!”“That’s a great idea!” said Mummy.WOOF!Rohan and Riya enjoy taking care of themselves. Do you? They make up a game with the germs and guess who wins?

Germs say, yucky, mucky and dirty is FUN!I say, I brush and wash and I know I have won!Germs say, never bathe, it’s a waste of time!I say, smelling nice with soap is so fine.Naughty germ says don’t pick up your things, The house looks better that way.I say, I tidy up because I like my thingsThat is a good way to end my day!And I feel better in every wayI feel better in every way! I FEEL BETTER IN EVERY WAY!!!!!Now make up your secret song and hum it when you have to do boring things!
zho: 羅漢醒來後，他開始和他的狗狗吉米一起玩。“你忘了做什麼了！” 他的姐姐麗亞說。 “刷牙！”汪！
“我不想刷牙！ 吉米不刷牙！”“動物也要照顧牙齒，但要用其他方式！ 我們必須刷牙以防止細菌滋生！”“細菌？”“細菌是非常細小的生物，你看不到的。 如果你沒有好好刷牙，它們會留在你的嘴裡造成蛀牙！”“對的！ 這就是為什麼我們必須每天早晚刷兩次牙來保護好我們的牙齒！”“但是刷牙不好玩！”“我會告訴你一個秘密，羅漢！”羅漢笑著。
媽媽叫："吃早餐了！""有件事我們應該先做！" 麗亞說。"洗我們的手！"汪！
“但是吉米一點都不想洗手！“麗亞笑道："牠不像我們一樣用手或爪子吃飯! 我們必須用肥皂洗手，才能消除细菌。""我們手上也有细菌嗎？""到處都有细菌！"汪！“啊楸！“麗亞一邊用手摀著嘴，一邊打噴嚏。"不要這樣做! 我的老師說，我们應該對著袖子打噴嚏，而不是對著手打!"羅漢說。“為什麼？“"因為當我們打噴嚏的時候，细菌會粘在手上。如果我們不洗手，就會傳播细菌，讓别人生病！"
“細菌來了！“ 麗亞大喊着，追著羅漢揮舞著髒手。“啊啊啊啊！”汪！
後來麗亞告訴羅漢正確的洗手方法。"把手弄濕，關上水龍頭。然後在手心、手背和手指間擦上一些肥皂。搓手二十秒! 现在，是時候冲洗乾淨並擦乾了！""可是那要花很長的時間啊！"“記得我的秘密嗎？“羅漢笑著。
玩完回家後，麗亞搖了搖羅漢："有件事我們先做！"媽媽開玩笑說，“是還要再玩嗎？““要洗澡了！“"媽媽，妳不知道细菌無處不在嗎？我們看不見它們，但它們会黏在我們的皮膚和衣服上！""所以我們每天都要洗澡...""......擺脫它們！"
"先把自己弄濕。"媽媽說。"然後把肥皂塗滿全身！" 麗亞和羅漢呵呵笑著當媽媽邊搔癢邊弄泡泡。“現在該用水沖乾淨了！“”然後再用乾淨的毛巾擦乾！“”超級乾淨！“汪！“接下來就輪到吉米了！”
“你想要聽一個故事嗎？“爸爸問
"我們有件事要先做！"麗亞提醒。"整理乾淨！"羅漢打著哈欠，“我們一定要嗎？”"還記得那天你找不到球了吗？把東西放在合適的地方，以後找起來就方便了！"“而且可以保持家裡整潔！““你們真聰明！”“爸爸驕傲的說。 “該睡覺了！”"爸爸! 有件事我們應該先做!" 麗亞拉著羅漢說。"用我們的魔法秘密讓病菌消失！" 羅漢點點頭。
幾分鐘後，爸爸媽媽聽到了熟悉的曲子。"原來這就是你的秘密呀！"爸爸說。"哼著歌，把刷牙變得更有趣！""而且還可以邊洗手！""这是個好主意！"媽媽說。汪！羅漢和麗亞喜歡照顧自己。你喜歡嗎? 他們用细菌做了一個遊戲，猜猜誰贏了？
细菌說，呸，髒兮兮的，髒兮兮的就是FUN!我說，我刷刷洗洗就知道我赢了!病菌說，從來不洗澡，浪费時間!我說，用香皂聞起来很香，真好。調皮的细菌說，不要撿你的東西。這樣的房子看起来更好。我說，我收拾是因為我喜歡我的東西。這是一個很好的方式來結束我的一天！而且我覺得自己各方面都好了我覺得在各方面都更好!我覺得各方面都好了!!!!現在编好你的秘密歌曲，然后哼著它當你不得不做無聊的事情！

eng: One day, grandfather gave my brother and me some money."Go and buy books," he said.We were both very happy. We both love to read.
Should we go now? Should we go later?Should we go today? Should we go tomorrow?We decided to go right now.
Should we go to the big market? Should we go to the small shop?Should we go with somebody? Should we go alone?We decided to go to the small shop, just the two of us.
We like the small bookshop. It is small but it has many books.The man in the shop likes us. He always helps us.
Should I buy a book with a lot of pictures?Should I buy a book with many stories?Should I buy a thin book?I could not decide.

We do not know which book to buy. The man in the shop smiled at us. “Relax, come with me,” he said. “These books are about animals. Those are about machines. Those over there are about wars. Take what you want.”
I picked up some books. My brother picked up some books.I sat on the floor. He sat on the chair.And we read and we read and we read.
It was very quiet. There was no sound.One hour passed. Two hours passed.Finally, we knew which books to buy.

The man in the bookshop smiled at us. I got a fat book with many stories. My brother got a big book with many pictures.We ran home to our grandfather. We climbed on his bed.He put his arms around us and then we read, and read, and read.
zho: 有一天，爷爷给了弟弟和我一些钱。“去买几本书吧。”他说。弟弟和我都非常开心。我们俩都很喜欢读书。
我们应该现在去吗？还是待会再去？我们应该今天去吗？还是明天去呢？我们决定现在就去。
我们应该去大书城吗？还是去小书店呢？我们应该叫上谁一起去吗？还是我们自己去呢？我们决定去小书店，就我们两个人。
我们喜欢这家小书店。书店很小，但有很多书。管理书店的人喜欢我们。他总是提供给我们帮助。
我应该买一本有很多图画的书吗？我应该买一本有很多故事的书吗？我应该买一本薄薄的书吗？我决定不了。
我们不知道买哪本书。管书店的人对我们笑了笑。“放轻松，跟我来吧。”他说。“这些书是讲动物的。那些是讲机器的。那边那些是讲战争的。挑你们喜欢的吧。”
我选了一些书。我弟弟也选了一些书。我坐在地上。他坐在椅子上。然后我们读呀读呀读呀。
身边非常安静。一点声音也没有。一小时过去了。两小时过去了。终于，我们知道买哪些书了。
管书店的人对我们笑。我拿了一本厚厚的故事书。我的弟弟拿了一本厚厚的图画书。我们回家找爷爷了。我们爬上他的床。他伸手揽过我们俩，然后我们读呀、读呀、读呀。
下課鈴響了，曼圖和他的妹妹吉薩從學校出來，曼圖說吉薩我在等著爆破餅乾說曼圖，吉薩說曼圖我們有1個月的假期，我們去祖父母家吧！
然後吉薩去找她媽媽，問媽媽我們可以去爺爺奶奶家嗎？ 媽媽說是的，親愛的，今晚去那裡也通知曼圖。 吉薩然後收拾好他們所有的東西，走到他們的祖父母家。
曼图和他的爷爷在他的花园里曼图问爷爷，你怎么种出这些美丽的梨子，我爱他们！ 爺爺回答哈哈哈我小心翼翼地把它們養好休息自然會照顧曼圖爺爺說。
晚餐時間曼圖和吉薩在餐桌上吃著熱騰騰的多薩，曼圖說我來這裡只是為了你的美味，奶奶說曼圖，然後吉薩咬了一口辛辣的綠色寒冷吉薩尖叫著眼淚不停地從她的眼睛裡滾出來然後曼圖取笑吉薩 然後奶奶給了吉薩水，說孩子們到外面去爆餅乾。
哇 夜晚充滿了餅乾和燈光，吉薩和曼圖正在快樂地爆裂餅乾。
結束
eng: The school bell rang and Mantu and his sister Geetha came out of school and Mantu said Geetha I am waiting to burst my crackers said Mantu, Geetha said Mantu we have 1 month leave let's go to grandparents house !

Then Geetha went to her mom and asked Mom Can we go to grandpa and grandma's house ? Mom said yes dear lets go there this night also inform Mantu. Geetha then packed all of their things and walked to their grandparents house.

Mantu is with his grandpa in his garden Mantu asked grandpa how come you grow these beautiful pears I love them ! grandpa replied ha ha ha I grow them with care and rest nature will take care Mantu said grandpa.

Its dinner time Mantu and Geetha are at the table with hot Dosa, Mantu says I am here only for your tasty food grandma said Mantu, Then Geetha bit a spicy green chilly Geetha screamed and tears kept rolling from her eyes then Mantu made fun of Geetha. Then grandma gave Geetha water and said kids go outside and burst crackers.
Wow The night was sparkling with crackers and lights and Geetha and Mantu were happily bursting crackers.
THE END

房子裡有一隻老鼠，奶奶先看到它。「﻿老鼠！」她大叫並跳上沙發，抱枕掉到了地上。
「在哪裡？」爸爸爬上窗戶，把窗簾拉了下來。「在那裡！」媽媽跳上桌子，盤子掉落一地。
﻿米頓﻿對著貓咪說「﻿抓住它！」。貓咪看到老鼠後躲到床底下。「﻿是老鼠！」﻿米頓﻿邊跑邊喊。
「我會把它趕出去的！」媽媽勇敢地說。她拿著掃把戳來戳去。爸爸大喊：「老鼠在你後面！」媽媽看到老鼠後就躲到床底下。
「我知道怎麼做！」奶奶邊喊邊跳下沙發。她捲起報紙東戳西戳。
「老鼠！」爸爸大喊，在窗戶上爬得更高了。「在你的左邊！」奶奶看到老鼠，躲進了床底。
「歐，不！」爸爸輕輕地說。他不能爬更高了。他小心翼翼的爬下窗戶，在被老鼠看到之前躲進床底。
「家裡有老鼠！」大家一起喊著。小寶寶被吵醒了。她坐在墊子上，睡眼惺忪的揉著眼睛。在她的枕頭上的是什麼啊？
它有一雙眼睛，四隻腳，和一條很長的尾巴。「老鼠！」小寶寶一邊拍手一邊說。小寶寶看了老鼠一眼，老鼠逃走了，小寶寶在後面追。
老鼠跳到沙發上，爬到窗戶上，跳到桌上，將抱枕弄散一地...
...在窗簾間到處跑，穿過盤子，最後逃出家門！
eng:
A rat has entered the house. Grandma was the first to see it.

"Rat!" He jumped on the sofa as he shouted.

The little pillows in it all fell down.

"Where?" Dad climbed out the window as he heard that.

The curtains all fell down as he pulled.

"There!" Mom jumped on the table shouting. The plates in it fell down and broke.

﻿
"Catch the mouse," Mithun looked at the cat and shouted.

The cat saw the mouse, then ran away and crawled under the bed.

"Rat!" Mithun ran after the cat shouting.

"I will chase away that rat," said the mother boldly.

He took a broom and stabbed here and there.

"You're a rat," Dad shouted. Mom saw the rat and he too hid under the cot.
"I know how to get rid of this rat!" Grandma jumped down from the sofa. He rolled up a newspaper and stabbed it here and there.

"Rat!" Said Dad. He climbed a little further up the window.

"Left with you!"

Grandma looked at the mouse. He too ran and hid under the bed.

"Damn!" Said Dad. He could not climb above it.

Slowly descended from the window. He hid under the bed without catching the mouse's eye!

“Rat! Rat! ” That everyone shouted together.

Papa woke up to that noise.

She sat up in bed and rubbed her eyes gently.

Um, of course, yes, I know this, why it's something known in advance.

It had two eyes, four legs, and a long tail.

"Rat!" Papa clapped his hands happily.

Papa looked at the rat and the rat started to run. Papa also ran backwards!
Climb on the sofa, jump out the window, jump on the table, roll on the pillows ...
... slipped between the curtains, stumbled on the plates, and ran out the door!

zho: 這是我家
我和我的家人住在這兒！
我們把鞋子放在這兒！
我們在這兒洗手和臉
我把我的衣服掛在掛鉤上
爺爺把他的拐杖放在角落
我們也把毯子放在那兒
爸爸把他的機車停在外面
但是他的安全帽放在櫃子上
媽媽和奶奶把紗麗放在櫃子裡
好吃的食物在廚房裡！
冷的時候我們把被子拿出來
熱的時候我們用電扇
重要的客人來我們家的時候, 我們拿出椅子來
有空來我家坐坐,快點來喔！
eng: i live with my entire family here.
This is my house.
we leave our shoes and slipers here
here we wash our face and hands
My grandfather keeps his stick in the corner.
We keep also our mats over there.
My father keeps his motercycle outside.
But there helmet is on the top of cupboard.
My mother and grandmother keep there sarees in trunk.
In the kitchen delecious food is cooked.
when there is  cold than we put out our blankets.
when   special guests comes than only we bring our chairs out.
when we have special guests we  serve them delicious food
Do  come at my house and meet me soon.

zho: 我可以奇你的自行车吗？我问姐姐。
姐姐说“不”“你还小不能骑自行车”
﻿“姐姐你能拿来我哪个水泵吗？我问。
姐姐说 “不”“你长大后可以”
“   ﻿妈，我可以帮你切这个菜吗？”我问妈。
妈妈说“不”“你太小了不能用刀子”
“妈，你能喂我午餐吗？我问妈。
妈妈说  “不” “你可以喂你自己”
“我可以这墙上画画吗” 我问。
爸说“不”“你太小了不适合做这个”
“你能帮我穿鞋子吗”我问妈。
妈说“不”“你长大了可以穿你自己鞋”
我想我自己迷茫了，我到底长大了没有？
有一天。床底下我找到了妈妈的耳环。﻿
“                                                                               我找这个很长时间，妈说。
每一个人都庆祝“你长大了”都说这样。
但是我还迷茫。
eng: "May I ride your bicycle?" I asked Didi.
"No," Didi said. "You’re too young to ride a bike."
"Didi, can you start the water pump for me?" I asked.
"No," Didi replied. "You’re old enough to do it yourself."
"Ma, may I help you cut the vegetables?" I asked.
"No," Ma said. "You’re too young to use a knife."
"Ma, can you please feed me my lunch?" I asked.
"No," Ma said. "You’re old enough to feed yourself."
"May I help paint the wall?" I asked.
"No," Pa said. "You’re too young for this."
"Can you please help me put my shoes on?" I asked Ma.
"No," Ma said. "You’re old enough to put your shoes on yourself."
I was confused.  I thought to myself, Am I too old, or too young?
One day, I found Ma's earring under the bed.
"I’ve been looking for this for ages!" Ma said.
Everyone celebrated. "You're so grown-up!" they said.
But I'm still confused. Am I too old or too young?
Hello, my name is Rake. This is my house. Dad and Çinu also live here.Merhaba, benim adım Tırmık. Bu benim evim. Babam ve Çina da burada yaşıyor.
I have the best chair in the house, but isn't it better to sit on the lap?Evin en güzel koltuğu benimkidir. Ama yine de kucakta yatmak daha güzel değil mi?
Çinu is my best friend. I always wait for her to come back from school.Çinu benim en iyi arkadaşım. Ben hep onun okuldan dönüşünü beklerim.
I keep myself clean without water. I don't need a bath like Tombik.Ben su olmadan da kendimi temizleyebiliyorum. Tombik gibi yıkanmak zorunda değilim.
Shhhhh ... Don't tell anyone that I'm hiding here. 1,2,3, ... Gotcha!Şşşşşşt... Kimse burada saklandığımı söylemesin. 1,2,3,... Yakaladım!
Mom shouts at me when I bring home some funny food from the garden.Annem, eve yenmemesi gereken bir yiyecek getirdiğimde bana kızar.
I can climb trees and jump. I know all the shortcuts.Ben ağaçlara da tırmanabiliyorum. O yüzden bütün kestirme yolları biliyorum.
Sangu lives nearby. He teases me and that makes me angry!Sangu yakınlarımızda oturuyor. Benimle uğraşır durur. Kızıyorum artık!
Sanju doesn't know that tigers belong to the cat family... we both have sharp claws.Sangu'dan bahsetmişken, kaplanlar da kedi ailesindendir. Ama onların patileri daha keskin.
My friends sometimes make lots of noises outside, but I sleep quietly in bed.Benim arkadaşım bazen geceleri horluyor. Ama ben yatağımda sessiz sessiz uyurum hep.

Paw speaks.When the dogs are happy, they wag their tails.When cats shake their tails, they are getting angry.Pençe de konuşuyor. Köpekler mutlu olduklarında kuyruklarını sallıyorlar.Kediler de kızdıkları zaman kuyruklarını sallarlar.
zho: 这是我的家。妈妈，爸爸，和小轩都住在这里。
房子里最好的椅子是我的。但坐在小轩的脚更好，对吗？
小轩是我最好的朋友。我每天都等她从学校回家。
我不必用水来保持干净。我不需要像汤米一样洗澡。
Shhh...不要告诉别人我在这里躲藏！一，二，散。。。抓到你了！
当我从花园里带回一些美味的食物时，妈妈回对我大喊大叫。
我能爬树。我能跳。我知道这里的所有捷径！
三州住在附近。他常常挑逗我。这让我很生气！
请告诉三州老虎是猫科动物。我们有尖锐的爪子。
我的朋友们晚上有时会很吵。到了那个时候，我已经安静地躺在床上了！
尾巴可以说话 ！ 你知道动物和鸟类能用它们的尾巴来类沟通吗？一只狗快乐的时候就会摇尾巴。一只猫生气的时候就会吹起尾巴。

我的心感觉到很多事情
晚上奶奶给我讲故事的时候是我感到最开心的时候
跟朋友一起玩的时候我感觉很笨
当我爸爸告诉我他没有钱的时候我感觉很不好
当妈妈拥抱我的时候我感觉到被爱
eng:
My heart feels a
lot of things.

I feel happy when
my granny tells us stories in the evening.

I feel silly when
I play with my friend.

I feel bad when
my dad says he does not have money.

I feel loved when
my mom gives me a hug.

zho: 从前不久，一群朋友在一个村庄里玩耍。忽然，一阵突如其来的强风将他们吹走了。“这是什么地方？” 他们问道。 “我们在哪？ 这个地方好安静好可怕啊。”其中一个孩子喊：“看！ 那里有间屋子。 我们去看看是否有人能帮帮我们吧。”
孩子们一起走到房子前，透过窗户看向屋内。 屋内里，他们看到一张摆满美味佳肴的餐桌。 突然，大门魔术般自己打开了。一个奇怪的声音叫道：“ “你们看起来都饿了。 进来吃点东西吧。”
山姆起了疑心。 他警告伙伴们说：“我认为我们不应该吃这里的食物。”“但好饿啊！” 伙伴们哭喊着。 “我受不了这饥饿感了，食物越看越好吃。”其中一位朋友对山姆说：“你如果不想吃的话就不要吃，但不要阻止我们。”
朋友便进屋吃东西了，只留下山姆紧紧抓住妹妹的手。“山姆，我真的好饿，” 她哭了。 “我也想吃东西！”山姆摇了摇头。 “不可以啊，索亚。 记得爸爸妈妈叮嘱过我们 — 不要为了填肚子吃东西， 也不要因为虚荣而行动。 而且，你难道不觉得这间房子很奇怪吗？”
突然之间，山姆和索亚惊见伙伴们居然变成了... 怪兽！ 山姆握住索亚的手，夺门而出，跑进森林里。
屋里，出现了一个老女巫。 女巫数了数怪兽后，脸上顿时流露出愤怒。“还有两个孩子在哪里呢？”她尖叫着，紧追着山姆和索亚飞走了。
山姆和索亚一直在森林中奔跑，试图寻找一个藏身之处。他们跑着跑着，遇到了一只白色的大老鼠。 大老鼠说道：“进来我巢穴吧。 我来帮你们躲起来！”“我好害怕啊，山姆！” 索亚一边和山姆跑进白老鼠的巢穴， 一边对山姆说。 “如果女巫找到我们怎么办？”山姆安慰妹妹。“别想这些，女巫可能会闻到我们的恐惧。”
从白老鼠的巢穴里，孩子们清楚地听到女巫搜寻他们时的哀号和尖叫声。终于， 她飞走了，白老鼠说：“你们很明智， 没有吃女巫屋子里的食物。”“她为什么要这样对我们的朋友？”山姆和索亚问。老鼠告诉他们，女巫的主人命令她把一百个孩子变成怪物，并把他们带到他面前。老鼠说：“女巫把这一百个孩子带到他面前，便会获得长生不老的回报。”
“我要怎么做才可以帮助我的朋友们变回人类呢？”山姆问。“这很难，”老鼠难过地说。 “如果你三天之内没有找到咒语，他们将永远都是怪兽。”“糟了！ 我为他们害怕，山姆，” 索亚哭道。“别害怕，索亚。 我们要坚强。” 山姆边说边拥抱着妹妹。
“你知道我们怎么样才能帮助我们的朋友吗？”山姆问老鼠。“知道。” 老鼠回答。“你们必须到神秘的寺庙， 并且找到魔镜。 魔镜会帮助你们救回你们的朋友！”“那这座神秘的寺庙在哪里呢？”山姆问。“它在遥远的东方。 抓紧启程吧！”老鼠说。
当他们离开时，山姆说：“索亚，你必须找到一个村庄，告诉他们我们的朋友发生了什么事。 我会一路向东，寻找魔镜。”
山姆边走， 边想起爷爷曾经告诉他的一段话： “你的话语将帮助你找到途径。”路上，山姆遇到了一个女人。“不好意思，” 他说。 “请问你知道通向神秘寺庙是哪条路吗？”“你得沿着这条路走，直到一个大湖。 湖的对岸就是你在找的神秘寺庙。”她告诉他。
在旅途中，山姆来到了悬崖的边缘。 当他低头往下看时，他注意到有一只小鹰在小溪中挣扎。他不假思索，跳入水中，并且将它救出。 当他从水中出来，一只大老鹰飞向他。“非常感谢你救了我的孩子！”老鹰吱道。 “你想来我的窝里取取暖吗？”山姆爽快地答应了。
趁山姆在鹰巢里取暖，老鹰送了他一枚戒指。她告诉山姆：“我在收集树枝筑巢时发现了这枚戒指。它看起来像是一枚具有强大力量的戒指。 你拿去吧， 也许它可以帮助你救回你的朋友。”“非常感谢你，老鹰，” 山姆说。 “请问你知道怎么才能到达那座神秘寺庙吗？”“你坐到我的背上， 我带你去吧。”老鹰说完， 便带着山姆一起飞上天空。
终于，他们到达了大湖的岸边。 老鹰在岸边放下山姆，并且告诉他：“记住，相信自己。”“我会记住的。 谢谢你，老鹰。”山姆回答。
山姆转向湖面一看，顿时开始担心起来。 大湖里全是凶恶无比的鳄鱼！他随手扔了一块木头，看看鳄鱼的反应。 一条鳄鱼猛扑上去，并一口气j将木头咬成两半。山姆不知如何赶在三天期限前到达寺庙， 感到又沮丧又绝望。
他看了看大湖的周围， 发现树上挂着许多藤蔓。山姆灵机一动！他把藤蔓绑在一起，做成一条粗粗的绳子，使出全身力气， 试图将自己荡到大湖的对岸。 眼看山姆就要成功到对岸了， 这时。。。啪！藤蔓断了， 而山姆也掉进湖里。 他瞬间被鳄鱼重重包围。
山姆跌入湖中的同时，戒指也从他的手指上滑落水中。 戒指碰到水的那一刹那，整个湖冻结了，鳄鱼更是都成了雕像， 一动也不动！ 山姆从湖里一路跑到寺庙。他在寺庙门口毕恭毕敬的鞠躬， 并且礼貌地向庙里的僧侣们示意。 “各位尊敬的师傅，我向您们鞠躬。 请问有人在吗？”回复他是一片沉默。山姆蹑手蹑脚踏进寺庙后，发现一道耀眼的光。 他仰头一看， 高架上居然有一个魔镜但正当他要伸手去拿魔镜时，一个小精灵出现了。
“你这个无礼的孩子！ 你居然想偷我的魔镜？ 我要把你吃了!” 小精灵吼道。“不要啊，拜托你不要吃了我！” 山姆急哭了。 “我需要魔镜， 这样我才可以救回被巫婆变成怪兽的朋友们。 我保证，我一定会把它带回来的。 到时如果你还想吃了我，再动手吧。”“我怎么知道我能相信你？”小精灵生气地问。“我从来不撒谎，”山姆说。 “我保证我一定会回来。”
“嗯……”精灵说。 “你可以把魔镜带走，但记住，你不可以违背诺言。”“我不会的。”山姆说。 “但是我担心我能及时赶回朋友们的身边。”小精灵说：“你只需将镜子发出的的光照到到墙上，然后穿过光斑。这样， 你就可以赶在第三天结束前到达朋友们的地方。”
山姆按照小精灵的指示，发现自己真的回到女巫的屋子里。不好了！ 山姆看到女巫正试图绑架妹妹索亚还有一群村民。山姆大声一喊，女巫便转向山姆开始诅咒他，但索亚朝她丢了一块石头。 女巫便试图诅咒索亚，但很快地，女巫就闯进了白老鼠的巢穴。女巫正想转身诱捕山姆时，却发现他已经消失了。
山姆跑到妹妹身边，一起用魔镜照着女巫。 看到两个小孩竟如此勇敢地和她对峙，她大为恼火，向他俩抛出了火球。可是，魔镜居然将火球反射回女巫。 她一声尖叫， 然后碎成灰烬。
山姆和索亚跑到女巫的屋子里，将镜子照在他们的每个朋友身上。朋友们一看到自己的倒影， 便立刻变回自己原来的样子了！他们快乐欢欣地跳着舞，鼓着掌。山姆却是开心不起来， 因为他必须按照承诺回到小精灵那里。
突然，精灵出现在他面前！小精灵说：“你是一个勇敢诚实的孩子。”你既会信守诺言，也会关心别人。 我是被女巫下了诅咒，要保护这个魔镜的，但现在她死了，她下的诅咒也就解除了。 你把自由还给了我！ 这面魔镜就当是礼物送给你了， 你就用它来帮助需要它的人吧。”
eng: Once upon a time not long ago, a group of friends were playing in a village when suddenly a strong wind swept them away. “What is this place?” they asked?  “Where are we? It's so quiet and scary.”  “Look! There's a house,” said one. “Let's go and see if someone is there to help us.”

The children walked to the house and peeked in the window. There, they saw a table full of delicious food. Suddenly, the front door opened as if by magic.  A strange voice called out to them. “You look hungry. Come in and eat.”

Sam was suspicious. "I don’t think we should eat this food," he warned his friends. “But we are so hungry!” they wailed. “We can’t bear this hunger any more and the food looks so good.”“Don’t eat it if you don’t want to," said one friend "but don’t stop us.”

As their friends went inside to eat, Sam held on tightly to his sister’s hand. “Sam, I’m so hungry,” she cried. “I want to eat too!"Sam shook his head. “No, Soy. Remember what our parents told us - ‘Don’t eat to fill your hunger, don’t act to fill your ego.’ And don’t you think this house is strange?”
All of a sudden, Sam and Soy saw that their friends had turned into... monsters! Sam grabbed Soy’s hand and ran  through the door into the forest.
Inside the house, an old witch appeared. The witch counted the monsters and her face turned hard with anger. “Where are the other two children?” she screeched. Then she flew away after Sam and Soy.

Sam and Soy ran and ran through the forest, desperately trying to find a hiding place.As they ran, they came across a big white rat. "Come to my den," he said. "I'll help you hide!" “I’m so afraid, Sam!” said Soy, as they ran into the white rat’s den. “What if the witch finds us?” Sam comforted his sister. “Don’t think about that, otherwise the witch might smell our fear.”

From inside the white rat’s den, the children could hear the witch wailing and screeching as she searched for them. Finally, she flew away and the white rat said, “It was wise of you to not eat the food inside the witch’s house.” "Why did she do this to our friends?" asked Sam and Soy. The rat told them that her master had ordered her to turn a hundred children into monsters and bring them to him."Once she brings these hundred children to him, she will be gifted with immortality,” said the rat.

“How can I help my friends become human again?” asked Sam.“It's hard to say,” said the rat sadly. "If you do not find a spell in three days they will stay monsters forever."“Oh no! I'm scared for them, Sam," cried Soy. “Don’t be afraid, Soy. We must be strong," Sam said as he hugged her.

“Do you know how we can help our friends?” Sam asked the rat.“Yes," said the rat. "You must find the magic mirror in the mysterious temple. It will help you save your friends!” “Where is this mysterious temple?” asked Sam. “It's far away in the east. Hurry, go now!”said the rat.
As they left Sam said, “Soy, you must search for a village and tell them about what's happened to our friends. I will travel east and find the mirror.”

As Sam walked, he remembered what his grandfather had told him. "Your words will help you find the way." Along the road, Sam came across a woman. “Excuse me?" he said. "Do you know which way leads to the mysterious temple?"“You must go down this road until you see a big lake. On the other side you will find the mysterious temple," she told him.

On his journey, Sam came to the edge of a cliff. When he looked down he saw an eaglet struggling in the stream below. He quickly jumped in the water and rescued her. As he came out, a large eagle flew to him. “Thank you so much for saving my baby!" chirped the eagle. "Would you like to come to my nest to warm yourself?” Sam happily agreed.

As Sam warmed himself in the Eagle's nest she gave him a ring.  "I found this ring as I was collecting sticks to build my nest," she told him. "It looks like a powerful ring. Take it so that it can help you to save your friends.”“Thank you so much, eagle," said Sam. "Do you know how I can get to the mysterious temple?"“Get on my back and I will take you there,” said the eagle, and flew up into the sky with Sam.
Finally, they reached the banks of a huge lake. There, the eagle dropped Sam and told him “Remember to have faith in yourself."“I will remember. Thank you, eagle," said Sam.

As Sam turned towards the lake he became concerned. It was filled with menacing crocodiles!He threw a piece of wood to see what they would do. One of the crocodiles lunged at the piece of wood and snapped it in its jaws. Sam felt disheartened and wondered how he would ever make it to the temple before the three days were finished.

He looked around the lake and saw that there were many trees with vines hanging from them. Suddenly an idea struck him! He tied the vines together to make a thick rope and swung himself as hard as he could across the lake. He was just about to reach the other side when...          SNAP!The vine broke and Sam fell into the lake. In an instant, he was surrounded by crocodiles.

As he fell, the ring slipped from his finger and fell into the water. The moment the ring touched the water, the entire lake froze and the crocodiles became statues! Sam ran from the water to the temple. He bowed outside of the temple politely addressed the monks. “I bow before you, venerable monks. Is anyone here?” But nobody answered him. Sam tiptoed into the temple where he saw a glittering light. He looked high up on a shelf and there he saw the magic mirror! But just as he was about to reach for the mirror, an elf appeared.

"You insolent child! You want to steal my mirror? I will eat you," howled the elf.  "No, please don’t eat me!" cried Sam. "I need this mirror to save my friends who have been turned to monsters by a witch. I will bring it back, I promise. If you want, you can eat me then.""How can I trust you?" asked the elf angrily. "I don't lie," said Sam. "I promise I will come back."

"Hmmm," said the elf. "You can take the mirror but remember, you must not break your promise.""I won’t," said Sam. "But I’m worried that I won't reach my friends in time.""Flash the light of this mirror at the wall and go through the light," said the elf. "You will reach your friends before the end of the third day."

Sam did as the elf instructed and found himself at the witch's house.Oh no! Sam saw that the witch was trying to kidnap his sister Soy and a group of villagers.Sam yelled out and the witch turned to curse Sam, but soy threw a stone at her. The witch tried to curse Soy instead, but she quickly ran into the white rat’s den. When the witch turned back to trap Sam, he had disappeared.

Sam ran to his sister and they both faced the witch with the mirror in front of them. Enraged to see two little children facing her so bravely, she screeched and hurled a ball of fire at them.  But the magic mirror reflected the ball of fire back at the witch. She screamed and collapsed into a pile of ashes.

Sam and Soy ran to the witch’s house and shined the mirror on each of their friends. As they saw their reflection, they changed back to their human selves!  They danced and clapped with joy and relief, but Sam was sad. He had to go back to the elf as he had promised.

Suddenly, the elf appeared before him!“You are a  brave and honest kid," said the elf. "You have kept your promise and you care for others. I was cursed by the witch to protect this magic mirror, but now that she's dead, her curse has lifted. You have given me my freedom back! Take this mirror as my gift to you, and use it to help anyone who needs it.”
“Puchku! Have a bath!”              “Puchku! Eat your food!”
“Puchku! Go to class!”"Puchku! Get on the bus!”
“Where is Puchku?”
Puchku is busy.She has a book to read.Puchku reads all the time.
"Why are you always reading?"asks Boitu."Come, watch TV with us!"says Dodla.
"Books are more fun!” says Puchku. Words become stories and WHOOSH! You are in a new world!
But today, Puchku is sad.She has read all the booksin the library!
"No more books!"wails Puchku."What will I do?"
But, wait! What is that?Puchku looks up and sees..."More books!"
But the shelf is too tall.Puchku is too short.How can she get up there?
Maybe a wash line?How about chairs and tables?
If only Puchku had a giraffe.Or a monkey.
Puchku has a plan. She calls two boys for help.Up, up, upthey climb.Puchku has her hand on a book!But then, it all goes wrong.
AAAAAAAAH!
“What is this?” It is the Very Tall Librarian! She puts Puchku down. "Can I help?"
"I have run out of books,” says Puchku.The Very Tall Librarian smiles.May I pick you up?”Puchku nods.
“I will take this one," says Puchku. "Thank you!"“Take this one too,” says the Very Tall Librarian.
"I loved this book when I was small.You will grow too."she tells Puchku."Until you do, just ask for help."
But Puchku does not hear.
She has a new book!
zho: “Puchku！快去洗澡！”“Puchku！快吃你的饭！”
“Puchku！去上课！”“Puchku！赶紧上巴士！”“Puchku！做你的功课！”
“Puchku到哪里去了呢？”
Puchku非常忙碌。她非常喜欢读书。Puchku一天到晚都在读书 -- 在家，在学校，在公园，甚至在床上。一页一页，一篇一篇，她都把它们一本一本地读完了。
“Puchku，为什么每次都看到你在读书呢？”Boltu问到。“我们一起来看卡通吧！”Dodla说到。
“但是，读书比较有趣啊！”Puchku回答。”“你看到这个圆形！还有这个直线！这里一推，那里一拉，就变成了一个字母。把字母排在一起就变成了一个字。有些字很有智慧，有些很有趣，有些却很伤心，有些带着阳光。我们接着把字连起来，就变成了句子。把句子连起来就变成了故事！当你读故事时，哇～，最像是在另一个世界呢！”
不过今天，Puchku遇到了一个小状况。她已经没有新书读了！在图书馆里的所有书，她都读过一遍了，从 A 到 Z 都读完了。
“我该怎么办！已经没有书读了啊！”Puchku大声地哭泣。
等等！那是什么？Puchku抬头一看，数了数。一层，两层，错！三层装了满满的书。“原来还有书呢！”Puchku高兴地感叹。
不够还有一个非常大的问题。她的个子长得不高，书架却是非常的高。Puchku要怎么才能够拿到书呢？
可能他可以用洗衣线？或者用妈妈的萨莉来荡过去？或者把椅子和桌子叠起来，然后爬上去？
如果有一只长颈鹿或者一只猴子的话，那会多么的方便啊！
Puchku有了个计划，找来了Boltu和Dolda帮忙。静悄悄地，Puchku爬上了他们的肩膀上。“Boltu，你好重啊！”Dolda投诉着。“都跟你说别吃最后的那个饼了。”“不是我重，是Puchku！”Boltu反驳。“安静！差点到了！”Puchku说。就在这时候，不幸的事情发生了。
“这里到底发生了什么事？”一位非常高的图书管理员走了过来。她把Puchku救了下来。 Boltu和Dolda赶紧的逃走了。Puchku泪眼汪汪的看着书架上的书，管理员问了她：“我可以帮你什么吗？”
“刚才，我实在爬书架因为我想拿上面的书， 我已经没有书读了”Puchku伤心地说。“啊你怎么不早说啊？”管理员说到。“只要我在，你不需要自己爬，找我抱上你就行了。”
“我要这个，这个，还有那个！”Puchku很高兴地说。“谢谢！”“你也拿这个吧。我小时候非常喜欢读这本。”管理员说到。
“诶，你也有小过吗？”Puchku问。“那当然，比你还小呢。”管理员说。“不过我慢慢长高，你也会的。在你长高之前，只要找我，我就会抱你起来选书。”
Puchku已经没在听了！她已经投入在书里，这里圈，那里写。忙着在读书。
因为Puchku有一本新书了。
博博有很多家人。
他的家庭成員有：1. 奶奶2. 爺爺3. 博博（和貓咪）4. 姨姨5. 叔叔6. 寶寶7. 爸爸媽媽
家裏總是太多人了！博博沒有地方玩耍。
終於， 大家都睡着了。
貓咪把毛線球推過來，現在博博可以和貓咪玩了。
真開心！
﻿ ﻿哎呀！
小寶寶哭了。                        媽媽生氣了，                 爸爸怪博博，                   爺爺也說博博不對。

博博大叫：
















「 我沒有地方可以玩！家裏太多人了！
















」
博博大哭起來，他越哭越累，最後睡著了。
博博醒來了。咦，怎麼怪怪的？
寶寶去哪裏了？媽媽不見了。奶奶也不見了。
爺爺去哪裏了？爸爸怎麼不見了？叔叔和姨姨呢？
只有博博一個人在家。太好了！
﻿突然變得好黑...發生什麽事了？
突然天空閃電了，博博好害怕。大家去哪裏了？

滴答滴答，下雨了。博博聽到媽媽的聲音，還有爺爺奶奶的聲音
















、


寳寶的聲音。
雨下過不停。爸爸回來了！叔叔姨姨也回來了！大家都淋濕了。
博博感到不怕了。有家人真幸福！

不論去哪裏，博博永遠有愛他的家人

！
eng: Bin has a big joint family.
This is everyone.1. Grandma2. Grandpa3.  Bin (and Cat)4. Uncle5. Aunt6. Their Baby7. Bin's Parents
There are too many people!        Bin feels he has nowhere to play.
At last, his family takestheir afternoon nap.
Cat gets the yarn.Now Bin and Cat can play.
It is so much fun!
CRASH!Uh-oh.Everything is a mess!The yarn is tangled.
The baby cries.Mom scolds Bin.Dad scolds Bin.Even Grandpa scolds Bin.
Bin talks back.I have no place to play!This house is too small!Ours is too big a family!
Bin cries loudly.Bin cries softly.Bin falls asleep.
Bin wakes up.The house seems strange.
There’s no baby,no Mom,no Grandma.
There is no Grandpa.No Dad.No Uncle or Aunt.

Bin and cat are home alone.


"This is great! We can play however we want!"thought Bin.
Suddenly it is dark. What happened?
The sky flashes. "Where is everyone?" thought Bin, scared.
Then come his mom and grandparents. And the baby.
It starts raining.Then Dad is home! Uncle and Aunt are home too!
Bin feels safe now.
Bin starts playing with his cousin, the baby.His grand parents tell him a lot of stories.His uncle and aunt play with him too.
"Sometimes it is nice to have a big joint family.", he thought.
And he can always play outside.

﻿                  Rani has a shiny green car.         Pihu has a black and yellow auto.
﻿               ﻿Rohit has big red bus.      Aman has long blue lorry.
On your marks, get set, ready....  Go!!!!Here comes Lucky- the dog, joining the race.....
﻿ ﻿﻿Everybody staring at Lucky...                   The fastest of all..                         And so the winner is our Lucky!!!!

Venn有一辆绿色的汽车米娜有一辆黄色的汽车。

哇！ Lucky是最快的！ Lucky赢了！

zho: 周日，我们呆在家里打扫卫生。
周一，我们到叔叔家去。

﻿周三，我们去游泳。
