每天，

宾蒂

 醒来时都充满了移动一座山的能量。


今天，她可以移动五个。这是一个特殊的日子

。

家里的每个人都很忙。宾蒂也想帮忙

。

差不多是时候离开了。宾蒂喜欢看祖母做好准备。 妈咪拿出祖母送给宾蒂的手表。 宾蒂不喜欢戴它，因为皮带让她的手腕发痒。

但今天，她笑着穿上它。

当杜丽阿姨、普兰叔叔和平库回家时，他们正要离开。 宾蒂知道杜丽阿姨会做什么。拉她的脸颊，让它们转来转去。 但是今天，宾蒂

一个都没有
！
当宾蒂看到平库手中的波罗时，宾蒂几乎没有逃过杜丽阿姨的手指。  “把我的波罗还给我，”宾蒂说。 平库紧紧地捏着波罗的肚子。 “分享真好，宾蒂，”爸爸说。

“把我的波罗还给我，”宾蒂吼道。  

波罗

很高兴回到宾蒂的怀抱。
妈妈说他们来晚了。 他们向平库和他的父母道别，很快就离开了。

宾蒂从未见过这么多人在一起。她的

祖母
看起来最聪明。 

祖母决定在她 70 岁那年上大学。妈妈说宾蒂那时甚至不能走路。 今天 祖母
完成了3年的大学生活。她已经很努力了。
当祖母获得奖牌时，每个人都为她鼓掌。  宾蒂鼓掌的声音最大。

宾蒂选择了一个美味的蛋糕

祖母的庆祝活动。 “宾蒂，停下！”妈妈说。 “你会掉的。” “我能做到，妈妈，

我可以！”宾蒂说。哎呀！蛋糕卷到了祖母的纱丽上。

“看看你做了什么，宾蒂，”祖母说。 “你从不听。” “那只是一片，祖母，”宾蒂说，“现在看看这个。” 宾蒂把蛋糕切开，这一次是慢慢地，舀出一块整齐的蛋糕给祖母。

“我的宾蒂，她总是知道自己的想法！”爸爸说，给了她有史以来最大的拥抱。
eng: Every day, Binti woke up with the energy to move a mountain.Today, she could move five. It was a special day.Everyone at home was busy. Binti wanted to help too.
And she packed a yummy box of biscuits for Dadi before running out.
“Binti, stop!” said Didi. “You’ll fall.”“I can do it Didi, I can,” said Binti.

It was almost time to leave. Binti loved watching Dadi getting ready.Mummy took out the watch that Dadi had gifted Binti.Binti did not like wearing it because the strap made her wrist itchy. But today, she wore it with a smile.

They were about to leave when Dhuli Aunty, Pooran Uncle and Pinku came home.Binti knew what Dhuli Aunty would do. Pull her cheeks and make them go round and round.But today, Binti would have none of it!
Binti had barely escaped Dhuli Aunty’s fingers when she saw Boro in Pinku’s hands.“Give me back my Boro,” said Binti.Pinku squeezed Boro’s tummy tight.“It’s good to share, Binti,” said Papa.
That is what everyone always said. But they didn’t know the horrible things Pinku did with her toys.“He hurt Boro’s eyes last time, Papa,” said Binti.Pinku held it tighter.
“GIVE ME BACK MY BORO,” Binti roared.Boro was happy to be back in Binti’s arms.
Mummy said they were getting late. They said their goodbyes to Pinku and his parents, and soon they were off.

Binti had never seen so many people together. Her Dadi looked the smartest.Dadi had decided to study in college the year she turned 70. Mummy said Binti couldn’t even walk back then.Today, Dadi was finishing 3 years of college. She had worked hard.
Everybody clapped for Dadi when she got her medal. Binti clapped the loudest.
Binti selected a delicious cake for Dadi’s celebrations.“Binti, stop!” said Mummy. “You’ll drop it.”“I can do it, Mummy, I can!” said Binti.Oops! The slice of cake rolled on to Dadi’s sari.

“Look what you’ve done, Binti,” said Didi. “You never listen.”“That was only one slice, Didi,” said Binti, “now look at this.”Binti sliced through the cake, this time slowly, and scooped up a neat piece for Dadi.“My Binti, she always knows her mind!” said Dadi, giving her the biggest hug she ever had.

zho: 曼珠对钥匙和锁非常着迷。她特别喜欢听见钥匙打开锁时发出的轻柔的金属声。曼珠最喜欢的玩具就是妈妈绑在曼珠的纱丽上的一串钥匙。曼珠喜欢探索钥匙孔深处的秘密。每天，曼珠去上学的路上都会经过村子里的锁匠兰吉特的店铺。她喜欢听锁匠用工具制作新钥匙的时候，工具间发出的摩擦声。
有一天，曼珠的妈妈需要为她的衣橱配一把新钥匙。曼珠陪她一起去了锁匠兰吉特的店铺。兰吉特拿起一片扁扁的金属片。“这是什么？”曼珠问。
“这是一把原始钥匙。”兰吉特回答。然后他举起曼珠妈妈给他的钥匙，说：“你能看到这些像山峰一样的尖锐的部分和像河谷一样弯曲的部分吗？你家的衣橱锁里也有这些像山峰和河谷一样的部分。这把钥匙的山峰和河谷正好可以和那把锁里的构造匹配。所以当你转动钥匙的时候，那把锁才会开！我现在就要把这把旧钥匙上像山峰和河谷一样弯弯曲曲的部分复制到这把新钥匙上。然后这把新钥匙就能打开衣柜啦！‘’
回到家，曼珠一刻不停地谈论着锁匠。她把锁匠说的话告诉隔壁的穆妮拉阿姨，甚至还对着一只看上去非常无聊，花了半分钟舔自己脸的小猫谈论那个锁匠。当晚，曼珠的表姐丽珠来家里作客时，曼珠也忍不住和她谈论起来。丽珠在大学读书，未来想成为一名工程师。
“丽珠，你知道如果你想给锁配一把新钥匙，你必须把旧钥匙上那些像山峰和河谷的部分复制到一把空钥匙上吗？”曼珠问。
“真的吗？如果是这样，那么妈妈就能保管好钥匙了。否则谁都能复制这把钥匙，然后偷我们的东西！”丽珠说。“是的！”“这就是我正在研究的东西！”丽珠说。
“嗯？制作钥匙？”曼珠问。“和制作钥匙很类似，我们把需要保管好的东西锁起来，就像把纱丽存放在衣柜里一样，对不对？”丽珠答。曼珠点点头。“那么假如你需要保管的东西是信息呢？”“比如？”曼珠问。“比如你存进银行账户里有多少钱，或者你最好的朋友的秘密，或者是祖母传给你妈妈的秘制菜谱。”“哦，我们必须好好保管这些东西。”曼珠认同地说。
“如果我们必须保护好这些信息，我们就必须把它放到安全的地方，锁起来！有很多安全的地方，比如我的电脑，我经常把大学的课堂笔记存在里面。”丽珠说。“如果你想看我写的东西，你必须在这里输入密码。”说着，丽珠打开电脑。“什么是密码？”曼珠很想知道。
“密码就像一把钥匙。就像拼图一样，只有当钥匙和锁的形状匹配的时候，衣柜的门才能打开。如果要打开我的电脑，就必须输入一个和我之前设置好的密码相匹配的密码。如果你把密码告诉了别人，那么他们也能打开你的电脑了。所以你不要轻易把密码告诉别人。”“嗯，如果我有一台电脑，我该怎么设置密码呢？”曼珠大声提问。
“如果有些人把出生日期，宠物的名字，或者住址设置成密码，那么他们的密码就会很容易被猜出来。一个好的密码应该有些难度。越长的密码越难猜。如果密码里面同时包含数字和字母，就更好了。但是也不要设置一个太难记的密码。”就在这时，曼珠的妈妈来叫丽珠，丽珠跑出去和阿姨打招呼。叮！丽珠的手机响了。
那会是什么？是新游戏吗？丽珠有最好玩的游戏！曼珠过去经常在晚上缠着丽珠玩游戏。今天她要自己玩。曼珠在丽珠的手机上按下一个键。屏幕亮了起来。一个数字键盘出现了。需要输入密码！
曼珠输入了1234.“密码错误”屏幕上提示。然后她试了0000，但是手机还是没能解锁。她试着输入丽珠的生日，10-10-97。“嘿！”丽珠喊道。
“我已经用密码把我的手机锁起来了，而且我没有把密码给调皮的小女孩。”曼珠听了，吐了吐舌头。
“现在你知道密码有多么重要了吧，曼珠。他们就像钥匙一样把我们的东西保管好。”丽珠说。“是的，可我知识想玩一些手机游戏！”曼珠说。“那你需要问一下我”丽珠说道，输入了密码。“我给你看个新游戏——猜密码！”
和曼珠一起玩：这个游戏里有猜密码的线索，试试看你能不能找出来。手机密码：1.曼珠比丽珠小9岁。如果曼珠用自己的生日年份设置密码，这个密码会是什么呢？2.如果丽珠的密码是把出生日期倒过来，密码会是什么样呢？3.还记得曼珠尝试的第一个密码吗？顺序颠倒一下，会是什么呢？答案：1.20062.7901013.4321

你找到这些线索了吗？记住，如果你可以解开，那么别人也可以。所以我在这里提供一些注意事项供你参考：1.不要把密码设置得太短（比如123，xyz，abcd都是弱密码）2.用脑子记住你的密码，这样你就不需要用笔记下来了。如果你写下来，可能会有人找到这些密码。3.大小写字母都要有（ComPUteR）4.不要用那种特别容易猜的词语（比如你的学校名称，狗狗的名字，或是住址）密码可以打开手机，电脑，银行的保管库，网站上的账号和其他很多东西。现在指纹和视网膜也可以当做密码了。这些被称作生物识别密码。
你的手指在屏幕上滑动的特定轨迹也可以被设置成密码。就像这样：
eng: Manju was fascinated by locks and keys. The soft metallic sound of a key turning in a lock made her happy. The key bunch Mummy kept tied to her saree was Manju’s favourite toy.She loved to explore the mysterious depths of keyholes. Manju passed the village locksmith Ranjith’s shop on her way to school every day. She loved to listen to the rasping of the tools as he made new keys.
One day, Mummy needed to get a new key for her almirah. Manju went with her to Ranjith’s shop.Ranjith picked up a flat piece of metal. “What is this?” Manju asked.

“This is a blank key,” replied Ranjith.Then he held up Mummy’s key and said, “See these pointy bits that look like mountains? And these curvy bits that look like valleys? Your almirah lock also has mountains and valleys inside it. The key’s mountains and valleys fit that pattern. So when you turn the key, the lock opens!I am copying the mountains and valleys from the old key to the new one. So the new key will also open the almirah.”

Back home, Manju couldn’t stop talking about the locksmith. She told
Munira Aunty, who lived next door. She even told her cat, who stopped licking
his face for half a minute and looked bored. When her cousin Riju came to visit
that evening, she told her too. Riju was studying to be an engineer.
“Do you know, Riju didi,” Manju said, “if you want to make a new key for a lock, you have to copy the pattern of mountains and valleys from the old key to a blank key?”

“Really?” said Riju. “Then it’s a very good thing that Mummy keeps the keys safe. Otherwise anyone could copy the key and steal our things!”“That’s true!”“This is the sort of thing that I am studying,” said Riju.

“What, making keys?” asked Manju.“Something similar,” replied Riju. “We lock up things we want to keep safe, like the sarees in our almirah, right?”Manju nodded.“But what if the thing you want to keep safe is information?” “Like what, Riju didi?” asked Manju.“Like how much money you have in your bank account. Or your best friend’s secret.Or the notebook of recipes passed down from our grandmother to your mother.”“Oh yes, we need to keep those safe,” agreed Manju.

“If we have to protect this information, we have to
put it in a safe place and lock it! There are many safe places. Like my
computer, where I keep my college notes,” said Riju.
She opened her laptop. “To see my work, you have to
type the password here!” 

“What’s a password?” Manju wanted to know.

“A password is like a key. The almirah’s lock opens only when the pattern on the key fits the pattern in the lock, like a jigsaw puzzle. My computer will only open if the password I type matches the password I have set. If you tell anyone the password, they can open it too! So you have to be very careful whom you give your password to.” “Hmmm… When I get a computer, what should I set as my password?”  Manju wondered aloud.

“Some people’s passwords are really easy to guess – their date of birth, their pet’s name, or the name of their street. A good password is difficult to guess. The longer it is, the harder it is to guess. It is better if it has letters and numbers. But a password should also be easy to remember.”Just then, Mummy called Riju, who ran off to greet her aunt. TING! went Riju’s mobile.

What might that be? A new game? Riju had the best
games! Manju often spent her evenings pestering her cousin to let her play.
Today, she would play them by herself.
Manju pressed a button on her
cousin’s phone. The screen lit up. A keypad with numbers appeared. It needed a
password!

She pressed 1234. “Incorrect password” appeared on the screen. Then she
tried 0000, but the phone did not unlock. She also tried Riju’s birthday,
10-10-97.
“Hoi!” That was Riju.

“I’ve locked my phone with a password,” she said.
“And I don’t give it to nosey little girls.” Manju stuck her tongue out.

“Now do you see why passwords are so important, Manju?” Riju said. “They’re like keys to the things we want to keep private.” “Yes, didi,” said Manju. “I only wanted to play some games!” “And you only had to ask!” Riju said, typing in her password. “Let me show you a new game – Guess the Password!”

Play with Manju This game gives you clues to passwords. See if you can crack them. Phone passwords 1. Manju is nine years younger than her cousin. If Manju chooses her birth year as her password, what would it be?  2. If Riju’s password is her date of birth backwards, it would be... 3. Remember the first password Manju tried on Riju’s phone? What’s that in reverse order? Answers:  1. 2006 2. 790101 3. 4321

Did you solve the clues? Remember, if you did, others can too. So here are some simple dos and don’ts: 1. Don’t keep passwords that are too short (123, xyz, abcd are weak passwords). 2. Remember your password so that you do not have to write it down. If you write it down, someone might be able to find it.  3. Use both upper and lower cases (ComPUteR).4. Don’t use words that are easy to guess (The name of your school, dog or town).Passwords are used to ‘unlock’ or open mobile phones, computers, safety vaults in banks, our accounts on websites, and many other things.Fingerprints and retina scans are also used as passwords. These are called bio-metric passwords.
A password could also be a set pattern you trace on the screen.                                                      Like this:

zho: 小蝉非常喜欢唱歌
可是，每次都是相同的歌，小蝉也想唱新的歌曲。
然后小蝉去了翠鸟的家，想学习新的歌曲。
翠鸟开始唱起个来， “Qi Li Li Li~”。但是，小蝉却发不出这样的声音。
接着，小蝉去了竹雀的家，想唱竹雀的歌曲。
竹雀唱起了“Kyalu Kyu”的歌曲。可是，小蝉也唱不出这样的歌曲。
然后，小蝉去了蟋蟀的家。他想着我一定要学习新的歌曲！
蟋蟀发出了“ChiLi ChiLi”的歌声。但是，小蝉还是唱不出来这样的歌曲。
随后，雨下了起来。鸭子唱起了“嘎嘎”的歌曲。
青蛙也过来了，他唱起了“呱呱”的歌曲。
大家都聚在了一块，开始一起唱歌。“qilililili， qilililili”“Kyalu Kyu”“Qili Qili Qililili”"嘎嘎嘎"“呱呱呱”
小蝉听了大家的歌，果然，大家也不能像我一样唱歌。接着，小蝉也开始一起歌唱。“咪音 咪音”
大家都在一起唱歌。“qilililili， qilililili”“Kyalu Kyu”“Qili Qili Qililili”"嘎嘎嘎"“呱呱呱”“咪音 咪音”
从这个时候，小蝉又开始喜欢上了自己的歌声。有时候也会唱起了新的歌声。但这些歌其他的动物无法歌唱。
eng: Little Cicada loved to sing.
But her song was always the same. She wanted to learn a new song!
So she decided to visit Kingfisher to learn to sing his song.
“Doo-oo-oo! Doo-oo-oo!” sang Kingfisher.But Little Cicada could not sing his song.
She then visited Mynah. Maybe she could learn to sing Mynah's  song.
“Keak! Kaek! Kaek!” sang Mynah.But Cicada could not sing Mynah's song.
She then visited Cricket. Cicada was determined to learn a new song!
“Krik krik krik! Krik krik krik!” sang Cricket.But Cicada could not sing Cricket's song, either.
Then it started to rain.The ducks sang, “Quack! Quack! Quack!”

Frog came out and croaked,

“Ribbit! Ribbit! Ribbit!”

All the animals came out. And they all sang their songs.“Doo-oo-oo! Doo-oo-oo!”“Keak! Kaek! Kaek!” “Krik krik krik! Krik krik krik!”“Quack! Quack! Quack!”
“Ribbit! Ribbit! Ribbit!”
Cicada listened to all the songs.None of the other songs sounded like hers.So she started to sing.“Yaeng! Yaeng! Yaeng!”

All the animals sang together!“Doo-oo-oo! Doo-oo-oo!”“Keak! Kaek! Kaek!”“Krik krik krik! Krik krik krik!”“Quack! Quack! Quack!”
“Ribbit! Ribbit! Ribbit!”



“Yaeng! Yaeng! Yaeng!”
Since then, Cicada has enjoyed her song.Sometimes she even makes up new songs,songs that only she can sing.
My Amma tells me a story every night.
There is one story about a frog which talks.
There is another story about a king with a long beard.
Sometimes it is about a flying elephant.
In one story a fox and a tiger are friends. The tiger falls into a hole.
How will the tiger get out?

Then the clever fox saves the tiger. This is the
best story.
I listen to the story and then fall asleep.
zho: 我的母親每天晚上會說一個故事給我聽。
有個故事是關於一隻會說話的青蛙。
另一個故事是關於一個有長鬍子的國王。
有時候是關於一隻會飛的大象。
其中一個故事中有狐狸跟老虎是朋友。老虎掉進了一個洞中。
老虎要怎麼離開這個洞呢？
然後聰明的狐狸拯救了老虎。這是其中最好的故事。我一邊聽著這個故事一邊進入了夢鄉。
穆尼亚知道那只巨大的只有一根羽毛的大象鸟并没有吞下那匹马。大象鸟很大，足以吞下一匹马。但这并不意味着他真的那样做了。爱德哈尼亚村只有一辆马车，由名叫伐由和德鲁特的两匹马负责拉车。而伐由在大象鸟居住的丛林里的湖边失踪了。好几代村民都知道关于大象鸟的事。
人们以为这个物种已经灭绝了几百年了，而他是最后一只。世界上的人并不知道这只仅存的大象鸟，虽然掉得只剩一根羽毛，但仍然游荡在爱德哈尼亚的丛林里。这只大象鸟和村民彼此保持着一定的安全距离。但穆尼亚例外。虽然她走路一瘸一拐，但她很勇敢，经常溜进丛林里去看大象鸟。
大象鸟在白天的时候来湖边晒太阳，或到湖里玩水。他有时半坐在水中。有时又好像消失得无影无踪。也许他只是在茂密的丛林里的某个角落休息。他像树一样高，脖子又粗又长，巨大的双腿上长着爪子，还有一个像重矛一样的头。他的长爪和指甲看起来很吓人！
但穆尼亚很快发现他其实是一只害羞的食草鸟类。他刚刚在湖边上嚼着树叶。穆尼亚觉得自己和大象鸟有些共同之处。大象鸟不能飞，而穆尼亚不能跑！村子里其他小朋友嘲笑她的瘸腿，不带她一起玩游戏。所以她喜欢自己一个人呆着。
每天早上，穆尼亚从村子的井里打三桶水，再拾些柴火以便阿妈点燃炉灶。然后她就外出很长时间。阿妈以为她去跟别的小朋友们一起玩了。她完全想不到穆尼亚会溜进丛林里，去大象鸟居住的湖边。
有一天，穆尼亚鼓足勇气走到湖边的空地。大象鸟没有转头，只是把目光转向穆尼亚，然后就闭上了双眼。他并不在意穆尼亚靠近自己。穆尼亚跺了跺脚，也没能引起大象鸟的注意。他似乎更在意飞舞在他头顶的那群苍蝇。大象鸟突然抬起了一只爪子。穆尼亚吓哭了，一头栽进湖边的浅水中。她浑身湿透的爬起来，看见大象鸟笑得浑身乱颤！
“很好笑，是吗？”她生气的问，转身要走。临走之前，穆尼亚感到脚上被什么东西砸了一下。原来是大象鸟扔给她的一个水果。大象鸟想跟她一起玩！穆尼亚有些犹豫的把水果扔向大象鸟。大象鸟侧身跑去，用嘴接住水果。就这样，穆尼亚和大象鸟成了朋友。只是当她终于交了一个朋友的时候，伐由失踪了！所有人都怀疑大象鸟。
到处寻找伐由之后，村民们聚集在老榕树下。所有人都认为爱德哈尼亚村不可能有小偷。他们彼此信任。送奶工发誓说，他看见伐由向湖边去了。“到处都没有伐由的踪迹。一定是丛林里的什么东西把它抓走了。”有个村民对村长说。“除了大象鸟还会有谁？必须干掉他！”送奶工说。“这么多年来，他一声不吭，密谋他的邪恶计划！“
人们都表示同意。穆尼亚静静的看着这一切。她想说些什么，但又怕因此受罚。即使她说话，又有谁信呢？“没错，这么多年漫无目的的生活让这只巨兽非常危险。”穆尼亚的爸爸说。“今天是一匹马，明天可能就是我们的孩子们......”村长对怒吼的村民们喊道：“兄弟们，尽管我们面对的是一只巨兽，但是我们人多力量大。咱们去干掉他！”
人们欢呼而起。“大象鸟并没有吃掉马。”穆尼亚轻声但坚定的说，一瘸一拐的走上前。“伐由失踪的时候，我和大象鸟在一起！”人群突然安静下来。“你说这话什么意思？”村长吼道。“大象鸟是我的朋友。他没有吃掉马！”“这女孩疯了！”人群后面有人喊道。其他的孩子们大笑。“他只吃树叶，怎么会吃马？”穆尼亚站在原地大喊。
“你连编辫子都不会，还对我们指手画脚？”穆尼亚的爸爸怒气冲冲的对她说。“去跟你的朋友们玩儿去吧！”“这只大象鸟是我唯一的朋友。”穆尼亚说。她爸爸瞪着她。但她并没有哭，而是站在原地面对着村民们。“别理这丫头。我们早上去抓大象鸟。”村长说。人群于是散去。
穆尼亚只有一个晚上的时间去证明大象鸟的清白。“动脑筋，穆尼亚，动脑筋！”她对自己说。“送奶工看见伐由沿着去湖边的路走远了。但这条路在到达湖边之前转向堪德萨拉。如果伐由沿着那条路走了呢？”穆尼亚的爸爸妈妈对她很生气。他们一言不发的打发她上床睡觉。等他们睡着了，穆尼亚溜下床，拎着灯笼走出了房子。
她穿过爱德哈尼亚，来到通往临近村庄堪德萨拉的丛林之路。喔......丛林的空中传来猫头鹰的叫声。一只豺狼在远处嚎叫。树木的影子像长长的黑手指在移动。她犹豫了一下，但想起大象鸟正在丛林里安静的睡觉。如果她不想办法解开谜团，大象鸟恐怕活不到明天晚上。她深吸一口气，一瘸一拐的沿着丛林之路走在死一般的黑夜里。
第二天早上，村民们拿着棍子、锋利的石头和长长的菜刀来到湖边。当人群靠近他时，大象鸟正在休息。太阳照在他秃毛的背上。他慢慢站起来，盯着人群。村民们停在远处，看着大象鸟的个头。稍稍犹豫之后，村长喊道，“准备！”大伙咆哮着，紧握武器，准备冲向巨大的一根羽毛的大象鸟。
“住手！”穆尼亚细细的声音打破了喧闹。她一瘸一拐的走在大伙和巨兽之间。“穆尼亚！马上回来！”她的爸爸命令她。“把她抓起来！”有人喊道。穆尼亚的爸爸和另一个村民冲向她。大象鸟向前几步。他们于是停下来。“好吧......如果你想这样，那我们就把你俩一起收拾了！”一个手拿长矛的人吼道。
“出什么事了？”人群后面传来一个声音。一个长着长胡子有点儿驼背的人牵着一根马的缰绳走来。村长一脸疑惑的问，“萨阿提，你在这儿干什么？为什么伐由和你在一起？”
“哦，你知道，几年前我把伐由卖给了你。昨天一早，我经过你们村，伐由的兄弟哈布鲁和嘎布鲁拉着车。我不知道伐由怎么挣脱了缰绳，跟着我们回到了堪德萨拉！我差点儿没认出他，也不知道该怎么办。直到今天早上，我看到这个小女孩挨家挨户的问一匹丢失的马。到底发生什么事了？”他又问。
村民们没有回答萨阿提。他们羞愧的低下了头。穆尼亚的爸爸走向她，双手将她举起带回村子。从那天起，再也没有小朋友嘲笑穆尼亚的瘸腿。他们都想跟她交朋友，也都想跟大象鸟交朋友。穆尼亚的故事传到了许多村庄。就连遥远村子里的人们之间也在流传，“穆尼亚知道一根羽毛的大象鸟没有吞掉那匹马！”
这个故事的灵感来自于大象鸟（学名：象鸟），这是我们星球上最大的鸟类。它生活在马达加斯加岛上。随着岛上定居的人越来越多，以及越来越多的森林遭到破坏，这个物种在公元1700年左右灭绝。
eng: Munia knew that the giant, one-feathered elephant bird had not swallowed the horse. Yes, he was big enough to swallow a horse, but that didn't mean he had! The village of Adhania had only one horse-cart pulled by the two horses Vayu and Drut. And Vayu had gone missing near the lake in the jungle where the bird lived. The villagers had known about the elephant bird for generations.

He was the last of his race, which was considered extinct for hundreds of years. The world did not know that the living 
relic of that race, who had lost all his feathers but one, still roamed 
the jungles of Adhania. The bird and the villagers kept a safe distance from each other. But not Munia. Although she walked with a limp, she was brave of heart. She often slipped into the jungle to watch the elephant bird.

The elephant bird came near the lake in the daytime to bask in the sun or play in the lake alone splashing water. Sometimes he sat half-submerged in water. At other times there was no trace of him. Perhaps he just rested in some corner of the dense jungle. He stood as tall as a tree. He had a long strong neck, huge legs with claws and a heavy spear-like head. His long talons and nails looked scary.

But Munia soon realised he was a shy herbivorous bird. He just munched on leaves by the lakeside. Munia felt she had something in common with him. The elephant bird could not fly and Munia could not run! Other village children mocked her limp and did not include her in their games. That was why she liked staying alone.

Every morning Munia helped fetch three pitchers of water from the village well, and collected wood so that Amma could light the stove. And then she would be out for a long time. Amma believed she went out to play with the kids. Little did she know that Munia went into the jungle to the lake where the elephant bird lived.

One day, gathering courage, Munia stepped in the open near the lake. Without turning his head the elephant bird rolled his eyes towards Munia and then closed them, uninterested by her advance.Getting no more attention than the flies buzzing over his head, Munia stomped her feet. Suddenly the elephant bird lifted one of his claws. Munia cried and fell headlong into the shallow waters of the lake. She came out drenched to see him shaking all over. He was laughing!

“That’s funny, huh?” she asked angrily and turned to leave. Before Munia had walked away from the clearing, something hit her feet. It was a fruit that the elephant bird had thrown at her. The elephant bird wanted to play! Hesitantly, Munia threw it at him. He trotted sideways and caught the fruit in his beak. Thus, Munia’s friendship with the elephant bird had begun. And just when she had finally found a friend, Vayu had gone missing! And everyone’s suspicion had turned towards the elephant bird.

After searching for Vayu high and low, the villagers gathered under the old banyan tree.Everyone agreed that there could be no thief in Adhania. They all trusted one another. The milkman swore that he had seen Vayu gallop away towards the lake. “There is no sign of Vayu anywhere. It must be something in the jungle that got him,” a villager addressed the headman. “Who else can it be but the giant one-feathered elephant bird? He must be destroyed!” said the milkman. “For years he has been lying silent, hatching his evil plans!”

The crowd agreed. Munia watched the proceedings quietly. She wanted to speak, but was scared of being punished for speaking up. Even if she spoke, who would believe her? “Yes, all these years of aimless living has made the giant dangerous,” said Munia’s father. “Today it is a horse, tomorrow it may be our children…”The headman spoke over the villagers’ angry shouts, “Brothers, even though we are facing a giant, we have the strength of numbers. So let us go out and finish him!”

A cheer of approval went up. “The elephant bird did not eat the horse,” Munia said softly but firmly, limping forward. “I was with him when Vayu went missing!” A heavy silence fell on the gathering. “What does this mean?” roared the headman. “That the elephant bird is my friend, and he has not done this!” “This girl has lost her mind!” shouted someone from the back. The other children laughed. “He only eats leaves! How can he eat Vayu?” Munia shouted, not moving from her place.

“You can’t even plait your hair and you are giving us advice?” Munia’s father fumed and came towards her. “Go play with your friends!” “This elephant bird is the only friend I have,” said Munia. Her father glared at her. But she didn’t cry and stood there facing the villagers. “Forget about the girl, we will get the elephant bird in the morning,” said the headman and the gathering dispersed.

Munia had only one night to prove the elephant bird’s innocence. “Think, Munia, think!” she whispered to herself. “The milkman saw Vayu gallop away on the road that goes to the lake. But the road takes a turn before it reaches the lake and goes towards Chandesara. What if Vayu had gone that way?” Munia’s parents were angry with her and sent her to bed without speaking a word. Once they were asleep, she got out of bed, took the hanging lamp and stepped out of the house.

She crossed Adhania, and came to the jungle path leading to Chandesara, the neighbouring village. Whoooo... rang the call of an owl in the jungle air. A jackal howled from a distance. The shadows of trees moved like long dark fingers. She hesitated for a moment but then thought of the elephant bird sleeping peacefully in the jungle. If she didn't do something to solve the mystery, the elephant bird may not be alive to see the next night. She took a deep breath and limped alone on the jungle path in the dead of the night.

The next morning the villagers gathered near the lake with sticks, sharp stones and long kitchen knives. The elephant bird was resting when the crowd approached him. The sun shone on his featherless back. He got up slowly and stared at the crowd. Looking at his size, the villagers stopped at some distance. After a moment’s hesitation the headman cried, “Be ready!” The mob roared, firming the grip on the weapons, ready to run down the giant one-feathered elephant bird.

“Stop!” Munia’s thin voice cut through the din. She limped between the mob and the giant. “Munia! Come back at once!” her father ordered. “Grab her!” cried someone else.  Munia’s father and another villager rushed towards her. The elephant bird advanced a couple of steps and they stopped. “Okay… if this is how you want it, we’ll tackle both of you together!” yelled a man, holding a spear.

“What’s going on?” someone shouted from behind the crowd. A slightly hunched man with a long beard came in holding a horse’s reins. The headman asked with a surprised look, “Saarthi, what are you doing here? And why is Vayu with you?”

“Oh, as you know, I had sold Vayu to you some years back. Yesterday I was passing by your village early in the morning in my buggy pulled by Jhabru and Ghabru – Vayu’s brothers. I don’t know how Vayu got loose and followed us back to Chandesara! I couldn’t recognize him and didn’t know what to do with him until this morning when I saw this little girl going from hut to hut, asking about a lost horse. But what is going on?” he asked again.

The villagers did not answer Saarthi. They hung their heads in shame. Munia’s father went to her, lifted her in his arms and took her back to the village. Since that day, no child laughed at Munia’s limp. They all wanted to be friends with her. And they all wanted to be friends with the elephant bird. Munia’s tale reached many villages and the villagers in faraway hamlets whispered to each other, “Munia knew that the giant one-feathered elephant bird had not swallowed the horse!”

This story is inspired by the real Elephant Bird (scientific name: Aepyornis maximus), the biggest bird that walked our planet. It inhabited the island of Madagascar. With more and more settlements on the island, and more forests ruined, the species became extinct around 1700 CE.

zho: 我问奶奶，“我可以吃糖果吗？”奶奶说：“现在不行，贝塔，也许明天。”可是我不想等到明天。
我问爷爷，“我可以和朋友出去玩吗？”爷爷说，“现在不行，贝塔，也许午觉以后？”可是我不想等到午觉以后。
我问妈妈，“我可以穿新衣裳吗？”妈妈说，“现在不行，贝塔，我们出门的时候你就可以穿它们了。”可是我不想等到我们出门。
我问爸爸：“我可以打开这个漂亮的盒子吗？”爸爸说，“现在不行，你得等等。”可是我不想再等了。
为什么大人们总是说，“现在不行，现在不行。”那天晚上，我睡觉的时候很生气。
第二天，我早早地醒来走进厨房。奶奶说，“你可以吃这些糖果了”。
爷爷说：“你可以出去玩了。”妈妈说：“你可以穿新衣服了。”爸爸说：“你可以打开这个盒子了。”然后他们一起对我说：“生日快乐！”
eng: My awesome Ajji makes delicious laddoos , I asked Ajji ," May i Please have these yummy for my tummy Laddoos?"She my heart as she uttered,"Not now, beta, may be a little later, not today though, you will get it tomorrow."But I had no patience so ,I could not wait till tomorrow

With a heavy heart i thought for the park i asked Ajja ," May I go out to play with my friends?" he got me into his sweet lovely trap, he simply said," Little later you may go my chap, before that you have to take your nap." But I had no patience to wait till the nap

Then i saw my superman dress,With all my heart i went to mom to address," Can i wear my new costume and do my zip,. zap, zooom"  O her words cleared my doubt when she plainly refused saying you may wear it when we go out

The box attracted me to it right from the start,How to take permission from dad to open it is an unknown art. He refused right away and told me to simply wait. I wanted it right there i knew for sure, So I could not wait any more.
I went to bed with a heavy heart, why do they never learn to say 'yes'? why the elders cannot learn that art?I went to bed all annoyed
Next day when i entered the kitchen it was a sweet surprise. Ajji came to me with a smile She said in her volume which is usually low,," You can eat these laddoos now."

Ajja said,' bring your bat and ball, its time to hit the six  as cricket will b e played by all."Papa also gave me permission to open the box and before i thought it was a haux, I had everyone around me clapping and smiling and loudly they say," Happy Birthday !"

zho: 我們是一家四口。我到哪裡都跟著晴古。
我必須照顧晴古，因為我比他年長。
有時候晴古很粗心，守護房子便成了我的工作。
我們做什麼都在一起。我們一起工作。
我們一起玩。
甚至一起被媽媽罵。
每當晴古去上學，我會幫忙媽媽。我會趕走烏鴉，不讓它們接近印度薄餅。
今天晴古是我的老師。我終於可以學到新東西了。
我是一隻乖狗狗。我不會把貓咪嚇跑。
你是晴古的朋友嗎？那麼你也是我的朋友。
閱讀下列句子。以下的活動，哪一個是你喜歡的活動？我喜歡跳舞。我喜歡游泳。我喜歡跳繩。我喜歡畫畫。
我喜歡騎腳踏車。我喜歡攀爬。有時候我們說：「跟狗一樣的忠心。」這是因為狗狗總是跟主人很親近。如果狗狗去了很遙遠的地方或是走失了，它總是能找到回家的路。
eng: ﻿There are four of us in the family. Miguel is my favorite,                              and I follow him everywhere.
I have to keep an eye on Miguel.                                 I'm older than him.
Sometimes Miguel is not careful,                         so I had to guard the house.
﻿I am with him in everything. We sympathize with everyone.
We play with each other.
And Mother scolded us too.
I help Mom when Miguel is busy.   I pimp the birds away from our wares.
Today, Miguel will teach me. Finally, I will learn something new.
I am a kind dog. I'm not chasing cats.
If you're Miguel's friend, I'm your friend too!
Read the following sentences. Which of these do you like? I love to dance. I love to swim. I love jumping rope. I love to draw.

I love cycling. I love to climb. There is a saying “Nothing is more loyal than a dog”. This is because the dog does not leave his master. Whether he goes away or gets lost, he can definitely return to his master.

Sam
was a very curious boy.




And
what he was curious about was his Christmas present!

“Mummy, where is my
Christmas present?” asked Sam.

She smiled and said, “It is
hidden in a secret place, Sam.”Sam stuck his tongue out and
went in search of his father.

“Daddy, where is my
Christmas present?” asked Sam.

“It is hidden in a secret
place, Sam,” his father replied smiling.

“I know what to do!” Sam
said.

“I will go gift hunting!”

He looked behind his father’s
desk. And he found... a gift box wrapped in red paper.


“But this is for aunt Juju,”
said Sam reading the tag.

So, he slipped into his
parents' room. And he found... a gift box wrapped in gold paper.


“For uncle Alfie,” Sam
read aloud from the tag.

Then he opened his mother’s
cupboard. And he found... a gift box wrapped in purple paper.

‘For our daughter Sophie’
was written on the tag.

Sam went back to his room and
sat on the floor feeling
very sad. He had badly wanted to find his present!


And then he saw a gift box
wrapped in silver paper under his bed!

“This is for me!” he
shouted, reading the tag.

Sam shook the box. He turned
it around in his hands.  

What was inside? Oh, what
could it be?


Did he open it or leave it in
the secret place?


Are you curious to know what
curious Sam did with his gift?

He put it back under the bed
and decided to wait for Christmas.
zho: 山姆是一个好奇宝宝。这会儿，他正在好奇他的圣诞礼物是什么！
“妈妈，我的圣诞礼物在哪里呀？”- 山姆问妈妈。妈妈笑着说，“藏在了一个神秘的地方哦，宝贝。”
“爸爸，我的圣诞礼物在哪儿啊？” 山姆问爸爸。“藏在了一个神秘的地方哦。”爸爸笑着回答。
“我知道我要做什么啦！” 山姆说，“我要找到我的礼物！”
他翻啊翻，终于在爸爸的书桌里找到了一个红色包装的盒子。“但是这是给珠珠阿姨的”，山姆看着盒子上的标签嘟囔道。
他又偷偷跑到父母的卧室。他又发现了一个金色纸包装的盒子。“这个是给阿尔菲叔叔的。”山姆大声读出了标签。
她又打开了妈妈的衣橱。他找到了一个紫色纸包装的盒子。盒子上的标签写着“给我的女儿苏菲”。
山姆回到自己的房间，坐在地上，觉得很沮丧。他真的超级想找到他的礼物啊！突然，他看到床下有一个银色纸包装的盒子！
“这是我的诶！”他兴奋的读着盒子上的标签。
山姆摇了摇盒子，把盒子赚着看了又看。里面到底有什么呢？他道理有没有打开这个礼物，还是把他放回了床下？你想知道山姆后来做了什么吗？
他把礼物放回了床下，因为他决定还是等到圣诞节。

eng: Sniffle sniffle.Uh-oh! Divya has the sniffles.
Divya can’t have the sniffles today! She has to PLAY!It’s the finals of the Famous Football Cup!
Sniffle, sniffle.They’ve WON!THEY’VE WON THE FAMOUS FOOTBALL CUP!
Sniffle, sniffle."High five, Rustam!"Sniffle, sniffle."Good game, Gurmeet!"
Sniffle, sniffle."Well done, Mohit!"Sniffle, sniffle."You did it, Pooja!"
Sniffle, sniffle.         "Congratulations, everyone!"
A-A-A-AAACHOOOO!
Sniffle, sniffle.No more football for Divya until she gets better.She misses all her friends.
A week later…No more sniffles!Divya can’t wait to see all her friends!
Sniffle, sniffle.Uh-oh! What’s this? It looks like Rustam has the sniffles now…Sniffle, sniffle.And Gurmeet...
Sniffle, sniffle.... And Mohit...Sniffle, sniffle.... And Pooja too!
OH NO!EVERYONE has the sniffles!Sniffle, sniffle.
zho: 吸吸——吸吸。哦！迪薇娅感冒了。
今天迪薇娅不能感冒呀！她还得去踢球呢！今天可是足球赛总决赛的日子呀！
吸吸——吸吸。他们赢了！他们赢得了足球赛总决赛的大奖杯！
吸吸——吸吸。“击个掌吧，鲁斯坦！”吸吸——吸吸。“棒极了，格米特！”
吸吸——吸吸。“干得漂亮，莫希特！”吸吸——吸吸。“终于拿奖了，普佳！”
吸吸——吸吸。“我们赢啦！”
啊——啊——啊嚏！
吸吸——吸吸。迪薇娅感冒好了以后才能继续踢球。她好想她的朋友们。
一个星期过去了......迪薇娅的感冒好了！她巴不得立马就见到她的朋友们！
吸吸——吸吸。哦！怎么回事？鲁斯坦好像感冒了......吸吸——吸吸。还有格米特......
吸吸——吸吸。莫希特感冒了......吸吸——吸吸。连普佳也中招了！
哦，不！大家都感冒了！吸吸——吸吸——
